Quote: The reality of loving God is loving him like he's a Superhero who actually saved you from stuff rather than a Santa Claus who merely gave you some stuff.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: The room fell quiet. And as I read down the list of over one hundred and fifty eight-grade boys, I realized that to me, there had only ever been one boy.
Author: Wendelin Van Draanen

Quote: Women are tenacious, and all of them should be tenacious of respect; without esteem they cannot exist; esteem is the first demand that they make of love.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quote: You have been with me from the very first life. You are my first memory every time, the single thread in all of my lives. It`s you who makes me a person.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: You will find as you look back upon your life that the moments when you have truly lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.
Author: Henry Drummond

Quote: Anyone who is considered funny will tell you, sometimes without even your asking, that deep inside they are very serious, neurotic, introspective people.
Author: Wendy Wasserstein

Quote: If you are ready for the secret, you already possess one half of it,therefore, you will readily recognize the other half the moment it reaches your mind.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: You're mind is working at its best when you're being paranoid.You explore every avenue and possibility of your situationat high speed with total clarity.
Author: Banksy

Quote: Is this the part where you start tearing off strips of your shirt to bind my wounds?""If you wanted me to rip my clothes off, you should have just asked.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: He was still thoughtful. 'Do you think any of us ever really knows anyone?'  'Philosophy, Lord Dryden? And yet it's daylight and everyone is still sober.
Author: Julie Anne Long

Quote: Many of our most serious conflicts are conflicts within ourselves. Those who suppose their judgements are always consistent are unreflective or dogmatic.
Author: John Rawls

Quote: Sed nescio quo modo nihil tam absurde dici potest quod non dicatur ab aliquo philosphorum. (There is nothing so absurd but some philosopher has said it.)
Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

Quote: There are times when wisdom cannot be found in the chambers of parliament or the halls of academia but at the unpretentious setting of the kitchen table.
Author: E.A. Bucchianeri

Quote: There are two kinds of people in this world: Those who believe there are two kinds of people in this world and those who are smart enough to know better.
Author: Tom Robbins

Quote: With a philosophy education, one can infuriate his peers, intimidate his date, think of obscure, unreliable ways to make money, and never regret a thing.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Your past karma is what you found difficult or challenging in this life. To heal your past karma you would need to learn your life lessons for this life.
Author: Avis J. Williams

Quote: Don't tell me you're not beautiful. You're the kind of beautiful the blind would see if we could figure out some way to give them three seconds of sight.
Author: Shane Koyczan

Quote: Man was created to glorify God. Now, that may encompass other things which God has planned for each man, but essentially, man was created to glorify God.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Everyone should strive to be a world citizen. Boundaries were created by man, not the Creator. There is no such thing as THEM vs. US. There is only 'WE'.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: If a man can possess a woman sexually -really possess- he won't need to control her ideas, her opinions, her clothes, her friends, even her other lovers.
Author: Toni Bentley

Quote: We have to recognise that there cannot be relationships unless there is commitment, unless there is loyalty, unless there is love, patience, persistence.
Author: Cornel West

Quote: We've lost a lot of years, but you can't lose love. Not real love. It stays locked inside you, ready for whenever you are strong enough to find it again.
Author: Martina Boone

Quote: You might think that a boy is just your friend, but then if you find out that maybe he likes you (in a boyfriend way), everything changes instantly. (47)
Author: Charise Mericle Harper

Quote: Hobbies of any kind are boring except to people who have the same hobby. This is also true of religion, although you will not find me saying so in print.
Author: Dave Barry

Quote: If goodness has causes, it is not goodness; if it has effects, a reward, it is not goodness either. So goodness is outside the chain of cause and effect.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Sin will take you where you didn't plan to go. It will keep you there longer than you planned to stay. And it will cost you more than you intended to pay
Author: James L. Nicodem

Quote: His hands are saying that he wants to hold her. His feet are saying that he wants to chase after her... He's probably forgotten that I'm here, beside him
Author: Ai Yazawa

Quote: Never be afraid to tell me anything,” he whispered against her hair. “No matter how ashamed you might feel. I'll never judge you, Rachel. I love you.
Author: Maya Banks

Quote: Now the wren has gone to roost and the sky is turnin' goldAnd like the sky my soul is also turnin'Turnin' from the past, at last and all I've left behind
Author: Ray Lamontagne

Quote: According to the moral absolutism that characterizes McCandless's beliefs, a challenge in which a successful outcome is assured isn't a challenge at all.
Author: Jon Krakauer

Quote: Every city across the country that has successfully renewed and revitalized itself points to a robust education system as its fundamental key to success.
Author: Alan Autry

Quote: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Sometimes, because of my success, I am afraid that I was not a good father. With the first two I was too strong, and with the other three I was too weak.
Author: Roberto Cavalli

Quote: The fundamental virtue of success is that it allows you to know the true significance of what it means to have the freedom to make your dreams come true.
Author: Stacy Keach

Quote: Creationists eagerly seek a gap in present-day knowledge or understanding. If an apparent gap is found, it is assumed that God, by default, must fill it.
Author: Richard Dawkins

Quote: Emotional states are fairly quick bursts of neuronal gossip. Traits, on the other hand, are more like the neuronal equivalent of committed relationships.
Author: Yongey Mingyur

Quote: See now the power of truth; the same experiment which at first glance seemed to show one thing, when more carefully examined, assures us of the contrary.
Author: Galileo Galilei

Quote: If you don't want to be beaten, imprisoned, mutilated, killed or tortured then you shouldn't condone such behaviour towards anyone, be they human or not.
Author: Moby

Quote: If you don't want to be beaten, imprisoned, mutilated, killed or tortured, then you shouldn't condone such behavior towards anyone, be they human or not.
Author: Moby

Quote: Think of the fierce energy concentrated in an acorn! You bury it in the ground, and it explodes into an oak! Bury a sheep, and nothing happens but decay.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Every morning I jump out of bed and step on a landmine. The landmine is me. After the explosion, I spend the rest of the day putting the pieces together.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: I need words that mean more than they mean, words not just with height and width, but depth and weight and, and other dimensions that I cannot even name.
Author: Lois McMaster Bujold

Quote: My goal is to write every day. I say it is my ideal. I am careful not to pass judgment or create anxiety if I do not do it. No one lives up to his ideal.
Author: Natalie Goldberg

Quote: There's nothing on Earth like really nailing the last line of a big book. You have 200 pages to tickle their fancy, and seven words to break their heart.
Author: Alex de Campi

Quote: Even though you can't expect to defeat the absurdity of the world, you must make the attempt. That's morality, that's religion, that's art, that's life.
Author: Phil Ochs

Quote: I think most of the people involved in any art always secretly wonder whether they are really there because they're good or there because they're lucky.
Author: Katharine Hepburn

Quote: Madness is the absolute break with the work of art; it forms the constitutive moment of abolition, which dissolves in time the truth of the work of art.
Author: Michel Foucault

Quote: The Japanese have a wonderful sense of design and a refinement in their art. They try to produce beautiful paintings with the minimum number of strokes.
Author: David Rockefeller

Quote: There are perhaps no days of our childhood we lived so fully as those we believe we left without having lived them, those we spent with a favorite book.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: Amy [Winehouse] changed pop music forever, I remember knowing there was hope, and feeling not alone because of her. She lived jazz, she lived the blues.
Author: Lady Gaga

Quote: And what does it mean -- dying? Perhaps man has a hundred senses, and only the five we know are lost at death, while the other ninety-five remain alive.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: A good head and good heart are always a formidable combination. But when you add to that a literate tongue or pen, then you have something very special.
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quote: To be ignorant is to waste the talents you were born with. To be ignorant is to confine your life to a path no different than the generations before you
Author: Linda Cardillo

Quote: As I ponder my pilgrim's progress to Orthodoxy, however, I realize that I didn't make the trip alone, but in a two-seater. And I wasn't the one driving.
Author: Frederica Mathewes-Green

Quote: The word I think of is precarious. I am struck by how precarious it all is. How the things that hold us are only as strong as the faith we have in them.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: Why do we go around acting as though everything was friendship and reliability when basically everything everywhere is full of sudden hate and ugliness?
Author: Anna Freud

Quote: Come on,"I said, taking his hand. Clutching the afghan with the other hand, he trailed down the hall after me, a snow white giant in tiny red underwear.
Author: Charlaine Harris

Quote: I believe that the government that governs best is a government that governs least, and by these standards we have set up a fabulous government in Iraq.
Author: Stephen Colbert

Quote: God will judge us, Mr. Harris, by--by what we did to relieve the suffering of our fellow human beings. I don't think God cares what doctrine we embrace.
Author: Abraham Verghese

Quote: If you wish to befriend someone, look for a person who loves first God then themselves. If they love God, they will be able to love their neighbor, too.
Author: Peter Deunov

Quote: Parents are like God because you wanna know they're out there, and you want them to think well of you, but you really only call when you need something.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Anne was always glad in the happiness of her friends; but it is sometimes a little lonely to be surrounded everywhere by happiness that is not your own.
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Quote: Cosmetics makers have always sold 'hope in a jar' - creams and potions that promise youth, beauty, sex appeal, and even love for the women who use them.
Author: Virginia Postrel

Quote: History says, Don't hopeOn this side of the grave,But then, once in a lifetimeThe longed-for tidal waveOf justice can rise up,And hope and history rhyme
Author: Seamus Heaney

Quote: I hope to live long enough to see my surviving comrades march side by side with the Union veterans along Pennsylvania Avenue, and then I will die happy.
Author: James Longstreet

Quote: I want to show another side of Middle Easterners. My hope is that I would be able to play a variety of parts, and not always be the guy with the accent.
Author: Maz Jobrani

Quote: Many possessions, if they do not make a man better, are at least expected to make his children happier; and this pathetic hope is behind many exertions.
Author: George Santayana

Quote: Tomorrow, you promise yourself, things will be different, yet, tomorrow is too often a repetition of today. And you disappoint yourself again and again.
Author: James T. McCay

Quote: We hope that eventually there would be an occasion which I can personally prove that game music can in fact impress many different people and move them.
Author: Nobuo Uematsu

Quote: When I was a kid, my father didn't really have much hope for me. He thought I was a dreamer; he didn't think I would amount to anything. My mother also.
Author: Frank Gehry

Quote: You've gotta dive into the abyss if you wanna get anything good. Every record, you've gotta go down in the abyss and hope that you come out of it alive.
Author: King Tuff

Quote: A few said they'd be horses. Most said they'd be some sort of cat. My friend said she'd like to come back as a porcupine. I don't like crowds, she said.
Author: Brian Andreas

Quote: I don't happen to have a sense of humor personally, so I don't know what's funny about a character... This happens to be a feature of my life generally.
Author: Wallace Shawn

Quote: I have a very silly sense of humor. I've never laughed harder in my entire life than seeing someone with toilet paper stuck on the bottom of their shoe.
Author: Paula Poundstone

Quote: I wish we could make out in your bed."Noah sighed. "As do I, but I'm afraid we have ritual burning to conduct.""It's always something.""Isn't it though?
Author: Michelle Hodkin

Quote: The purpose of this lectchoor is to let you know where we are. We are in the deep cack. It couldn't be worse if it was raining arseholes. Any questions?
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: What I write when I force myself is generally just as good as what I write when I'm feeling inspired. It's mainly a matter of forcing yourself to write.
Author: Tom Wolfe

Quote: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.[Quoting Reverend Phillips Brooks, during Remarks at Presidential Prayer Breakfast, February 7 1963]
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: I can't say this strongly enough, but our feelings about ourselves are actually the most important barometer for determining the condition of our lives!
Author: Anita Moorjani

Quote: Kindness can transform someone's dark moment with a blaze of light. You'll never know how much your caring matters. Make a difference for another today.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: True love is boundless like the ocean and, swelling within one, spreads itself out and, crossing all boundaries and frontiers, envelops the whole world.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Try, reach, want, and you may fall. But even if you do, you might be okay anyway. If you don't try, you save nothing, because you might as well be dead.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: When we make our own misery we sometimes cling to it even when we want so bad to change, because misery is something we know. The misery is comfortable.
Author: Dean Koontz

Quote: A lion of truth never assumes anything without validity. Assumptions are quick exits for lazy minds that like to graze out in the fields without bother.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: Be still, sad heart! and cease repining;Behind the clouds is the sun still shining;Thy fate is the common fate of all,Into each life some rain must fall
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: Disciplining yourself to do what you know is right and importance, although difficult, is the highroad to pride, self-esteem, and personal satisfaction.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: I have a lot of sympathy for young people because I realize how disturbed I was. How would I deal with life in the future? What would I do for a living?
Author: Clyde Tombaugh

Quote: I never wanted to go away, and the hard part now is the leaving you all. I'm not afraid, but it seems as if I should be homesick for you even in heaven.
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Quote: Right now, I had everything I could ask for. It wasn't a long list, but it was a very satisfying one, starting with the love of my life back in my arms.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick

Quote: Sometimes it's heartbreaking to see your siblings as the people they've become. Maybe that's why we all stay away from each other as a matter of course.
Author: Jonathan Tropper

Quote: That I survived the Holocaust and went on to love beautiful girls, to talk, to write, to have toast and tea and live my life - that is what is abnormal.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: The difference between school and life? In school, you're taught a lesson and then given a test. In life, you're given a test that teaches you a lesson.
Author: Tom Bodett

Quote: The meaning of life is contained in every single expression of life. It is present in the infinity of forms and phenomena that exist in all of creation.
Author: Michael Jackson

Quote: Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;Man got to sit and wonder 'why, why, why?'Tiger got to sleep, bird got to land;Man got to tell himself he understand.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....
Author: Erica Jong

Quote: Americans... are forever searching for love in forms it never takes, in places it can never be. It must have something to do with the vanished frontier.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: And to the devil with it if she is!"said the Consul. "One girl, who is not Nephilim, is not, cannot, be our priority.""She is my priority!"Will shouted.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Can he love her? Can the soul really be satisfied with such polite affections? To love is to burn - to be on fire, like Juliet or Guinevere or Eloise...
Author: Emma Thompson

Quote: Hope is not about proving anything. It's about choosing to believe this one thing, that love is bigger than any grim, bleak shit anyone can throw at us.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: It is that we are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love, never no helplessly unhappy as when we have lost our loved object of its love.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: It's a strange thing to discover and to believe that you are loved when you know that there is nothing in you for anybody but a parent or a God to love.
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: Love is the ability and willingness to allow those that you care for to be what they choose for themselves without any insistence that they satisfy you.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Mama was my greatest teacher, a teacher of compassion, love and fearlessness. If love is sweet as a flower, then my mother is that sweet flower of love.
Author: Stevie Wonder

Quote: Sometimes I sit alone under the stars and think of the galaxies inside my heart and truly wonder if anyone will ever want to make sense of all that I am
Author: Christopher Poindexter

Quote: The measure of a man is not how great his faith is, but how great his love is. We must not let government programs disconnect our souls from each other.
Author: J. C. Watts

Quote: When I design a wedding dress with a bustle, it has to be one the bride can dance in. I love the idea that something is practical and still looks great.
Author: Vera Wang

Quote: Is standing by the window muttering about blood something he does all the time?"asked Simon."No,"Jace said. "Sometimes he sits on the couch and does it.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: [E]very man ought to say to himself, "Am I really the kind of man who has the right to act in such a way that humanity might guide itself by my actions?
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: Everything we see hides another thing, we always want to see what is hidden by what we see, but it is impossible. Humans hide their secrets too well....
Author: René Magritte

Quote: Man is not born to solve the problem of the universe, but to find out what he has to do; and to restrain himself within the limits of his comprehension.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: We are often taught to look for the beauty in all things, so in finding it, the layman asks the philosopher while the philosopher asks the photographer.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: One difference between poetry and lyrics is that lyrics sort of fade into the background. They fade on the page and live on the stage when set to music.
Author: Stephen Sondheim

Quote: Still, what I want in my lifeis to be willingto be dazzled—to cast aside the weight of factsand maybe evento float a littleabove this difficult world.
Author: Mary Oliver

Quote: You have to open up to the world and learn optimism...Contentment with the past, happiness with the present, and hope for the future. Learned optimisim.
Author: Jennifer Crusie

Quote: There's no need to curse God if you're an ugly duckling. He chooses those strong enough to endure it so that they can guide others who've felt the same.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Any self-defense class worth its salt will tell you thatyou don't pull out a weapon unless you intend to use it.The same should apply to ballsy remarks.
Author: Henry Mosquera

Quote: Love is beyond reason. Love is not measurable in words. Love cannot be partial; it cannot have owners. Love is essentially beyond definition or concept.
Author: Mabel Iam

Quote: No, I am never setting foot in this house again it scares me and makes me sad and I wish you could be a mom whose eyes worked but I don't think you can.
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson

Quote: I don't see,' I said, 'how people stand being old. Your insides all dry up. When you're young you're so self-reliant. You don't even need much religion.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: National identity is the last bastion of the dispossessed. But the meaning of identity is now based on hatred, on hatred for those who are not the same.
Author: Umberto Eco

Quote: She moved to pinch me again but I blocked her hand. I'm no expert on girls, but when one tries to pinch you four times, I'm pretty sure that's flirting.
Author: Ransom Riggs

Quote: There was a time when our desire for each other would have landed us in an asylum or prison, had it not been sanctioned by mutual assent. True or false.
Author: Lawrence Krauser

Quote: When it comes to men who are romantically interested in you, it's really simple. Just ignore everything they say and only pay attention to what they do.
Author: Randy Pausch

Quote: Why is he scared of the dark?"I meant the words for a joke, but Shade nodded seriously. "Like all monsters. Because it reminds him of what he truly is".
Author: Rosamund Hodge

Quote: And Meredith and Bonnie, who's going to bend some spoons for us next. I'm going to throw you down a rope… that is, unless Bonnie can levitate you out.
Author: L.J. Smith

Quote: The question is whether any civilization can wage relentless war on life without destroying itself, and without losing the right to be called civilized.
Author: Rachel Carson

Quote: There is no royal road to science, and only those who do not dread the fatiguing climb of its steep paths have a chance of gaining its luminous summits.
Author: Karl Marx

Quote: If you experience bliss of the Self (samadhi) amidst complete problematic stage, then know that you have met a “Gnani Purush” [the enlightened one]!
Author: Dada Bhagwan

Quote: And the thing is, we can't fail. We've already hit the bottom and come out of it. From here on out, if we just love and listen, we can't go wrong, babe.
Author: Erin McCarthy

Quote: I don't think ethical people deal with intimidation as a method to achieve success. Undermining someone's self-esteem isn't a method to achieve success.
Author: Dominique Moceanu

Quote: I want to do it because I want to do it. Women must try to do things as men have tried. When they fail, their failure must be but a challenge to others.
Author: Amelia Earhart

Quote: In every stump speech I give, I speak about the fact that people who dream and achieve enormous success do not make us poorer - they make us better off.
Author: Mitt Romney

Quote: King Louis Philippe once said to me that he attributed the great success of the British nation in political life to their talking politics after dinner.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Middle class families are struggling to send their sons and daughters to school. For many Americans, a college education is essential to future success.
Author: Albio Sires

Quote: The really essential factors of success in any undertaking are money and opportunity, and as a rule, the man who can make the first can make the second.
Author: Dorothy L. Sayers

Quote: You cannot allow your desire to be a winner to be diminished by achieving success before and I believe there is room for improvement in every sportsman.
Author: Lionel Messi

Quote: I don't play with my life by talking bullshit.I might have some chances in this bitchy life,but I've got only one fuckin' chance to give...my best shot.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: The secret of high finance...if you really need a loan, you won't qualify. And if you don't need a loan, all the lenders will line up to give you money.
Author: Joanne Fluke

Quote: Veganism denotes a philosophy and way of living which seeks to exclude exploitation of, and cruelty to, animals for food, clothing or any other purpose.
Author: Donald Watson

Quote: Basically we should stop doing those things that are destructive to the environment, other creatures, and ourselves and figure out new ways of existing.
Author: Moby

Quote: Being vegan is not the key to immortality. We're all going to get sick and die. But to know you're living without harming? That's the loveliest feeling.
Author: Victoria Moran

Quote: If you don't want to be beaten, imprisoned, mutilated, killed or tortured then you shouldn't condone such behavior towards anyone, be they human or not.
Author: Moby

Quote: Vegan food is soul food in its truest form. Soul food means to feed the soul. And to me, your soul is your intent. If your intent is pure, you are pure.
Author: Erykah Badu

Quote: Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: In the beginning was the Word. Then came the fucking word processor. Then came the thought processor. Then came the death of literature. And so it goes.
Author: Dan Simmons

Quote: No, it's not a very good story - its author was too busy listening to other voices to listen as closely as he should have to the one coming from inside.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: And the first rude sketch that the world had seen was joy to his mighty heart, till the Devil whispered behind the leaves 'It's pretty, but is it Art?'
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Quote: Art is contemplation. It is the pleasure of the mind which searches into nature and which there divines the spirit of which nature herself is animated.
Author: Auguste Rodin

Quote: As a child I was very into gadgets and machines and robots. The idea of experimenting with machines to create art was always something I tinkered with.
Author: Reggie Watts

Quote: Good management is the art of making problems so interesting and their solutions so constructive that everyone wants to get to work and deal with them.
Author: Paul Hawken

Quote: Sidda can't help herself. She just loves books. Loves the way they feel, the way they smell, loves the black letters marching across the white pages...
Author: Rebecca Wells

Quote: Bushido is realized in the presence of death. This means choosing death whenever there is a choice between life and death. There is no other reasoning.
Author: Tsunetomo Yamamoto

Quote: Ethan was loyal and funny and protective. When we were little, he was the brother most likely to make me cry—and mostly likely to wipe away my tears.
Author: Rachel Vincent

Quote: Odd, isn't it? You know when your birthday is, but not your death day, even though you pass the date year after year, never suspecting that some day…
Author: Mary Downing Hahn

Quote: Democracy cannot succeed unless those who express their choice are prepared to choose wisely. The real safeguard of democracy, therefore, is education.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quote: How can the bird that is born for joySit in a cage and sing?How can a child, when fears annoy,But droop his tender wing,And forget his youthful spring?
Author: William Blake

Quote: We spend the first year of a child's life teaching it to walk and talk and the rest of its life to shut up and sit down. There's something wrong there.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: In the end, only God can see the heart of an individual and distinguish the difference between legalistic deadweight and the passion of holy solemnity.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give.
Author: George MacDonald

Quote: Embedded in the larger story of redemption is a principle we must not miss: God uses ordinary people to do extraordinary things in the lives of others.
Author: Paul David Tripp

Quote: Like when you sit in front of a fire in winter — you are just there in front of the fire. You don't have to be smart or anything. The fire warms you.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: Happily Single"is recognizing that you don't need or want to be rescued from your life by a handsome prince because your life is pretty awesome, as is.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: If people were employed at creating heaven on earth, everybody would be happy; instead each one is creating his own heaven by creating hell for others.
Author: Bangambiki Habyarimana

Quote: It is always worth itemising happiness, there is so much of the other thing in a life, you had better put down the markers for happiness while you can.
Author: Sebastian Barry

Quote: Like love, like talent, like any other virtue, like anything else in this life, happiness needs to be nurtured - this is the truth of the whole matter.
Author: Ogwo David Emenike

Quote: Three o'clock in the morning. The soft April night is looking at my windows and caressingly winking at me with its stars. I can't sleep, I am so happy.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: Here is little habit that can make a big difference. Send sunbeams. Intentionally send a word of encouragement or appreciation every day to one person.
Author: Steve Goodier

Quote: I hope that some day the practice of producing cowpox in human beings will spread over the world - when that day comes, there will be no more smallpox.
Author: Edward Jenner

Quote: The cruelest thing you can do to a person who's living in panic is to offer him or her hope that turns out false. When the crash comes its intolerable.
Author: Robert Ludlum

Quote: The screen is a magic medium. It has such power that it can retain interest as it conveys emotions and moods that no other art form can hope to tackle.
Author: Stanley Kubrick

Quote: The visions we offer our children shape the future. It _matters_ what those visions are. Often they become self-fulfilling prophecies. Dreams are maps.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: There is a lot of luck in football. Following England is like following Wycombe Wanders or Leyton Orient. You hope for the best and hope you are lucky.
Author: Alan Sugar

Quote: Whiskey's to tough, Champagne costs too much, Vodka puts my mouth in gear. I hope this refrain, Will help me explain, As a matter of fact, I like beer.
Author: Tom T. Hall

Quote: Grief is an amputation, but hope is incurable haemophilia: you bleed and bleed and bleed. Like Schrödinger's cat inside a box you can never ever open.
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: Apparently, dancing for him and throwing herself at him weren't enough. Apparently, she had to nearly commit murder to arouse him enough to attack her.
Author: Gena Showalter

Quote: But we're going to smile and pretend we're fine with the dorky birthmas gifts because people do not get that they can't mush a birthday into christmas.
Author: P.C. Cast

Quote: Humor has to surprise us; otherwise, it isn't funny. It's a death knell for a writer to be labeled a humorist because then it's not a surprise anymore.
Author: Garrison Keillor

Quote: Humor is rare in science fiction... there's so little of it that it automatically reminds you of other heroes with that acerbic humor when you find it.
Author: John Scalzi

Quote: I have a need to always make people laugh. I have a desperate need. I love a great sense of humor. The people I sort of surround myself with have that.
Author: Peter Dinklage

Quote: I'm not 17 anymore. I still have some of the same sort of anger, but I have a sense of humor about it... a sense of being constructive with that anger.
Author: Dave Pirner

Quote: I've got a great sense of humor, and if I'm able to say or do something in a movie that people feel like they want to repeat, that's hugely flattering.
Author: Matthew McConaughey

Quote: My doctor says that I have a malformed public-duty gland and a natural deficiency in moral fibre and that I am therefore excused from saving universes.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
Author: Calvin Trillin

Quote: When your mother asks, "Do you want a piece of advice?"it's a mere formality. It doesn't matter if you answer yes or no. You're going to get it anyway.
Author: Erma Bombeck

Quote: Writing in English is the most ingenious torture ever devised for sins committed in previous lives. The English reading public explains the reason why.
Author: James Joyce

Quote: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: Every day you should up with the excitement in knowing that God's plans for you are far greater than your dreams for yourself. The best is yet to come!
Author: DeWayne Owens

Quote: In our world,"said Eustace, "a star is a huge ball of flaming gas."Even in your world, my son, that is not what a star is, but only what it is made of.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: It is worse to stay where one does not belong at all than to wander about lost for a while and looking for the psychic and soulful kinship one requires
Author: Clarissa Pinkola Estés

Quote: No one loses anyone, because no one owns anyone. That is the true experience of freedom: having the most important thing in the world without owning it
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Serenity is when you get above all this, when it doesn't matter what they think, say or want, but when you do as you are, and see God and Devil as one.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: She lacks confidence, she craves admiration insatiably. She lives on the reflections of herself in the eyes of others. She does not dare to be herself.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: So I wanted to sing inspirational music, and that's exactly how I approached it - only the words have been changed to declare my relationship with God.
Author: Smokey Robinson

Quote: The best remedy for those who are afraid, lonely or unhappy is to go outside, somewhere where they can be quite alone with the heavens, nature and God.
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: The greatest thing about dreams is they don't expire. They can lay dormant for years and when you pull them out and dust them off, they shine like new.
Author: Casi McLean

Quote: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: You always supposed to have that i'm number 1 mentality,don't let anyone make you feel like you is number 2 when they not even worth being number 1 !!!
Author: jojo1980

Quote: You're not a human being until you value something more than the life of your body. And the greater the thing you live and die for the greater you are.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: Have a GOAL to keep the following 5-"H' OUT of your lifeH – HarassH – HamperH – HurtH – HarmH – HinderTo Ensure H=Happiness Prevails forever!
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: Stress the right of the individual to select only what he desires to know, to use any knowledge as he wishes, that he himself owns what he has learned.
Author: L. Ron Hubbard

Quote: All that is important is this one moment in movement. Make the moment important, vital, and worth living. Do not let it slip away unnoticed and unused.
Author: Martha Graham

Quote: Every time you step on the football field in between those lines you're putting your life, your career, every single ligament in your body in jeopardy.
Author: Robert Griffin III

Quote: Everyone is lonely, we have to remember that life is to be lived one day at a time. You cannot worry about the past or future. Happiness is in the now.
Author: Claudia Gray

Quote: For me an object is something living. This cigarette or this box of matches contains a secret life much more intense than that of certain human beings.
Author: Joan Miro

Quote: I thought about the days i had handed over to a bottle..the nights i can't remember..the mornings i slept thru..all the time spent running from myself.
Author: Mitch Albom

Quote: In fairy tales, the princesses kiss the frogs, and the frogs become princes. In real life, the pricesses kiss princes, and the princes turn into frogs.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Independence is my happiness, and I view things as they are, without regard to place or person; my country is the world, and my religion is to do good.
Author: Thomas Paine

Quote: Never lose faith in yourself, and never lose hope; remember, even when this world throws its worst and then turns its back, there is still always hope.
Author: Pittacus Lore

Quote: Real life is only ever just real life. Messy. What it means depends on how you look at it. The only thing you've got to do is find a way to live there.
Author: Patrick Ness

Quote: The best way to waste your life, is by taking notes. The easiest way to avoid living is to just watch. Look for the details. Report. Don't participate.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Trust is the glue of life. It's the most essential ingredient in effective communication. It's the foundational principle that holds all relationships.
Author: Stephen Covey

Quote: First best is falling in love. Second best is being in love. Least best is falling out of love. But any of it is better than never having been in love.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: I want YOU to be the one wanting me first. Pushing me first. Kissing me first. Don't be careful with me,"he said. "Because I won't be careful with you.
Author: Michelle Hodkin

Quote: If conversation was the lyrics, laughter was the music, making time spent together a melody that could be replayed over and over without getting stale.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: In this part of the story I am the one whodies, the only one, and I will die of love because I love you,because I love you, Love, in fire and in blood.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: Some people can't stand being alone. I love solitude and silence. But when I come out of it, I'm a regular talking machine. It's all or nothing for me.
Author: Celine Dion

Quote: The only difference between falling in love and being in love is that your heart already knows how you feel, but your mind is too stubborn to admit it.
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: To love yourself right now, just as you are, is to give yourself heaven. Don't wait until you die. If you wait, you die now. If you love, you live now.
Author: Alan Cohen

Quote: Annabeth pressed her lips to Percy's ear. “I love you.”She wasn't sure he could hear her—but if they died, she wanted those to be her last words.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: The mind can go in a thousand directions, but on this beautiful path, I walk in peace. With each step, the wind blows. With each step, a flower blooms.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich

Quote: When I am king they shall not have bread and shelter only, but also teachings out of books, for a full belly is little worth where the mind is starved.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end.
Author: Gilda Radner

Quote: There is a stubbornness about me that never can bear to be frightened at the will of others. My courage always rises at every attempt to intimidate me.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Thomas Edison's last words were "It's very beautiful over there". I don't know where there is, but I believe it's somewhere, and I hope it's beautiful.
Author: John Green

Quote: You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: A modern philosopher who has never once suspected himself of being a charlatan must be such a shallow mind that his work is probably not worth reading.
Author: Leszek Kołakowski

Quote: Apocalypse is a frame of mind."[Nicodemus] said then. "A belief. A surrender to inevitability. It is a despair for the future. It is the death of hope.
Author: Jim Butcher

Quote: For Christians . . . an unreflective faith is not possible if we take seriously the injunction to love God with the mind as well as the heart and soul.
Author: Delwin Brown

Quote: I find people with depression are like a broken clocks, and clock maker after clock maker will try to fix you, but sometimes time itself is the answer.
Author: isaac andrews

Quote: The connection between art and Christ is like the connection between sunlight and the sun. It is, in fact, the connection between Sonlight and the Son.
Author: Peter Kreeft

Quote: The essence of independence has been to think and act according to standards from within, not without: to follow one's own path, not that of the crowd.
Author: Nicholas Tharcher

Quote: Being human means throwing your whole life on the scales of destiny when need be, all the while rejoicing in every sunny day and every beautiful cloud.
Author: Rosa Luxemburg

Quote: I could do with a bit more excess. From now on I'm going to be immoderate--and volatile--I shall enjoy loud music and lurid poetry. I shall be rampant.
Author: Joanne Harris

Quote: Writing is not a matter of time, but a matter or of space. If you don't keep space in your head for writing, you won't write even if you have the time.
Author: Katerina Stoykova Klemer

Quote: I knew in that moment that I was full of it. I didn't know who I was. I only knew my routine. I knew who I was suppose to be, who I was expected to be.
Author: Stacie Hammond

Quote: Believe God for something today. Prayer is the key to connecting with God and allowing Him to speak to your spirit. Open your heart and free your mind.
Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana

Quote: life weighs heavy upon my shoulders and patience starts wearing thin, it is divine hope and dreams which sustain me, pushing me forth against the wind.
Author: Terry A. O'Neal

Quote: How do you know? How best to ensure his nervous breakdown?"I ask."Keep going,"Christian says. "Just go on as if nothing has happened. We all hate that.
Author: Suzanne Finnamore

Quote: I had a dream about you. We couldn't decide on a sunrise. You wanted a tan, I only cared about the view. Then World War III fulfilled both our desires.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: People will walk in and walk out of your life, but the one whose footstep made a long lasting impression is the one you should never allow to walk out.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson

Quote: ...Catholic versus Protestant, essentially. It's that kind of fight. ... And it goes on to this day. Will we never learn? Who knows? Religion. Shit it.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: I guess if I had to pick a spiritual figurehead to possess the deed to the entirety of Earth, I'd go with Buddha, but only because he wouldn't want it.
Author: Sarah Vowell

Quote: I'd spent a night with Ranger a while ago, and I knew what happened when he was encouraged. Ranger knew how to make a woman want him. Ranger was magic.
Author: Janet Evanovich

Quote: Mungkin ada benarnya juga buku - buku itu bilang. Orang - orang yang jatuh cinta terkadang terbelenggu oleh ilusi yang diciptakan oleh hatinya sendiri.
Author: Tere Liye

Quote: My only love sprung from my only hate!Too early seen unknown, and known too late!Prodigious birth of love it is to me,That I must love a loathed enemy.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Her gaze met his, her blue eyes filled with confusion and terror – and love. If Julian hadn't already been in love with her, that would have done it.
Author: Pamela Clare

Quote: Science, like life, feeds on its own decay. New facts burst old rules; then newly divined conceptions bind old and new together into a reconciling law.
Author: William James

Quote: Time and time again, throughout the history of medical practice, what was once considered as "scientific"eventually becomes regarded as "bad practice".
Author: David Stewart

Quote: If I discover within myself a desire which no experience in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that I was made for another world.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Man has no Body distinct from his soul; for that called Body is a portion of a Soul discerned by the five senses, the chief inlets of Soul in this age.
Author: William Blake

Quote: Basically, when you get to my age, you'll really measure your success in life by how many of the people you want to have love you actually do love you.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: I'm an American. We've translated democracy and brotherhood and equality into enterprise and opportunity and success - and that's getting Americanised.
Author: Susan Glaspell

Quote: Obstacles are necessary for success because in selling, as in all careers of importance, victory comes only after many struggles and countless defeats.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: People of mediocre ability sometimes achieve outstanding success because they don't know when to quit. Most men succeed because they are determined to.
Author: George Allen

Quote: The way forward is to stop pestering yourself for answers and let it, the creative part of your mind, come up with the solution when the time is right.
Author: Steve Backley

Quote: If you like someone, you tell the truth because that, to me, is respect. If you hate someone, you tell them the truth because what do you have to lose?
Author: Tara Kelly

Quote: I've always loved animals. When you start making the connection between what you're eating and what happens to these poor animals, there's no way back.
Author: Tony Kanal

Quote: Mainly I'm a vegan because I like animals, and I don't want to be involved in their suffering. Also, it's better for my health and for the environment.
Author: Moby

Quote: Non-violence is the greatest force at the disposal of mankind. It is mightier than the mightiest weapon of destruction devised by the ingenuity of man.
Author: Mah?tm? Mohandas Gandhi

Quote: I used to think the worst thing in life is to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel all alone.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Once the writer in every individual comes to life (and that time is not far off), we are in for an age of universal deafness and lack of understanding.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quote: I stand in the mist and cry, thinking of myself standing in the mist and crying, and wondering if I will ever be able to use this experience in a book.
Author: Erica Jong

Quote: No harm's done to history by making it something someone would want to read."(The Course of Human Events, NEH Jefferson Lecture in the Humanities 2003)
Author: David McCullough

Quote: Sometimes writing is running downhill, your fingers jerking behind you on the keyboard the way your legs do when they can't quite keep up with gravity.
Author: Rainbow Rowell

Quote: If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Leave the beaten track behind occasionally and dive into the woods. Every time you do you will be certain to find something you have never seen before.
Author: Alexander Graham Bell

Quote: The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.
Author: Sathya Sai Baba

Quote: Art is not necessary at all. All that is necessary to make this world a better place to live in is to love - to love as Christ loved, as Buddha loved.
Author: Isadora Duncan

Quote: Great art speaks a language which every intelligent person can understand. The people who call themselves modernists today speak a different language.
Author: Marshall McLuhan

Quote: Hip-hop don't have no fresh energy, none at all. It's money driven, everybody tryin' to make that cheque, nobody putting art in their albums any more.
Author: Andre Benjamin

Quote: I look at a lot of artists. I'm inspired by - I suppose I shouldn't say 'inspired,' but it's not really influenced. I am inspired. Art comes from art.
Author: Cy Twombly

Quote: Be as careful of the books you read, as of the company you keep; for your habits and character will be as much influenced by the former as the latter.
Author: Paxton Hood

Quote: Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...
Author: Umberto Eco

Quote: Books to the ceiling,Books to the sky,My pile of books is a mile high.How I love them! How I need them!I'll have a long beard by the time I read them.
Author: Arnold Lobel

Quote: Censorship of anything, at any time, in any place, on whatever pretense, has always been and always will be the last resort of the boob and the bigot.
Author: Eugene O'Neill

Quote: It was a year for the ages, like 79, like 1346, to name just a few. Forget the scythe, Goddamn it, I needed a broom or a mop. And I needed a vacation.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: I was thinking about how people seem to read the bible a lot more as they get older, and then it dawned on me—they're cramming for their final exam.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Francie, huddled with other children of her kind, learned more that first day than she realized. She learned of the class system of a great Democracy.
Author: Betty Smith

Quote: In an age in which the media broadcast countless pieces of foolishness, the educated man is defined not by what he knows, but by what he doesn't know.
Author: Nicolás Gómez Dávila

Quote: The children are intrigued by these invitation, and it's only a matter of minutes before they find themselves engaged in a new world of possibilities.
Author: Rachelle Doorley

Quote: Allah tests our patience and our fortitude. He tests out strength of faith. be patient and there will endless rewards for you, insha'Allah"- Utaz Badr
Author: Leila Aboulela

Quote: Dusty, dark, cold, and hard, coal has no beauty of its own, but when it is consummated by fire it is beautiful and becomes what it was designed to be.
Author: Frederica Mathewes-Green

Quote: Faith is a process of leaping into the abyss not on the basis of any certainty about where we shall land, but rather on the belief that we shall land.
Author: Carter Heyward

Quote: Instead of giving a firm foundation for setting the conscience of man at rest forever, Thou didst choose all that is exceptional, vague and enigmatic.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quote: Even an animal, if you show genuine affection, gradually trust develops... If you always showing bad face and beating, how can you develop friendship?
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Even in the common affairs of life, in love, friendship, and marriage, how little security have we when we trust our happiness in the hands of others!
Author: William Hazlitt

Quote: The building of friendship, family, community and love is complicated. We are so isolated in this country, no longer supported by tribes and villages.
Author: Jasmine Guy

Quote: You know, sometimes kids get bad grades in school because the class moves too slow for them. Einstein got D's in school. Well guess what, I get F's!!!
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: But I don't understand God. I don't understand how he could see the way people treat one another, and not chalk up the whole human race as a bad idea.
Author: Jim Butcher

Quote: I try not to make plans. God always laughs at your plans. I'm going to keep the door open, and keep the page blank, and see what gets painted upon it.
Author: Tom Hiddleston

Quote: In my opinion, there are two things that can absolutely not be carried to the screen: the realistic presentation of the sexual act and praying to God.
Author: Orson Welles

Quote: Mine was a patchwork God, sewn together from bits of rag and ribbon, Eastern and Western, pagan and Hebrew, everything but the kitchen sink and Jesus.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: There's a major fault in Western society. It makes room for only one god, and in only one gender. There's no balance, no co-existence, no partnership.
Author: Tomson Highway

Quote: Why don't you think of [God] as the one who is coming, who has been approaching from all eternity... the ultimate fruit of a tree whose leaves we are.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: If everything really does get better, the way everyone claims, then happiness should be graphable. But that's crap, because better isn't quantifiable.
Author: Robyn Schneider

Quote: At the end of the day, all you can hope for is to go on. The older I get, the more I realize that just keeping on keeping on is what life's all about.
Author: Janis Ian

Quote: My advice to young entrepreneurs is not to accept defeat in the face of odds, and challenge negative forces with hope, self-confidence and conviction.
Author: Dhirubhai Ambani

Quote: I called Vee."How are you doing?"I asked."Good. How are you?""Good."Silence."Okay,"Vee said in a rush, "I am still totally freaked out. You?""Totally.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick

Quote: I like Thomas Jefferson, though he intimidated me. I thought he would have been very tough to be around. I don't know if he had such a sense of humor.
Author: Maira Kalman

Quote: I swear, my dear. Sometimes our conversations remind me of a broken sword."She raised an eyebrow."Sharp as hell,"Lightsong said, "but lacking a point.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: It's fascinating. You know all these words, and they're all English, but when you string them together into sentences, they just don't make any sense.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Leo had seen Tia Callida in action; she liked knives, snakes and putting babies in roaring fires. Yeah, definitely let's unleash her rage. Great idea.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Student: Dr. Einstein, Aren't these the same questions as last year's [physics] final exam?Dr. Einstein: Yes; But this year the answers are different.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The biggest void that people can have in their lives is a sense of humor. Spending your life with someone who doesn't have that wouldn't be palatable.
Author: Howie Mandel

Quote: When I buy a new book, I always read the last page first, that way in case I die before I finish, I know how it ends. That, my friend, is a dark side.
Author: Nora Ephron

Quote: Be natural my children. For the writer that is natural has fulfilled all the rules of art."(Last words, according to Dickens's obituary in The Times.)
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbour says or does or thinks, but only at what he does himself, to make it just and holy.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Make every effort to change things you do not like. If you cannot make a change, change the way you have been thinking. You might find a new solution.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Nervousness kill us... because we think we have only one opportunity that is in the Present and we don't think about the future! We loose our balance.
Author: Vikram Roy

Quote: She was a beautiful dreamer. The kind of girl, who kept her head in the clouds, loved above the stars and left regret beneath the earth she walked on.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: The value of things is not the time they last, but the intensity with which they occur. That is why there are unforgettable moments and unique people!
Author: Fernando Pessoa

Quote: There are two things that men should never weary of, goodness and humility; we get none too much of them in this rough world among cold, proud people.
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
Author: Buddha

Quote: Tidak ada niat baik yang boleh dicapai dengan cara buruk, dan sebaliknya tidak ada niat buruk yang berubah baik meski dilakukan dengan cara-cara baik.
Author: Tere Liye

Quote: You say I started out with practically nothing, but that isn't correct. We all start with all there is, it's how we use it that makes things possible.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Your attachment to unhealthy people and bad habits, which offer you no real control, is why you're spiritually dying and living a life out of balance.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: But I always liked side-paths, little dark back-alleys behind the main road- there one finds adventures and surprises, and precious metal in the dirt.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quote: But that was the problem with having the answers. It was only after you gave them that you realized they sometimes weren't what people wanted to hear.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: For me life is continuously being hungry. The meaning of life is not simply to exist, to survive, but to move ahead, to go up, to achieve, to conquer.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: I believe that I am not responsible for the meaningfulness or meaninglessness of life, but that I am responsible for what I do with the life I've got.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: I don't get high, but sometimes I wish I did. That way, when I messed up in life I would have an excuse. But right now there's no rehab for stupidity.
Author: Chris Rock

Quote: I think prime numbers are like life. They are very logical but you could never work out the rules, even if you spent all your time thinking about them
Author: Mark Haddon

Quote: I used to wonder if it was God's plan that I should be alone for so much of my life. But I found peace. I found happiness within people and the world.
Author: Lana Del Rey

Quote: It's impossible to go through life unscathed. Nor should you want to. By the hurts we accumulate, we measure both our follies and our accomplishments.
Author: Christopher Paolini

Quote: People are strange: They are constantly angered by trivial things, but on a major matter like totally wasting their lives, they hardly seem to notice.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: This is love: to fly toward a secret sky, to cause a hundred veils to fall each moment. First to let go of life. Finally, to take a step without feet.
Author: Rumi

Quote: I can do this… I can start over. I can save my own life and I'm never going to be alone as long as I have stars to wish on and people to still love.
Author: Jennifer Elisabeth

Quote: If you care about something you have to protect it – If you're lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it.
Author: John Irving

Quote: At the end of the day it's about how much you can bear, how much you can endure. Being together, we harm nobody; being apart, we extinguish ourselves.
Author: Tabitha Suzuma

Quote: Guys ask me, don't I get burned out? How can you get burned out doing something you love? I ask you, have you ever got tired of kissing a pretty girl?
Author: Tommy Lasorda

Quote: If you didn't love him, this never would have happened. But you did. And accepting that love and everything that followed it is part of letting it go.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: Let me tell ya. You gotta pay attention to signs. When life reaches out with a moment like this it's a sin if you don't reach back... I'm telling you.
Author: Matthew Quick

Quote: libidinous, adj.I never understood why anyone would have sex on the floor. Until I was with you and I realized: you don't realize you're on the floor.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: Loving others always costs us something and requires effort. And you have to decide to do it on purpose. You can't wait for a feeling to motivate you.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: My mother used to tell me that when push comes to shove, you always know who to turn to. That being a family isn't a social construct but an instinct.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: When I am with you, we stay up all night.When you're not here, I can't go to sleep.Praise God for those two insomnias!And the difference between them.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Don't."Clary raised a warning hand. "I'm not really in the mood right now.""That's got to be the first time a girl's ever said that to me,"Jace mused.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: I hate to hear you talk about all women as if they were fine ladies instead of rational creatures. None of us want to be in calm waters all our lives.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: I think it's good for a person to spend time alone. It gives them an opportunity to discover who they are and to figure out why they are always alone.
Author: Amy Sedaris

Quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: Pleasure to me is wonder—the unexplored, the unexpected, the thing that is hidden and the changeless thing that lurks behind superficial mutability.
Author: H.P. Lovecraft

Quote: You're the first Shadowhunter I've ever met."“That's too bad,” said Jace, “since all the others you meet from now on will be a terrible letdown.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: How keen everyone is to make this world their home forgetting its impermanence It's like trying to see and name constellations in a fireworks display.
Author: Nadeem Aslam

Quote: It is not God that is worshipped but the authority that claims to speak in His name. Sin becomes disobedience to authority not violation of integrity.
Author: Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan

Quote: Jokes of the proper kind, properly told, can do more to enlighten questions of politics, philosophy, and literature than any number of dull arguments.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: The philosophers have only interpreted the world, in various ways. The point, however, is to change it.[These words are also inscribed upon his grave]
Author: Karl Marx

Quote: The Purpose of Philosophy is to fall in Love. To strip the world of all its clothes, and fall in Love with it as it stand before you completely naked.
Author: Ilyas Kassam

Quote: The zipper displaces the button and a man lacks just that much time to think while dressing at dawn, a philosophical hour, and thus a melancholy hour.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: There is nothing more notable in Socrates than that he found time, when he was an old man, to learn music and dancing, and thought it time well spent.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: In the end, it is our defiance that redeems us. If wolves had a religion – if there was a religion of the wolf – that it is what it would tell us.
Author: Mark Rowlands

Quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Once, poets were magicians. Poets were strong, stronger than warriors or kings — stronger than old hapless gods. And they will be strong once again.
Author: Greg Bear

Quote: You have played, (I think) And broke the toys you were fondest of, And are a little tired now; Tired of things that break, and— Just tired. So am I.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: I am sure now that life is not what it is purported to be and that nature, in the canny words of the Scotch theologue, 'is not as natural as it looks.
Author: Loren Eiseley

Quote: Love knows no limit to its endurance, no end to its trust, no fading of its hope; it can outlast anything. Love still stands when all else has fallen.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: In marriage, each partner is to be an encourager rather than a critic; a forgiver rather than a collector of hurts; an enabler rather than a reformer.
Author: H. Norman Wright

Quote: The quickest way to rectify that mistake (choosing the wrong person) is by learning from that, moving on, and choosing much more wisely in the future.
Author: Greg Behrendt

Quote: How can I grieve what is still in motion?"I ask her. "Shoes are still dropping all over the place. I´m not kidding,"I say. "It´s Normandy out there.
Author: Suzanne Finnamore

Quote: An eternity of wishing to speak directly to my Creator - I thought in despair - and this is how He finally contacts me? Through AOL Instant Messenger?
Author: A.M. Jenkins

Quote: Maybe that's what religion is, hurling yourself off a cliff and trusting that something bigger will take care of you and carry you to the right place.
Author: Maria Semple

Quote: They could not understand the advantage of living contrary to their inclinations in this world in order to enjoy a hypothetical well-being in another.
Author: Isabel Allende

Quote: That it would always be summer and autumn, and you always courting me, and always thinking as much of me as you have done through the past summertime!
Author: Thomas Hardy

Quote: When they're together, the world could fall apart around them and they'd never notice or care as long as they have each other.About Alex and Brittany.
Author: Simone Elkeles

Quote: It is curious that the human mind could blindly accept an infinite speed but had reservations to accept a finite one, simply because it was too large!
Author: Felix Alba-Juez

Quote: ... the greatest menace to our capacity for contemplation is the incessant fabrication of tawdry empty stimuli which kill the receptivity of the soul.
Author: Josef Pieper

Quote: I've known rivers:I've known rivers ancient as the world and older than the flow of human blood in human veins.My soul has grown deep like the rivers.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: Let your wisdom guide youOn your own personal journey By listening to your heartYour soul will be alight And let you beAll that you are intended to be
Author: Karen Hackel

Quote: She has often felt that her outsides were too dull for her insides, that deep within her there was something better than what everyone else could see.
Author: Myla Goldberg

Quote: For success, the author must make the reader care about the destiny of the principals, and sustain this anxiety, or suspense, for about 100,000 words.
Author: Ken Follett

Quote: Four years of football are calculated to breed in the average man more of the ingredients of success in life than almost any academic course he takes.
Author: Knute Rockne

Quote: I'd rather strive for the kind of interview where instead of me asking to introduce myself to society, society asks me to introduce myself to society.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: I'm not after fame and success and fortune and power. It's mostly that I want to have a good job and have good friends; that's the good stuff in life.
Author: Drew Barrymore

Quote: My story of success and failure is not just about music and being famous. It's about living and loving and trying to find purpose in this crazy world.
Author: Wynonna Judd

Quote: The logic of worldly success rests on a fallacy: the strange error that our perfection depends on the thoughts and opinions and applause of other men!
Author: Thomas Merton

Quote: You will be a failure, until you impress the subconscious with the conviction you are a success. This is done by making an affirmation which 'clicks.'
Author: Florence Scovel Shinn

Quote: When I touched her body,I believed she was God.In the curves of her formI found the birth of Man,the creation of the world,and the origin of all life.
Author: Roman Payne

Quote: When you have money in hand,only you forget who are you .But when you do not have any money in your hand,the whole world forget who you are.It's life.
Author: Bill Gates

Quote: To shut your mind, heart, imagination to the sufferings of others is to begin slowly but inexorably to die. It is to cease by inches from being human.
Author: John Austin Baker

Quote: At times anger will trigger harsh words. After a cooling period wisdom sets in; finally, the ability to speak from the heart with love and compassion.
Author: Ana Monnar

Quote: But goodness alone is never enough. A hard, cold wisdom is required for goodness to accomplish good. Goodness without wisdom always accomplishes evil.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Quote: Grown people know that they do not always know the way of things, and even if they think they know, they do not know where and how they got the proof.
Author: Zora Neale Hurston

Quote: I was tired of seeing the Graces always depicted as beautiful young things. I think wisdom comes with age and life and pain. And knowing what matters.
Author: Louise Penny

Quote: Many have died; you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.
Author: Kabir

Quote: Writing is really a way of thinking--not just feeling but thinking about things that are disparate, unresolved, mysterious, problematic or just sweet.
Author: Toni Morrison

Quote: The educator must believe in the potential power of his pupil, and he must employ all his art in seeking to bring his pupil to experience this power.
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: We work in the dark - we do what we can - we give what we have. Our doubt is our passion and our passion is our task. The rest is the madness of art.
Author: Henry James

Quote: When you think about Dada and the great moments in Modern Art, it's always the sense of when you're not sure that art is most likely to be occurring.
Author: Richard Phillips

Quote: My grandfather says that's what books are for,"Ashoke said, using the opportunity to open the volume in his hands. "To travel without moving an inch.
Author: Jhumpa Lahiri

Quote: The failure to read good books both enfeebles the vision and strengthens our most fatal tendency -- the belief that the here and now is all there is.
Author: Allan Bloom

Quote: There is a line of poetry, a sentence in a fable, a word in an essay, by which my existence is justified; find that line, and immortality is assured.
Author: Alberto Manguel

Quote: What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore, it knows it's not foolin' a soul.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: I like to imagine that, on the day after my last, my library and I will crumble together, so that even when I am no more I'll still be with my books.
Author: Alberto Manguel

Quote: I was waiting for the longest time, she said. I thought you forgot.It is hard to forget, I said, when there is such an empty space when you are gone.
Author: Brian Andreas

Quote: Even if it were true that evolution, or the teaching of evolution, encouraged immorality that would not imply that the theory of evolution was false.
Author: Richard Dawkins

Quote: Trying to get more learning out of the present system is like trying to get the Pony Express to compete with the telegraph by breeding faster ponies.
Author: Edward Fiske

Quote: [I]t is difficult to imagine a set of beliefs more suggestive of mental illness than those that lie at the heart of many of our religious traditions.
Author: Sam Harris

Quote: Love is like the wild rose-briar; Friendship like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose-briar blooms, but which will bloom most constantly?
Author: Emily Bronte

Quote: Rock n' roll as a genre is different from pop and hip hop: it is about bands, and that for me suggests brotherhood, family, friendship and community.
Author: Steven Van Zandt

Quote: Bachelorhood: all the fun of married life and more prosperity, leaving lots of descendants to boast of their father's memory to their fellow inmates.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: People who cease to believe in God or goodness altogether still believe in the devil... Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.
Author: Anne Rice

Quote: All things, even the deepest sorrow or the most profound happiness are all temporary. Hope is fuel for the soul, without hope, forward motion ceases.
Author: Landon Parham

Quote: The British do not expect happiness. I had the impression, all the time that I lived there, that they do not want to be happy; they want to be right.
Author: Quentin Crisp

Quote: To be stupid, and selfish, and to have good health are the three requirements for happiness - though if stupidity is lacking, the others are useless.
Author: Julian Barnes

Quote: As I hope it doesn't come to the point where I need to take a day off. I feel pretty good right now and I'm not resting or saving for any other game.
Author: Tim Duncan

Quote: At twenty a man is full of fight and hope. He wants to reform the world. When he is seventy he still wants to reform the world, but he know he can't.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: Be prepared, work hard, and hope for a little luck. Recognize that the harder you work and the better prepared you are, the more luck you might have.
Author: Ed Bradley

Quote: Growing up in Canada, most kids from Canada dream of playing in the NHL, and they also hope one day to be on a Stanley Cup team. That was a big goal.
Author: Bobby Orr

Quote: He never had any real hope in the affair from the beginning;but being a cheerful hobbit he had not needed hope,as long as despair could be postponed.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: In English, my name means hope. In Spanish, it means too many letters. It means sadness. It means waiting. It is like the number nine, a muddy color.
Author: Sandra Cisneros

Quote: In the central place of every heart, there is a recording chamber; so long as it receives messages of beauty, hope, cheer and courage, you are young.
Author: Samuel Ullman

Quote: Is there a chance?A fragment of light at the end of the tunnel?A reason to fight?Is there a chance you may change your mind?Or are we ashes and wine?
Author: A Fine Frenzy

Quote: Over the years, I had nurtured the hope to be able to fly; to handle a machine as it rose higher and higher in the stratosphere was my dearest dream.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: When you have put all your faith in man and continue to be disappointed, don't you hope there is something out of there that is not of human element?
Author: Natalie Cole

Quote: You can tell people of the need to struggle, but when the powerless start to see that they really can make a difference, nothing can quench the fire.
Author: Leymah Gbowee

Quote: I have a hobby. I have the world's largest collection of sea shells. I keep it scattered on beaches all over the world. Maybe you've seen some of it.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: I really hate sitcoms on television with canned laughter and stuff. What really makes me laugh is the real-life stuff. I've got a dry sense of humor.
Author: Katie Price

Quote: I should say, one of the things about being a widow or a widower, you really, really need a sense of humor, because everything's going to fall apart.
Author: Joyce Carol Oates

Quote: I'm trying to make some sense out of the phrase "Everything happens for a reason,"and I think I've figured out what the reason is - to pissed me off.
Author: Cecelia Ahern

Quote: Teasing and a sense of humor, if you can develop that in your kids, and if you can exercise it with the kids, just makes for a pleasanter atmosphere.
Author: P. J. O'Rourke

Quote: The way humor's usually used in horror, it's as a pressure-release valve; without it, the drama would escalate out of all control almost immediately.
Author: Stephen Graham Jones

Quote: RésuméRazors pain you,Rivers are damp,Acids stain you,And drugs cause cramp.Guns aren't lawful,Nooses give,Gas smells awful.You might as well live.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: A mathematical formula for happiness:Reality divided by Expectations.There were two ways to be happy:improve your reality or lower your expectations.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: Ask yourself these three questions, Tatiana Metanova, and you will know who you are. Ask: What do believe in? What do you hope for? What do you love?
Author: Paullina Simons

Quote: I have never felt that anything really mattered but knowing that you stood for the things in which you believed and had done the very best you could.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: No one in this world can change your habits, but only you can..... so, MOst powerfull person of this world is you..!..........keep that in your mind!
Author: M Fazan Hafeez

Quote: The difference between false memories and true ones is thesame as for jewels: it is always the false ones that look themost real, the most brilliant.
Author: Salvador Dalí

Quote: Whatever you think, be sure it is what you think; whatever you want, be sure that is what you want; whatever you feel, be sure that is what you feel.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: When each day is the same as the next, it's because people fail to recognize the good things that happen in their lives every day that the sun rises.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Words are tears that have been written down. Tears are words that need to be shed. Without them, joy loses all its brilliance and sadness has no end.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: You must learn to take a step back and visualize the whole piece. If you focus only on the thread given to you, you lose sight of what it can become.
Author: Colleen Houck

Quote: But God caused knowledge to be given to Adam and those with him, so that the kings of chaos and the underworld might not lord it over them."[--Jesus]
Author: Rodolphe Kasser

Quote: Don't wish...DO! Don't try...BE! Don't think...KNOW! And above all: Bless a stranger with a small, yet powerful, random act of kindness. You feel me?
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Many things the gods achieve beyond our judgement,'"said the sorrowful girl. "'What we thought is not confirmed and what we thought not God contives.
Author: John Irving

Quote: We are drowning in information but starving for knowledge and wisdom. Education ought to teach us not only how to make a living but also how to live.
Author: Shiv Khera

Quote: Because there was a hunger in me to see everything and do everything. I wanted to be everyone I saw. I wasn't enough for me. Can you understand that?
Author: Sidney Sheldon
