Quote: I can't imagine the scientists wanting me to walk into the lab and start fiddling around with some big bowl of electrons they had out.
Author: Jim Benton

Quote: If you are searching for sacred knowledge and not just a palliative for your fears, then you will train yourself to be a good skeptic.
Author: Ann Druyan

Quote: One general law, leading to the advancement of all organic beings, namely, multiply, vary, let the strongest live and the weakest die.
Author: Charles Darwin

Quote: You know what's wrong with scientific power? It's a form of inherited wealth. And you know what assholes congenitally rich people are.
Author: Michael Crichton

Quote: All those that don't allow us to do things for the Soul (our True Self), they are our opposers (kashays); we shouldn't listen to them.
Author: Dada Bhagwan

Quote: How can I tell anyone that there has always lived within me a rusty sense of disgust-a dull, brackish water that I suspect is my soul?
Author: A.M. Homes

Quote: Honesty and loyalty are key. If two people can be honest with each other about everything, that's probably the biggest key to success.
Author: Taylor Lautner

Quote: If you have a success you have it for the wrong reasons. If you become popular it is always because of the worst aspects of your work.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: Success depends in a very large measure upon individual initiative and exertion, and cannot be achieved except by a dint of hard work.
Author: Anna Pavlova

Quote: Success is realising the true joy and wonder of life can only be yours if you follow your own intuition, aiming to achieve your bliss.
Author: Steven Redhead

Quote: The delusions of self-love cannot be prevented, but intellectual misconceptions as to the means of achieving success may be corrected.
Author: George Henry Lewes

Quote: The first step is the most important. It is the most crucial and the most effective as it will initiate the direction you have chosen.
Author: Steve Backley

Quote: The hardest thing to find in life is balance - especially, the more success you have, the more you look to the other side of the gate.
Author: Celine Dion

Quote: The negative side of the American Dream comes when people pursue success at any cost, which in turn destroys the vision and the dream.
Author: Azar Nafisi

Quote: Whatever success I may have attained is due to the fact that since I was old enough to work at all, my ambition has never deserted me.
Author: Anna Held

Quote: You really have to work hard and apply yourself and by applying yourself and working hard and being diligent, you can achieve success.
Author: Julie Benz

Quote: All truth passes through three stages: First, it is ridiculed; Second, it is violently opposed; Third, it is accepted as self-evident.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: Don't assume, ask. Be kind. Tell the truth. Don't say anything you can't stand behind fully. Have integrity. Tell people how you feel.
Author: Warsan Shire

Quote: For people who say they hate being lied to, just start telling them nothing but the pure truth--about everything. That will teach them
Author: Seth Adam Brown

Quote: The First Splendid Truth: To be happy, I need to think about feeling good, feeling bad, and feeling right, in an atmosphere of growth.
Author: Gretchen Rubin

Quote: They're just words. And words alone don't really mean anything. It's what you feel and what you believe when you say them that matter.
Author: Dana Reinhardt

Quote: When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: Animals don't have a voice, but I do. A loud one. A big f***ing mouth. My voice is for them. And I'll never shut up while they suffer.
Author: Ricky Gervais

Quote: Animals don't have a voice, but I do. A loud one. A big fucking mouth. My voice is for them. And I'll never shut up while they suffer.
Author: Ricky Gervais

Quote: The best part of being a vegan is the purity and peace of mind one experiences and the strong connection I feel to the animal kingdom.
Author: Uri Gellar

Quote: The more important point here, though, is that the whole animal-cruelty-and-eating issue is not just complex, it's also uncomfortable.
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: The most powerful bond we know of is the bond between mother and child, and we break it in order to make 'comfort foods' for ourselves
Author: Michael Schwarz

Quote: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: The wise are not wise because they make no mistakes. They are wise because they correct their mistakes as soon as they recognize them.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: Water is the softest thing, yet it can penetrate mountains and earth. This shows clearly the principle ofsoftness overcoming hardness.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Better to write for yourself and have no public, than to write for the public and have no self."[The New Statesman, February 25, 1933]
Author: Cyril Connolly

Quote: But the truth is, it's not the idea, it's never the idea, it's always what you do with it."(Online journal entry for January 31, 2009)
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: I start with a tingle, a kind of feeling of the story I will write. Then come the characters, and they take over, they make the story.
Author: Karen Blixen

Quote: The best fame is a writer's fame. It's enough to get a table at a good restaurant, but not enough to get you interrupted when you eat.
Author: Fran Lebowitz

Quote: Es kommt nicht darauf an, wie eine Geschichte anfängt. Auch nicht darauf, wie sie aufhört. Sondern auf das, was dazwischen passiert.
Author: Walter Moers

Quote: Courage is the willingness to engage in a risk-taking behavior regardless of whether the consequences are unknown or possibly adverse.
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: Giving is the secret of a healthy life. Not necessarily money, but whatever a person has of encouragement, sympathy and understanding.
Author: John D. Rockefeller

Quote: Just trust that everything is unfolding the way it is supposed to. Don't resist... Great things are waiting for you around the corner.
Author: Sonia Ricotti

Quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Being good in business is the most fascinating kind of art. Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.
Author: Andy Warhol

Quote: If commercialization is putting my art on a shirt so that a kid who can't afford a $30,000 painting can buy one, then I'm all for it.
Author: Keith Haring

Quote: Venice is the perfect place for a phase of art to die. No other city on earth embraces entropy quite like this magical floating mall.
Author: Jerry Saltz

Quote: A word to the unwise.Torch every book.Char every page.Burn every word to ash.Ideas are incombustible.And therein lies your real fear.
Author: Ellen Hopkins

Quote: But there is in everything a reasonable division of labour. I have written the book, and nothing on earth would induce me to read it.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: If all printers were determined not to print anything till they were sure it would offend nobody, there would be very little printed.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: The unread story is not a story; it is little black marks on wood pulp. The reader, reading it, makes it live: a live thing, a story.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quote: You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up.
Author: Pat Conroy

Quote: I said, 'I need to know how he died.'He flipped back and pointed at, 'Why?'So I can stop inventing how he died. I'm always inventing.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: I wish to live to 150 years old, but the day I die, I wish it to be with a cigarette in one hand and a glass of whiskey in the other.
Author: Ava Gardner

Quote: Nico found a sort of freedom in knowing that eventually, no matter what happened, he would end up at the foot of his father's throne.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: There is a certain right by which we many deprive a man of life, but none by which we may deprive him of death; this is mere cruelty.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: to die tomorrow was no worse than dying on any other day. Every day was there to be lived or to mark one's departure from this world.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: We are all the fools of time and terror: DaysSteal on us and steal from us; yet we live,Loathing our life, and dreading still to die.
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: Would you like me to [kill you] now?"asked Snape, his voice heavy with irony. "Or would you like a few moments to compose an epitaph?
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Education, boy, is not something to prepare you for life. That is a vulgar American error.… It's something to take you out of life.
Author: John Horne Burns

Quote: The Bible makes it clear that every time that there is a story of faith, it is completely original. God's creative genius is endless.
Author: Eugene H. Peterson

Quote: The only thing that stands between a person and what they want in life is the will to try it and the faith to believe it is possible.
Author: Rich DeVos

Quote: Friendship is a plant of slow growth and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to the appellation.
Author: George Washington

Quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
Author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quote: I hate you' she said to me one afternoon. 'I really, really hate you.' Call me sensitive, but I couldn't help but take it personally.
Author: David Sedaris

Quote: When I was growing up we didn't have a massive house and there were five women running around, so my dad and I had to stick together!
Author: Louis Tomlinson

Quote: Human happiness is defined by the hardships and conflicts you have been through. The greater they are, the greater is your happiness.
Author: Peter Deunov

Quote: Be a craftsman in speech that thou mayest be strong, for the strength of one is the tongue, and speech is mightier than all fighting.
Author: Ptahhotep

Quote: Have you lost your hope? Have you remained inside the fog? Don't worry; even if you can't find it, a new hope will come and find you!
Author: Mehmet Murat ildan

Quote: Stop trying to be less of who you are. Let this time in your life cut you open and drain all of the things that are holding you back.
Author: Jennifer Elisabeth

Quote: I am forever grateful for not knowing—What would have been. WHAT WILL BE holds none of those bittersweet pangs and it is lit w joy.
Author: Erica Goros

Quote: I kept reaching for my muses,my wandering muses, floatingon clouds filled with their passions.”(Muses of Wandering Passions, p. 64)
Author: Chimnese Davids

Quote: Basically, I think you need two things to get by in this world: a sense of humor and the ability to laugh when your ego is destroyed.
Author: Arlo Guthrie

Quote: Calvin: Why are you crying mom?Mom: I'm cutting up an onion.Calvin: It must be hard to cook if you anthrpomorphisize your vegetables.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: Everybody finished the song at different times. At last, only the Weasley twins were left singing along to a very slow funeral march.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Honesty may be the best policy, but it's important to remember that apparently, by elimination, dishonesty is the second-best policy.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I can still kick your pony-lovin' butt with twice this much pain."Thomas shrugged, "I do love ponies. Wish I could eat one right now.
Author: James Dashner

Quote: I gave him my best cryptic smile. He did not fall down to his feet, kiss my shoes, and promise me the world. I must be getting rusty.
Author: Ilona Andrews

Quote: I have a high pain threshold. In fact, it's more of a large and tastfully decorated foyer than a threshold. But I do get easily bored
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Let me ask you a question Alex. What do you think is the greatest evil on this plant today?""Is that including, or not including you?
Author: Anthony Horowitz

Quote: There is a proverbial saying chiefly concerned with warning against too closely calculating the numerical value of un-hatched chicks.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Wit is a weapon. Jokes are a masculine way of inflicting superiority. But humor is the pursuit of a gentle grin, usually in solitude.
Author: Frank Muir

Quote: Amida's unimpeded light is the sun of wisdom that destroys the mind of darkness.(Preface in Teaching, Practice, Faith, Enlightenment)
Author: Kentetsu Takamori

Quote: Even if things don't unfold the way you expected, don't be disheartened or give up. One who continues to advance will win in the end.
Author: Daisaku Ikeda

Quote: Every moment is an opportunity to become more enlightened, more open and expanded. Continually choose that path and you will be free.
Author: Dashama Konah Gordon

Quote: In order to grow, I promise you'll have to let go of some habits. 10 times out of 10, they'll be the habits you're most in love with.
Author: Brandi L. Bates

Quote: Living a Princely life requires that you learn to think and reason like the Prince, talk and behave like him, react like him as well.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: There are two ways to reach me: by way of kisses or by way of the imagination. But there is a hierarchy: the kisses alone don't work.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: We are all of us born with a letter inside us, and that only if we are true to ourselves, may we be allowed to read it before we die.
Author: Douglas Coupland

Quote: You need to trustTo surrenderTo ask for guidanceGo within for the answersThey're within youYou have the answersAll you need do is ask
Author: Karen Hackel

Quote: You see countries like India really investing in their space program because they see it as inspirational and good for their economy.
Author: Ellen Stofan

Quote: A peaceful feeling: A happy harmony or symphony of all of our character pieces working in powerful unison” from Cinderella In Focus
Author: H.L. Balcomb

Quote: I just want you to know that you're very special… and the only reason I'm telling you is that I don't know if anyone else ever has.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: Of what a strange nature is knowledge! It clings to a mind when it has once seized on it like a lichen on a rock."- Frankenstein p115
Author: Mary Shelley

Quote: One is seldom unchanged by the death of those one loves. It gives me a deeper knowledge of them, and so of oneself in regard to them.
Author: Elizabeth Goudge

Quote: Knowledge without application is simply knowledge. Applying the knowledge to one's life is wisdom — and that is the ultimate virtue
Author: Kasi Kaye Iliopoulos

Quote: and every day I thank [God] that I am alive, not because I fear death, but because my wife has a husband and my son is not an orphan.
Author: Khaled Hosseini

Quote: Atticus had said it was the polite thing to talk to people about what they were interested in, not about what you were interested in.
Author: Harper Lee

Quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: Everyone has his own reality in which, if one is not too cautious, timid or frightened, one swims. This is the only reality there is.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: I have been very blessed in my life and rewarded with good friends and good health. I am grateful and happy to be able to share this.
Author: Eric Idle

Quote: If there was anything that depressed him more than his own cynicism, it was that quite often it still wasn't as cynical as real life.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: It's never an insult to be called what somebody thinks is a bad name. It just shows you how poor that person is, it doesn't hurt you.
Author: Harper Lee

Quote: My formula for life is very simple: in the morning, wake up; at night, go to sleep. In between I try and occupy myself as best I can.
Author: Cary Grant

Quote: Often, it's not about becoming a new person, but becoming the person you were meant to be, and already are, but don't know how to be.
Author: Heath L. Buckmaster

Quote: Real life is messy, inconsistent, and it's seldom when anything ever really gets resolved. It's taken me a long time to realize that.
Author: Alan Moore

Quote: Single is not a status, it is a word that describes a person who is strong enough to live and enjoy life without depending on others.
Author: prixie

Quote: Things Happen and once they start happening you pretty much just to hold on for dear life and see where they drop you when they stop.
Author: Meg Rosoff

Quote: I didn't have a fireworks moment for my salvation. I had a falling in love with Jesus in Sunday school when I was a very young child.
Author: Beth Moore

Quote: I prayed for all his dreams to come true. I prayed that I would always be able to connect with him--even if I was no longer on earth.
Author: Alexandra Adornetto

Quote: If I had a camera,' I said, 'I'd take a picture of you every day. That way I'd remember how you looked every single day of your life.
Author: Nicole Krauss

Quote: Love is much nicer to be in than an automobile accident, a tight girdle, a higher tax bracket or a holding pattern over Philadelphia.
Author: Judith Viorst

Quote: Love never reasons, but profusely gives; it gives like a thoughtless prodigal its all, and then trembles least it has done to little.
Author: Hannah More

Quote: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time; what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.
Author: Sydney J. Harris

Quote: The essence of Hinduism is the same essence of all true religions: Bhakti or pure love for God and genuine compassion for all beings.
Author: Radhanath Swami

Quote: You have to be very fond of men. Very, very fond. You have to be very fond of them to love them. Otherwise they're simply unbearable.
Author: Marguerite Duras

Quote: You know, all that really matters is that the people you love are happy and healthy. Everything else is just sprinkles on the sundae.
Author: Paul Walker

Quote: The future reshapes the memory of the past in the way it recalibrates significance: some episodes are advanced, others lose purchase.
Author: Gregory Maguire

Quote: Wrote my way out of the hood...thought my way out of poverty! Don't tell me that knowledge isn't power. Education changes everything.
Author: Brandi L. Bates

Quote: ...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.
Author: Ally Condie

Quote: I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: It matters not how strait the gate, How charged with punishments the scroll, I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul.
Author: William Ernest Henley

Quote: It's a lot easier to be lost than found. It's the reason we're always searching and rarely discovered--so many locks not enough keys.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: So light a fire!"Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!"... "HAVE YOU GONE MAD!"Ron bellowed. "ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: I can accept anything, except what seems to be the easiest for most people: the half-way, the almost, the just-about, the in-between.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: The progress of the world can certainly never come at all save by the modified action of the individual beings who compose the world.
Author: George Eliot

Quote: To be poor, ugly and, moreover, intelligent condemns one in our society to a dark and disillusioned life...to beauty all is forgiven.
Author: Muriel Barbery

Quote: When we sense something, it is due to the movement of atoms in space. When I see the moon it is because "moon atoms"penetrate my eye.
Author: Jostein Gaarder

Quote: You do not write your life with words...You write it with actions. What you think is not important. It is only important what you do.
Author: Patrick Ness

Quote: He wanted to be a poet,' someone else put in while Maggie hugged Tim and patted his back. 'Said he'd only lacked the words to be one.
Author: Nora Roberts

Quote: One need not be a Chamber — to be Haunted — One need not be a House — The Brain has Corridors — surpassing Material Place —
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: A man who has come to the full realization of his responsibility to men won't stick to one man. It will be foolhardy if he does that.
Author: Ogwo David Emenike

Quote: If the fate of the universe was decided in a single moment at the instant of the Big Bang , that was the most creative moment of all.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: A man can know his father, or his son, and there might still be nothing between them but loyalty and love and mutual incomprehension.
Author: Marilynne Robinson

Quote: It's just the most amazing thing to love a dog, isn't it? It makes our relationships with people seem as boring as a bowl of oatmeal.
Author: John Grogan

Quote: Do those people who hold up the Bible as an inspiration tomoral rectitude have the slightest notion of what is actually writtenin it?
Author: Richard Dawkins

Quote: My best advice to anyone who wants to raise a happy, mentally healthy child is: Keep him or her as far away from a church as you can.
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: I will bathe in your warmth ma petite. Roll you around me until my heart beats only for you. My breath will grow warm from your kiss.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton

Quote: She could not leave him hanging like this. “If you were hurt, I need to know.” It was a rule somewhere, in the good-guy handbook.
Author: Tara Janzen

Quote: Nature never appeals to intelligence until habit and instinct are useless. There is no intelligence where there is no need of change.
Author: H.G. Wells

Quote: The element of chance in basic research is overrated. Chance is a lady who smiles only upon those few who know how to make her smile.
Author: Hans Selye

Quote: What are the chances that we will one day discover that DNA has absolutely nothing to do with inheritance? They are effectively zero.
Author: Sam Harris

Quote: Friendship is not by force but by choice.You can never please everybody, he who aims to please everybody will end up pleasing nobody.
Author: Stella Oladiran

Quote: Get off the treadmill of consumption, replication, and mediocrity. Begin lifting the weights of creativity, originality, and success.
Author: Ryan Lilly

Quote: Racing is about discipline and intelligence, not about who has the heavier foot. The one who drives smart will always win in the end.
Author: Garth Stein

Quote: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
Author: Dale Turner

Quote: You have to take your own bold approach, and if you do you will be rewarded with success. Or calamitous failure. That can happen too.
Author: Steven Moffat

Quote: Every impulse of feeling should be guided by reason; and, in my opinion, exertion should always be in proportion to what is required.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: I'd rather have cancer than a dishonest heart. Which isn't being pious. Just practical. Cancer may cool you, but the other's sure to.
Author: Truman Capote

Quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
Author: René Descartes

Quote: Speciesism is morally objectionable because, like racism, sexism, and heterosexism, it links personhood with an irrelevant criterion.
Author: Gary L. Francione

Quote: By eating meat we share the responsibility of climate change, the destruction of our forests, and the poisoning of our air and water.
Author: Thích Nh?t H?nh

Quote: We cannot justify treating any sentient nonhuman as our property, as a resource, as a thing that we an use and kill for our purposes.
Author: Gary L. Francione

Quote: You have just dined, and however scrupulously the slaughterhouse is concealed in the graceful distance of miles, there is complicity.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The operation of the Church is entirely set up for the sinner; which creates much misunderstanding among the smug.”(August 9, 1955)
Author: Flannery O'Connor

Quote: I want to be clear about this. If you wrote from experience, you'd get maybe one book, maybe three poems. Writers write from empathy.
Author: Nikki Giovanni

Quote: If you show someone something you've written, you give them a sharpened stake, lie down in your coffin, and say, "When you're ready'.
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: In old days books were written by men of letters and read by the public. Nowadays books are written by the public and read by nobody.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Mastery is not a function of genius or talent, it is a function of time and intense focus applied to a particular field of knowledge.
Author: Robert Greene

Quote: My actions are my only true belongings. I cannot escape the consequences of my actions. My actions are the ground upon which I stand.
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh

Quote: There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quote: A work of art when placed in a gallery loses its charge, and becomes a portable object or surface disengaged from the outside world.
Author: Robert Smithson

Quote: Art is the child of Nature; yes, her darling child, in whom we trace the features of the mother's face, her aspect and her attitude.
Author: Beck

Quote: I was an anorexic, beer drinking, class cutting, doodling, shoplifting, skater chick that was into nature, art class, and the beach.
Author: Rebecca Miller

Quote: In our life there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
Author: Marc Chagall

Quote: The artist's world is limitless. It can be found anywhere, far from where he lives or a few feet away. It is always on his doorstep.
Author: Paul Strand

Quote: Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they'll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back.
Author: John Green

Quote: Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they'll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back.
Author: John Green

Quote: For all the books in his possession, he still failed to read the stories written plain as day in the faces of the people around him.
Author: Emma Donoghue

Quote: In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you.
Author: Mortimer J. Adler

Quote: Men, I thought, were more trouble than they were worth. Really, one should stick to books where one sees the hero coming a mile off.
Author: Eva Rice

Quote: Let us beware of saying that death is the opposite of life. The living being is only a species of the dead, and a very rare species.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: We are biology. We are reminded of this at the beginning and the end, at birth and at death. In between we do what we can to forget.
Author: Mary Roach

Quote: As the world fights those who use violence to advance their agenda, engagement, not neutrality,is needed in our educational systems.
Author: Gregory S. Prince

Quote: I would say, then, that you are faced with a future in which education is going to be number one amongst the great world industries.
Author: R. Buckminster Fuller

Quote: I'm a Prince of Wales Trust ambassador, so I'm all about giving youth an education, a voice and a chance to not take the wrong road.
Author: Benedict Cumberbatch

Quote: There are few things more pathetic than those who have lost their curiosity and sense of adventure, and who no longer care to learn.
Author: Gordon B. Hinckley

Quote: Comparing yourself to others does nothing for you. Society has conditioned us to value people who fit a secular mold of perfection".
Author: Michele Woolley

Quote: Doubt is a question mark; faith is an exclamation point. The most compelling, believable, realistic stories have included them both.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: faith gaped at him"how the hell did you do this?"He looked at her as if she'd asked the dumbest question in history. "I'm brilliant.
Author: Dianne Sylvan

Quote: For me the most radical demand of Christian faith lies in summoning the courage to say yes to the present risenness of Jesus Christ.
Author: Brennan Manning

Quote: I accept the Organic Trinity of Mineral, Vegetable, and Animal with as much authority as I accept the Holy Trinity. Both are sacred.
Author: Terry Tempest Williams

Quote: The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not.
Author: Eric Hoffer

Quote: Around the time I graduated from high school, I decided better to underachieve and have friendship than to overachieve and be alone.
Author: Evangeline Lilly

Quote: I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: So India's problem turns out to be the world's problem. What happened in India has happened in God's name.The problem's name is God.
Author: Salman Rushdie

Quote: To judge from the notions expounded by theologians, one must conclude that God created most men simply with a view to crowding hell.
Author: Marquis de Sade

Quote: Whatever God requires is right, no matter what it is, although we may not see the reason there of until all of the events transpire.
Author: Joseph Smith Jr.

Quote: Freddie often fold me that you've got to be happy when you can, because life won't wait for you to take the time. And she was right.
Author: April Genevieve Tucholke

Quote: It's true that laughter really is cheap medicine. It's a prescription anyone can afford. And best of all, you can fill it right now.
Author: Steve Goodier

Quote: The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.
Author: Carlos Castaneda

Quote: For though, I walk through the valley of shadows of Death, I will never fear. For You are in Me and I know You will never let me Go.
Author: Jestoni Revealed

Quote: God gives me hope that there is something greater than us, something better and bigger than the here and now, that can help us live.
Author: Mattie Stepanek

Quote: Hope is necessary in every condition. The miseries of poverty, sickness and captivity would, without this comfort, be insupportable.
Author: William Samuel Johnson

Quote: I get asked to read new works a lot, in the hope that I will give a quotation and I will only give a 'puff' for a book I truly love.
Author: Peter James

Quote: I simply can't build my hopes on a foundation of confusion, misery and death... I think... peace and tranquillity will return again.
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: I think if you show up and you work hard and you're straightforward, you can always create your own opportunities. I hope I'm right.
Author: Cory Monteith

Quote: Only those with skin as thick as elephant hide can hope to sail through their teens unscathed by self-doubt and bouts of depression.
Author: Mariella Frostrup

Quote: She knew then that white was more than a color: It was a cold, pale shade of understanding that seems to take all of your hope away.
Author: Vannetta Chapman

Quote: Unless our conception of patriotism is progressive, it cannot hope to embody the real affection and the real interest of the nation.
Author: Jane Addams

Quote: What hurts so bad about youth isn't the actual butt whippings the world delivers. It's the stupid hopes playacting like certainties.
Author: Mary Karr

Quote: When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.
Author: Pittacus Lore

Quote: Be sure to lie to your kids about the benevolent, all-seeing Santa Claus. It will prepare them for an adulthood of believing in God.
Author: Scott Dikkers

Quote: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye.
Author: Jim Henson

Quote: Before you criticize a man, walk a mile in his shoes. That way, when you do criticize him, you'll be a mile away and have his shoes.
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: Do you know, sire, I think that if we live to tell our grandchildren about this war, they will accuse us of making it up.' -Marielle
Author: Tamora Pierce

Quote: I have never voted in my life... I have always known and understood that the idiots are in a majority so it's certain they will win.
Author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline

Quote: I think humor can be an effective way of getting the point across, but there are definitely times where I just write very earnestly.
Author: Alex Pareene

Quote: If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask? Do they get smart just in time to ask questions?
Author: Scott Adams

Quote: It was sad music. But it waved its sadness like a battle flag. It said the universe had done all it could, but you were still alive.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: My dad instilled in me a great sense of humor. I wasn't bullied at school because my outward attitude was confident, and that helps.
Author: Warwick Davis

Quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: Yes, vanity is a weakness indeed. But pride - where there is a real superiority of mind, pride will be always under good regulation.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Leo,” Hazel gasped, “I can't—my arms—”“Hazel,” he said. “Do you trust me?”“No!”“Me neither,” Leo admitted.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Appreciate every little beautiful moment in every day of your life. Give it a try and you'll see the world from another perspective.
Author: Thea Kristine May

Quote: But even if we don't have the power to choose where we come from we can still choose where we go from there. We can still do things.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: But yield who will to their separation, My object in living is to uniteMy avocation and my vocationAs my two eyes make one in sight.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Choose joyful abundance in your heart and be unbounded, free, and relaxed. Be relentless with your choice and you'll make your mark.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Don't judge your success by what people think of you. You are your own success.Your determination and perserverence is what matters.
Author: Abigal Muchecheti

Quote: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: None of us will ever accomplish anything excellent or commanding except when he listens to this whisper which is heard by him alone.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: People say, 'It's hard to forgive...et al'. I think it's much harder to live peacefully. So, forgive and focus on living peacefully.
Author: m.ralte

Quote: We're never called on to do what hurts. We just do what hurts out of ignorance and habit. Once we see what we're doing, we can stop.
Author: Steve Hagen

Quote: Which road, which road did you takeThat brought you here at last?No road, no road did I take.I leaped, I leaped from dream to dream.
Author: Franz Werfel

Quote: Yoga is not a religion. It is a science, science of well-being, science of youthfulness, science of integrating body, mind and soul.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: She had discovered that her love of knowing was not unnatural or sinful but the direct consequence of a God-given ability to reason.
Author: Donna Woolfolk Cross

Quote: You know what I should do?"Hoshino asked excited. "Of course,"the cat said. "What'd I tell you? Cats know everything. Not like dogs.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: But I have my life, I'm living it. It's twisted, exhausting, uncertain, and full of guilt, but nonetheless, there's something there.
Author: Banana Yoshimoto

Quote: Don't sacrifice yourself too much, because if you sacrifice too much there's nothing else you can give and nobody will care for you.
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: I had spent my whole life feeling homesick. The only difference between the two of us was that I didn't know what or where home was.
Author: Marian Keyes

Quote: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.
Author: Charles Darwin

Quote: I'm very happy with my life. I am what I am. I don't worry about anything that I can't control. That's a really good lesson in life.
Author: Tom Watson

Quote: No man is worth his salt who is not ready at all times to risk his well-being, to risk his body, to risk his life, in a great cause.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: sometimes you don't need a goal in life, you don't need to know the big picture. you just need to know what you're going to do next!
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: That's what I do. Watch movies and read. Sometimes I even pretend to write, but I'm not fooling anyone. Oh, and I go to the mailbox.
Author: Nicole Krauss

Quote: The cost of a thing is the amount of what I will call life which is required to be exchanged for it, immediately or in the long run.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: You don't have to disrespect and insult others simply to hold your own ground. If you do, that shows how shaky your own position is.
Author: Red Haircrow

Quote: Be happy with being you. Love your flaws. Own your quirks. And know that you are just as perfect as anyone else, exactly as you are.
Author: Ariana Grande

Quote: Deep in her heart, she wasn't sure she deserved to be happy, nor did she believe that she was worthy of someone who seemed...normal.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: I am good, but not an angel. I do sin, but I am not the devil. I am just a small girl in a big world trying to find someone to love.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: I knew I loved you before I met youI think I dreamed you into lifeI knew I loved you before I met youI have been waiting all my life
Author: Savage Garden

Quote: I wanted movement and not a calm course of existence. I wanted excitement and danger and the chance to sacrifice myself for my love.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: I'm kind of old-school and love nothing more than sitting, opening a book, and reading it. But I also love listening to audio books.
Author: Nick Cave

Quote: In the darkness, he is invisible, but I can still feel him beside me. Sometimes you don't have to see something to know it is there.
Author: Maggie Stiefvater

Quote: One rarely falls in love without being as much attracted to what is interestingly wrong with someone as what is objectively healthy.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: To love another human in all of her splendor and imperfect perfection , it is a magnificent task...tremendous and foolish and human.
Author: Louise Erdrich

Quote: Because I've got a lot more terms of endearment to use. Honey pie. Sugarplum. Bread pudding."“Why are they all high-calorie foods?
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: There is nothing more important to true growth than realizing that you are not the voice of the mind - you are the one who hears it.
Author: Michael A. Singer

Quote: the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: The loneliest moment in someone's life is when they are watching their whole world fall apart, and all they can do is stare blankly.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Nu pot fi eu insumi decat daca ma inalt pana la furie sau cobor pana la descurajare: la nivelul meu obisnuit, ignor faptul ca exist.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quote: Pursue not the outer entanglements; Dwell not in the inner void; Be serene in the oneness of things; And dualism vanishes by itself.
Author: Sengcan

Quote: The secret of Buddhism is to remove all ideas, all concepts, in order for the truth to have a chance to penetrate, to reveal itself.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich

Quote: To believe in nothing is as ridiculous as to believe in everything. Reason and factual evidence may convert a belief into knowledge.
Author: Felix Alba-Juez

Quote: The road ahead is long and there will be many setbacks. Success is not assured… but the price of failure has never been this high.
Author: Charles Lee Lesher

Quote: Times change, as do our wills, What we are - is ever changing; All the world is made of change, And forever attaining new qualities.
Author: Luís Vaz de Camões

Quote: ....but talking to a ghost about a demon when you're in a room full of people who can't see either of them is not to be recommended.
Author: Kerstin Gier

Quote: Success is not determined by the outcome. The outcome is the result of having already decided that you are successful to begin with.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: There is bound to be turbulence in the clouds of confusion before one can view the friendly skies, and an illuminated landing strip.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: First of all, never buy a man a plasma TV until you're married. A lot of men once they have a plasma TV they don't need a girlfriend
Author: Greg Behrendt

Quote: Never knew what a friendship was, Never knew how to really love, You can't be what I need you to, & I don't know why I fuck with you
Author: Erykah Badu

Quote: The battle you are going through is not fueled by the words or actions of others; it is fueled by the mind that gives it importance.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: It is in your hands to make life miserable or happy. No religion, spiritual leaders or knowledge will ever make you fully satisfied.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: The best way to drive out the devil, if he will not yield to texts of Scripture, is to jeer and flout him, for he cannot bear scorn.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: You could just as well say that an agnostic is a deeply religious person with at least a rudimentary knowledge of human fallibility.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: He smiled. "How kind of you to confirm what I already know. Perhaps next you will introduce me to myself. I hear I am quite popular.
Author: Meredith Duran

Quote: She had been forced into prudence in her youth, she learned romance as she grew older: the natural sequel of an unnatural beginning.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: She shook off the self-recrimination. What-ifs and could-have-beens were not the way to move forward. She knew that from experience.
Author: Judi Fennell

Quote: She was not sorry. And if it was the wine telling her that, then she would tell the wine the same thing tomorrow. She was not sorry.
Author: Mary Balogh

Quote: Gravity disappears again, and we rise up off the floor like spooks from a grave. It's like the Rapture in here every thirty seconds.
Author: Mary Roach

Quote: This fascination with computer models is something I understand very well. Richard Feynmann called it a disease. I fear he is right.
Author: Michael Crichton

Quote: while the scientist sees everything that happens in one point of space, the poet feels everything that happens in one point of time.
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: Books let us into their souls and lay open to us the secrets of our own."[The Sick Chamber (The New Monthly Magazine , August 1830)]
Author: William Hazlitt

Quote: Each life involves an essential errand; not simply the task of survival, but a life-mission embedded in the soul from the beginning.
Author: Michael Meade

Quote: Everything you need for better future and success has already been written. And guess what? All you have to do is go to the library.
Author: Henri Frederic Amiel

Quote: Fashion does not have to prove that it is serious. It is the proof that intelligent frivolity can be something creative and positive
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: Forget about the consequences of failure. Failure is only a temporary change in direction to set you straight for your next success.
Author: Denis Waitley

Quote: Instead of this confusion, we need the unifying force of an official language, English, which is the language of success in America.
Author: Ernest Istook

Quote: Living as we do in an age of noise and bluster, success is now measured accordingly. We must all be seen, and heard, and on the air.
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Quote: Success depends almost entirely on how effectively you learn to manage the game's two ultimate adversaries: the course and yourself.
Author: Jack Nicklaus

Quote: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack in will.
Author: Vince Lombardi Jr.

Quote: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: The way to achieve your goals is step by step, you just need to build enough track, to be ahead of the train."~ John Milton Lawrence
Author: John Milton Lawrence

Quote: Nothing could be any worse than having to turn to your friends, your colleagues and your loved ones and say –"I gave up too soon'.
Author: Steve Backley

Quote: Lady, I do not make up things. That is lies. Lies are not true. But the truth could be made up if yo know how. And that's the truth.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: Why did adults have to be so thick? They always say “tell the truth,” and when you do, they don't believe you. What's the point?
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Perhaps in the back of our minds we already understand that something terribly wrong is happening. Our sustenance comes from misery.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: People who have chosen to live a cruelty-free plant-based lifestyle are baffled as to why other people have not made the connection.
Author: Benjamin Zephaniah

Quote: Consider that animals, like us, have one life. It is their life, their only life, and as important to them as our own life is to us.
Author: Jill Robinson

Quote: Bitter your acts, bitter am I,Kindness your deeds, kindness am I,Pleasant and gentle, so you are,Fine honeyed lips and sweet talker.
Author: Rumi

Quote: But neither infinite power nor infinite wisdom could bestow godhood upon men. For that there would have to be infinite love as well.
Author: Walter M. Miller Jr.

Quote: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: There is only one all pervading God. It has only one message - Love all, encompass all and transcend the limits of the selfish gene.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: We judge others by their actions and ourselves by our intentions. We need to offer grace to all, because we all need a little grace.
Author: Jayce O'Neal

Quote: When the last dime is gone, I'll sit on the curb outside with a pencil and a ten cent notebook and start the whole thing over again.
Author: Preston Sturges

Quote: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, 'What's in it for me?'
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Celebrity doesn't have anything to do with art or craft. It's about being rich and thinking that you're better than everybody else.
Author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt

Quote: Dear God! how beauty varies in nature and art. In a woman the flesh must be like marble; in a statue the marble must be like flesh.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: For art to exist, for any sort of aesthetic activity to exist, a certain physiological precondition is indispensable: intoxication.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I'm a disciple of Raymond Chandler, who said in his essays that there's a quality of redemption in anything that can be called art.
Author: Michael Connelly

Quote: But at night, when the library lamps are lit, the outside world disappears and nothing but the space of books remains in existence.
Author: Alberto Manguel

Quote: Walking the stacks in a library, dragging your fingers across the spines -- it's hard not to feel the presence of sleeping spirits.
Author: Robin Sloan

Quote: A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?""Well, sweetheart,"I tell her, "yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: As for Gussie Finknottle, many an experienced undertaker would have been deceived by his appearance and started embalming on sight.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: But often life asks much of you, and you either honor life by answering with all your heart, or you cower your way into your grave.
Author: James Clemens

Quote: Death is a stripping away of all that is not you. The secret of life is to "die before you die"--- and find that there is no death.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: I didn't tell him that the diagnosis came three months after I got my first period. Like: Congratulations! You're a woman. Now die.
Author: John Green

Quote: Death has this much to be said for it:You don't have to get out of bed for it.Wherever you happen to beThey bring it to you—free.
Author: Kingsley Amis

Quote: The quality of the relationships that students have in class with their peers and teachers is important to their success in school.
Author: Bob Pletka

Quote: Faith can be very very dangerous, and deliberately to implant it into the vulnerable mind of an innocent child is a grievous wrong.
Author: Richard Dawkins

Quote: God is perceived by the heart, not by your reason. But what is reason? Your heart simplifying God's guidance to fit your own needs.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: It isn't for the moment you are struck that you need courage, but for that long uphill climb back to sanity and faith and security.
Author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

Quote: There is nothing anti-intellectual in the leap of faith, for faith is not believing without proof but trusting without reservation.
Author: William Sloane Coffin Jr.

Quote: Everyone should be able to do one card trick, tell two jokes, and recite three poems, in case they are ever trapped in an elevator.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: It may not always be easy, convenient or politically correct to stand for truth and right, but it is the right thing to do. Always.
Author: M. Russell Ballard

Quote: The irony is that while God doesn't need us but still wants us, we desperately need God but don't really want Him most of the time.
Author: Francis Chan

Quote: ‎"Do you know that nothing you do in this life will ever matter, unless it is about loving God and loving the people he has made?
Author: Francis Chan

Quote: The dead don't desire revenge, but the happiness of the livng. To dirty your small hands would bring joy to no one.-Kenshin to Eiji
Author: Nobuhiro Watsuki

Quote: To be happy you must have taken the measure of your powers, tasted the fruits of your passion, and learned your place in the world.
Author: George Santayana

Quote: We are often insane with happiness. We are also very unhappy for reasons neither of us can do anything about. Like being separated.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger

Quote: And this we should believe: that hope and volition can bring us closer to our ultimate goal: justice for all, injustice for no-one.
Author: Eyvind Johnson

Quote: Being a star has made it possible for me to get insulted in places where the average Negro could never hope to go and get insulted.
Author: Sammy Davis

Quote: I have more awareness of other people and, I hope, more sensitivity to their needs. I also find that I'm more direct and outspoken.
Author: Christopher Reeve

Quote: I'm a good person, I hope. But I'm never as good as I want to be, never as nice as I want to be, never as generous as I want to be.
Author: David Tennant

Quote: Reality is, Hope and Despair lie in the same places. And they're just a matter of perspective.What changed my perspective, was her.
Author: Richie Singh

Quote: Everything here is edible; even I'm edible. But that, dear children, is cannibalism, and is in fact frowned upon in most societies.
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: Everything in this room is edible. Even I'm edible. But, that would be called canibalism. It is looked down upon in most societies.
Author: Tim Burton

Quote: His eyes widened just a bit, his lips flexed. I realized he was trying not to laugh. I hate it when people find my threats amusing.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton

Quote: Humor writing requires a rhythm and timing, as well as some kind of connection to the reader, and I think that's how I tap into it.
Author: Kristan Higgins

Quote: I hate women who complain about being fat when they're like a size 5. Anything under size 5 isn't a woman. It's a boy with breasts.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton

Quote: I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: molesting the vampire while he's too weak to fight back, iz? jace asked. i'm pretty sure that violates at least one of the accords.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: So, please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookcase on the wall.
Author: Roald Dahl

Quote: We could visit him,"suggests Will. "But what would we say? 'I didn't know you that well, but I'm sorry you got stabbed in the eye'?
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: a wind has blown the rain away & the sky away & all the leaves away, & the trees stand. i think i, too, have known autumn too long.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: Architecture is not an inspirational business, it's a rational procedure to do sensible and hopefully beautiful things; that's all.
Author: Harry Seidler

Quote: It is a sad day when one looks back and sees that his largest regrets have become some of the most integral elements of his dreams.
Author: John Knowles

Quote: it is impossible to build one's own happiness on the unhappiness of others. This perspective is at the heart of Buddhist teachings.
Author: Daisaku Ikeda

Quote: It is not the failure of others to appreciate your abilities that should trouble you, but rather your failure to appreciate theirs.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Some instances in life call for humility. But, sometimes you need to be flat-out brazen when it comes to the desires of your heart.
Author: Nakia R. Laushaul

Quote: The meaning of life is that it is to be lived, and it is not to be traded and conceptualized and squeezed into a patter of systems.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: The tide was a poem that only time could create, and I watched it stream and brim and makes its steady dash homeward, to the ocean.
Author: Pat Conroy

Quote: Well if God wanted a broken spirit out of me, He would get Hiswish. At this point in my life the only thing I could do was look up.
Author: Michelle Sutton

Quote: When you are up against a wall, put down roots like a tree, until clarity comes from deeper sources to see over that wall and grow.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: Knowledge is like money: To be of value it must circulate, and in circulating it can increase in quantity and, hopefully, in value.
Author: Louis L'Amour

Quote: Sorrow is knowledge: they who know the most must mourn the deepest o'er the fatal truth, the Tree of Knowledge is not that of Life.
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: But all I could think of was how when nothing made sense and hadn't for ages, you just have to grab onto anything you feel sure of.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?
Author: Audrey Niffenegger

Quote: Even After All this timeThe Sun never says to the Earth,"You owe me."LookWhat happensWith a love like that,It lights the whole sky.
Author: حافظ

Quote: I can't really act the way I want to act, or say what I want to say all the time. And a lot of times, I cover that up with a smile.
Author: Hilary Duff

Quote: I know it's not easy for you, living this life, but try to remember, always try to remember, you're not the only one with troubles.
Author: Laini Taylor

Quote: It's a big theme in my life, learning about myself and being a better person. I'm a work in progress; I have revelations every day.
Author: Rick Rubin

Quote: Kiss a lover, Dance a measure, Find your name And buried treasure. Face your life, It's pain, It's pleasure, Leave no path untaken.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between, I occupy myself as best I can.
Author: Cary Grant

Quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: Sometimes it seemed to him that his life was delicate as a dandelion. One little puff from any direction, and it was blown to bits.
Author: Katherine Paterson

Quote: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, "What's in it for me?
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: The direction of your focus is the direction your life will move. Let yourself move toward what is good, valuable, strong and true.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: When we cannot bear to be alone, it means we do not properly value the only companion we will have from birth to death - ourselves.
Author: Eda J. LeShan

Quote: When we long for life without difficulties, remind us that oaks grow strong in contrary winds and diamonds are made under pressure.
Author: Peter Marshall

Quote: You can't have living without dying. So you can't call it living, what we got. We just are, we just be, like rocks beside the road.
Author: Natalie Babbitt

Quote: You can't just plan a moment when things get back on track, just as you can't plan the moment you lose your way in the first place.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: How do you know when it's over?""Maybe when you feel more in love with your memories than with the person standing in front of you.
Author: Gunnar Ardelius

Quote: I don't care if you danced naked on the roof of the Little Palace with him. I love you, Alina, even the part of you that loved him.
Author: Leigh Bardugo

Quote: I know...and I love you. But I don't think we love each other in the same way. And...I think keeping you near me, would destroy me.
Author: S.C. Stephens

Quote: I love Thanksgiving because it's a holiday that is centered around food and family, two things that are of utmost importance to me.
Author: Marcus Samuelsson

Quote: I think... if it is true that there are as many minds as there are heads, then there are as many kinds of love as there are hearts.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: I want my wardrobe to be full of good clothes, so that when I'm deciding what to wear, I don't run out of options. I love shopping!
Author: Virat Kohli

Quote: If in thirst you drink water from a cup, you see God in it. Those who are not in love with God will see only their own faces in it.
Author: Rumi

Quote: I'm beginning to think that maybe it's not just how much you love someone. Maybe what matters is who you are when you're with them.
Author: Anne Tyler

Quote: I'm like a starving man who has been given food. Maybe he's cold, and his clothes are torn, and he's ashamed, but he's not unhappy.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: I'm telling you this for one reason and one reason only: No matter how sure you are of someone's love, it's always nice to hear it.
Author: Mike Gayle

Quote: Real friendship or love is not manufactured or achieved by an act of will or intention. Friendship is always an act of recognition.
Author: John O'Donohue

Quote: She thought she was independent and strong, but she got one small taste of love and she was hungrier than anyone. She was ravenous.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: There are all kinds of ways for a relationship to be tested, even broken, some, irrevocably; it's the endings we're unprepared for.
Author: Katherine Owen

Quote: When you are missing someone, time seems to move slower, and when I'm falling in love with someone, time seems to be moving faster.
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: You don't always have to be a leader and be as vocal as I am. I'm sure some people would love it if I didn't talk as much as I did.
Author: Chris Paul

Quote: You know what the secret is? It's so simple. We love one another. We're nice to one another. Do you know how rare that is? - Carmen
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: …There is the heat of Love, the pulsing rush of Longing, the lover's whisper, irresistible—magic to make the sanest man go mad.
Author: Homer

Quote: I didn't want to kiss you goodbye — that was the trouble — I wanted to kiss you good night — and there's a lot of difference.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: Because you don't learn anything unless you can find the patience to read. TV takes that away from you. It robs you from your mind.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: If someone is going down the wrong road, he doesn't need motivation to speed him up. What he needs is education to turn him around.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.
Author: John W. Campbell Jr.

Quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: It always shocked me when I realized that I wasn't the only person in the world who thought and felt such strange and awful things.
Author: John Green

Quote: People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: So please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookshelf on the wall.
Author: Roald Dahl

Quote: Because this is what happens when you try to run from the past. It just doesn't catch up, it overtakes … blotting out the future.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: A novel is never anything but a philosophy expressed in images. And in a good novel the philosophy has disappeared into the images.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Because it's much more pleasant to be obsessed over how the hero gets out of his predicament than it is over how I get out of mine.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: I think, therefore a single fertilized egg cell can replicate itself into trillions of specialized and exquisitely organized cells.
Author: David Self

Quote: Knowledge subverts love: in proportion as we penetrate our secrets, we come to loathe our kind, precisely because they resemble us.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quote: Returning home is the most difficult part of long-distance hiking; You have grown outside the puzzle and your piece no longer fits.
Author: Cindy Ross

Quote: Using your talent, hobby or profession in a way that makes you contribute with something good to this world is truly the way to go.
Author: Simon Zingerman

Quote: We sinned for no reason but an incomprehensible lack of love, and He saved us for no reason but an incomprehensible excess of love.
Author: Peter Kreeft

Quote: Yet the ivory gods, And the ebony gods, And the gods of diamond-jade, Are only silly puppet gods That people themselves Have made.-
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: The grass as bristly and stout as chives and me wondering when the ground will break and me wondering how anything fragile survives
Author: Anne Sexton

Quote: Transform from being a fault-finder and blamer to a happiness-finder and appreciator. Positive emotions will increase in your life.
Author: Maddy Malhotra

Quote: The difference between successful people and really successful people is that really successful people say no to almost everything.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Shame isn't a strong enough word for what I feel. "You could live a hundred lifetimes and not deserve him, you know,"Haymitch says.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: If people but knew their own religion, how tolerant they would become, and how free from any grudge against the religion of others.
Author: Hazrat Inayat Khan

Quote: Only a very few can be learned, but all can be Christian, all can be devout, and – I shall boldly add – all can be theologians.
Author: Desiderius Erasmus

Quote: And if you say that's because you lot barged into her home like a herd of mentally deficient sheep, I'm disowning all three of you.
Author: Julia Quinn

Quote: I love these pet names,"she said, gazing soulfully up into his eyes, "Nitwit. Sap skull. Termagant. How they make my heart flutter!
Author: Loretta Chase

Quote: I didn't want to cry in front of you.”He wiped away the tears with the pad of his thumb.“I want you to cry only in front of me.
Author: Robyn Carr

Quote: A process cannot be understood by stopping it. Understanding must move with the flow of the process, must join it and flow with it.
Author: Frank Herbert

Quote: I am not afraid of a person who knows 10000 kicks. But I am afraid of a person who knows one kick but practices it for 10000 times.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: While the art of printing is left to us science can never be retrograde; what is once acquired of real knowledge can never be lost.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: I must admit that I personally measure success in terms of the contributions an individual makes to her or his fellow human beings.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: Powerful words come with powerful intent. Where you have passion, strength, courage, and determination you can accomplish anything!
Author: K.L. Toth

Quote: The secret to success is good leadership, and good leadership is all about making the lives of your team members or workers better.
Author: Tony Dungy

Quote: For my part, whatever anguish of spirit it may cost, I am willing to know the whole truth; to know the worst and to provide for it.
Author: Patrick Henry

Quote: If my work has a theme, I suspect it is a simple one: that most human beings are inescapably alone, and therein lies their tragedy.
Author: Richard Yates

Quote: Then I realized that most of the world's problems stemmed from macho dickheadism, and if I cold defeat that I could save the world.
Author: Carrie Vaughn

Quote: Even as a junkie I stayed true to vegetarianism - "I shall have heroin, but I shan't have a hamburger.' What a sexy little paradox.
Author: Russell Brand

Quote: He who is cruel to animals becomes hard also in his dealings with men. We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quote: If a wave of veganism washed over the land, in six months there would be Broccoli Kings, Taco Bell Peppers, and McTofu Drive-Thrus.
Author: Brian Wansink

Quote: Nothing will benefit human health and increase chances for survival of life on Earth as much as the evolution to a vegetarian diet.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: How you spend your time is more important than how you spend your money. Money mistakes can be corrected, but time is gone forever.
Author: David Norris

Quote: I've learned that you shouldn't go through life with a catcher's mitt on both hands; you need to be able to throw some things back.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Mum liked to say that some things happen for a reason, that sometimes obstacles were there to stop you from doing something stupid.
Author: Maggie Stiefvater

Quote: The weak are dominated by their ego, the wise dominate their ego, and the intelligent are in a constant struggle against their ego.
Author: Hamza Yusuf

Quote: Every true writer is like a bird; he repeats the same song, the same theme, all his life. For me, this theme as always been revolt.
Author: Alberto Moravia

Quote: Fools stand on their island of opportunities and look toward another land. There is no other land; there is no other life but this.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Always look on the bright side of things. If you can't comprehend this, polish that which has become dull until it begins to shine.
Author: Zen Proverb

Quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Life goes by very fast. And the worst thing in life that you can have is a job that you hate, and have no energy and creativity in.
Author: Robert Greene

Quote: Logic: The art of thinking and reasoning in strict accordance with the limitations and incapacities of the human misunderstanding.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: Look. Art knows no prejudice, art knows no boundaries, art doesn't really have judgement in it's purest form. So just go, just go.
Author: K. D. Lang

Quote: Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: I'd never seen anything like it. First a trial, then a few murders, then dancing. Life goes on. Or, in this case, death continues.
Author: Charlaine Harris

Quote: A man who has never gone to school may steal a freight car; but if he has a university education, he may steal the whole railroad.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: A wise parent humors the desire for independent action, so as to become the friend and advisor when his absolute rule shall cease.
Author: Elizabeth Gaskell

Quote: He wastes his time over his writing, trying to accomplish what geniuses and rare men with college educations sometimes accomplish.
Author: Jack London

Quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: To 'choose' dogma and faith over doubt and experience is to throw out the ripening vintage and to reach greedily for the Kool-Aid.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
Author: Anais Nin

Quote: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.
Author: George Foreman

Quote: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.
Author: Hanya Yanagihara

Quote: It's sometimes funny to watch some people doing something the wrong way but doing it confidently. Even more funny, they succeeded.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: Mal snickered. "What's so funny?""I just pictured the Darkling being cornered by a sweaty duchess trying to have her way with him.
Author: Leigh Bardugo

Quote: My friend "M"says the irony of being a zombie is that everything is funny, but you can't smile, because your lips have rotted off.
Author: Isaac Marion

Quote: Could a being create the fifty billion galaxieseach with two hundred billion starsthen rejoice in the smell of burning goat flesh?
Author: Ron Patterson

Quote: He believed in God even if he was doubtful of men's claims to know God's mind. But that a God unable to forgive was no God at all.
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Quote: He hath never failed thee yet.Never will His love forget.O fret not thyself nor letThy heart be troubled,Neither let it be afraid.
Author: Amy Carmichael

Quote: Be happy for no reason, like a child. If you are happy for a reason, you're in trouble, because that reason can be taken from you.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: I wanted color. I wanted to soar with happiness even if it meant dealing with the weight of fear and guilt, too. I wanted to live.
Author: Heather Anastasiu

Quote: Surely every one realizes, at some point along the way, that he is capable of living a far better life than the one he has chosen.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: The midsummer sun shines but dim, The fields strive in vain to look gay; But when I am happy in Him December's as pleasant as May.
Author: John Newton

Quote: You will realize one day that all the money in the world cannot buy you happiness. Nor can it make you a person of good character.
Author: Richelle E. Goodrich

Quote: I am hopeful, though not full of hope, and the only reason I don't believe in happy endings is because I don't believe in endings.
Author: Edward Abbey

Quote: I wear a necklace of hope with pearly beads. When I met you, it broke, and the beads spilled all over the floor, into the gutters.
Author: Karen Quan

Quote: I'm beginning to think that to hope isn't the same as to expect something. To hope is to believe that life is an acceptable chaos.
Author: Goenawan Mohamad

Quote: The happy Union of these States is a wonder; their Constitution a miracle; their example the hope of Liberty throughout the world.
Author: James Madison

Quote: When we create hope and opportunity in the lives of others, we allow love, decency and promise to triumph over cowardice and hate.
Author: Kirsten Gillibrand

Quote: Although Kurt Vonnegut may not be considered a humor writer, 'Breakfast of Champions' is one of the funniest books I've ever read.
Author: Justin Halpern

Quote: Bob Hope, like Mark Twain, had a sense of humor that was uniquely American, and like Twain, we'll likely not see another like him.
Author: Dick Van Dyke

Quote: Excuse me, Captain. Are you two going to weep salty tears of admiration over a helmet all night, or do we have matters to discuss?
Author: Eoin Colfer

Quote: I can talk to fish!"Angel said happily, water dripping off her long, skinny body. "Ask one over for dinner,"Fang said, joining us.
Author: James Patterson

Quote: I rode an elevator with a guy who was whistling the tune of 'this is the song that never ends'. Putting that on me? Come on dude..
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: I try to give all my characters a sense of humor, so I guess I feel like I have done comedy, but maybe I'm better known for drama.
Author: Kathy Baker

Quote: Mom says it's because she has PMS.Do you even know what that means?"I'm not a little kid anymore. It means pissed-at- men syndrome
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: Newspaper people, once celebrated as founts of ribald humor and uncouth fun, have of late lost all their gaiety, and small wonder.
Author: Russell Baker

Quote: That would be a good thing for them to cut on my tombstone: Wherever she went, including here, it was against her better judgment.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: There is - I mean - I found early in life that righteous indignation is a little off-putting, and so I try to couch it with humor.
Author: Al Franken

Quote: When something needs to be said, you look for a man to say it. But when something needs actually to be done, you look for a woman.
Author: P.B. Kerr

Quote: Wit and playfulness represent a desperately serious transcendence of evil. Humor is both a form of wisdom and a means of survival.
Author: Tom Robbins

Quote: You're going to burn in a very special level of hell. A level they reserve for child molesters and people who talk at the theater.
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Be compassionate ... and take responsibility for each other. If we only learned those lessons, this world would be a better place.
Author: Mitch Albom

Quote: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings so that you shall come easily by what others have labored hard for.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Enjoy the limitless bliss consciousness here and now. The reality of you lies much beyond your sensory perceptions and boundaries.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: Every game is winnable if you change your mind about what the prize should be and your perspective about the players at the table.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: If there is anything that links the human to the divine, it is the courage to stand by a principle when everybody else rejects it.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: If you are lazy, and accept your lot, you may live in it. If you are willing to work, you can write your name anywhere you choose.
Author: Gene Stratton-Porter

Quote: May the fleas of a thousand camels invade the crotch of the person that ruins your day. And may their arms be to short too scratch
Author: Keisha Keenleyside

Quote: No name-calling truly bites deep unless, in some dark part of us, we believe it. If we are confident enough then it is just noise.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton

Quote: Nothing's perfect, the world's not perfect. But it's there for us, trying the best it can; that's what makes it so damn beautiful.
Author: Hiromu Arakawa

Quote: Once we believe in ourselves, we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
Author: e. e. cummings

Quote: Reading is like travel, allowing you to exit your own life for a bit, and to come back with a renewed, even inspired, perspective.
Author: Laurie A. Helgoe

Quote: The jump is so frightening between where I am and where I want to be... because of all I may become I will close my eyes and leap!
Author: Mary Anne Radmacher

Quote: Understanding is the reward of faith. Therefore, seek not to understand that you may believe, but believe that you may understand.
Author: Augustine of Hippo

Quote: You don't have to make something that people call art. Living is an artistic activity, there is an art to getting through the day.
Author: Viggo Mortensen

Quote: You should never assume. You know what happens when you assume. You make an ass out of you and me because that's how it's spelled.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: But honestly... I just don't know what anyone's thinking. To me, that's scarier than any half-rotten ghoul trying to eat my flesh.
