Author: Robert Kirkman

Quote: The only thing more dangerous than ignorance is the pretense of intelligent ignorance. The former is teachable; the latter is not.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Without a spiritual wakefulness to divine purposes and connections in all things, we will not know things for what they truly are.
Author: John Piper

Quote: Every major question in history is a religious question. It has more effect in molding life than nationalism or a common language.
Author: Hilaire Belloc

Quote: I can choose either to be a victim of the world or an adventurer in search of treasure. It's all a question of how I view my life.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life; define yourself.
Author: Harvey Fierstein

Quote: Only the person who has experienced light and darkness, war and peace, rise and fall, only that person has truly experienced life.
Author: Stefan Zweig

Quote: The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.
Author: Eric Berne

Quote: To treat a person like a carpet, it is necessary that one do the walking, and one allow himself to be walked on.--Shin'a'in saying
Author: Mercedes Lackey

Quote: We can have in life but one great experience at best, and the secret of life is to reproduce that experience as often as possible.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: We must laugh and cry, enjoy and suffer, in a word, vibrate to our full capacity … I think that's what being really human means.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: You'll forget it when you're dead, and so will I. When I'm dead, I'm going to forget everything–and I advise you to do the same.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: A busy, vibrant, goal-oriented woman is so much more attractive than a woman who waits around for a man to validate her existence.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: A mighty pain to love it is,And 't is a pain that pain to miss;But of all pains, the greatest painIt is to love, but love in vain.
Author: Abraham Cowley

Quote: A wedding anniversary is the celebration of love, trust, partnership, tolerance and tenacity. The order varies for any given year.
Author: Paul Sweeney

Quote: Chemistry can be a good and bad thing. Chemistry is good when you make love with it. Chemistry is bad when you make crack with it.
Author: Adam Sandler

Quote: I'm not saying that love always takes you to heaven. Your life can become a nightmare. But that said, it is worth taking the risk.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved -- loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: There are only really a few stories to tell in the end, and betrayal and the failure of love is one of those good stories to tell.
Author: Sean Lennon

Quote: To fall in love with God is the greatest romance; to seek him the greatest adventure; to find him, the greatest human achievement.
Author: Augustine of Hippo

Quote: We are not people who touch each other carelessly; every point of contact between us feels important, a rush of energy and relief.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: You seem to think you have a choice,"Cam said. "But you have it backwards. Love chooses you. The shadow moves as the sun commands.
Author: Lisa Kleypas

Quote: Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger

Quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life; define yourself.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Not everything is about you,"Clary said furiously."Possibly,"Jace said, "but you do have to admit that the majority of things are.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.
Author: Joyce Carol Oates

Quote: We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.' But eating too many, is quite enough-plenty. And you'll have to go see the good doc anyway.
Author: Solange nicole

Quote: Historically, philosophy does not have an impressive track record of answering questions about natural world in a decisive manner.
Author: Christof Koch

Quote: If an apology is followed by an excuse or a reason, it means they are going to commit same mistake again they just apologized for.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: if being is many, it must be both like and unlike, and this is impossible, for neither can the like be unlike, nor the unlike like
Author: Zeno of Citium

Quote: The safest general characterization of the European philosophical tradition is that it consists of a series of footnotes to Plato.
Author: Alfred North Whitehead

Quote: Because in some other universe, you are me, I am you, and we are perfectly happy together. Or perhaps not… and just like this…
Author: Abhimanyu Jha

Quote: În clipa când ți se impune să nu te gândești la un lucru, te vei gândi doar la el, obsesiv. Interdicția devine obligație.
Author: Jean-Claude Carrière

Quote: I have no doubt at all the Devil grins,As seas of ink I spatter. Ye gods, forgive my "literary"sins --The other kind don't matter.
Author: Robert W. Service

Quote: I love the silent hour of night,For blissful dreams may then arise,Revealing to my charmed sightWhat may not bless my waking eyes.
Author: Anne Brontë

Quote: We would rather be ruined than changedWe would rather die in our dreadThan climb the cross of the momentAnd let our illusions die.
Author: W.H. Auden

Quote: Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Love and religion! thought Clarissa, going back into the drawing room, tingling all over. How detestable, how detestable they are!
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Because you are the superhero fledgling. I'm just your more attractive sidekick. Oh, and the herd of nerds are your dorky minions.
Author: P.C. Cast

Quote: The most telling and profound way of describing the evolution of the universe would undoubtedly be to trace the evolution of love.
Author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

Quote: A single day spent doing things which fail to nourish the soul is a day stolen, mutilated, and discarded in the gutter of destiny.
Author: Michel Faber

Quote: He was a gentle and sensitive soul, and therefore had a short temper, which is why he went straight after everything with an ax...
Author: Bohumil Hrabal

Quote: It may help us, in those times of trouble, to remember that love is not only about relationship, it is also an affair of the soul.
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: A strong man does not succumb to pressures, he knows that without pressures he will not find pleasures and so he will not be made.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: Athletes who are able to stay completely focused in pursuit of their dreams are the ones that are most likely to become champions.
Author: Steve Backley

Quote: I never feel any pressure about a film. What is meant to happen will happen. I have seen failure as well as success several times.
Author: Akshay Kumar

Quote: I think the biggest challenge is to continue on the same path. I think it's easy to become complacent from the success you've had.
Author: Jason Derulo

Quote: The measure of success is not whether you have a tough problem to deal with, but whether it is the same problem you had last year.
Author: John Foster Dulles

Quote: True success is a silence inner process that can empower the mind, heart and soul through strong aspiration for great achievement.
Author: Nur Sakinah Thomas

Quote: Whenever I've had success, I never learn from it. Success usually breeds a degree of hubris. When you fail, that's when you learn.
Author: Moby

Quote: She has been to the compound before. She remembered this hallway. She knows about the initiation process. My mother was Dauntless.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth.
Author: Niels Bohr

Quote: When i tell the truth, it is not for the sake of convincing those who do not know it, but for the sake of defending those that do.
Author: William Blake

Quote: As someone who loves animals, when I hear about a process that involves animal cruelty, I no longer want to be associated with it.
Author: Lucy Watson

Quote: Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself.
Author: James A. Froude

Quote: You know what's more insane than slaughterhouses? Meat eaters. Walking around, acting like their lifestyle isn't causing any harm.
Author: Gary Yourofsky

Quote: In God's eyes, a man who teaches one truth and nothing else is more righteous than a man who teaches a million truths and one lie.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Peace is not happenstance. It is a living fire that must be fed constantly. It must be tended to with vigilance, else it dies out.
Author: Libba Bray

Quote: The one thing I do remember is that as I retraced my steps through all the familiar streets of my life, Inow felt completely lost.
Author: Carolyn Mackler

Quote: You'd be surprised how easy some things can be, things you never thought you'd do, when you take self-respect out of the equation.
Author: Sarah Addison Allen

Quote: Because this business of becoming conscious, of being a writer, is ultimately about asking yourself, How alive am I willing to be?
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: To achieve lasting literature, fictional or factual, a writer needs perceptive vision, absorptive capacity, and creative strength.
Author: Lawrence Clark Powell

Quote: You must understand that when you are writing a novel you are not making anything up. It's all there and you just have to find it.
Author: Thomas Harris

Quote: Every defeat, every heartbreak every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: Society is composed of two great classes those who have more dinners than appetite, and those who have more appetite than dinners.
Author: Nicolas Chamfort

Quote: You are a function of what the whole universe is doing in the same way that a wave is a function of what the whole ocean is doing.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Everyone discusses my art and pretends to understand, as if it were necessary to understand, when it is simply necessary to love.
Author: Claude Monet

Quote: The artist produces for the liberation of his soul. It is his nature to create as it is the nature of water to run down the hill.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: Death is part of who we are. It guidesus. It shapes us. It drives us to madness. Can you still be human if you have no mortal end
Author: Christopher Paolini

Quote: Everybody has an angel hiding inside. When you die, your angel comes out. You can die, but not your angel. Your angel never dies.
Author: Jerry Spinelli

Quote: Warmblood now a bloodborne death,Will rob your body of it's breathMark your skin and seal your fate The Underland becomes a plate
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: We'd stared into the face of Death, and Death blinked first. You'd think that would make us feel brave and invincible. It didn't.
Author: Rick Yancey

Quote: I didn't want any degrees if all the ill-read literates and radio announcers and pedagogical dummies I knew had them by the peck.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: Improving intelligence is possible, but it is more likely to occur if children are given the right experiences at the right ages.
Author: Dennis Garlick

Quote: The purpose of education is to save young people from the paralyzing effects of wealth and poverty. (more or less verbatim quote)
Author: Kurt Hahn

Quote: The purpose of school should not be to prepare students for more school. We should be seeking to have fully engaged students now.
Author: Donalyn Miller

Quote: Un sceptique qui adhère à un croyant cela est simple comme la loi des couleurs complémentaires.Ce qui nous manque nous attire.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: During the 1950s, Aristotle Onassis and I formed what grew to be a close friendship and association in several business ventures.
Author: J. Paul Getty

Quote: Friendship is also about liking a person for their failings, their weakness. It's also about mutual help, not about exploitation.
Author: Paul Theroux

Quote: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
Author: E. W. Howe

Quote: A lot of people ask me if I were shipwrecked, and could have only one book, what would it be? I always say, "How to Build a Boat.
Author: Stephen Wright

Quote: A man wrapped up in himself always suffocates. But his loved ones will forever hold in their hearts the memory of that Christmas.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: Honestly, Clary, if you don't start utilizing a bit of your natural feminine superiority I just don't know what I'll do with you.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Before you came into my life, I believed that God had abandoned me.Now I know that He has blessed me beyond measure. -sir Bannor-
Author: Teresa Medeiros

Quote: We must go out into a desert of some kind (your backyard will do) and come into a personal experience of the awesome love of God.
Author: Brennan Manning

Quote: You're gonna have to serve somebody; well, it may be the devil, or it may be the Lord, but you're gonna have to serve somebody...
Author: Bob Dylan

Quote: ...the face has limited space. My mother used to say, if you fill your face with laughing, there will be no more room for crying.
Author: Rohinton Mistry

Quote: Clearly the secret of happiness...is a variation on the general principle of banging your head against a wall, and then stopping.
Author: Stef Penney

Quote: It's not my job to make you happy. It's your job to learn that only those who quit selfishly seeking their own happiness find it.
Author: Richelle E. Goodrich

Quote: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves—say rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: And when I raised myself to look at the man who'd spoken, I had a feeling of leaving my misery behind me there on the stone wall.
Author: Arthur Golden

Quote: But no matter how much evil I see, I think it's important for everyone to understand that there is much more light than darkness.
Author: Robert Uttaro

Quote: Desire is the starting point of all achievement, not a hope, not a wish, but a keen pulsating desire which transcends everything.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: I hope I'm not a tourist attraction - I'm sure that they come here really because St. Andrews is just amazing, a beautiful place.
Author: Prince William

Quote: I'm feeling pretty good right now, but I hope we can just win the whole thing and I can run off into the sunset and say good-bye.
Author: David Wells

Quote: Today well lived makes every yesterday a dream of happiness and every tomorrow a vision of hope. Look well therefore to this day.
Author: Francis Gray

Quote: When you are kind to someone in trouble, you hope they'll remember and be kind to someone else. And it'll become like a wildfire.
Author: Whoopi Goldberg

Quote: Faith to me is trusting in every evidence that something is―that it  is  possible, that it  is  significant, that it  is  real.
Author: Richelle E. Goodrich

Quote: Aquí hay algo más que recordar: la esperanza te mantiene viva. Incluso cuando estás muerta, es lo único que te mantiene viva.
Author: Lauren Oliver

Quote: A perfect person is easy to love. But when somebody likes all your imperfections, well, that's when you know they really mean it.
Author: Michelle Dalton

Quote: Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing, moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense, dancing.
Author: Clive James

Quote: I like George Carlin's jokes. I like his humor. He's one of my heroes, and I like what he did with talking about everyday things.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: I sent the club a wire stating, PLEASE ACCEPT MY RESIGNATION. I DON'T WANT TO BELONG TO ANY CLUB THAT WILL ACCEPT ME AS A MEMBER.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: Oh that looked painful,"called another Puck, a little farther down. "We really need to talk about your anger-management problems.
Author: Julie Kagawa

Quote: Suspense is very important. Even though this is humor and they're short stories, that theory of building suspense is still there.
Author: Sergio Aragones

Quote: We do need a system, and we do need you and your 'Bertos, and sometimes we need Sam to just come along and kick some ass. - Quinn
Author: Michael Grant

Quote: We have just witnessed a classic example of what I like to call 'misdirected rage'. I believe the technical term is being an ass.
Author: Natsuki Takaya

Quote: Why it's simply impassible!Alice: Why, don't you mean impossible?Door: No, I do mean impassible. (chuckles) Nothing's impossible!
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: You're Valentine's son. I'm sure you're the one the Queen really wants to see. Besides, you're charming. Maybe not at the moment.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Believe it is possible to solve your problem. Tremendous things happen to the believer. So believe the answer will come. It will.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Do not do what you cannot continue to deliver.For, remember, the world wants to see a continuity of delivery of set standards...!
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: Do not give way to useless alarm; though it is right to be prepared for the worst, there is no occasion to look on it as certain.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: I can't give you a sure-fire formula for success, but I can give you a formula for failure: try to please everybody all the time.
Author: Herbert Bayard Swope

Quote: Let each man take the path according to his capacity, understanding and temperament. His true guru will meet him along that path.
Author: Sivananda Saraswati

Quote: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.
Author: Michael Jackson

Quote: Men love women who are courageous for it means they can go all the way with him in his pursuit of his good dreams and intentions.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: Some days are like this. And the only way to get through them is to remember that they are only one day, and that every day ends.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: Talent is a faucet. When it is on, one must write. Inspiration is a farce that poets have invented to give themselves importance.
Author: Jean Anouilh

Quote: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the bullshit story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
Author: Jordan Belfort

Quote: The three great essentials to achieve anything worthwhile are, first, hard work; second, stick-to-itiveness; third, common sense.
Author: Thomas A. Edison

Quote: There's a very positive relationship between people's ability to accomplish any task and the time they're willing to spend on it.
Author: Joyce Brothers

Quote: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: What a large volume of adventures may be grasped within the span of his little life by him who interests his heart in everything.
Author: Laurence Sterne

Quote: You can close your eyes to the things you don't want to see, but you can't close your heart to the things you don't want to feel.
Author: Jonny Depp

Quote: People don't want to know. They have to be made to know. Whether they act on what they know is up to them. But they have to know.
Author: Anthony Burgess

Quote: Since there is no real silence, Silence will contain all the sounds, All the words, all the languages, All knowledge, all memory.
Author: Dejan Stojanovic

Quote: A successful life is one that is lived through understanding and pursuing one's own path, not chasing after the dreams of others.
Author: Chin-Ning Chu

Quote: Being taken for granted can be a compliment. It means that you've become a comfortable, trusted element in another person's life.
Author: Joyce Brothers

Quote: Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Do nothing, and nothing happens. Life is about decisions. You either make them or they're made for you, but you can't avoid them.
Author: Mhairi McFarlane

Quote: Don't get me wrong, I admire elegance and have an appreciation of the finer things in life. But to me, beauty lies in simplicity.
Author: Mark Hyman

Quote: Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: I just wanted to tell you that I understand if you go. It's okay if you have to leave us. It's okay if you want to stop fighting.
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: In my many years I have come to a conclusion that one useless man is a shame, two is a law firm, and three or more is a congress.
Author: Peter Stone

Quote: It may be true that the law cannot make a man love me, but it can stop him from lynching me, and I think that's pretty important.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: 'Secrets Of The Millionaire Mind' was born out of my own journey of self-discovery within both my personal and professional life.
Author: T. Harv Eker

Quote: The continuous narrative of existence is a lie. There is no continuous narrative, there are lit-up moments, and the rest is dark.
Author: Jeanette Winterson

Quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Deep in my heart I'm concealing things that I'm longing to say. Scared to confess what I'm feeling - frightened you'll slip away.
Author: Madonna

Quote: I am a Mormon because I love the Lord Jesus Christ. And as I exercise faith in Him, I am blessed with the Holy Spirit in my life.
Author: Jane Clayson

Quote: I discovered after going to music festivals that I am a rock fan. I love the guitars, the phrasing, and the abandon of rock fans.
Author: Beyonce Knowles

Quote: I love a massage. I'd go every day if I could. I don't need to be wrapped in herbs like a salmon fillet, but I do love a massage.
Author: Jason Bateman

Quote: I love you, and because I love you, I would sooner have you hate me for telling you the truth than adore me for telling you lies.
Author: Pietro Aretino

Quote: I wanted to be his life preserver, the thing that would keep him afloat. Instead, he became my anchor. And I'm tired of drowning.
Author: Amanda Grace

Quote: If you have it [love], you don't need to have anything else, and if you don't have it, it doesn't matter much what else you have.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Quote: It may be true that the law cannot make a man love me, but it can keep him from lynching me, and I think that's pretty important.
Author: Martin Luther King

Quote: She is a friend of my mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order.
Author: Toni Morrison

Quote: There ain't no way you can hold onto something that wants to go, you understand? You can only love what you got while you got it.
Author: Kate DiCamillo

Quote: It is only normal that people count losses with their minds, and ignore to count blessings with the graciousness of their hearts.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: The curious mind embraces science; the gifted and sensitive, the arts; the practical, business; the leftover becomes an economist
Author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

Quote: A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?''That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.
Author: John Green

Quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: We came to see Jace. Is he alright?""I don't know,"Magnus said. "Does he normally just lie on the floor like that without moving?
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: You don't love someone for their looks, or their clothes, or for their fancy car, but because they sing a song only you can hear.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: I have always thought that all philosophical debates are ultimately between the partisans of structure and the partisans of "goo.
Author: Alan W. Watts

Quote: In the way this strange gentleman was going on, he would leave the world without having done any good to himself or anybody else.
Author: Jules Verne

Quote: Mere philosophy will not satisfy us. We cannot reach the goal by mere words alone. Without practice, nothing can be achieved. (3)
Author: Swami Satchidananda

Quote: One has to take a somewhat bold and dangerous line with this existence: especially as, whatever happens, we are bound to lose it.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Reason is, and ought only to be the slave of the passions, and can never pretend to any other office than to serve and obey them.
Author: David Hume

Quote: The seed of suffering in you may be strong, but don't wait until you have no more suffering before allowing yourself to be happy.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich

Quote: There is desire in the perfect, beauty in the imperfect.Thus I lust over the flawless,and fall amorously forceless to the flawed.
Author: Ilyas Kassam

Quote: What is humor?' one of their professors had posed, and he had answered, ''nondangerous, unexpectedly inappropriate juxtaposition.
Author: Sena Jeter Naslund

Quote: Do you not think that God will protect us?”“No,” he said flatly. “My experience is that He rarely attends to the obvious.
Author: Philippa Gregory

Quote: and sometimes I sitdown at my typewriterand I thinknot of someonecause there isn't anyoneto thinkabout and i wonderis it worth it
Author: Nikki Giovanni

Quote: Autumn DuskI saw above a sea of hillsA solitary planet shine,And there was no one, near or far,to keep the world from being mine.
Author: Sara Teasdale

Quote: I give you this to take with you:Nothing remains as it was. If you know this, you canbegin again, with pure joy in the uprooting.
Author: Judith Minty

Quote: Great minds have purpose, others have wishes. Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortunes; but great minds rise above them.
Author: Washington Irving

Quote: It is not true that everyone is special. It is true that everyone was once special and still possesses the ability to recover it.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: The indefatigable pursuit of an unattainable perfection ...***...is what alone gives meaning to our life on this unavailing star.
Author: Logan Pearsall Smith

Quote: Are you desperate or determined? With desperation comes frustration. With determination comes purpose, achievement, and peace….
Author: James A. Murphy

Quote: Love is a flower that should never cease to grow. Nurture it, and it will outlive you. Neglect it, and it will wilt away and die.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: The reason we all like to think so well of others is that we are all afraid for ourselves. The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: There is no mystery-- that's the beauty of it. We are entirely explicable to each other, and yet we stay. What a miracle that is.
Author: Kamila Shamsie

Quote: You can disagree with another person's opinions. You can disagree with their doctrines. You can't disagree with their experience.
Author: Krista Tippett

Quote: I still love you. I will always love you, and that is all that matters. I will forgive you anything, and I will forgive you this.
Author: Melissa de la Cruz

Quote: Just that I have loved you, even when I was nothing and no one to you, when you didn't know my name and barely knew my face.- Leo
Author: Sherry Thomas

Quote: Was it the infinite sadness of her eyes that drew him or the mirror of himself that he found in the gorgeous clarity of her mind?
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: What d'you suppose I care if I'm a gentleman or not? If I were a gentleman I shouldn't waste my time with a vulgar slut like you.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: Avoidable human misery is more often caused not so much by stupidity as by ignorance, particularly our ignorance about ourselves.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: To say that the first casualty of war is truth is to miss the rather more important point that a principal weapon of war is lies.
Author: Harry M. Collins

Quote: And at that moment, Thibaut knew he was a murderer. He had murdered his brother that night; he had taken away his brother's soul.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: If my eyes have pain, I close them; If my body aches, I rest it; If my heart breaks, I mend it; If my soul is lost, I pray for it
Author: Jeremy Aldana

Quote: There's no heaven as I had known before. It's just a great universe which is available to be enjoyed by souls who dream about it.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: When the outside intent (other than the intent of Pure Soul, Parbhaav) stops, he attains enlightened bliss of the Self (samadhi).
Author: Dada Bhagwan

Quote: I never expected any sort of success with 'Mockingbird'... I sort of hoped someone would like it enough to give me encouragement.
Author: Harper Lee

Quote: Let every man feel that he is the architect and builder of his own life, and that he proposes to make a success of it by working.
Author: Heber J. Grant

Quote: The five essential entrepreneurial skills for success: Concentration, Discrimination, Organization, Innovation and Communication.
Author: Harold S. Geneen

Quote: Whether you come from a council estate or a country estate, your success will be determined by your own confidence and fortitude.
Author: Michelle Obama

Quote: If only they would all just leave me alone with my books and my letters, I would be content to let life, and the world pass me by
Author: Alison Weir

Quote: Whatever games are played with us, we must play no games with ourselves, but deal in our privacy with the last honesty and truth.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I just didn't want to be fat. I got tired of breathing hard. I got tired of my joints hurting. I just got tired of being lied to.
Author: Waka Flocka Flame

Quote: If you don't like seeing pictures of violence towards animals being posted, you need to help stop the violence, not the pictures.
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: If you look at veganism, and question how we do things, and how we should be living, veganism, to me, seems like the logical way.
Author: Romesh Ranganathan

Quote: Part of my becoming a vegetarian was that I would look at my burger, then look at my dogs, and I wasn't able to see a difference.
Author: Kristen Bell

Quote: Part of my becoming a vegetarian was that I would look at my burger, then look at my dogs, and I wasn't able to see a difference.
Author: Kristen Bell

Quote: People don't think about how each of these animals that we call dinner have the same kinds of personalities as our dogs and cats.
Author: Emily Deschanel

Quote: Things that seem morally obvious and intuitive now weren't necessarily so in the past; many started with nonconforming reasoning.
Author: Robert M. Sapolsky

Quote: Soldiers live. He dies and not you, and you feel guilty, because you're glad he died, and not you. Soldiers live, and wonder why.
Author: Glen Cook

Quote: They say you should know your limits and work within them. But how can you really know your limits unless you try to expand them?
Author: Jonathan Cainer

Quote: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
Author: Plutarch

Quote: I think that perhaps if I had had to slow down the ideas so that I could capture them on paper I might have stifled some of them.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: I want to write about people who dream and wait for the night to end, who long for the light so they can hold the ones they love.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: If you would not be forgotten, as soon as you are dead and rotten, either write things worth reading, or do things worth writing.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Associate yourself with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company.
Author: George Washington

Quote: It is important to fight and fight again, and keep fighting, for only then can evil be kept at bay though never quite eradicated.
Author: Albus Dumbledore

Quote: Move out of your comfort zone. You can only grow if you are willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: The whole problem with the world is the fools and fanatics are always so sure of themselves, and wiser people are full of doubts.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: We have to walk in a way that we only print peace and serenity on the Earth. Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh

Quote: Art to me is an anecdote of the spirit, and the only means of making concrete the purpose of its varied quickness and stillness.
Author: Mark Rothko

Quote: I think art is not an ornament or refinement at the fringes of human intelligence, I think it's at the center. It's at the core.
Author: Robert Pinsky

Quote: It is a mistake for a sculptor or a painter to speak or write very often about his job. It releases tension needed for his work.
Author: Henry Moore

Quote: One must do the same subject over again ten times, a hundred times. In art nothing must resemble an accident, not even movement.
Author: Edgar Degas

Quote: The art of healing comes from nature, not from the physician. Therefore the physician must start from nature, with an open mind.
Author: Paracelsus

Quote: I know nothing in the world that has as much power as a word. Sometimes I write one, and I look at it, until it begins to shine.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: Overall, the library held a hushed exultation, as though the cherished volumes were all singing soundlessly within their covers.
Author: Diana Gabaldon

Quote: those of us who read because we love it more than anything, who feel about bookstores the way some people feel about jewelers...
Author: Anna Quindlen

Quote: I felt the unfairness of it, the inarguable injustice of loving someone who might have loved you back but can't due to deadness.
Author: John Green

Quote: If they tell you that she died of sleeping pills you must know that she died of a wasting grief, of a slow bleeding at the soul.
Author: Clifford Odets

Quote: Tell me not in mournful numbers,Life is but an empty dream!For the soul is dead that slumbers,And things are not what they seem.
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: The trouble about jumping was that if you didn't pick the right number of storeys, you might still be alive when you hit bottom.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: Together, they would watch everything that was so carefully planned collapse, and they would smile at the beauty of destruction.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: As the essence of courage is to stake one's life on a possibility, so the essence of faith is to believe the possibility exists.
Author: William Salter

Quote: Keep the faith. The vision is always for the appointed time. Be patient, prayerful and wait for the fulfillment of your visions.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

Quote: Oh what a wonderful soul so bright inside you. Got power to heal the sun's broken heart, power to restore the moon's vision too.
Author: Aberjhani

Quote: Our forgiving love toward men is the evidence of God's forgiving love in us. It is a necessary condition of the prayer of faith.
Author: Andrew Murray

Quote: Spiritual pain is when you can't stand another moment not knowing the real truth, and when you finally do know you can't let go.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.
Author: Mignon McLaughlin

Quote: Neatness begets order; but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.
Author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

Quote: There was the smell of old books, a smell that has a way of making all libraries seem the same. Some say that smell is asbestos.
Author: Scott Douglas

Quote: Do what you do only for God's sake, start for God's sake, work for God's sake, and act within the sphere of God's good approval.
Author: Said Nursî

Quote: When one person suffers from a delusion, it is called insanity. When many people suffer from a delusion it is called a Religion.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: A FriendSomeoneYou're happy to see,Who's happy to see you.SomeoneYou like for who they areNot just for what they can do for you.
Author: Nancy J. Cavanaugh

Quote: If you really want to be happy, don't just go for the money. Go for the relationship that lasts. Go for things of greater value.
Author: Tony Meloto (Your First Job by: N. Dy)

Quote: I'm a happy person. If you want to be around me, you can either choose to be happy too, or follow the signs to the nearest exit!
Author: Sharon Swan

Quote: Nourishing yourself in a way that helps you blossom in the direction you want to go is attainable, and you are worth the effort.
Author: Deborah Day

Quote: Take responsibility for your own happiness, do not expect people or things to bring you happiness, or you could be disappointed.
Author: Rodolfo Costa

Quote: Helplessness induces hopelessness, and history attests that loss of hope and not loss of lives is what decides the issue of war.
Author: B. H. Liddell Hart

Quote: I had to stop going to auditions thinking, 'Oh, I hope they like me.' I had to go in thinking I was the answer to their problem.
Author: George Clooney

Quote: I have tried to keep on with my striving because this is the only hope I have of ever achieving anything worthwhile and lasting.
Author: Arthur Ashe

Quote: I hope that my story, I hope that my life is... an encouragement for people, especially in Brooklyn. I feel humbled and blessed.
Author: Iyanla Vanzant

Quote: It is sound judgment to hope that in the not too distant future we shall be competent to understand so simple a thing as a star.
Author: Arthur Eddington

Quote: I've been pleased to work with so many wonderful stars through the years. This has been an amazing journey. I hope it continues.
Author: Keanu Reeves

Quote: Many are less fortunate than you' may not be a roof to live under, but it will serve to retire beneath in the event of a shower.
Author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

Quote: The hope of a secure and livable world lies with disciplined nonconformists who are dedicated to justice, peace and brotherhood.
Author: Martin Luther King

Quote: We hope that, when the insects take over the world, they will remember with gratitude how we took them along on all our picnics.
Author: Bill Vaughan

Quote: We must seek together to address the good aspirations of people everywhere, for we are bound together through great commonality.
Author: Bryant McGill

Quote: You just hope that you will get the opportunity to do what you love and pay your bills, and that is being a success as an actor.
Author: Debra Messing

Quote: In an age of hope men looked up at the night sky and saw “the heavens."In an age of hopelessness they call it simply “space.
Author: Peter Kreeft

Quote: A lot of my humor does come from anger. It's like, you're not gonna pull one over on me - which is pretty much my motto anyways.
Author: Courteney Cox

Quote: Because I was a television writer for many years, I write very conversationally. I put things straight, and with a lot of humor.
Author: Tracy McMillan

Quote: Do you know what breakfast cereal is made of? It's made of all those little curly wooden shavings you find in pencil sharpeners!
Author: Roald Dahl

Quote: Down with tyranny!' Bramble cried. 'Aristocracy! Autocracy! Monocracy! Other ocracy things! You are outnumbered, sir! Surrender!
Author: Heather Dixon

Quote: I'm not just a big-haired redhead country singer who dresses flamboyantly, has this wicked sense of humor and wears rhinestones.
Author: Naomi Judd

Quote: Just give me a second. Attempting to give a fuck...Attempting harder to give a fuck...Sorry, there was an error; fuck not given.
Author: Suzanne Wright

Quote: Peter, you're twelve years old. I'm ten. They have a word for people our age. They call us children and they treat us like mice.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: Since I became a knitting humor writer, I seem to be understood a little better - at least for the purposes of social discourse.
Author: Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

Quote: Sometimes I lie awake at night and I ask, "Why me?", then a voice answers "Nothing personal, your name just happened to come up.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: There's nothing more contagious than the laughter of young children; it doesn't even have to matter what they're laughing about.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: You climbed into my window in the middle of the night. So, either you're some kind of Vampire or some kind of Perv. Which is it?
Author: Kami Garcia

Quote: Most men don't seem to get that telling a pissed-off woman to calm down is like throwing gunpowder on a fire.” ~ Liberty Jones
Author: Lisa Kleypas

Quote: He who takes offense when no offense is intended is a fool, and he who takes offense when offense is intended is a greater fool.
Author: Brigham Young

Quote: Humility is not weakness but a price for greatness. Be humble for CHRIST sake and watch GOD take you to places you never dreamt.
Author: James C. Uwandu

Quote: It is in the knowledge of the genuine conditions of our lives that we must draw our strength to live and our reasons for living.
Author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quote: I've been absolutely terrified every moment of my life - and I've never let it keep me from doing a single thing I wanted to do.
Author: Georgia O'Keeffe

Quote: Just because someone desires you, it does not mean that they value you.Read it over.Again.Let those words resonate in your mind.
Author: Nayyirah Waheed

Quote: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.
Author: Ella Fitzgerald

Quote: Language imparts identity, meaning, and perspective to our human condition. Writers are either polluters or part of the cleanup.
Author: Mary Pipher

Quote: Learn everything you can, anytime you can, from anyone you can, there will always come a time when you will be grateful you did.
Author: Sarah Caldwell

Quote: Me with nothing left to lose, plotting my big revenge in the spotlight. Give me violent revenge fantasies as a coping mechanism.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Most people think happiness is about gaining something, but it's not. It's all about getting rid of the darkness you accumulate.
Author: Carolyn Crane

Quote: My spirit is healthy, yes. But I tell you, my flesh is healthy too. I am enlightened and free, but I am also lustful and carnal.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Prolong not the pastInvite not the futureDo not alter your innate wakefulnessFear not appearancesThere in nothing more than this
Author: Ram Dass

Quote: The quality of a man's life is in direct proportion to his commitment to excellence, regardless of his chosen field of endeavor.
Author: Vince Lombardi Jr.

Quote: The wisdom of LIFE eludes even the best...For those who pass the test Life is a fest,While, its forever, A battle for the rest..
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: Thought I wanted overnight success, until I achieved it through hard work and the refusal to back down! What you earn, you keep.
Author: A.M. Hudson

Quote: To oppose something is to maintain it... You must go somewhere else; you must have another goal; then you walk a different road.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quote: To see a World in a Grain of Sand And a Heaven in a Wild Flower, Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand And Eternity in an hour.
Author: William Blake

Quote: Whatever you vividly imagine, ardently desire, sincerely believe, and enthusiastically act upon... must inevitably come to pass!
Author: Paul J. Meyer

Quote: How had this happened? Everyone in the world knew more than us, about everything, and this I hated then found hugely comforting.
Author: Dave Eggers

Quote: I don't know much more than I did when I was alive. Most of the stuff I know now that I didn't know then I can't put into words.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: in times like the present, men should utter nothing for which they would not willingly be responsible through time and eternity.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: It's common platitude that knowledge is neutral but every now and then it would be useful if it was on your side and not theirs.
Author: John Brunner

Quote: Like roses we are born, we grow and expand, in knowledge and bliss, and when our time is due our bodies return to mother Nature.
Author: Joseph Rain

Quote: Properly, we should read for power. Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand.
Author: Ezra Pound

Quote: trichloroethane [...] All my extensive testing has shown this to be the best treatment for a dangerous excess of human knowledge
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Whatever people in general do not understand, they are always prepared to dislike; the incomprehensible is always the obnoxious.
Author: Letitia Landon

Quote: A simple life is good with me. I don't need a whole lot. For me, a T-shirt, a pair of shorts, barefoot on a beach and I'm happy.
Author: Yanni

Quote: All the lives I could live, all the people I will never know, never will be, they are everywhere. That is all that the world is.
Author: Aleksandar Hemon

Quote: Hopes are like hair ornaments. Girls want to wear too many of them. When they become old women they look silly wearing even one.
Author: Arthur Golden

Quote: If I have any worth, it is to live my life for God so as to teach these peoples; even though some of them still look down on me.
Author: Saint Patrick

Quote: It's not so much the journey that's important; as is the way that we treat those we encounter and those around us, along the way
Author: Jeremy Aldana

Quote: It's paradoxical, that the idea of living a long life appeals to everyone, but the idea of getting old doesn't appeal to anyone.
Author: Andy Rooney

Quote: LearningTo believe you are magnificent. And gradually to discover that you are not magnificent. Enough labor for one human life.
Author: Czesław Miłosz

Quote: Many people come to reinvention when life changes around them, but people come in all different stripes. I'm oriented to change.
Author: Jane Pauley

Quote: Many people say I'm the best women's soccer player in the world. I don't think so. And because of that, someday I just might be.
Author: Mia Hamm

Quote: Self-consciousness is the enemy of all art, be it acting, writing, painting, or living itself, which is the greatest art of all.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: The Hercules' was a monumental undertaking. It is the largest aircraft ever built... I put the sweat of my life into this thing.
Author: Howard Hughes

Quote: The resistance that you fight physically in the gym and the resistance that you fight in life can only build a strong character.
Author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

Quote: These woods are lovely, dark and deep,But I have promises to keep,And miles to go before I sleep,And miles to go before I sleep.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: To live is to be musical, starting with the blood dancing in your veins. Everything living has a rhythm. Do you feel your music?
Author: Michael Jackson

Quote: You stay safe, You love. You survive. You laugh and cry and struggle and sometimes you fail and sometimes you succeed. You Push.
Author: Carrie Ryan

Quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together,but do so with all your heart.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: All any of us wanted, really, was to know that we counted. That someone else's life would not have been as rich without us here.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: I come here with no expectations, only to profess, now that I am at liberty to do so, that my heart is and always will be yours.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: I have never found anybody who could stand to accept the daily demonstrative love I feel in me, and give back as good as I give.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: I love mankind, he said, "but I find to my amazement that the more I love mankind as a whole, the less I love man in particular.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quote: I say what I want to say and do what I want to do. There's no in between. People will either love you for it or hate you for it.
Author: Eminem

Quote: If you cannot inspire a woman with love of you, fill her above the brim with love of herself ~ all that runs over will be yours.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: Love is so unconditional; love liberates; love is the reason why I do what I do, and so I think it is the greatest gift we have.
Author: BeBe Winans

Quote: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: Then he made one last effort to search in his heart for the place where his affection had rotted away, and he could not find it.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: What do I care how 'e looks? I am good-looking enough for both of us, I theenk! All these scars show is zat my husband is brave!
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: It's impossible,” he snapped. “Why?” “Because I'm Sebastian, Lord St. Vincent. I can't be celibate. Everyone knows that.
Author: Lisa Kleypas

Quote: If you want to be sure of unusual thing such as aliens or UFOs, then you have to think about it from an unusual way of thinking.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: But who prays for Satan? Who, in eighteen centuries, has had the common humanity to pray for the one sinner that needed it most?
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: I suspect the truth is that we are waiting, all of us, against insurmountable odds, for something extraordinary to happen to us.
Author: Khaled Hosseini

Quote: Sometimes you have to be apart from people you love, but that doesn't make you love them any less. Sometimes you love them more.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: [O]ther thinkers have philosophised since the time of Plato, but that does not destroy the interest and beauty of his philosophy
Author: Frederick Charles Copleston

Quote: Every life has a destiny... the trick is to discover it before then end of your life. Otherwise, you will have too many regrets.
Author: Kevin J. Anderson

Quote: Let whoever can do so deceive me, he will never bring it about that I am nothing, so long as I continue to think I am something.
Author: René Descartes

Quote: The philosopher is a person who refuses no pleasures which do not produce greater sorrows, and who knows how to create new ones.
Author: Giacomo Casanova

Quote: The philosophers write about things as they are and as they appear to be, but as an artist I find that appearance is everything.
Author: Gary Inbinder

Quote: Until the day when God shall deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is summed up in these two words,-Wait and hope.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quote: The premise of the Taker story is 'the world belongs to man'. … The premise of the Leaver story is 'man belongs to the world'.
Author: Daniel Quinn

Quote: Kein Philosoph würde ein dickes Buch schreiben, wenn er im Vornherein wüsste, auf welche Weise er später zitiert werden wird.
Author: Juli Zeh

Quote: I have stretched ropes from steeple to steeple; Garlands from window to window; Golden chains from star to star ... And I dance.
Author: Arthur Rimbaud

Quote: I never dreamed the sea so deep,The earth so dark; so long my sleep,I have become another child.I wake to see the world go wild.
Author: Allen Ginsberg

Quote: Never cry because you have mountains of problem in your hands to solve. Always smile because each problems will someday resolve.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: Sir, I admit your general rule, That every poet is a fool, But you yourself may serve to show it, That every fool is not a poet.
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quote: Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light; I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.
Author: Sarah Williams

Quote: Being brave enough to be alone frees you up to invite people into your life because you want them and not because you need them.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: Give up smoking cold turkey. Start a diet in the next 5 min. Accept that job right away. Life can be beautiful without planning!
Author: Rossana Condoleo

Quote: If you ever walk down a path surrounding by negative energy, look for the fork in the path then cross over to the positive side.
Author: Victoria Addino

Quote: To think what is true, to sense what is beautiful and to want what is good, hereby the spirit finds purpose of a life in reason.
Author: Johann Gottfried Herder

Quote: A woman can become a man's friend only in the following stages - first an acquantaince, next a mistress, and only then a friend.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: Just start off with the same goals in mind. If you have the same values, same goals then you'll be on track for the same future.
Author: Angelina Jolie

Quote: The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: If you have to say or do something controversial, aim so that people will hate that they love it and not love that they hate it.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: I'm sorry if any of you are catholic. I'm not sorry if you're offended, I'm actually just sorry by the fact that you're catholic
Author: Bill Hicks

Quote: Your beliefs will be the light by which you see, but they will not be what you see and they will not be a substitute for seeing.
Author: Flannery O'Connor

Quote: I've been in love with you since the very beginning. You asked why there isn't anyone else in my life, and the reason... is you.
Author: Julie James

Quote: You naked in my bed is even more unbelievably beautiful than I thought it would be... and trust me I've thought about it. A lot.
Author: Abbi Glines

Quote: Dans la nature rien ne se crée, rien ne se perd, tout change.In nature nothing is created, nothing is lost, everything changes.
Author: Antoine Lavoisier

Quote: Let fear once get possession of the soul, and it does not readily yield its place to another sentiment.Sebastopol by Leo Tolstoy
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Memories aren't stored in the heart or the head or even the soul, if you ask me, but in the spaces between any given two people.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: No man owns me. All man can do is practice the timeless, criminal art of threatening to separate my soul from her physical host.
Author: Tiffany Madison

Quote: There may be a great fire in our soul, yet no one ever comes to warm himself at it, and the passers-by see only a wisp of smoke.
Author: Vincent van Gogh

Quote: Write from the soul, not from some notion about what you think the marketplace wants.The market is fickle; the soul is eternal'.
Author: Jeffrey Carver

Quote: A constant struggle, a ceaseless battle to bring success from inhospitable surroundings, is the price of all great achievements.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: As my father used to tell me, the only true sign of success in life is being able to do for a living that which makes you happy.
Author: Al Yankovic

Quote: Every human being is searching for a deep sense of meaning, and yet we're all chasing success. We've confused one for the other.
Author: Donald Miller

Quote: Real success is being totally indulgent about your own trip. You put your blinders on about the garbage and go full speed ahead.
Author: Betsey Johnson

Quote: The great dream merchant Disney was a success because make-believe was what everyone seemed to need in a spiritually empty land.
Author: Arthur Erickson

Quote: The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
Author: Cecil B. DeMille

Quote: The road to success is not easy to navigate, but with hard work, drive and passion, it's possible to achieve the American dream.
Author: Tommy Hilfiger

Quote: There's not an instruction manual on how to deal with success, so you just have to rely on having great friends and a good team.
Author: Bryan Adams

Quote: You are not permitted to live and die as a non-entity because you have encountered the greatness that is associated with Christ.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: You don't have to be a genius or a visionary or even a college graduate to be successful. You just need a framework and a dream.
Author: Michael Dell

Quote: It is an occupational hazard that anyone who has spent her life learning how to lie eventually becomes bad at telling the truth.
Author: Ally Carter

Quote: My stomach lurched, an appetizer before the full portion of heartache I had a feeling was going to be served at some point soon.
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: The right to search for the truth implies also a duty; one must not conceal any part of what one has recognized to be the truth.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Everyone is down on pain, because they forget something important about it: Pain is for the living. Only the dead don't feel it.
Author: Jim Butcher

Quote: If we only fell in love with people who were perfect for us...then there wouldn't be so much fuss about love in the first place.
Author: Amor Towles

Quote: To finish the moment, to find the journey's end in every step of the road, to live the greatest number of good hours, is wisdom.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The Master said, “A true teacher is one who, keeping the past alive, is also able to understand the present.”(Analects 2.11)
Author: Confucius

Quote: [A young adult novel] ends not with happily ever after, but at a new beginning, with the sense of a lot of life yet to be lived.
Author: Richard Peck

Quote: My perfect day is sitting in a room with some blank paper. That's heaven. That's gold and anything else is just a waste of time.
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Quote: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings, so that you shall gain easily what others have labored hard for.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: A performance art piece is unprecedented. It is difficult to censor since it has a good possibility of never being done before.
Author: Jack Bowman

Quote: All architecture is great architecture after sunset; perhaps architecture is really a nocturnal art, like the art of fireworks.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: Art, as far as it is able, follows nature, as a pupil imitates his master; thus your art must be, as it were, God's grandchild.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quote: Modernity is the transient, the fleeting, the contingent; it is one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immovable.
Author: Charles Baudelaire

Quote: The art of effective listening is essential to clear communication, and clear communication is necessary to management success.
Author: James Cash Penney

Quote: Books are like oxygen to a deep-sea diver,"she had once said. "Take them away and you might as well begin counting the bubbles.
Author: Alan Bradley

Quote: Books swept me away, this way and that, one after the other; I made endless vows according to their lights for I believed them.
Author: Annie Dillard

Quote: I don't believe in the kind of magic in my books. But I do believe something very magical can happen when you read a good book.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Only five books tonight, Mommy,"she says.No, Olivia, just one."How about four?"Two."Three."Oh, all right, three. But that's it!
Author: Ian Falconer

Quote: What is wonderful about great literature is that it transforms the man who reads it towards the condition of the man who wrote.
Author: E.M. Forster

Quote: I think it's cool to wear roadkill. If I died and somebody wanted to wear my teeth around their neck to VMAs, I'd feel honored.
Author: Ke$ha

Quote: Maybe they did what they had to do to live, and tried to get a little love and have a little fun before the darkness took them.
Author: Poppy Z. Brite

Quote: You can still be cool when you're dead. In fact, it's much easier, because you aren't getting old and fat and losing your hair.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger

Quote: The education of all children, from the moment that they can get along without a mother's care, shall be in state institutions.
Author: Karl Marx

Quote: The rearing of children is considered too important to be left to the individual and should be the responsibility of the state.
Author: Jostein Gaarder

Quote: Anti-intellectualism remains strongly entrenched in many parts of the church, but it is grounded in fear, not in faith. (p. 19)
Author: Robin R. Meyers

Quote: Extraordinary afflictions are not always the punishment of extraordinary sins, but sometimes the trial of extraordinary graces.
Author: Matthew Henry

Quote: Faith as the state of being ultimately concerned implies love, namely, the desire and urge toward the reunion of the seperated.
Author: Paul Tillich

Quote: God, I am trying to recover my faith. Please don't abandon me in the middle ofthis adventure, I prayed, pushing my fears aside.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Science tells me God must exist.My mind tells me I'll never understand God.My heart tells me I'm not meant to. [Vittoria Vetra]
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: A woman may very well form a friendship with a man, but for this to endure, it must be assisted by a little physical antipathy.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I'm single, footloose and fancy free, I have no responsibilities, no anchors. Work, friendship and self-improvement, that's me.
Author: Joel Edgerton

Quote: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

Quote: I wanted to have premarital sex with a midget, but I was afraid the ringmaster would banish me for unlawful carnival knowledge.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: Working for Mab now, are you, Wolfman?"he smirked. "Like a good little attack dog? Will you also roll over and beg if she asks?
Author: Julie Kagawa

Quote: Are we biology or God or something higher? I know my heart beats and I listen to it. The beat is biology, but what is the song?
Author: James Frey

Quote: Can a mortal ask questions which God finds unanswerable? Quite easily, I should think. All nonsense questions are unanswerable.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Faith does not need to push the river because faith is able to trust that there is a river. The river is flowing. We are in it.
Author: Richard Rohr

Quote: I think music is what language once aspired to be. Music allows us to face God on our own terms because it reaches beyond life.
Author: Simon Van Booy

Quote: If there's a God out there, then i would hope he has more important things to attend to than my drinking scotch or eating pork.
Author: Khaled Hosseini

Quote: The Bible is the greatest of all books; to study it is the noblest of all pursuits; to understand it, the highest of all goals.
Author: Charles C. Ryrie

Quote: We might be wise to follow the insight of the enraptured heart rather than the more cautious reasoning of the theological mind.
Author: A.W. Tozer

Quote: When you mature in your relationship with God you realize how suffering and patience are like eating your spiritual vegetables.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Always try to be joyful and proactively benign to the people. By doing so everyday, people have no control at all over my mood.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: I think about my mother singing after lunch on a Summer afternoon, twirling in blue dress across the floor of her dressing room
Author: Audrey Niffenegger

Quote: Point me out the happy man and I will point you out either extreme egotism, selfishness, evil -- or else an absolute ignorance.
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of scenery—air, mountains, trees, people. I thought, "This is what it is to be happy.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: And as I watched him, I knew that in every dark night there was, somewhere, a small light burning that could never be quenched.
Author: Juliet Marillier

Quote: Few people know so clearly what they want. Most people can't even think what to hope for when they throw a penny in a fountain.
Author: Barbara Kingsolver

Quote: I'm still like a butterfly going from one job to another job. But it's quite lovely - I hope to keep this freedom, to have fun.
Author: Carine Roitfeld

Quote: In these times I don't, in a manner of speaking, know what I want; perhaps I don't want what I know and want what I don't know.
Author: Marsilio Ficino

Quote: That would be the death of anyone - to recognize false hopes with a certainty. One mustn't know that. If it is offered, refuse!
Author: Jesse Ball

Quote: The planet's hope and salvation lies in the adoption of revolutionary new knowledge being revealed at the frontiers of science.
Author: Bruce Lipton

Quote: Unfortunates, who ought to begin with God, do not have any hope in him till they have exhausted all other means of deliverance.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quote: What is true of the individual will be tomorrow true of the whole nation if individuals will but refuse to lose heart and hope.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Comedy is difficult for an actor. But I think I have a good sense of humor and manage to make people laugh and make them happy.
Author: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

Quote: Have you noticed that whatever sport you're trying to learn, some earnest person is always telling you to keep your knees bent?
Author: Dave Barry

Quote: I compare Stephen Sondheim with humor, because humor is unanalyzable. You can't analyze humor. You just have to get through it.
Author: Elaine Stritch

Quote: I don't know about your true form, but the weight of your ego sure is pushing the crust of the earth toward the breaking point.
Author: Jim Butcher

Quote: I had no desire to hear another woman tell my boyfriend how hot he was. If I wanted him to know, I'd damn well tell him myself.
Author: Rachel Vincent

Quote: Just as I had long suspected, a person didn't really need math for anything anyway. Maybe some people did. Some limited people.
Author: Augusten Burroughs

Quote: The satirist shoots to kill while the humorist brings his prey back alive and eventually releases him again for another chance.
Author: Peter De Vries

Quote: Well sure, who doesn't need a boyfriend? but realistically, those exotic creatures are hard to come by. At least a quality one.
Author: Rachel Cohn

Quote: You can laugh! But people used to believe there were no such things as the Blibbering Humdinger or the Crumple-Horned Snorkack!
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you're so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone.
Author: Tina Fey

Quote: ...and remember my sentimental friend that a heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
Author: L. Frank Baum

Quote: a dog is not considered a good dog because he is a good barker. a man is not considered a good man because he is a good talker.
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: By recalling God's past provision, we can reassure ourselves that what He has done in the past, He will do again in the future.
Author: Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

Quote: Commitment mixed with drive and sprinkled with imagination creates sustained results. Stay focused and you will make your mark!
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Even if it's absurd to think you can change things, it's even more absurd to believe that it is foolish and unimportant to try.
Author: Peter C. Newman

Quote: Even if you don't have all the things you want, be grateful for the things you don't have that you don't want (Bob Dylan's dad)
Author: Bob Dylan

Quote: Everybody is special. Everybody. Everybody is a hero, a lover, a fool, a villain. Everybody. Everybody has their story to tell.
Author: Alan Moore

Quote: How does one become a butterfly? They have to want to learn to fly so much that you are willing to give up being a caterpillar.
Author: Trina Paulus

Quote: I just hope I remember to tell my kids that they are as happy as I look in my old photographs. And I hope that they believe me.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: I wanted change and excitement and to shoot off in all directions myself, like the colored arrows from a Fourth of July rocket.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: If I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: If you're lost and aloneOr you're sinking like a stoneCarry on...May your past be the soundOf your feet upon the groundCarry on
Author: Fun

Quote: Indeed, learning to write may be part of learning to read. For all I know, writing comes out of a superior devotion to reading.
Author: Eudora Welty

Quote: It's never the value of water but thirst, it's never the value of life but death and it's never about the friendship but trust.
Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S

Quote: One more dance along the razor's edge finished. Almost dead yesterday, maybe dead tomorrow, but alive, gloriously alive, today.
Author: Robert Jordan

Quote: People turn to meditation because they want to make good decisions, break bad habits & bounce back better from disappointments.
Author: Sharon Salzberg

Quote: Picasso had a saying - 'good artists copy, great artists steal' - and we have always been shameless about stealing great ideas.
Author: Walter Isaacson

Quote: The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That's the day we truly grow up.
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: The light of compassion opens the petals of the heart. When the petals of the heart unfold fragrance spreads across the valley.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: The Prince is the only option to a better living. His arm is reliable and dependable. Get to Him, stay glued and remain on Top!
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: The world is full of people who all want the same thing, and you have to do a little something extra to make them remember you.
Author: Candace Bushnell

Quote: whatever you dobe gentle with yourself.you don't just livein this worldor your homeor your skin.you also livein someone's eyes.
Author: Sanober Khan

Quote: All the time you're saying to yourself, 'I could do that, but I won't,' — which is just another way of saying that you can't.
Author: Richard Feynman

Quote: Always hear others out and remain open-minded; the day you think you know everything is the day you have the most yet to learn.
Author: A.J. Darkholme

Quote: Knowledge grows exponentially. The more we know, the greater our ability to learn, and the faster we expand our knowledge base.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: We the people have no excuse for starry-eyed sycophantic group-think in the Information Age. Knowledge is but a fingertip away.
Author: Tiffany Madison

Quote: All teachings are mere references. The true experience is living your own life. Then, even the holiest of words are only words.
Author: Ming-Dao Deng

Quote: At the time, my life just seemed too complete, and maybe we have to break everything to make something better out of ourselves.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.
Author: Lord Byron

Quote: I had a dream about you last night.. You were balancing ten tiny footballs on your nose while dancing with a turquoise unicorn.
Author: Amy Summers

Quote: I would not have you descend into your own dream. I would have you be a conscious citizen of this terrible and beautiful world.
Author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

Quote: It's paradoxical that the idea of living a long life appeals to everyone, but the idea of getting old doesn't appeal to anyone.
Author: Andy Rooney

Quote: Oh, you hate your job? Why didn't you say so?There's a support group for that. It's called EVERYBODY, and they meet at the bar.
Author: Drew Carey

Quote: People aren't born good or bad. Maybe they're born with tendencies either way, but its the way you live your life that matters.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Sexual living is a reflection of God's love for us. It has two key qualities, which is faithfulness and creativity of new life.
Author: Vincent Nichols

Quote: That's the duty of the old, to be anxious on behalf of the young. And the duty of the young is to scorn the anxiety of the old.
Author: Philip Pullman

Quote: We know from daily life that we exist for other people first of all, for whose smiles and well-being our own happiness depends.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I hold it true, whate'er befall;I feel it when I sorrow most;'Tis better to have loved and lostThan never to have loved at all.
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

Quote: I love pointy nails! A cute way to add a pop of color to your nails is to make a V-shape at the ends of them in a pastel color.
Author: Bella Thorne

Quote: I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: "Go down again - I dwell among the people.
Author: John Henry Newman

Quote: If you cannot inspire a woman with love of you, fill her above the brim with love of herself; all that runs over will be yours.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering.
Author: Nicole Krauss

Quote: She wasn't doing a thing that I could see, except standing there leaning on the balcony railing, holding the universe together.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: Someone once wrote that a novel should deliver a series of small astonishments. I get the same thing spending an hour with you.
Author: E. Lockhart

Quote: The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: They are orphans again, with no true home but each other and whatever life they can make together on the other side of the sea.
Author: Leigh Bardugo

Quote: For desired conclusions, we ask ourselves, "Can I believe this?", but for unpalatable conclusions we ask, "Must I believe this?
Author: Thomas Gilovich

Quote: All this time I've hated myself for it. I thought I'd given it up for nothing. But if I hadn't fallen, I wouldn't have met you.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick

Quote: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: It's all right to love someone who doesn't love you back, as long as they're worth you loving them. As long as they deserve it.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future.
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: The only thing better than imagining Dimitri carrying me in his arms was imagining him shirtless while carrying me in his arms.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
Author: Rumi

Quote: A bridge of silver wings stretches from the dead ashes of an unforgiving nightmareto the jeweled vision of a life started anew.
Author: Aberjhani

Quote: I don't know what's worse: to not know what you are and be happy, or to become what you've always wanted to be, and feel alone.
Author: Daniel Keyes

Quote: It is therefore senseless to think of complaining since nothing foreign has decided what we feel, what we live, or what we are.
