Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: The lesson we are indebted to Egypt for, our future generations learned that in the face of oppression silence is never golden.
Author: Aysha Taryam

Quote: The meaning of earthly existence lies not, as we have grown used to thinking, in prospering but in the development of the soul.
Author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

Quote: The moment we cry in a film is not when things are sad but when they turn out to be more beautiful than we expected them to be.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: The most total opposite of pleasure is not pain but boredom, for we are willing to risk pain to make a boring life interesting.
Author: Peter Kreeft

Quote: Under heaven all can see beauty as beauty only because there is ugliness. All can know good as good only because there is evil.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: April is the cruelest month, breedinglilacs out of the dead land, mixingmemory and desire, stirringdull roots with spring rain.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: I hunger for your sleek laugh and your hands the color of a furious harvest. I want to eat the sunbeams flaring in your beauty.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: Poetry is not the most important thing in life... I'd much rather lie in a hot bath reading Agatha Christie and sucking sweets.
Author: Dylan Thomas

Quote: To see a World in a grain of sand,And a Heaven in a wild flower,Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand,And Eternity in an hour.
Author: William Blake

Quote: We flatter those we scarcely know,We please the fleeting guest;And deal full many a thoughtless blow,To those who love us best.
Author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

Quote: You lethargic, waiting upon me,waiting for the fire and Iattendant upon you, shaken by your beautyShaken by your beauty Shaken.
Author: William Carlos Williams

Quote: Instead of saying, "I'm damaged, I'm broken, I have trust issues"say "I'm healing, I'm rediscovering myself, I'm starting over.
Author: Horacio Jones

Quote: I had a dream about you last night.. You thought you were a candy vampire, you were standing in the sun screaming 'I'm melting.
Author: Nicole McKay

Quote: Often romantic relationships fail because you are trying to get someone to fall in love with the YOU that you never discovered.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: I challenge anyone to understand Islam, its spirit, and not to love it. It is a beautiful religion of brotherhood and devotion.
Author: Yann Martel

Quote: What's the good of being true to your religion on the outside, if you don't change what's on the inside,were it really counts ?
Author: Randa Abdel-Fattah

Quote: Where questions of religion are concerned, people are guilty of every possible sort of dishonesty and intellectual misdemeanor.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: I don't care where I come from or who you are. I can make you happy, and you make me happy. We could have a happily ever after.
Author: Amanda Hocking

Quote: In our time together, you claimed a special place in my heart, one I'll carry with me forever and that no one can ever replace.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: We will restore science to its rightful place and wield technology's wonders to raise health care's quality and lower its cost.
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: You have to appreciate where you have come from to know who you are in the present and whom you would like to be in the future.
Author: Truth Devour

Quote: How many a man has thrown up his hands at a time when a little more effort, a little more patience would have achieved success.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: I am struck by how sharing our weakness and difficulties is more nourishing to others than sharing our qualities and successes.
Author: Jean Vanier

Quote: I've had great success and I've had catastrophic failure. It's really how you handle the rough stuff that defines you, I think.
Author: Peter Berg

Quote: Think of yourself as on the threshold of unparalleled success. A whole, clear, glorious life lies before you. Achieve! Achieve!
Author: Andrew Carnegie

Quote: We're all to driven by materialism. Obsessed with success. With money. With trying to impress people who'll never be impressed.
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
Author: Bob Dylan

Quote: In this treacherous worldNothing is the truth nor a lie.Everything depends on the colorOf the crystal through which one sees it
Author: Pedro Calderón de la Barca

Quote: Institutionalized rejection of difference is an absolute necessity in a profit economy which needs outsiders as surplus people.
Author: Audre Lorde

Quote: To love truth for truth's sake is the principal part of human perfection in this world, and the seed-plot of all other virtues.
Author: John Locke

Quote: Humans have victimized animals to such a degree that they are not even considered victims. They are not even considered at all.
Author: Gary Yourofsky

Quote: The worst sin toward our fellow creatures is not to hate them, but to be indifferent to them: that's the essence of inhumanity.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: With lentils, tomatoes and rice, olives and nuts and bread, Why does a man care to gnaw a slice of something bleeding and dead?
Author: Henry Bailey Stevens

Quote: True wisdom gives the only possible answer at any given moment, and that night, going back to bed was the only possible answer.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: I write entirely to find out what I'm thinking, what I'm looking at, what I see and what it means. What I want and what I fear.
Author: Joan Didion

Quote: Which of us has not felt that the character we are reading in the printed page is more real than the person standing beside us?
Author: Cornelia Funke

Quote: Writing- the profession in which you stare at a computer screen, stare out the window, type a few words, then curse repeatedly.
Author: Drew Goodman

Quote: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying, that he is wiser today than yesterday.
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quote: Peace is not something you wish for; It's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: When I judge art, I take my painting and put it next to a God made object like a tree or flower. If it clashes, it is not art.
Author: Paul Cezanne

Quote: You can understand nothing about art, particularly modern art, if you do not understand that imagination is a value in itself.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quote: Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?
Author: Christopher Paolini

Quote: CUSTOMER: If I were to, say... meet the love of my life in this bookshop, what section do you think they would be standing in?
Author: Jen Campbell

Quote: I attempted briefly to consecrate myself in the public library, believing every crack in my soul could be chinked with a book.
Author: Barbara Kingsolver

Quote: I know every book of mine by its smell, and I have but to put my nose between the pages to be reminded of all sorts of things.
Author: George Gissing

Quote: If time heals all wounds, and a book can hold a person's entire life, then you can speed up the process with a pulp time warp.
Author: Deb Caletti

Quote: Is that what death would feel like? The nicest, warmest, heaviest never-ending nap? If that's what it's like, I wouldn't mind.
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: Tell your friend that in his death, a part of you dies and goes with him. Wherever he goes, you also go. He will not be alone.
Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

Quote: The man who kills a man kills a man.The man who kills himself kills all men.As far as he is concerned, he wipes out the world.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: Witness also that when we talk about literature, we do so in the present tense. When we speak of the dead, we are not so kind.
Author: John Green

Quote: Getting rid of poverty is not about making the rich more aware: it's about educating the poor and empowering them from within.
Author: Joseph Rain

Quote: She saw why teachers get very old and stay very young. For there is no closer probing of the mind--not even in psychoanalysis.
Author: John Horne Burns

Quote: All I know is that the closer I get to God, the deeper I get into the Bible, and the heavier the burden seems on my shoulders.
Author: Tim LaHaye

Quote: Focus on faith and grow your roots strong and deep so no one can make you believe in something that is not good for your soul.
Author: Molly Friedenfeld

Quote: In all my travels, I've never seen a country's population more determined to forgive, and to build and succeed than in Rwanda.
Author: Rick Warren

Quote: We do know that no person can be saved except through Christ. We do not know that only those who know Him can be saved by Him.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: I have a friendship with Hezbollah, and I also have contacts outside of Lebanon, but it doesn't mean I follow anyone's agenda.
Author: Najib Mikati

Quote: It's quite difficult to write about female friendship without it seeming to be a very niche subject. It's a difficult balance.
Author: Samantha Harvey

Quote: My aim is to create a happy society with genuine friendship. Friendship between Tibetan and Chinese peoples is very essential.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
Author: Washington Irving

Quote: The feeling of friendship is like that of being comfortably filled with roast beef; love, like being enlivened with champagne.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: And my piece of advice is...don't flirt with any of the female instructors. They all have access to weapons bigger than yours.
Author: Simone Elkeles

Quote: Ethan Wyeth: I hope you're thirsty."Gideon Wyeth:"Why?"Ethan: "Cause your dumb and ugly, but I can do something about thirsty.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: I also don't trust Caribou anymore. They're out there, on the tundra, waiting... Something's going down. I'm right about this.
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: It doesn't sound logical to say that a man is an atheist just because he's probably someonewho knows his own God...personally.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: What do people mean when they say, 'I am not afraid of God because I know He is good'? Have they never even been to a dentist?
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Without God, life has no purpose, and without purpose, life has no meaning. Without meaning, life has no significance or hope.
Author: Rick Warren

Quote: Women are delicate creatures. Fragile. Gentle. Made by God to be sheltered from the harshness of this world..Morgan MacDonnell
Author: Teresa Medeiros

Quote: It's not strength, it's PERCEPTION that makes you stronger. If you change how you SEE it, you'll change how you FEEL about it.
Author: Yvonne Pierre

Quote: Many people think excitement is happiness.... But when you are excited you are not peaceful. True happiness is based on peace.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich

Quote: She still cared for me, and the best way I could make amends to her was to be happy.I do have a knack for finding great women.
Author: Craig Ferguson

Quote: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation, but you thoughts about it. Be aware of the thoughts you are thinking.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: There is no greater power than that of a laugh and happiness is a force which can save a person from the horrors of the world.
Author: Hillary DePiano

Quote: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: For love would be love of the wrong thing; there is yet faith, But the faith and the love and the hope are all in the waiting.
Author: T. S. Eliot

Quote: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

Quote: Hope-that unshakable golden belief that things can get better- is why I'm here talking to you now. Without it, we are nothing.
Author: Alexander Gordon Smith

Quote: I tremble for my country when I hear of confidence expressed in me. I know too well my weakness, that our only hope is in God.
Author: Robert E. Lee

Quote: In a world plagued with commonplace tragedies, only one thing exists that truly has the power to save lives, and that is love.
Author: Richelle E. Goodrich

Quote: That's all a man can hope for during his lifetime - to set an example - and when he is dead, to be an inspiration for history.
Author: William McKinley

Quote: A melancholy-looking man, he had the appearance of one who has searched for the leak in life's gas-pipe with a lighted candle.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: Check out that one at the end. He's taken the form of a footstool. Weird...but somehow I like his style.""That is a footstool.
Author: Jonathan Stroud

Quote: Everyone is flailing through this life without an owner's manual, with whatever modicum of grace and good humor we can manage.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: I used to think anyone doing anything weird was weird. Now I know that it is the people that call others weird that are weird.
Author: Paul McCartney

Quote: If our Founding Fathers wanted us to care about the rest of the world, they wouldn't have declared their independence from it.
Author: Stephen Colbert

Quote: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he isn't. A sense of humor was provided to console him for what he is.
Author: Horace Walpole

Quote: I've noticed that when people are joking they're usually dead serious, and when they're serious, they're usually pretty funny.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: Nobody's ever asked me to a party before, as a friend. Is that why you dyed your eyebrow, for the party? Should I do mine too?
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Part of my humor is the fact that I love coming out of left field. I don't want people to expect what is going to happen next.
Author: Howie Mandel

Quote: Politics is not a bad profession. If you succeed there are many rewards, if you disgrace yourself you can always write a book.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Sometimes losing a pet is more painful than losing a human because in the case of the pet, you were not pretending to love it.
Author: Amy Sedaris

Quote: To keep your marriage brimming, with love in the wedding cup, whenever you're wrong, admit it; whenever you're right, shut up.
Author: Ogden Nash

Quote: What's a philosopher?' said Brutha.Someone who's bright enough to find a job with no heavy lifting,' said a voice in his head.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Differences are not intended to separate, to alienate. We are different precisely in order to realize our need of one another.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: Every comforting word is a command from a man of action...While every word of command is commotion from a man of just words...
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: Falling in love with humans is like walking into a pantry and realizing you're trapped in it without Whip Cream, and Cherries.
Author: AainaA-Ridtz

Quote: I think . . . I said things to Silas. He'll be angry.''If he didn't care about you, you couldn't upset him,' was all she said.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: It's funny, for all it took was a broken heart and that alone was enough, enough for her to do everything she ever dreamed of.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: It's your living room, it's your life, go nuts. You like Home Improvement? Tape it and go over it like it's the Zapruder film.
Author: Dennis Miller

Quote: Leadership is all about caring, daring and sharing!Caring for people, Daring to Act fearlessly,& Sharing the success with all!
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. Your really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
Author: Lucille Ball

Quote: One of the most scariest thing in life is when you come to the realization that the only thing that can save you is...yourself
Author: Demi Lovato

Quote: Opportunities? They are all around us ... There is power lying latent everywhere waiting for the observant eye to discover it.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: So, this is my life. And I want you to know that I am both happy and sad and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: There is no tomorrow and there was no yesterday; if you truly want to accomplish your goals you must engulf yourself in today.
Author: Noel DeJesus

Quote: When people see some things as beautiful,other things become ugly.When people see some things as good,other things become bad.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: When you release a trauma on one level of your energetic being, you will experience relief on all other levels simultaneously.
Author: Dashama Konah Gordon

Quote: When you see a good person, think of becoming like her/him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.
Author: Confucius

Quote: And people who don't dream, who don't have any kind of imaginative life, they must… they must go nuts. I can't imagine that.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: To learn which questions are unanswerable, and not to answer them: this skill is most needful in times of stress and darkness.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quote: A pain stabbed my heart, as it did every time I saw a girl I loved who was going the opposite direction in this too-big world.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: Anything was better than nothing. Half-full was better than empty. Ignorance was the lowest form of humiliation and suffering.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick

Quote: Children should be able to live a life free from bullying and harassment and it is time that we all took a stand against this.
Author: Katherine Jenkins

Quote: Do not let your difficulties fill you with anxiety, after all it is only in the darkest nights that stars shine more brightly.
Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S

Quote: I haven't been very impressed lately.By people,or places,or the way someone said he loved me and then slowly changed his mind.
Author: Charlotte Eriksson

Quote: I slept and I dreamed that life is all joy. I woke and I saw that life is all service. I served and I saw that service is joy.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: If you want small changes in your life, work on your attitude. But if you want big and primary changes, work on your paradigm.
Author: Stephen Covey

Quote: In one drop of water are found all the secrets of all the oceans; in one aspect of You are found all the aspects of existence.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: The primary source of the appeal of Christianity was Jesus - His incarnation, His life, His crucifixion, and His resurrection.
Author: Kenneth Scott Latourette

Quote: There are a lot of things I wish I would have done, instead of just sitting around and complaining about having a boring life.
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: What made me run away was doubtless not so much the fear of settling down, but of settling down permanently in something ugly.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: When I look at my old pictures, all I can see is what I used to be but am no longer. I think: What I can see is what I am not.
Author: Aleksandar Hemon

Quote: You said we all want there to be more than this! Well, there's always more than this. There's always something you don't know.
Author: Patrick Ness

Quote: A family is a risky venture, because the greater the love, the greater the loss... That's the trade-off. But I'll take it all.
Author: Brad Pitt

Quote: Every time I close my eyes, it's like a dark paradise. No one compares to you, but there's no you, except in my dreams tonight
Author: Lana Del Rey

Quote: I love Christmas, not just because of the presents but because of all the decorations and lights and the warmth of the season.
Author: Ashley Tisdale

Quote: Some people feel like they don't deserve love. They walk away quietly into empty spaces, trying to close the gaps of the past.
Author: Jon Krakauer

Quote: That's when you know for sure somebody loves you. They figure out what you need and they give it to you -- without you asking.
Author: Adriana Trigiani

Quote: There is never a time or place for true love. It happens accidentally, in a heartbeat, in a single flashing, throbbing moment.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: They say: 'If a man knew himself,he would know all mankind.'I say: 'If a man loved mankind,he would know something of himself.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: When God knows you're ready for the responsibility of commitment, He'll reveal the right person under the right circumstances.
Author: Joshua Harris

Quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Would you mind repeating that? I'm afraid I might have lost my wits altogether and just hallucinated what I've longed to hear.
Author: Jeaniene Frost

Quote: Yearning for love made her feel like a cat that was always twining around ankles, meowing Pet me, pet me, look at me, love me.
Author: Laini Taylor

Quote: Don't worry about hurting me, if that's what you're afraid of. I want to get hurt. At least I´ll feel something for a change.
Author: Katie Kacvinsky

Quote: Consciousness does not just passively reflect the objective material world; it plays an active role in creating realityitself.
Author: Stanislav Grof

Quote: I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Being reminded about the incredible power of God's love, and living as He intended, is the most powerful motivation to change.
Author: Rick Warren

Quote: Even the strongest and bravest must sometimes weep. It shows they have a great heart, one that can feel compassion for others.
Author: Brian Jacques

Quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
Author: Maxim Gorky

Quote: I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.
Author: J.R. Ward

Quote: It is more fun to talk with someone who doesn't use long, difficult words but rather short, easy words like "What about lunch?
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: It is true that those we meet can change us, sometimes so profoundly that we are not the same afterwards, even unto our names.
Author: Yann Martel

Quote: No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: There's nothing worse than waiting and not knowing what'll happen to you. Your own imagination can be crueler than any captor.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Quote: The principle of democracy is a recognition of the sovereign, inalienable rights of man as a gift from God, the Source of law.
Author: Fulton J. Sheen

Quote: The smallest minority on earth is the individual. Those who deny individual rights cannot claim to be defenders of minorities.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: To conquer oneself is the best and noblest victory; to be vanquished by one's own nature is the worst and most ignoble defeat.
Author: Plato

Quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself, And what I assume you shall assume,For every atom belonging to me as good belongs to you.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: It is not our job to remain whole.We came to lose our leavesLike the trees, and be born again,Drawing up from the great roots.
Author: Robert Bly

Quote: One! two! and through and throughThe vorpal blade went snickersnack!He left it dead, and with its headHe went galumphing back.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: Feast, and your halls are crowdedFast, and the world goes bySucceed and give, and it helps you liveBut no man can help you die
Author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

Quote: The circumstances of the world are so variable that an irrevocable purpose or opinion is almost synonymous with a foolish one.
Author: William Seward

Quote: You will have fewer regrets in life if you start focusing and taking responsiblity for where you are and where you want to be.
Author: Deborah Day

Quote: Have you ever noticed how parents can go from the most wonderful people in the world to totally embarrassing in three seconds?
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: I had a dream about you last night. We stopped telling each other about our dreams when we realized we were still inside them.
Author: Michael Summers

Quote: I mean, if the relationship can't survive the long term, why on earth would it be worth my time and energy for the short term?
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: I think you are wrong to want a heart. It makes most people unhappy. If you only knew it, you are in luck not to have a heart.
Author: L. Frank Baum

Quote: Tina leans forward and asks quietly, 'Do you? You know? Love her?'Squeezing Nat's knee again, I reply, 'She's teachin' me how.
Author: Belle Aurora

Quote: I like a cook who smiles out loud when he tastes his own work.Let God worry about your modesty; I want to see your enthusiasm.
Author: Robert Farrar Capon

Quote: Don't make a feller wait too long. A feller waiting on a gal can get ornery'er than a huntin' dog that's tree'd it's squirrel.
Author: Colleen Houck

Quote: This time the fluttery feeling in my stomach was more intense. It made the inside of my thighs tingle and my breathing deepen.
Author: P.C. Cast

Quote: Temporis filia veritas; cui me obstetricari non pudet.Truth is the daughter of time, and I feel no shame in being her midwife.
Author: Johannes Kepler

Quote: The measure of greatness in a scientific idea is the extent to which it stimulates thought and opens up new lines of research.
Author: Paul A.M. Dirac

Quote: You're paved in my heart like an old road. Like the pebbles in a pebble field, dirt in dirt, dust in dust, cobwebs in cobwebs.
Author: Kyung-sook Shin

Quote: Anyone who wants to sell you overnight success or wealth is not interested in your success; they are interested in your money.
Author: Bo Bennett

Quote: I think that my biggest attribute to any success that I have had is hard work. There really is no substitute for working hard.
Author: Maria Bartiromo

Quote: If you carefully consider what you want to be said of you in the funeral experience, you will find your definition of success.
Author: Stephen Covey

Quote: If you want to continue to be the best in the world, then you have to train and compete like you are second best in the world.
Author: Steve Backley

Quote: Success is neither magical nor mysterious. Success is the natural consequence of consistently applying the basic fundamentals.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: The way into the hall of success always passes through the chamber of decision. Decide to be a success; success is deliberate!
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: Whenever you're successful you owe that success to the people in the community, because they are the ones buying your product.
Author: Carl Karcher

Quote: And the truth must finally lie in that which every oppressed individual feels within himself but hasn't the courage to express
Author: Wilhelm Reich

Quote: For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Words are like eggs dropped from great heights; you can no more call them back than ignore the mess they leave when they fall.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: We all have but one life, human, cow, ant, everyone, and it is not our right to take it away on a whim, simply because we can.
Author: Jaco van Drongelen

Quote: Do you know why most survivors of the Holocaust are vegan? It's because they know what it's like to be treated like an animal.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Knowing others is intelligence;knowing yourself is true wisdom.Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Sure, it was your idea and your fly, but he caught the big fish. Remember, fairness is a human idea largely unknown in nature.
Author: John Gierach

Quote: The moon will guide you through the night with her brightness, but she will always dwell in the darkness, in order to be seen.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: The notion of freedom proclaimed by the modern world is anti-discipline. But true freedom cannot be separated from discipline.
Author: Matthew Kelly

Quote: Your biggest opportunity probably lies under your own feet, in your current job, industry, education, experience or interests.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: A letter is a soul, so faithful an echo of the speaking voice that to the sensitive it is among the richest treasures of love.
Author: Honoré de Balzac

Quote: But the purpose of a story is to teach and to please at once, and what it teaches is how to recognize the snares of the world.
Author: Umberto Eco

Quote: Who is more to be pitied, a writer bound and gagged by policemen or one living in perfect freedom who has nothing more to say?
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading.
Author: William Styron

Quote: I have gone to [this bookshop] for years, always finding the one book I wanted - and then three more I hadn't known I wanted.
Author: Mary Ann Shaffer

Quote: I like books whose virtue is all drawn together in a page or two. I like sentences that don't budge though armies cross them.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Be of good cheer about death, and know this of a truth, that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
Author: Socrates

Quote: If we knew a person was going to die, we'd hold harder to the memories."Fire corrected him, in a whisper. "The good memories.
Author: Kristin Cashore

Quote: As regards moral courage, then, it is not so much that the public schools support it feebly, as that they suppress it firmly.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: I must judge for myself, but how can I judge, how can any man judge, unless his mind has been opened and enlarged by reading.
Author: John Adams

Quote: We will continue to chase rainbows unless we recognize that they are rainbows and there is no pot of gold at the end of them.
Author: Diane Ravitch

Quote: À ceux qui ignorent, enseignez-leur [...]Le coupable n'est pas celui qui y fait le péché, mais celui qui y a fait l'ombre.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: If you can admit that you haven't yet understood everything,faith can fill the emptiness in heart to confront the hesitation.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: Success always necessitates a degree of ruthlessness. Given the choice of friendship or success, I'd probably choose success.
Author: Sting

Quote: Fire. God of Abraham, God of Isaac, God of Jacob, not of the philosophers and the scholars. I will not forget thy word. Amen.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: For in Paris, whenever God puts a pretty woman there (the streets), the Devil, in reply, immediately puts a fool to keep her.
Author: Jules Barbey d'Aurevilly

Quote: Personally, I do not want to make you a man. Men are so very frail. Men break. Men die. No, I've always wished to make a god.
Author: Pierce Brown

Quote: They call him Aslan in That Place,"said Eustace."What a curious name!""Not half so curious as himself,"said Eustace solemnly.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: We try too much and trust too little. Count the times God's Book tells us to "try."Now count the times it tells us to "trust.
Author: Peter Kreeft

Quote: Got no checkbooks, got no banks. Still I'd like to express my thanks - I've got the sun in the mornin' and the moon at night.
Author: Irving Berlin

Quote: Happiness is excitement that has found a settling down place, but there is always a little corner that keeps flapping around.
Author: E.L. Konigsburg

Quote: Happiness is something you lay siege to, it is a battle like a game of go. I will take hold of all the pain and snuff it out.
Author: Shan Sa

Quote: In order to have great happiness, you have to have great pain and unhappiness-otherwise how would you know when you're happy?
Author: Leslie Caron

Quote: My only regrets are the moments when i doubted myself and took the safe route. Life is too short to waste time being unhappy.
Author: Dan Howell

Quote: Oh, Marilla, I thought I was happy before. Now I know that I just dreamed a pleasant dream of happiness. This is the reality.
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Quote: You can be happy with money and you can be wretched with it. It depends on what kind of person you are. -- A Prologue to Love
Author: Taylor Caldwell

Quote: And I sometimes think that a moment of touching is the difference between complete utter despair and the ability to carry on.
Author: Eleanor Cameron

Quote: Compromise is but the sacrifice of one right or good in the hope of retaining another - too often ending in the loss of both.
Author: Tryon Edwards

Quote: His hope wasn't lost, it was buried, and somehow Prudence Ryland made that old grave seem much more shallow than it once was.
Author: Kathryn Smith

Quote: hope had become despair, protestors had become terrorists, love had become sex, music had become noise, and us had become me.
Author: Susan R. Sloan

Quote: I challenge you to make your life the masterpiece you want to paint, the novel you want to read, the day you want to wake to.
Author: Toni Sorenson

Quote: It's time to get real, folks. Hope and change ain't working. Hope and change is not a solution. Hope and change is not a job.
Author: Herman Cain

Quote: People are just too hopeful, and sometimes hope is the biggest weapon of all to use against us. People will believe anything.
Author: Edwidge Danticat

Quote: The reason most people give up so fast is that they look at how far they still have to go, instead of how far they have come.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: When the world caves inStill my hope will clingTo Your promiseWhere my courage endsLet my heart find strengthIn Your presence
Author: Hillsong

Quote: I'm going to follow this invisible red thread until I find myself again… until I finally figure out… who I'm meant to be.
Author: Jennifer Elisabeth

Quote: As people, we're generally optimistic, no matter how disabled our lives are, and we find the humor in the darkest situations.
Author: John Wells

Quote: Bathroom humor, fart, and poo poo humor in movies gets a laugh. It's a pretty easy audience, and that's been around for ages.
Author: Selma Blair

Quote: I learned early in my career to not let myself get in the way of humor but, instead, find what is great in a talented person.
Author: Tamra Davis

Quote: I try to find humor in everything I do, because I think all great plays - even great tragedies - have enormous humor in them.
Author: Marian Seldes

Quote: I value humor, kindness, and the ability to tell a good story far more than money, status, or the kind of car someone drives.
Author: Rebecca Wells

Quote: If you approach Cannes with a sense of humor, nothing is that bad. You have to take it for what it is; otherwise, it's silly.
Author: Mathieu Amalric

Quote: I'm really happy I went to a Catholic school because a lot of the repressive tactics they use make for great senses of humor.
Author: Denis Leary

Quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Peter to Austin:"Hard-ons don't make you think less. They make you think stupid. Which makes me think you must have one 24/7.
Author: Dani Alexander

Quote: Sex had been amazing, but it wasn't a magical cure for everything. Damn. Somewhere along the way, I'd picked up common sense.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Speak in French when you can't think of the English for a thing--turn your toes out when you walk---And remember who you are!
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: The interesting thing about humor is that in humor, you - in logic, something is A or not A. In humor, it's both A and not A.
Author: Robert Mankoff

Quote: The man with the real sense of humor is the man who can put himself in the spectator's place and laugh at his own misfortune.
Author: Bert Williams

Quote: The nuclear arms race is like two sworn enemies standing waist deep in gasoline, one with three matches, the other with five.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: The reason for the unreason with which you treat my reason , so weakens my reason that with reason I complain of your beauty.
Author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

Quote: When I was in school the teachers told me practice makes perfect; then they told me nobody's perfect so I stopped practicing.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: Yeah, well, food's one of the five exceptions to Gamp's Law of Elemental Transfigurations,"said Ron, to general astonishment.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: You can turn painful situations around through laughter. If you can find humor in anything, even poverty, you can survive it.
Author: Bill Cosby

Quote: You have to remember one thing about the will of the people: it wasn't that long ago that we were swept away by the Macarena.
Author: Jon Stewart

Quote: ‎No people whose word for 'yesterday' is the same as their word for 'tomorrow' can be said to have a firm grip on the time.
Author: Salman Rushdie

Quote: A focused Mind is a result Of a little Effort To tell Your Distractions To sleep for A couple of hours While you are at WORK.
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: An ocean of shimmering love exists in your heart. Tap into it today and rest in the undulating currents of the great mystery.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Do not go gentle into that good night,Old age should burn and rave at close of day;Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
Author: Dylan Thomas

Quote: I must work harder to achieve my goal of not seeking approval from those whose approval I'm not even sure is important to me.
Author: Lauren Graham

Quote: In order to write the book you want to write, in the end you have to become the person you need to become to write that book.
Author: Junot Díaz

Quote: It is said that God has created man in his own image. But it may be that humankind has created God in the image of humankind.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich

Quote: It's not about what you've done; it's how you've experienced whatever has happened to you. Matt Lawrence in The Overachievers
Author: Alexandra Robbins

Quote: No, our science is no illusion. But an illusion it would be to suppose that what science cannot give us we can get elsewhere.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: People who work in an environment where doing their best is recognized have a better chance of feeling good about their work.
Author: Marilyn Suttle

Quote: There is a candle in your heart, ready to be kindled.There is a void in your soul, ready to be filled.You feel it, don't you?
Author: Rumi

Quote: Without leaps of imagination or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all is a form of planning.
Author: Gloria Steinem

Quote: Write to please just one person. If you open a window and make love to the world, so to speak, your story will get pneumonia.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: Consider what really makes up your self-worth—like your caring heart or your ability to stand tall in the face of adversity
Author: Susan Bernstein

Quote: For if we're destroyed, the knowledge is dead...We're nothing more than dust jackets for books...so many pages to a person...
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: They knew many things but had no idea why. And strangely this made them more, rather than less, certain that they were right.
Author: Neal Stephenson

Quote: Wenn du weißt, behaupte, dass du es weißt. Und wenn du etwas nicht weißt, gib zu, dass du es nicht weißt. Das ist Wissen.
Author: Confucius

Quote: All sacrifice and suffering is redemptive. It is used to either teach the individual or to help others. Nothing is by chance.
Author: A.J. Russell

Quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.
Author: Wil Zeus

Quote: By the truth we are undone. Life is a dream. 'Tis the waking that kills us. He who robs us of our dreams robs us of our life.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki

Quote: Life doesn't make any sense without interdependence. We need each other, and the sooner we learn that, the better for us all.
Author: Erik Erikson

Quote: Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along.
Author: E.M. Forster

Quote: People see me laughing and telling jokes, but they had no idea after the show was over, I had no joy in my life, in my heart.
Author: Steve Harvey

Quote: Shock is a merciful condition. It allows you to get through disaster with a necessary distance between you and your feelings.
Author: Lisa Kleypas

Quote: So he tasted the deep pain that is reserved only for the strong, just as he had tasted for a little while the deep happiness.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
Author: Booker T. Washington

Quote: The more credit you give away, the more will come back to you. The more you help others, the more they will want to help you.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Animals have never betrayed me. They are an easy prey, as I have been throughout my career. So we feel the same. I love them.
Author: Brigitte Bardot

Quote: If you love a flower that lives on a star, it is sweet to look at the sky at night. All the stars are a-bloom with flowers...
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: If you want a love message to be heard, it has got to be sent out. To keep a lamp burning, we have to keep putting oil in it.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
Author: Lucille Ball

Quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: The most painful thing is losing yourself in the process of loving someone too much, and forgetting that you are special too.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: The truth is that love smashes into your life like an ice floe, and even if your heart is built like the Titanic you go down.
Author: Jeanette Winterson

Quote: This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Valentine WeatherKiss me with rain on your eyelashes,come on, let us sway together,under the trees, and to hell with thunder.
Author: Edwin Morgan

Quote: When we are in love, we are convinced nobody else will do. But as time goes, others do do, and often do do, much much better.
Author: Coco J. Ginger

Quote: There's no better way to inform and expand you mind on a regular basis than to get into the habit of reading good literature.
Author: Stephen R. Covey

Quote: Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Quote: I am coming to terms with the fact that loving someone requires a leap of faith, and that a soft landing is never guaranteed.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: I am not eccentric. It's just that I am more alive than most people. I am an unpopular electric eel set in a pond of catfish.
Author: Edith Sitwell

Quote: I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners."Jace flipped a page. "Very funny, Fray.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Some lose all mind and become soul,insane.some lose all soul and become mind, intellectual.some lose both and become accepted
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.
Author: Anna Quindlen

Quote: Sleep,” he says. “I'll fight the bad dreams off if they come to get you.” “With what?” “My bare hands, obviously.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: Atheism is a way of humility. It's to think oneself to be an animal, as we are actually and to allow oneself to become human.
Author: André Comte-Sponville

Quote: Only God may be adored, because only God is unlimited goodness, truth, and beauty, and thus only God deserves unlimited love.
Author: Peter Kreeft

Quote: The method of 'postulating' what we want has many advantages ; they are the same as the advantages of theft over honest toil.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: It's the fire in my eyes, And the flash of my teeth, The swing in my waist, And the joy in my feet. I'm a woman Phenomenally.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Maybe the trying is the thing. Maybe it doesn't get better than that. Maybe you never quite get there. And maybe that's okay.
Author: Keith Ablow

Quote: Part of him wanted to weep... but his purpose was rigid within him. He felt he could not bend to gentleness without breaking.
Author: Stephen R. Donaldson

Quote: You were never created to live depressed, defeated, guilty, condemned, ashamed or unworthy. We were created to be victorious.
Author: Joel Osteen

Quote: I choose not to waste my energy hating someone and I recognise that their negativity drags me down, so I walk away from them.
Author: Karon Waddell

Quote: The smooth folds of her dress concealed a tumultuous heart, and her modest lips told nothing of her torment. She was in love.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Better not to invent her in her absence. Better to wait until she's actually here. Then he can make her up as she goes along.
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: If you do not respect your own wishes, no one else will. You will simply attract people who disrespect you as much as you do.
Author: Vironika Tugaleva

Quote: Proclaim your pride and bitterness loudly to the world, but to me speak softly, and tell me simply that she doesn't love you.
Author: Edmond Rostand

Quote: The secret of a good sermon is to have a good beginning and a good ending; and to have the two as close together as possible.
Author: George Burns

Quote: There's no reason to think we're going to stop loving each other,' he said. 'And there's every reason to think that we won't.
Author: Rainbow Rowell

Quote: WORTH IT and perfect are different things. No one's perfect, yet in romance, everyone becomes WORTH IT. And that's the trick.
Author: Maureen Johnson

Quote: You have captured me utterly, and you hold my heart in your hands. Be gentle with it. It's more fragile than you might think.
Author: J. Kenner

Quote: John Muir, Earth — planet, Universe[Muir's home address, as inscribed on the inside front cover of his first field journal]
Author: John Muir

Quote: Life is real! Life is earnest!And the grave is not its goal;Dust thou are, to dust thou returnest,Was not spoken of the soul.
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: Sometimes, the only soul that can mend a broken heart is the one that broke it. For they are the ones holding all the pieces.
Author: Patti Roberts

Quote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: I didn't know how to deal with success. If there was a Rock Star 101, I would have liked to take it. It might have helped me.
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: Many people succeed when others do not believe in them. But rarely does a person succeed when he does not believe in himself.
Author: Herb True

Quote: The most important thing is being passionate about what you're doing and always give it your all. That is the key to success.
Author: Charlie White

Quote: In practical life we are compelled to follow what is most probable ; in speculative thought we are compelled to follow truth.
Author: Baruch Spinoza

Quote: It's funny whom we end up choosing to love and who ends up choosing to love us. It's rarely the people we think it should be.
Author: Robin Jones Gunn

Quote: Lies are neither bad nor good. Like a fire they can either keep you warm or burn you to death, depending on how they're used.
Author: Max Brooks

Quote: The single best thing about coming out of the closet is that nobody can insult you by telling you what you've just told them.
Author: Rachel Maddow

Quote: Truth is neither in the scripture nor in the words of prophets. It is in your heart, feel it, discover it and expand with it.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: Why, if it was an illusion, not praise the catastrophe, whatever it was, that destroyed illusion and put truth in it's place?
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: There is no fundamental difference between man and animals in their ability to feel pleasure and pain, happiness, and misery.
Author: Charles Darwin

Quote: You put a baby in a crib with and apple and a rabbit. If it eats the rabbit and plays with the apple, I'll buy you a new car.
Author: Harvey Diamond

Quote: a wise woman puts a grain of sugar in everything she says to a man, and takes a grain of salt with everything he says to her.
Author: Helen Rowland

Quote: Men have two greatest fears: the first fear is the fear of being needed, and the second fear is the fear of not being needed.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: what's right? If you want something, you have the right to take it. If you want to do something, you have the right to do it.
Author: Bret Easton Ellis

Quote: All profound distraction opens certain doors. You have to allow yourself to be distracted when you are unable to concentrate.
Author: Julio Cortázar

Quote: Be sure not to discuss your hero's state of mind. Make it clear from his actions."(Letter to Alexander Chekhov, May 10, 1886)
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of.
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: You can approach the act of writing with nervousness, excitement, hopefulness, or despair ... Come to it any way but lightly.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.
Author: W. Clement Stone

Quote: Be of good cheer about death, and know this of a truth, that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
Author: James Matthew Barrie

Quote: People don't realize that now is all there ever is; there is no past or future except as memory or anticipation in your mind.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Another unsettling element in modern art is that common symptom of immaturity, the dread of doing what has been done before.
Author: Edith Wharton

Quote: Speak the truth, do not yield to anger; give, if thou art asked for little; by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.
Author: Confucius

Quote: What art is, in reality, is this missing link, not the links which exist. It's not what you see that is art; art is the gap.
Author: Marcel Duchamp

Quote: A library outranks any other one thing a community can do to benefit its people. It is a never failing spring in the desert.
Author: Andrew Carnegie

Quote: In the shop we buy and sell them, but in truth books have no owner. Every book you see here has been somebody's best friend.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: Never lend books, for no one ever returns them; the only books I have in my library are books that other folks have lent me.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: Not that she objected to solitude. Quite the contrary. She had books, thank Heaven, quantities of books. All sorts of books.
Author: Jean Rhys

Quote: The walls of books around him, dense with the past, formed a kind of insulation against the present world and its disasters.
Author: Ross Macdonald

Quote: We are never allowed to forget that some books are badly written; we should remember that sometimes they're badly read, too.
Author: Nick Hornby

Quote: I have lived with you and loved you, and now you are gone. Gone where I cannot follow, until I have finished all of my days.
Author: Victoria Hanley

Quote: Oh, brothers! I don't care for brothers. My elder brother won't die, and my younger brothers seem never to do anything else.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: One of the inescapable encumbrances of leading an interesting life is that there have to be moments when you almost lose it.
Author: Jimmy Buffett

Quote: Perfection of character is this: to live each day as if it were your last, without frenzy, without apathy, without pretence.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Learning is by nature curiosity... prying into everything, reluctant to leave anything, material or immaterial, unexplained.
Author: Philo of Alexandria

Quote: Real education should educate us out of self into something far finer; into a selflessness which links us with all humanity.
Author: Nancy Astor the Viscountess Astor

Quote: Still reading but learning a lot about true education and the process of guiding our children in their educational pursuits.
Author: Oliver DeMille

Quote: Conjugal love, or the friendship of spouses, can persist even after sexual desires have weakened, withered, and disappeared.
Author: Mortimer Adler

Quote: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
Author: Robert Southey

Quote: Yeah, I was thinking about taking one of those showers where you huddle in the corner fully clothed and cry,"Archer offered.
Author: Rachel Hawkins

Quote: Yes, I'm back,"he said, "And look who I ran into."Horace grinned at him. "i hope you ran into him hard.""As hard as I could.
Author: John Flanagan

Quote: God does not play games with His loyal servants", said the Metatron, but in a worried tone of voice."Whoopee", said Crowley.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Perfect prayer does not consist in many words, silent remembering and pure intention raises the heart to that supreme Power.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Be like a branch of a tree; flex your body to face 'wind of sorrow'; flex little harder to dance in the 'wind of happiness'.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: I am very happyBecause I have conquered myselfAnd not the world.I am very happyBecause I have loved the worldAnd not myself.
Author: Sri Chinmoy

Quote: Life is so short. The only person you hurt when you stay angry or hold grudges is you. Forgive everyone, including yourself.
Author: Tom Giaquinto

Quote: Nothing is miserable unless you think it so; and on the other hand, nothing brings happiness unless you are content with it.
Author: Boethius

Quote: The notion that a human being should be constantly happy is a uniquely modern, uniquely American, uniquely destructive idea.
Author: Andrew Weil

Quote: You would not want to be responsible for someone else's happiness, so please do not hold someone else responsible for yours!
Author: Jennifer O'Neill

Quote: ... omniscience about life and death is not within a physician's purview. A doctor should never write off a person a priori.
Author: Jerome Groopman

Quote: Don't despair: despair suggests you are in total control and know what is coming. You don't - surrender to events with hope.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: I hope that in some way that I can be some sort of beacon of hope, especially because I am not the typical Hollywood beauty.
Author: Octavia Spencer

Quote: If I had to choose between betraying my country and betraying my friend, I hope I should have the guts to betray my country.
Author: E. M. Forster

Quote: Night always turns to day again as long as the sun shall rise, so shall it be for darkened dreams grown pale from compromise
Author: Tracy L. Conway

Quote: Some men don't have the opportunity to be the type of father they need to be, and I hope my example teaches them to step up.
Author: Marvin Sapp

Quote: There is a secret medicine given only to those who hurt so hard they can't hope.The hopers would feel slighted if they knew.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Trust to some was placing all your insecurities and beliefs in one single person, and hoping he or she wouldn't squash them.
Author: Holly Hood

Quote: We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quote: When Nelson Mandela walked free, the world sang with joy. Ever since, South Africa has stood as a beacon of hope for Africa.
Author: Ban Ki-moon

Quote: Yes, well I really hope I can make a difference, even in the smallest way. I am looking forward to helping as much as I can.
Author: Kate Middleton

Quote: Yesterday I was a dog. Today I'm a dog. Tomorrow I'll probably still be a dog. Sigh! There's so little hope for advancement.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Butch tightened his grip on his cell and wished there were an app that let you reach through a phone and bitch slap someone.
Author: J.R. Ward

Quote: Having a sense of humor has served me more than it has hurt me - just in the sense that it has allowed me to keep my sanity.
Author: Dee Dee Myers

Quote: I know the answer! The answer lies within the heart of all mankind! The answer is twelve? I think I'm in the wrong building.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: I often have said that to be a college president, you need a thick skin, a good sense of humor, and nerves like sewer pipes.
Author: Gordon Gee

Quote: I think being a parent is knowing how to love. Sometimes love is discipline, sometimes it's humor, sometimes it's listening.
Author: Melissa Etheridge

Quote: If this humor be the safety of our race, then it is due largely to the infusion into the American people of the Irish brain.
Author: William Howard Taft

Quote: It is characteristic of all deep human problems that they are not to be approached without some humor and some bewilderment.
Author: Freeman Dyson

Quote: It's self-effacing, it's hard-luck, the shtetl stories. All those Coasters things are an amalgam of Yiddish and black humor.
Author: Jerry Leiber

Quote: I've always been a fan of a Johnny Carson because he was so great with an audience and not afraid of self-deprecating humor.
Author: Vince Vaughn

Quote: My favorite kind of humor is basically, if it was happening to you, it wouldn't be funny, but to observe it, it's hilarious.
Author: Bill Burr

Quote: My parents armed me with an amazing sense of humor, and it's what you need when, well, it's what anyone needs in this world.
Author: Warwick Davis

Quote: Set your compass to beauty, humor, and grief; stay the course no matter what, and I'll support you with everything I've got.
Author: Chris Jordan

Quote: We have a certain warped sense of humor in Scandinavia, and that is what comes across in the choices in a lot of our movies.
Author: Connie Nielsen

Quote: Women, as they grow older, rely more and more on cosmetics. Men, as they grow older, rely more and more on a sense of humor.
Author: George Jean Nathan

Quote: ...A scar signifies past pain, a wound that did not heal as it ought. But it testifies, too, to survival...(Here be Dragons)
Author: Sharon Kay Penman

Quote: A woman can't do anything about her appearance. Either she's pretty or she isn't. But her character is quite another matter.
Author: Julie Garwood

Quote: Beauty is not who you are on the outside, it is the wisdom and time you gave away to save another struggling soul, like you.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Between natural ability and education choose natural ability, as it will keep you happy and will fetch you the glory sooner.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: Courage does not always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, 'I will try again tomorrow.
Author: Mary Anne Radmacher

Quote: Doing what you wanted to do was the only training, and the only preliminary, needed for doing more of what you wanted to do.
Author: Kingsley Amis

Quote: Don't be distracted by criticism. Remember ~ the only taste of success some people have is when they take a bite out of you.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Don't step backward toward nothing, step forward toward something, better awkward steps forward, than coward steps backward.
Author: Victoria Addino

Quote: I do like alternative rock and rap, but as far as inspirational, then I go full-on orchestra. It fills up your entire being.
Author: Osric Chau

Quote: If you're in the luckiest one per cent of humanity, you owe it to the rest of humanity to think about the other 99 per cent.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: I'm going to paraphrase Thoreau here... rather than love, than money, than faith, than fame, than fairness... give me truth.
Author: Jon Krakauer

Quote: Inhale when I inhale. Exhale when I exhale. Breathe with me,for two beating hearts breathing one breath together become one.
Author: Christina Westover

Quote: Lady Gaga is the present and the future. She is the most revolutionary and inspirational artist. She is fearless and daring.
Author: Donatella Versace

Quote: No one is to blame because there is no one other than you. Nothing is to disrespect because there is nothing other than you.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: Spread kindness, caring, and compassion and create your own paradise. Infuse it with joy and you've created heaven on earth.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: stand often in the company of dreamers: they tickle your common sense & believe you can achieve things which are impossible.
Author: Mary Anne Radmacher

Quote: The only thing wrong with trying to please everyone is that there's always at least one person who will remain unhappy. You.
Author: Elizabeth Parker

Quote: To recognize that the greatest error is not to have tried and failed, but that in trying, we did not give it our best effort
Author: Gene Kranz

Quote: We sing inspirational songs, songs of praise and worship, and about how good and how big God is. We are magnifying the Lord.
Author: Fred Hammond

Quote: When I hear music, I fear no danger. I am invulnerable. I see no foe. I am related to the earliest times, and to the latest.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Yoga is not just repetation of few postures - it is more about the exploration and discovery of the subtle energies of life.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: There is no time to waste in life and there is no cut and paste as well, only copy and paste – you can only emulate others
Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

Quote: I wonder,” he said, “whether the stars are set alight in heaven so that one day each one of us may find his own again...
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: Acquire knowledge and enjoy its freedom or allow someone to fill you with theirs and live within the jurisdiction of theirs.
Author: Ikechukwu Izuakor

Quote: I mean, you could claim that anything's real if the only basis for believing in it is that nobody's proved it doesn't exist!
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: If the ignorance of nature gave birth to such a variety of gods, the knowledge of this nature is calculated to destroy them.
Author: Paul Henri Thiry d'Holbach

Quote: That which others hear or read of, I felt and practised myself; they get their knowledge by books, I mine by melancholizing.
Author: Robert Burton

Quote: We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.
Author: John Archibald Wheeler

Quote: As far as we can discern, the sole purpose of human existence is to kindle a light of meaning in the darkness of mere being.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: Carve your name on hearts, not tombstones. A legacy is etched into the minds of others and the stories they share about you.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Creo que todos tenemos un poco de esa bella locura que nos mantiene andando cuando todo alrededor es tan insanamente cuerdo.
Author: Julio Cortázar

Quote: Give a bowl of rice to a man and you will feed him for a day. Teach him how to grow his own rice and you will save his life.
Author: Confucius

Quote: He'd always been a man who followed his head and not his heart.The heart was just a bloody motor.The head was meant to drive
Author: Mario Puzo

Quote: I am afraid to show you who I really am, because if I show you who I really am, you might not like it--and that's all I got.
Author: Sabrina Ward Harrison

Quote: I wonder if being sane means disregarding the chaos that is life, pretending only an infinitesimal segment of it is reality.
Author: Rabih Alameddine

Quote: If you're bored with life - you don't get up every morning with a burning desire to do things - you don't have enough goals.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: I've cried, and you'd think I'd be better for it, but the sadness just sleeps, and it stays in my spine the rest of my life.
Author: Conor Oberst

Quote: Never respond to an angry person with a fiery comeback, even if he deserves it...Don't allow his anger to become your anger.
Author: Bohdi Sanders

Quote: The masculine energy was about survival. The male was the hunter who risked his life and had to be in the fight-flight mode.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: The thing about getting older is that you don't need everything to be possible any more, you just need things to be certain.
Author: Monica Ali

Quote: Regardless of Sunshine or Rain, Be Thankful for another GREAT day…and treat Life as the ULTIMATE Gift.... Because IT IS :)
Author: Pablo

Quote: Character — the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life — is the source from which self-respect springs.
Author: Joan Didion

Quote: Before, I wanted to say: "I found love!"But now, I want to say: "I found a person. And he belongs to me and I belong to him.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: But hurry, let's entwine ourselves as one, our mouth broken, our soul bitten by love, so time discovers us safely destroyed.
Author: Federico García Lorca

Quote: It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them.
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: It took me years to figure out that upset was upset, and tumultuousness was not the same thing as passion. Love isn't drama.
Author: Deb Caletti

Quote: My mother... she is beautiful, softened at the edges and tempered with a spine of steel. I want to grow old and be like her.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: New Yorkers love it when you spill your guts out there. Spill your guts at Wimbledon and they make you stop and clean it up.
Author: Jimmy Connors

Quote: She had never imagined she had the power to make someone else so happy. And not a magical power, either--a purely human one.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Smirking, he says, "Whatever spell you just tried to cast on me, it didn't work, so I think you need to go back to Hogwarts.
Author: Jenny Han

Quote: The beauty of a woman must be seen from in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because generally they are the same people.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: The most confused you will ever get is when you try to convince your heart and spirit of something your mind knows is a lie.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: The saddest thing about love, Joe, is that not only the love cannot last forever, but even the heartbreak is soon forgotten.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: The secret of a happy marriage is finding the right person. You know they're right if you love to be with them all the time.
Author: Julia Child

Quote: Tucker strokes my hair. There's something so tender about the gesture. It might as well have been him whispering I love you.
Author: Cynthia Hand

Quote: Waiting for you is like waiting for rain in this drought. Useless and disappointing."~ Sam (Hilary Duff), A Cinderella Story
Author: Hilary Duff

Quote: We have all known the long loneliness and we have learned that the only solution is love and that love comes with community.
Author: Dorothy Day

Quote: Decision decides destiny. What God wants you to become is the positive person you decide to become when led by God's spirit.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: When enter the whole new world, men will deal with new science.To embrace a new science, men need to get used to new wisdom.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: And I guess I realized at that moment that I really did love her. Because there was nothing to gain, and that didn't matter.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: I think we dream so we don't have to be apart for so long. If we're in each other's dreams, we can be together all the time.
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: It's a metaphor, see: You put the killing thing right between your teeth, but you don't give it the power to do its killing.
Author: John Green

Quote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Strength is the capacity to break a Hershey bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces.
Author: Judith Viorst

Quote: There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.
Author: Washington Irving

Quote: We all have our time machines, don't we. Those that take us back are memories...And those that carry us forward, are dreams.
Author: H.G. Wells

Quote: All resistance is a rupture with what is. And every rupture begins, for those engaged in it, through a rupture with oneself.
Author: Alain Badiou

Quote: Men are made for happiness, and he who is completely happy has the right to say to himself, 'I am doing God's will on earth.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quote: Mereka yang memimpin selalu lupa ketika dipimpin, seperti kupu-kupu dengan kepompong, lupa bahkan pada ulat sebagai asalnya.
Author: Cok Sawitri

Quote: Only by examining our personal biases can we truly grow as artists; only by cultivating empathy can we truly grow as people.
Author: Jen Knox

Quote: People know what they do; frequently they know why they do what they do; but what they don't know is what what they do does.
Author: Michel Foucault

Quote: Philosophy, from the earliest times, has made greater claims, and achieved fewer results, than any other branch of learning.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: The greatest lesson we should learn is that from the moment we are born we already have everything we need within ourselves.
Author: George Pornaris

Quote: The ways of fate are indeed hard to understand. If there is not some compensation hereafter, then the world is a cruel jest.
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: The wealth required by nature is limited and is easy to procure; but the wealth required by vain ideals extends to infinity.
Author: Epicurus

Quote: We feel that even if all possible scientific questions be answered, the problems of life have still not been touched at all.
Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

Quote: I have been to lots of partiesand acted perfectly disgracefulbut I never actually collapsedoh Lana Turner we love you get up
Author: Frank O'Hara

Quote: Lord, may the pain be ours, And the weakness that it brings, But at least give us the strength, Of not showing it to anyone!
Author: Fernando Pessoa

Quote: When you write about what you dream, you become a writer.When you dream about what you write, you become haunted by a curse.
Author: A. Saleh

Quote: i held it up, and tried to channel happy dog thoughts toward Cerberus- Alpo commercials, cute little puppies, fire hydrants.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Be careful whom you choose to love. This decision will impact your future life and happiness in ways you cannot yet imagine.
Author: Toni Coleman

Quote: my only complaints are two:that I didn't make myself readyfor you sooner in life, thatI can't give you better,Love you more.
Author: Jan Beatty

Quote: This is where men and women are different, we can put aside petty competition for relationships - they can't. It interferes.
Author: Adriana Trigiani

Quote: Unless I understand the Cross, I cannot understand why my commitment to what is right must be precedence over what I prefer.
Author: Ravi Zacharias

Quote: If God would have wanted us to live in a permissive society He would have given us Ten Suggestions and not Ten Commandments.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Still amazes me that people spend more time researching a new vehicle than they do the religion they entrust their souls to.
Author: Larissa Ione

Quote: I'm not sure I trust myself around you I liked you from the start, J.D. I really wish things had been different, that's all.
Author: Julie James

Quote: Join us next time for Days of the Undead when Rachel learns her long lost brother is really a crown prince from outer space.
Author: Kim Harrison

Quote: This is going to sound crazy, but... from the moment I first set eyes on you I haven't been able to stop thinking about you.
Author: Leigh Fallon

Quote: A kiss without a moustache, they said then, is like an egg without salt; I will add to it: and it is like Good without Evil.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: Einstein said that if quantum mechanics were correct then the world would be crazy. Einstein was right - the world is crazy.
Author: Daniel M. Greenberger

Quote: IF YOU WANT TO CREATE A CHANGE, you must challenge not only the models of Unreality, but the paradigms that underwrite them.
Author: Stafford Beer

Quote: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.
Author: Joseph Prince

Quote: Success comes to you with luck and a lot of hard work, but it doesn't give you the right to be any better than anybody else.
Author: Nick Nolte

Quote: Success is like death. The more successful you become, the higher the houses in the hills get and the higher the fences get.
Author: Kevin Spacey

Quote: To be successful, one has to be one of three bees - the queen bee, the hardest working bee, or the bee that does not fit in.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: You solely owe success and happiness to yourself. So why not make your inner-self proud of your daily decisions and actions?
Author: Edmond Mbiaka

Quote: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to what light I have.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: I have never killed anybody, it is true, but it is because I lacked the courage or the time, not because I lacked the desire
Author: Eduardo Galeano

Quote: Never hide things from hardcore thinkers. They get more aggravated, more provoked by confusion than the most painful truths.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: In all the round world of Utopia there is no meat. There used to be, but now we cannot stand the thought of slaughterhouses.
Author: H.G. Wells

Quote: Animal factories are one more sign of the extent to which our technological capacities have advanced faster than our ethics.
Author: Peter Singer

Quote: The vegan lifestyle is a compassionate way to live that supports life, supports fairness and equality, and promotes freedom.
Author: Robert Cheeke

Quote: You put a baby in a crib with an apple and a rabbit. If it eats the rabbit and plays with the apple, I'll buy you a new car.
Author: Harvey Diamond

Quote: You put a baby in a crib with an apple and a rabbit. If it eats the rabbit and plays with the apple, I'll buy you a new car.
Author: Harvey Diamond

Quote: Friendship, as has been said, consists in a full commitment of the will to another person with a view to that person's good.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: He who binds to himself a joyDoes the winged life destroy;But he who kisses the joy as it fliesLives in eternity's sun rise.
Author: William Blake

Quote: That was courage, Keller thought. Not doing something without being afraid, but doing something even though you were afraid.
Author: L.J. Smith

Quote: When every situation which life can offer is turned to the profit of spiritual growth, no situation can really be a bad one.
Author: Paul Brunton

Quote: A story is a letter that the author writes to himself, to tell himself things that he would be unable to discover otherwise.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: Every scene should be able to answer three questions: "Who wants what from whom? What happens if they don't get it? Why now?
Author: David Mamet

Quote: The job of the first eight pages is not to have the reader want to throw the book at the wall, during the first eight pages.
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: I find the best way to love someone is not to change them, but instead, help them reveal the greatest version of themselves.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
Author: Wayne Gretzky

Quote: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
Author: Wayne Gretzky

Quote: There's no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love. There is only a scarcity of resolve to make it happen.
Author: Wayne Dyer
