Author: Tyler Edwards

Quote: I have one desire now - to live a life of reckless abandon for the Lord, putting all my energy and strength into it.
Author: Elisabeth Elliot

Quote: To believe that what has not occurred in history will not occur at all, is to argue disbelief in the dignity of man.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: When you are down to nothing, God is up to somethng. It is up to you to reach out to find what God is up to for you.
Author: Robert Schuler

Quote: My brother spent a large portion of the agonizingly slow drive to school banging his forehead on the stearing wheel.
Author: Michelle Hodkin

Quote: When I see God I see Beauty, I see Love, I see Joy, I see Peace and I see You. God loves us let us love one another.
Author: E'yen A. Gardner

Quote: Happiness is not achieved by the conscious pursuit of happiness; it is generally the by-product of other activities.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Merry hearts are vulnerable to death, don't be over-joyed to the state of oblivion, lest the enemy poison your meal.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson

Quote: The only way I can be angry at you is when I have thought, said, or done something that is unkind in my own opinion.
Author: Byron Katie

Quote: Write it on your heart you are the most beautiful soul of the Universe. Realize it, honor it and celebrate the life.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: But hope is no less realistic than despair. It is still our choice whether to live in light or lie down in darkness.
Author: Rick Yancey

Quote: Dear refuge of my weary soul,On thee, when sorrows rise,On thee, when waves of trouble roll,My fainting hope relies.
Author: Anne Steele

Quote: I love being able to sing for my job. I am blessed beyond words and I hope my fans can feel that while I'm on stage!
Author: Jordin Sparks

Quote: I love writing novels, even if only a few thousand people read them. Here's my soul; I hope it appeals to your soul.
Author: Mark O'Donnell

Quote: I plead with you--never, ever give up on hope, never doubt, never tire, and never become discouraged. Be not afraid.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: Middle age is when you're sitting at home on a Saturday night and the telephone rings and you hope it isn't for you.
Author: Ogden Nash

Quote: The past is a source of knowledge, and the future is a source of hope. Love of the past implies faith in the future.
Author: Stephen Ambrose

Quote: To not have any hope is where things start to get really bleak. Things are possible. The impossible can be possible.
Author: Sarah Paulson

Quote: A good night sleep, or a ten minute bawl, or a pint of chocolate ice cream, or all three together, is good medicine.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: A lot about Congress is about forming good working relationships with people, and humor can really help you do that.
Author: Linda Sanchez

Quote: An idealist is one who, on noticing that a rose smells better than a cabbage, concludes that it makes a better soup.
Author: H.L. Mencken

Quote: And humor has always been a weapon. You want to get even on somebody? You want to attack somebody? Make fun of them.
Author: Alan King

Quote: Even celebrities, most people have a sense of humor. Most of the people we meet who we've done on the show, like it.
Author: Matt Stone

Quote: Finding a way to find humor in things that are hardcore is definitely something that, I think, the sitcom does best.
Author: Megyn Price

Quote: From sixteen to twenty, all women, kept in humor by their hopes and by their attractions, appear to be good-natured.
Author: Samuel Richardson

Quote: Humor is such a wonderful thing, helping you realize what a fool you are but how beautiful that is at the same time.
Author: Lynda Barry

Quote: Humour is the weapon of unarmed people: it helps people who are oppressed to smile at the situation that pains them.
Author: Simon Wiesenthal

Quote: I feel like getting married, or committing suicide, or subscribing to L'Illustration. Something desperate, you know.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: It can hardly be a coincidence that no language on earth has ever produced the expression, 'As pretty as an airport.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: It is one of those lessons that every child should learn: Don't play with fire, sharp objects, or ancient artifacts.
Author: Patricia Briggs

Quote: It would seem that you have no useful skill or talent whatsoever,"he said. "Have you thought of going into teaching?
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: The entire universe has been neatly divided into things to (a) mate with, (b) eat, (c) run away from, and (d) rocks.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Well? Is it true? Did she?""Did she what?""You know. Fall outta the crazy tree and hit every branch on the way down?
Author: Kami Garcia

Quote: You probably found 'How to Survive a Robot Uprising' in the humor section. Let's just hope that is where it belongs.
Author: Daniel H. Wilson

Quote: Above all, never think you're not good enough. Never think that. In life people will take you at your own reckoning.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
Author: Christian D. Larson

Quote: Call him Voldemort, Harry. Always use the proper name for things. Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air.
Author: John Quincy Adams

Quote: Don't only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets, for it and knowledge can raise men to the divine.
Author: Ludwig van Beethoven

Quote: Failure is when you give up. A real winner is someone that doesn't give up, even when it feels like they are losing.
Author: Joshua Hartzell

Quote: God allows us to experience the low points of life in order to teach us lessons that we could learn in no other way.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'
Author: Muhammad Ali

Quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion'.
Author: Muhammad Ali

Quote: I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence, but it comes from within. It is there all the time.
Author: Anna Freud

Quote: In the sky there are always answers and explanations for everything: every pain, every suffering, joy and confusion.
Author: Ishmael Beah

Quote: Love drips like honey from the hive, constant, sweet, precious, into your heart each and every moment if you let it.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Our greatest opportunities are to let go and surrender to that which is greater than our egoistic needs and desires.
Author: Dashama Konah Gordon

Quote: That's what being alive is, Thing! It's being badly prepared for everything! Because you only get one chance, Thing!
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: The great thing about falling apart, is that you get to decide how to put yourself back together. Make good choices.
Author: Stacie Hammond

Quote: The Mustard Seed CharmWith Faith As Small As A Mustard Seed, Then You Can Move Mountains: Nothing Will Be Impossible
Author: Viola Shipman

Quote: The reason birds can fly and we can't is simply because they have perfect faith, for to have faith is to have wings.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Quote: A person must earn enlightenment, Eragon. It is not handed down to you by others, regardless of how revered they be.
Author: Christopher Paolini

Quote: A person of little knowledge Grows old as a plough-ox grows old.His fleshes increases; His wisdom does not increase.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: I sold my soul for knowledge of the future, only to have that very pact render me forever ignorant (Gerald Tarrant).
Author: C.S. Friedman

Quote: Knowledge & understanding mixed with ones convictions of 'experience' is hardly impositional". ~R. Alan Woods [2012]
Author: R. Alan Woods

Quote: Let us tenderly and kindly cherish therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write .
Author: John Adams

Quote: Don't leave a piece of jewelry at his house so you can go back and get it later; he may be with his real girlfriend.
Author: Amy Sedaris

Quote: I never ask a man what his business is, for it never interests me. What I ask him about are his thoughts and dreams.
Author: H.P. Lovecraft

Quote: If people do not believe that mathematics is simple, it is only because they do not realize how complicated life is.
Author: John von Neumann

Quote: If you don't want anyone to know about your existence, you might as well kill yourself. You're taking up space, air.
Author: Dave Eggers

Quote: If you truly believe in the value of life, you care about all of the weakest and most vulnerable members of society.
Author: Joni Eareckson Tada

Quote: If you want to achieve things in life, you've just got to do them, and if you're talented and smart, you'll succeed.
Author: Juliana Hatfield

Quote: It's not always easy being her daughter.' I think,' she said, 'sometimes it's hard no matter whose daughter you are.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: Life is a compromise of what your ego wants to do, what experience tells you to do, and what your nerves let you do.
Author: Walter Bagehot

Quote: My hometown I grew up in in Michigan is really tiny, and they are so excited for all of my adventures my whole life.
Author: Toni Trucks

Quote: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: She shrugged. "You can be happy for someone else's good fortune, but that doesn't mean you forget your own bad luck.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: Sickness, insanity and death were the angels that surrounded my cradle and they have followed me throughout my life.
Author: Edvard Munch

Quote: This must be Thursday,' said Arthur to himself, sinking low over his beer. 'I never could get the hang of Thursdays.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: We are all connected; To each other, biologically. To the earth, chemically. To the rest of the universe atomically.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: A man in love can do extraordinary things, I don't care if you're an angel, you're my angel, and I won't let you go.
Author: Alexandra Adornetto

Quote: Don't marry a rich man. Marry a good man. He will spend his life trying to keep you happy. No rich man can buy that!
Author: Staness Jonekos

Quote: I love to compete. To me, business is the ultimate sport. It's always on. There is always someone trying to beat me.
Author: Mark Cuban

Quote: It's hard to communicate anything exactly and that's why perfect relationships between people are difficult to find.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
Author: James A. Baldwin

Quote: Truth is so obscure in these times, and falsehood so established, that, unless we love the truth, we cannot know it.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: When you feel someone else's pain and joy as powerfully as if it were your own, then you know you really loved them.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: You'll probably die if you stay with me,' he told me.'Then I'm dead either way, because I won't survive without you.
Author: Julie Hockley

Quote: Death is not in the nature of things; it is the nature of things. But what dies is the form. The matter is immortal.
Author: John Fowles

Quote: It is of great importance, when we begin to practise prayer, not to let ourselves be frightened by our own thoughts.
Author: Teresa of Ávila

Quote: The lake of my mind, unbroken by oars, heaves placidly and soon sinks into an oily somnolence.' That will be useful.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Your battles inspired me - not the obvious material battles but those that were fought and won behind your forehead.
Author: James Joyce

Quote: Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: Question everything. Your love, your religion, your passion. If you don't have questions, you'll never find answers.
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?
Author: Ralph Ellison

Quote: Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare.
Author: Guy de Maupassant

Quote: Despair is typical of those who do not understand the causes of evil, see no way out, and are incapable of struggle.
Author: Vladimir Lenin

Quote: I assess the power of a will by how much resistance, pain, torture it endures and knows how to turn to its advantage
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: You can recognize a small truth because its opposite is a falsehood. The opposite of a great truth is another truth.
Author: Niels Bohr

Quote: Vivo sin vivir en mí... muero porque no muero. (I live without really being alive... I die because I am not dying.)
Author: Teresa of Ávila

Quote: I am tired, Beloved, of chafing my heart againstThe want of you;Of squeezing it into little inkdrops,And posting it.
Author: Amy Lowell

Quote: I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow. I feel my fate in what I cannot fear. I learn by going where I have to go.
Author: Theodore Roethke

Quote: The master said You must write what you see.But what I see does not move me.The master answered Change what you see.
Author: Louise Glück

Quote: We don't read and write poetry because it's cute. We read and write poetry because we are members of the human race.
Author: Tom Schulman

Quote: We real cool. We Left school. We Lurk late. We Strike straight. We Sing sin. We Thin gin. We Jazz June. We Die soon.
Author: Gwendolyn Brooks

Quote: I don't want to take revenge or teach you a lesson, but you will bear the consequences of your actions by losing me.
Author: Sudeep Nagarkar

Quote: Language is the mother, not the handmaiden, of thought; words will tell you things you never thought or felt before.
Author: W.H. Auden

Quote: I used to advertise my loyalty and I don't believe there is a single person I loved that I didn't eventually betray.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Relationships are never about power, and one way to avoid the will to power is to choose to limit oneself- to serve.
Author: Wm. Paul Young

Quote: That was the day that I promised I'd never sing of love that does not exist. but darling, You are the only exception
Author: Hayley Williams

Quote: People tend to criticize their spouse most loudly in the area where they themselves have the deepest emotional need.
Author: Gary Chapman

Quote: Phones are distracting. The internet is distracting.The way he looked at you? He wasn't distracted. He was consumed.
Author: Stephanie Perkins

Quote: You Stole my loneliness. I may have given you wings, but you've become my gravity. I'll never be free of your force.
Author: Pepper Winters

Quote: Down there between our legs, it's like an entertainment complex in the middle of a sewage system. Who designed that?
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: One has a greater sense of intellectual degradation after an interview with a doctor than from any human experience.
Author: Alice James

Quote: The advantage of the emotions is that they lead us astray, and the advantage of science is that it is not emotional.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: ...and the vessel was not full, his intellect was not satisfied, his soul was not at peace, his heart was not still.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: Education is a fundamental principle of what made America a success. We can't afford to throw any young people away.
Author: Ben Carson

Quote: First-person narrators is the way I know how to write a book with the greatest power and chance of artistic success.
Author: Anne Rice

Quote: Flaming enthusiasm, backed up by horse sense and persistence, is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: People should decide what success means for them, and not be distracted by accepting others' definitions of success.
Author: Tony Levin

Quote: Small shifts in your thinking, and small changes in your energy, can lead to massive alterations of your end result.
Author: Kevin Michel

Quote: Success is not to discover what others like, it is to acquire and practise the skills that help one gain their love.
Author: محمد عبد الرحمن العريفي

Quote: The fame of heroes owes little to the extent of their conquests and all to the success of the tributes paid to them.
Author: Jean Genet

Quote: The successful man doesn't use others, other people use the successful man, for above all the success is of service.
Author: Mark Caine

Quote: We cannot reach the pinnacle except by taking advantage of the abilities we have and acquiring those that we do not.
Author: محمد عبد الرحمن العريفي

Quote: What I have achieved by industry and practice, anyone else with tolerable natural gift and ability can also achieve.
Author: Johann Sebastian Bach

Quote: Dance in the rain, follow the path of lovely lanes, you are what you always wanted to be, so chill out, dear friend!
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: It's easier to fake it. When you fake it for sixteen years, it becomes part of you, something you don't think about.
Author: Alex Flinn

Quote: Why do you so earnestly seek the truth in distant places?Look for delusion and truth in thebottom of your own heart.
Author: Ryokan

Quote: Your words will either give you joy or give you sorrow, but if they were spoken without regret, they give you peace.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: I do not see any reason why animals should be slaughtered to serve as human diet when there are so many substitutes.
Author: The Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: You either approve of violence or you don't, and nothing on earth is more violent or extreme than the meat industry.
Author: Morrisey

Quote: You either approve of violence or you don't, and nothing on earth is more violent or extreme than the meat industry.
Author: Morrissey

Quote: Knowledge is merely brilliance in organization of ideas and not wisdom. The truly wise person goes beyond knowledge.
Author: Confucius

Quote: What is grand is necessarily obscure to weak men. That which can be made explicit to the idiot is not worth my care.
Author: William Blake

Quote: Sometimes a book isn't a heartbreaking work of staggering genius.Sometimes it's the only story you knew how to tell.
Author: Tahereh Mafi

Quote: the writing of somemenis like a vast bridgethat carries youoverthe many thingsthat claw and tear.The Wine of Forever
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.
Author: James Allen

Quote: Only one thing is ever guaranteed, that is that you will definitely not achieve the goal if you don't take the shot.
Author: Wayne Gretzky

Quote: The mirror is a worthless invention. The only way to truly see yourself is in the reflection of someone elses. eyes.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: You find peace not by rearranging the circumstances of your life, but by realizing who you are at the deepest level.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: A critic should be taught to criticise a work of art without making any reference to the personality of the author.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Art is the desire of a man to express himself, to record the reactions of his personality to the world he lives in.
Author: Amy Lowell

Quote: Every happening, great and small, is a parable whereby God speaks to us, and the art of life is to get the message.
Author: Malcolm Muggeridge

Quote: I'm a big illustration and comic book fan. In my eyes, comic books and illustration are the same kind of art forms.
Author: Mika

Quote: Authors like cats because they are such quiet, lovable, wise creatures, and cats like authors for the same reasons.
Author: Robertson Davies

Quote: Books are always obviously having conversations with other books, and some times they're amiable and sometimes not.
Author: China Miéville

Quote: He understood the way that you could sometimes fall right into them, as if each page was a hole into another world.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: Libraries should be open to all - except the censor.[Response to questionnaire in Saturday Review, October 29 1960]
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Maybe the books can get us half out of the cave. They just might stop us from making the same damm insane mistakes!
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: The Bookshop has a thousand books,All colors, hues, and tinges,And every cover is a doorThat turns on magic hinges.
Author: Nancy Byrd Turner

Quote: Well, I don't like the first bit and I don't know the last bit. So I'm really hoping the middle bit is exceptional.
Author: Eoin Colfer

Quote: Each child's story is worthy of telling. There shouldn't be a sliding scale of death. The weight of it is crushing.
Author: Anderson Cooper

Quote: A good problem is something you don't know how to solve. That's what makes it a good puzzle and a good opportunity.
Author: Paul Lockhart

Quote: There will be no mass-based feminist movement as long as feminist ideas are understood only by a well-educated few.
Author: bell hooks

Quote: Faith is belief in what you cannot see or prove or touch. Faith is walking face-first and full-speed into the dark.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: To make a man a saint, it must indeed be by grace; and whoever doubts this does not know what a saint is, or a man.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: You just don't have faith!"Frank repeated."Well I hope I never get it! It's like being hit by a hammer in the head!
Author: Kim Stanley Robinson

Quote: Friendship with ones self is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: I think friendship is more important than love, but that love that grows out of friendship is the very best of all.
Author: Jane Green

Quote: Sport is one of the few spaces where people can learn about different cultures in a spirit of trust and friendship.
Author: Richard Attias

Quote: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
Author: Laurence J. Peter

Quote: Are you okay?"I (Cassie) call up to him."Um. Define okay."(Ben)"Okay means you're not bleeding to death.""I'm okay.
Author: Rick Yancey

Quote: How long have you been standing there?""Just long enough to see you give Daemon the middle finger.""He deserved it.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

Quote: Among all the creatures of creation, the gods favor us: We are the only ones who can empathize with their problems.
Author: David Eagleman

Quote: I can no more understand the totality of God than the pancake I made for breakfast understands the complexity of me
Author: Donald Miller

Quote: I had a standing agreement with god. I'd agree to believe in him, barely, so long as he let me sleep in on Sundays.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: The unconditional love of God leads to a life of freedom and transforms each day into a potentially wild adventure.
Author: Randy Elrod

Quote: Worthy character is best forged from a life of consistent, correct choices centered in the teachings of the Master.
Author: Richard G. Scott

Quote: .. she believed a great happiness awaited her somewhere, and for this reason she remained calm as the days flew by.
Author: Gyula Krúdy

Quote: How was life before Pop-Tarts, Prozac and padded playgrounds? They ate strudel, took opium and played on the grass.
Author: Jennifer Michael Hecht

Quote: It will hurt."said Petra. "But let's make the most of what we have, and not let future pain ruin present happiness.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: Even when we make mistakes, we hope others will love us in spite of our shortcomings - even if we don't deserve it.
Author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

Quote: Hope knows no fear.Hope dares to blossom even inside the abysmal abyss.Hope secretly feeds and strengthens promise.
Author: Sri Chinmoy

Quote: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: If I lived a million lives, I would've felt a million feelings and I still would've fallen a million times for you.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: I'm a romantic; a sentimental person thinks things will last, a romantic person hopes against hope that they won't.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: My hope is that we continue to nurture the places that we love, but that we also look outside our immediate worlds.
Author: Annie Leibovitz

Quote: One of the greatest delusions in the world is the hope that the evils in this world are to be cured by legislation.
Author: Thomas Reed

Quote: The God I believe in believes in me and won't silence my heart or others based on a paycheck at the end of the day.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
Author: Joseph Addison

Quote: Una Salus Victis Nullam Sperare Salutem - (Latin - written 19 BC)The only hope for the doomed, is no hope at all...
Author: Virgil

Quote: Well I certainly have learned and I hope I'm moving on and certainly two years of prison was a terrible punishment.
Author: Jeffrey Archer

Quote: Artemis felt like he was six again and caught hacking the school computers trying to make the test questions harder
Author: Eoin Colfer

Quote: Everything human is pathetic. The secret source of humor itself is not joy but sorrow. There is no humor in heaven.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I like working on stories where I can explore the darker corners of childhood without illustrations but with humor.
Author: Kate Klise

Quote: I love to sleep. Do you? Isn't it great? It really is the best of both worlds. You get to be alive and unconscious.
Author: Rita Rudner

Quote: I met Elton John at an Interview dinner, and we just sort of became friends. He's got such a wicked sense of humor.
Author: Moby

Quote: I think hip-hop does a very good job of infusing comedy and humor and wit into music, a lot more than other genres.
Author: Carrie Brownstein

Quote: In Australia, even the darkest subject matter has a little pinch of humor. A little sweet to make the sour go down.
Author: Ben Mendelsohn

Quote: Men will confess to treason, murder, arson, false teeth, or a wig. How many of them will own up to a lack of humor?
Author: Frank Moore Colby

Quote: The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.
Author: George F. Will

Quote: There are different kinds of humor, some is sarcastic, some introspective. Introspective fit my personality better.
Author: Rita Rudner

Quote: We're going to knock those demons out and slay them with the power of Jesus. Hallelujah, can I get an amen?- Timmie
Author: Jeaniene Frost

Quote: Yes, reason has been a part of organized religion, ever since two nudists took dietary advice from a talking snake.
Author: Jon Stewart

Quote: You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: You know how hard it is to feel like an extreme falcon-headed combat machine when somebody calls you "chicken man"?
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Ah, if everyone was as sensitive as you! There's no girl who hasn't gone through that. And it's all so unimportant!
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: As you walk through forestsor the meadows of your mind,Stop and talk to those you fearGood friendships you may find
Author: Stephen Cosgrove

Quote: Being able to write becomes a kind of shield, a way of hiding, a way of too instantly transforming pain into honey.
Author: John Updike

Quote: Caminante, no hay puentes, se hace puentes al andar. (Voyager, there are no bridges, one builds them as one walks.)
Author: Gloria E. Anzaldúa

Quote: Courage is living by the free will that one creates for themselves, not the life of monotony determined by another.
Author: Michelle Cruz-Rosado

Quote: decision is of the mind not of the mouth also determination is of the heart not of the head- Golden Life Foundation
Author: Chris C. Nwakanma

Quote: Do not neglect to show hospitality to strangers, for by doing that some have entertained angels without knowing it.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Faith is like radar that sees through the fog -- the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.
Author: Corrie ten Boom

Quote: God used my year of waiting not to frustrate me, or abandon me, but to draw me into a closer relationship with Him.
Author: Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

Quote: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I heard a definition once: Happiness is health and a short memory! I wish I'd invented it, because it is very true.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: I stay cool, and dig all jive,That's the way I stay alive.My motto, as I live and learn, isDig and be dugIn return.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: I want a tattoo over my heart that reads TRY HARDER YOU LAZY PARAMEDIC SHITBAG OR I WILL HAUNT YOUR BEDROOM FOREVER
Author: Warren Ellis

Quote: In the end, just three things matter:How well we have livedHow well we have lovedHow well we have learned to let go
Author: Jack Kornfield

Quote: It is not needful for our dreams to be very grand nor very big. It is only needful for our dreams to be very shiny.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: See, as much as you want to hold on to the bitter sore memory that someone has left this world, you are still in it
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: The firmest friendships have been formed in mutual adversity, as iron is most strongly united by the fiercest flame
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: The goal in life is not to try and live forever, but to create something that will live forever in people's hearts.
Author: Karon Waddell

Quote: There's only one racing strategy that matters.It's the one I run by: Get in the lead and don't let anyone pass you.
Author: Megan McCafferty

Quote: Too many people are missing their destiny a year at a time because they're too scared to think in decades!"(p. 127)
Author: Pete Greig

Quote: We delight in the beauty of the butterfly, but rarely admit the changes it has gone through to achieve that beauty.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: You don't need to wait for inspiration to write. It's easier to be inspired while writing that while not writing...
Author: Josip Novakovich

Quote: You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: a hero is just somebody who does the right thing when it would be far, far easier to do nothing.”-Cedric Diggory-
Author: G. Norman Lippert

Quote: Un archeologo è il miglior marito che una donna possa avere: più lei diventa vecchia, più lui s'interessa a lei.
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: Knowledge exists potentially in the human soul like the seed in the soil; by learning the potential becomes actual.
Author: أبو حامد الغزالي

Quote: Nothing is generous. New knowledge is a valuable commodity. The more truth we have to work with, the richer we are.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: That knowledge which purifies the mind and heart alone is true Knowledge, all else is only a negation of Knowledge.
Author: Ramakrishna

Quote: The phrase "popular science' has in itself a touch of absurdity. That knowledge which is popular is not scientific.
Author: Maria Mitchell

Quote: Being happy doesn't mean that everything is perfect. It means that you've decided to look beyond the imperfections.
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: Everybody know death is inevitably coming, but it never fails to catch everybody by surprise everytime one is going
Author: Hlovate

Quote: Everyone suffers some injustice in life, and what better motivation than to help others not suffer in the same way.
Author: Bella Thorne

Quote: I believe that words are strong, that they can overwhelm what we fear when fear seems more awful than life is good.
Author: Andrew Solomon

Quote: I never could bear the idea of anyone's expecting something from me. Italways made me want to do just the opposite.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: Instead of trying to make your life perfect, give yourself the freedom to make it an adventure, and go ever upward.
Author: Drew Houston

Quote: Life is too short to not have fun; we are only here for a short time compared to the sun and the moon and all that.
Author: Coolio

Quote: Offence is important; that's how you know you care about things. Imagine a life where you're not offended. So dull.
Author: Marcus Brigstocke

Quote: Too late, I found you can't wait to become perfect, you got to go out and fall down and get up with everybody else.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats.
Author: H.L. Mencken

Quote: Gabe?"The newchild stirred slightly in his sleep. Jonas looked over at him. "There could be love", Jonas whispered.
Author: Lois Lowry

Quote: I love Amsterdam. The city is vibrant and alive. It's fresh and so open. It's definitely one of my favorite places.
Author: Stefon Harris

Quote: If you have the woman you love, what more do you need? Well, besides an alibi for the time of her husband's murder.
Author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo

Quote: Love is not blind; that is the last thing that it is. Love is bound; and the more it is bound the less it is blind.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: Nothing else wounds so deeply and irreparably. Nothing else robs us of hope so much as being unloved by one we love
Author: Clive Barker

Quote: People who love themselves, don't hurt other people. The more we hate ourselves, the more we want others to suffer.
Author: Dan Pearce

Quote: So many believe that it is love that grows, but it is the knowing that grows and love simply expands to contain it.
Author: Wm. Paul Young

Quote: We are not held back by the love we didn't receive in the past, but by the love we're not extending in the present.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: Well my music was different in high school; I was singing about love—you know, things I don't care about anymore.
Author: Lady Gaga

Quote: Eyes can only capture objects that already seen in mind.And mind can only see things that already written in heart.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: I nodded, looking at Rachel with respect. "You hit the Lord of the Titans in the eye with a blue plastic hairbrush.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: In the end that was the choice you made, and it doesn't matter how hard it was to make it. It matters that you did.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: The pursuit of truth and beauty is a sphere of activity in which we are permitted to remain children all our lives.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your informed opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant.
Author: Harlan Ellison

Quote: [N]ow we have a clearer idea what this story is all about: The world was made for man, and man was made to rule it.
Author: Daniel Quinn

Quote: Any person who, with all the sincerity of heart, is in search for God, on land or in the sea, is worthy of respect.
Author: Riaz Ahmed Gohar Shahi

Quote: But the goal of the arts, culinary or otherwise, is not to increase our comfort. That is the goal of an easy chair.
Author: Jeffrey Steingarten

Quote: Definitions are the guardians of rationality, the first line of defense against the chaos of mental disintegration.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: I prefer for 'my world' to have the highest certification of being a faithful representation of the exterior world.
Author: Jesus Zamora Bonilla

Quote: If it turns out that there is a God...the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: It is when those who are not strong enough have made some moderate amount of progress that they fail and give up...
Author: Confucius

Quote: The discovery of what is true and the practice of that which is good are the two most important aims of philosophy.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Whatever their future, at the dawn of their lives, men seek a noble vision of man's nature and of life's potential.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: All bad poetry springs from genuine feeling. To be natural is to be obvious, and to be obvious is to be inartistic.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I turned silences and nights into words. What was unutterable, I wrote down. I made the whirling world stand still.
Author: Arthur Rimbaud

Quote: I will come back to you, I swear I will;And you will know me still.I shall be only a little tallerThan when I went.
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: Since then, at an uncertain hour, That agony returns: And till my ghastly tale is told, This heart within me burns.
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quote: the stars began to burnthrough the sheets of clouds,and there was a new voicewhich you slowlyrecognized as your own
Author: Mary Oliver

Quote: Celebrate the people in your life who are there because they love you for no other reason than because you are YOU.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: The more you take responsibility for your attitudes, the more you can adjust yourself in a forward thinking manner.
Author: Deborah Day

Quote: Just because you discover that you may like somebody after all, it doesn't necessarily mean there's any attraction.
Author: Steve Kluger

Quote: The manlier you are, the harder it is to understand what a woman wants: there is not a hint of female brain in you.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Change is not what we expect from religious people. They tend to love the past more than the present or the future.
Author: Richard Rohr

Quote: I was born a heretic. I always distrusted people who know so much about what God wants them to do to their fellows.
Author: Susan B. Anthony

Quote: And it is you, spirit--with will and energy, and virtue and purity--that I want, not alone with your brittle frame.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: Fresh, sweet honeysuckle. Ripe and rich and ready to be fucked--PLUCKED, he corrected himself, ready to be plucked.
Author: Christine Warren

Quote: I certainly do care for you Jeff Campbell less than you are always thinking and much more than you are ever knowing
Author: Gertrude Stein

Quote: Sometimes limbs must be re-broken to set properly, her heart too needed to shatter anew before it could truly heal.
Author: Sherry Thomas

Quote: After all, that was a main purpose of science: to make things of all kinds happen sooner than they otherwise would.
Author: Robert Aickman

Quote: Just because an apple falls one hundred times out of a hundred does not mean it will fall on the hundred and first.
Author: Derek Landy

Quote: Science is an organized pursuit of triviality.Art is a casual pursuit of significance.Let's keep it in perspective.
Author: Vera Nazarian

Quote: When scientifically investigating the natural world, the only thing worse than a blind believer is a seeing denier.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: No matter our talent, we all know in the midnight of our souls that 90 percent of what we do is less than our best.
Author: Robert McKee

Quote: I always say be humble but be firm. Humility and openness are the key to success without compromising your beliefs.
Author: George Hickenlooper

Quote: Let us realize that: the privilege to work is a gift, the power to work is a blessing, the love of work is success!
Author: David O. McKay

Quote: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
Author: Wayne Gretzky

Quote: Success ... seems to be connected with action. Successful men keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.
Author: Conrad Hilton

Quote: Success is a little like wrestling a gorilla. You don't quit when you're tired. You quit when the gorilla is tired.
Author: Robert Strauss

Quote: The test of success is not what you do when you are on top. Success is how high you bounce when you hit the bottom.
Author: George S. Patton Jr.

Quote: To be successful you have to be lucky, or a little mad, or very talented, or find yourself in a rapid growth field.
Author: Edward de Bono

Quote: You got to insist on your success, resist every obstacle and persist in times of difficulty and you will get there.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: One should never trust a woman who tells one her real age. A woman who would tell one that would tell one anything.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Set patterns, incapable of adaptability, of pliability, only offer a better cage. Truth is outside of all patterns.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: The Bible has noble poetry in it... and some good morals and a wealth of obscenity, and upwards of a thousand lies.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: There are two ways to be fooled. One is to believe what isn't true; the other is to refuse to believe what is true.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: From the Buddhist point of view, all living beings are considered equal. Human beings can live without eating meat.
Author: The Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Personal purity isn't really the issue. Not supporting animal abuse - and persuading others not to support it - is.
Author: Peter Singer

Quote: The time will come when men such as I will look upon the murder of animals as they now look upon the murder of men.
Author: Leonardo Da Vinci

Quote: When humans act with cruelty we characterize them as animals, yet the only animal that displays cruelty are humans.
Author: Anthony Douglas Williams

Quote: I've been vegan since I got out of the hospital… It's another eye opener. It changed my life in a number of ways.
Author: Travis Barker

Quote: I've been vegan since I got out of the hospital… It's another eye opener. It changed my life in a number of ways.
Author: Travis Barker

Quote: Just because you're in a situation, doesn't mean you have to be that situation. You're not the situation you're in!
Author: K.M. Johnson

Quote: A good [short story] would take me out of myself and then stuff me back in, outsized, now, and uneasy with the fit.
Author: David Sedaris

Quote: Collect books, even if you don't plan on reading them right away. Nothing is more important than an unread library.
Author: John Waters

Quote: The ideal art, the noblest of art: working with the complexities of life, refusing to simplify, to "overcome"doubt.
Author: Joyce Carol Oates

Quote: There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.
Author: Beatrix Potter

Quote: Write what disturbs you, what you fear, what you have not been willing to speak about. Be willing to be split open.
Author: Natalie Goldberg

Quote: An approximate answer to the right question is worth a great deal more than a precise answer to the wrong question.
Author: John Tukey

Quote: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
Author: Wayne Gretzky

Quote: Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: The universe doesn't give you what you ask for with your thoughts - it gives you what you demand with your actions.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: The universe doesn't give you what you ask for with your thoughts - it gives you what you demand with your actions.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: We can choose to look at whatever we want.  We can look at what's wrong in our life or we can look at what's right.
Author: Sonia Ricotti

Quote: We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: You are not one person, but three: The one you think you are; The one others think you are; The one you really are.
Author: Sathya Sai Baba

Quote: Every other artist begins with a blank canvas, a piece of paper the photographer begins with the finished product.
Author: Edward Steichen

Quote: I wash my hands of those who imagine chattering to be knowledge, silence to be ignorance, and affection to be art.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: Magic's an art where you use slight of hand or illusion to create wonder. And I was just intrigued with that idea.
Author: David Blaine

Quote: I love the solitude of reading. I love the deep dive into someone else's story, the delicious ache of a last page.
Author: Naomi Shihab Nye

Quote: Without words, without writing and without books there would be no history, there could be no concept of humanity.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: and realized that death was not only a permanent probability, as he had always believed, but an immediate reality.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: Can you do it? When the time comes? When the time comes there will be no time. Now is the time. Curse God and die.
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Quote: Neither of the two people in the room paid any attention to the way I came in, although only one of them was dead.
Author: Raymond Chandler

Quote: Oh Lestat, you deserved everything that's ever happened to you. You better not die. You might actually go to hell.
Author: Anne Rice

Quote: They say that just before you die your whole life flashes before your eyes, but that's not how it happened for me.
Author: Lauren Oliver

Quote: What is a man's life but a prelude to his death? And what is death but a long sleep, a most welcome forgetfulness.
Author: Lisa M. Klein

Quote: Books have to be read (worse luck, for it takes a long time); it is the only way of discovering what they contain.
Author: E.M. Forster

Quote: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained
Author: Walt Disney Company

Quote: Meditation, education and beauty are the three transforming powers that can change individual and the whole world.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: We as economic society are going to have to pay our whole population to go to school and pay it to stay at school.
Author: R. Buckminster Fuller

Quote: Pais que não conhecem a si mesmo não são capazes de evitar a reprodução, em seus filhos, de suas disfunções
Author: Carlos Messa

Quote: [A] great deal of what we believe we do not know firsthand; instead we have faith in the knowledge of specialists.
Author: Terry Eagleton

Quote: Faith is always supposed to make it harder, not easier, to ignore the plight of our sisters and brothers. (p. 165)
Author: Robin R. Meyers

Quote: What looks like politics, and imagines itself to be political, will one day unmask itself as a religious movement.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with the part of another; people are friends in spots.
Author: George Santayana

Quote: I always felt that the great high privilege, relief and comfort of friendship was that one had to explain nothing.
Author: Katherine Mansfield

Quote: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship, we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quote: Love and esteem are the first principles of friendship; it is always imperfect if either of these two are wanting.
Author: Eustace Budgell

Quote: Many a friendship, long, loyal, and self-sacrificing, rested at first on no thicker a foundation than a kind word.
Author: Frederick William Faber

Quote: How dare you open a spaceman's helmet on an uncharted planet? My eyeballs could've been sucked from their sockets!
Author: Cathy East Dubowski

Quote: On Friday night, I was reading my new book, but my brain got tired, so I decided to watch some television instead.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: Remind me,"he paused, drawing in a stuttered gasp, "to never piss you off again. Christ, are you secretly a ninja?
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

Quote: She's cute, I thought, but you don't need to like a girl who treats you like you're ten: You've already got a mom.
Author: John Green

Quote: If you think God's there, He is. If you don't, He isn't. And if that's what God's like, I wouldn't worry about it.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: Oh my God ... YOU are real.Oh my God ... You ARE real.OH MY GOD ... You are REAL!Oh my God ... You're really real!
Author: Pattie Mallette

Quote: We may be surprised at the people we find in heaven. God has a soft spot for sinners. His standards are quite low.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: Each morning when I open my eyes I say to myself: I, not events, have the power to make me happy or unhappy today.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: It is my observations, though, that happiness limits the amount of suffering one is willing to inflict upon others
Author: Jacqueline Carey

Quote: That's the difference between me and the rest of the world! Happiness isn't good enough for me! I demand euphoria!
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: The secret of happiness is to see all the marvels of the world, and never to forget the drops of oil on the spoon.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: To like many people spontaneously and without effort is perhaps the greatest of all sources of personal happiness.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: Above all shadows rides the Sunand Stars for ever dwell:I will not say the Day is done,nor bid the Stars farewell.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: Donde termina el arco iris,en tu alma o en el horizonte?Where does the rainbow end,in your soul or on the horizon?
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: If you keep thinking about what you want to do or what you hope will happen, you don't do it, and it won't happen.
Author: Desiderius Erasmus

Quote: I'm here to spread a message of hope. Follow your heart. Don't follow what you've been told you're supposed to do.
Author: J. Cole

Quote: In the end, that's what this election is about. Do we participate in a politics of cynicism or a politics of hope?
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: Lord save us all from old age and broken health and a hope tree that has lost the faculty of putting out blossoms.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Even on the most solemn occasions I got away without wearing socks and hid that lack of civilization in high boots
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Faith, n. Belief without evidence in what is told by one who speaks without knowledge, of things without parallel.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: Hercules,huh? Percy frowned. "That guy was like the Starbucks of Ancient Greece. Everywhere you turn--there he is.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: How ghastly for her, people actually thinking, with their brains, and right next door. Oh, the travesty of it all.
Author: Gail Carriger

Quote: Humor must not professedly teach and it must not professedly preach, but it must do both if it would live forever.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I bet you anything that 10 times out of 10, Nicky, Vinny and Tony will beat the shit out of Todd, Kyle and Tucker.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I just like playing interesting, complex, complicated characters. I like films that also have an element of humor.
Author: Steve Buscemi

Quote: I remember the time I was kidnapped and they sent a piece of my finger to my father. He said he wanted more proof.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: In a series of events, all of which had been a bit thick, this, in his opinion, achieved the maximum of thickness.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: It's always amazed me how little attention philosophers, psychologists, or anyone else actually has paid to humor.
Author: Edward de Bono

Quote: She'd met Colin on a Monday.She'd kissed him on a Friday.Twelve years later.She sighed. It seemed fairly pathetic.
Author: Julia Quinn

Quote: Sometimes the only way to make palatable that which is appalling and apprehensive is to season it with some humor.
Author: Terrence Howard

Quote: There is one other reason for dressing well, namely that dogs respect it, and will not attack you in good clothes.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: We'll meet at the theater tonight. I'll hold your seat 'til you get there. Once you get there; you're on your own.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: What is Man? Man is a noisome bacillus whom Our Heavenly Father created because he was disappointed in the monkey.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Although my memory's fading, I remember two things very clearly: I am a great sinner and Christ is a great Savior.
Author: John Newton

Quote: At first, they'll only dislike what you say, but the more correct you start sounding the more they'll dislike you.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.
Author: Thomas à Kempis

Quote: Freedom is not having everything we crave, it's being able to go without the things we crave and being OK with it.
Author: Rob Bell

Quote: God is not willing to do everything, and thus take away our free will and that share of glory which belongs to us.
Author: Niccolò Machiavelli

Quote: I did an A Level in Theatre Studies and had a really inspirational teacher, and then I just went on to university.
Author: Jessica Raine

Quote: I didn't come here of my own accord, and I can't leave that way.Whoever brought me here will have to take me home.
Author: Rumi

Quote: I want to continue being crazy; living my life the way I dream it, and not the way the other people want it to be.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: IF YOU CHOKE YOUR POTENTIAL BEFORE IT HAS AN OPPORTUNITY TO BECOME A POSSIBILITY YOU WILL NEVER REACH YOUR DESTINY
Author: Mo Stegall

Quote: I'm not saying I'm gonna change the world, but I guarantee that I will spark the brain that will change the world.
Author: Tupac Shakur

Quote: it is (often) the quiet gesture which carries the most significance - the one which suddenly directs the symphony.
Author: Mary Anne Radmacher

Quote: It is better to be respected than it is to be popular. Popularity ends on yearbook day, but respect lasts forever.
Author: John Bytheway

Quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: No sooner have you feasted on beauty with your eyes than your mind tells you that beauty is vain and beauty passes
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Some ghosts or felt presences may simply be the essence of another living person projected outward while sleeping.
Author: Doug Dillon

Quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: There is really nothing more to say-except why. But since why is difficult to handle, one must take refuge in how.
Author: Toni Morrison

Quote: Think of what starlight And lamplight would lack Diamonds and fireflies If they couldn't lean against Black. . . .
Author: Mary O'Neill

Quote: Transcendent, magical romance happens when you're one hundred percent present for each other as #supersoul lovers.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: We must experience certain things in life, even in our childhood, so we can later look back and value the journey.
Author: Tanya R. Liverman

Quote: When I pictured myself, it was always like just an outline in a colouring book, with the inside not yet completed.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: And I'll tell her that I don't want my life to be samples and scraps. A taste of everything but a meal of nothing.
Author: Ally Condie

Quote: Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: Every minute you spend in planning saves 10 minutes in execution; this gives you a 1,000 percent Return on Energy!
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Exactly!"said Deep Thought. "So once you do know what the question actually is, you'll know what the answer means.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: Hope is such a beautiful word, but it often seems very fragile. Life is still being needlessly hurt and destroyed.
Author: Michael Jackson

Quote: I have discovered in life that there are ways of getting almost anywhere you want to go, if you really want to go.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph:THE ONLY PROOF HE NEEDEDFOR THE EXISTENCE OF GODWAS MUSIC
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: In life, there is always that special person who shapes who you are, who helps to determine the person you become.
Author: Molly Ringwald

Quote: Isn't it strange that I know you'd risk your life to save mine, but I don't even know what your favorite color is?
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: It's much easier to not know things sometimes. Things change and friends leave. And life doesn't stop for anybody.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: Life is a train that stops at no stations; you either jump abroad or stand on the platform and watch as it passes.
Author: Yasmina Khadra

Quote: Life is like a landscape. You live in the midst of it but can describe it only from the vantage point of distance.
Author: Charles Lindbergh

Quote: Life is like a novel. It's filled with suspense. You have no idea what is going to happen until you turn the page.
Author: Sidney Sheldon

Quote: Many people pray to be kept out of unexpected problems. Some people pray to be able to confront and overcome them.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: Money cannot buy peace of mind. It cannot heal ruptured relationships, or build meaning into a life that has none.
Author: Richard M. DeVos

Quote: Never stop just because you feel defeated. The journey to the other side is attainable only after great suffering.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: Our battered suitcases were piled on the sidewalk again; we had longer ways to go. But no matter, the road is life
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: Paradoxically though it may seem, it is none the less true that life imitates art far more than art imitates life.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Remember that life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away!
Author: Vicki Corona

Quote: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: The bat is not a toy, it's a weapon. It gives me everything in life, which helps me to do everything on the field.
Author: Virat Kohli

Quote: The things you do for yourself are gone when you are gone, but the things you do for others remain as your legacy.
Author: Kalu Ndukwe Kalu

Quote: there isn't enough of anythingas long as we live. But at intervalsa sweetness appears and, given a chanceprevails.
Author: Raymond Carver

Quote: Things don't always work out the way we hope. You just have to pick yourself up and find a new direction to go in.
Author: Joelle Charbonneau

Quote: We have nothing to lose, nothing to gain, nothing we desired anymore- except to make our lives into a work of art.
Author: Lana Del Rey

Quote: You must not ever stop being whimsical. And you must not, ever, give anyone else the responsibility for your life.
Author: Mary Oliver

Quote: ... i didn't fall in love of courseit's never up to youbut she was walking back and forthand i was passing through
Author: Leonard Cohen

Quote: And I'm dying to know, is it killing you like it's killing me? And the story of us looks a lot like a tragedy now.
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: As far as love is concerned, possession, power, fusion and disenchantment are the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse.
Author: Zygmunt Bauman

Quote: I began to realize that when people experience the love of God, it casts out their fear and frees them from guilt.
Author: Joseph Prince

Quote: If you didn't remember something happening, was it because it never had happened? Or because you wished it hadn't?
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. And if they don't, they never were.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: Love cannot be reduced to a catalogue of reasons why, and a catalogue of reasons cannot be put together into love.
Author: Eleanor Catton

Quote: Love is always open arms. If you close your arms about love you will find that you are left holding only yourself.
Author: Leo Buscaglia

Quote: Sometimes it takes a heartbreak to shake us awake & help us see we are worth so much more than we're settling for.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: The only thing more unthinkable than leaving was staying; the only thing more impossible than staying was leaving.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: The story of life is quicker than the wink of an eye, the story of love is hello and goodbye...until we meet again
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: The truth was, he now belonged only to my past, and it was time I begin to accept it, as much as it hurt to do so.
Author: Tammara Webber

Quote: There is no time for cut-and-dried monotony. There is time for work. And time for love. That leaves no other time.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quote: Whatever you want to do, if you want to be great at it, you have to love it and be able to make sacrifices for it.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Not thinking about anything is Zen. Once you know this, walking, sitting, or lying down, everything you do is Zen.
Author: Bodhidharma

Quote: Every day is a new day. It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: I am a man"he told her, "and men do not consume pink beverages. Get thee gone woman, and bring me something brown.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: I think I'm greedy, but I'm not greedy for money - I think that can be a burden - I'm greedy for an exciting life.
Author: David Hockney

Quote: If the moon smiled, she would resemble you.You leave the same impression Of something beautiful, but annihilating.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: All men have their frailties; and whoever looks for a friend without imperfections, will never find what he seeks.
Author: Cyrus the Great

Quote: Apakah seorang pencari keheningan adalah si mulia? ataukah si pengecut yang tidak berani menghadapi masalah dunia?
Author: Cok Sawitri

Quote: As soon as a religion comes to dominate it has as its opponents all those who would have been its first disciples.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I desire to live in peace and to continue the life I have begun under the motto 'to live well you must live unseen
Author: René Descartes

Quote: I do not know what the heart of a rascal may be, but I know what is in the heart of an honest man; it is horrible.
Author: Joseph de Maistre

Quote: I have made a ceaseless effort not to ridicule, not to bewail, not to scorn human actions, but to understand them.
Author: Baruch Spinoza

Quote: It is remarkable how long men will believe in the bottomlessness of a pond without taking the trouble to sound it.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
Author: Richard Dawkins

Quote: We are seeds as well as parasites to the earth. We can either give or take, depending on our perception of growth.
Author: Zephyr McIntyre

Quote: wherever you find the greatest good, you will find the greatest evil, because evil loves paradise as much as good.
Author: Wallace Stegner

Quote: Nu mai trăim un prezent placid, ci suntem prinși cu toții în efortul de a ne pregăti permanent pentru viitor.
Author: Jean-Claude Carrière

Quote: To me, fair friend, you never can be old,For as you were when first your eye I ey'd, Such seems your beauty still.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Real success is not rooted in positions, places or possessions, but in fulfilment of God's purposes for our lives.
Author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha

Quote: But it is impossible to go through life without trust; that is to be imprisoned in the worst cell of all, oneself.
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: Civilization will not attain to its perfection until the last stone from the last church falls on the last priest.
Author: Émile Zola

Quote: The Church of England is the only church in the world that interferes neither with your politics nor your religion
Author: Anthony Trollope

Quote: The minute you get a religion you stop thinking. Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: They are not mad. They're trained to believe, not to know. Belief can be manipulated. Only knowledge is dangerous.
Author: Frank Herbert

Quote: ..he wanted her.And at another time, as another man, he would have her. Without hesitation. As lover. . . as more.
Author: Sarah MacLean

Quote: And only now, when he was gray-haired, had he fallen in love properly, thoroughly, for the first time in his life.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: It feels incredible to be outside when I'm supposed to be inside. The sensation of freedom is intoxicating. - Sara
Author: Susane Colasanti

Quote: Oh, aye, Sassenach. I am your master . . . and you're mine. Seems I canna possess your soul without losing my own.
Author: Diana Gabaldon

Quote: When you give yourself to me, completely, I will bite you. Until then, my love, I will only nibble on you.”~Cole
Author: Tina Carreiro

Quote: Our civil rights have no dependence on our religious opinions any more than our opinions in physics or geometry...
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: When you cultivate a godly thought life your soul will shine and you will exhibit the presence of the Lord in you.
Author: Elizabeth George

Quote: A dream is a seed.Vision plants it.Imagination nurtures growth.Opportunities create blooms.Thoughts become things!
Author: Donna McGoff

Quote: Success means we go to sleep at night knowing that our talents and ablities were used in a way that served others.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.
Author: Conrad Hilton

Quote: The level of our success is limited only by our imagination and no act of kindness, however small, is ever wasted.
Author: Aesop

Quote: They talk about the failure of socialism but where is the success of capitalism in Africa, Asia and Latin America?
Author: Fidel Castro

Quote: Because I keep it real and reality is a ruthless bitch. Plus I wanna make money – you cool with that?” - Gable
Author: J.M. August

Quote: But as long as something is never even started, you never have to worry about it ending. It has endless potential.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: I believe in God but people are liars. It's those people who say they are appointed by God who I don't believe in.
Author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

Quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: If I am right, Thy grace impartStill in the right to stay;If I am wrong, O, teach my heartTo find that better way!
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: The simple step of a courageous individual is not to take part in the lie. "One word of truth outweighs the world.
Author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

Quote: We are all wonderful, beautiful wrecks. That's what connects us--that we're all broken, all beautifully imperfect.
Author: Emilio Estevez

Quote: Becoming vegan is the most important and direct change we can immediately make to save the planet and its species.
Author: Chris Hedges

Quote: Especially when it comes to animals used for food, humanity's reasoning power and concern about fairness plummets.
Author: Karen Davis

Quote: Going vegetarian - and then vegan - has calmed me down, and it has also made me physically and emotionally strong.
Author: Kangana Ranaut

Quote: If the whole world went vegan, there would be less war. How you eat determines your mood and your outlook on life.
Author: Alexandra Paul

Quote: No human influenced me to become vegan. The screaming, terrified, enslaved animals were the only influence needed.
Author: Gary Yourofsky

Quote: The Gods created certain kinds of beings to replenish our bodies; they are the trees and the plants and the seeds.
Author: Plato

Quote: The world is a dangerous place, not because of those who do evil, but because of those who look on and do nothing.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: What we must do is start viewing every cow, pig, chicken, monkey, rabbit, mouse, and pigeon as our family members.
Author: Gary Yourofsky

Quote: Failure is instructive. The person who really thinks learns quite as much from his failures as from his successes.
Author: John Dewey

Quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Tell the truth. Sing with passion. Work with laughter. Love with heart. 'Cause that's all that matters in the end.
Author: Kris Kristofferson

Quote: All I'm writing is just what I feel, that's all. I just keep it almost naked. And probably the words are so bland.
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: I don't wait for moods. You accomplish nothing if you do that. Your mind must know it has got to get down to work.
Author: Pearl S. Buck

Quote: I have always held the old-fashioned opinion that the primary object of work of fiction should be to tell a story.
Author: Wilkie Collins

Quote: The beautiful part of writing is that you don't have to get it right the first time, unlike, say, a brain surgeon.
Author: Robert Cormier

Quote: True alchemy lies in this formula: "Your memory and your senses are but the nourishment of your creative impulse'.
Author: Arthur Rimbaud

Quote: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
Author: George Washington

Quote: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
Author: Laozi

Quote: Spend eighty percent of your time focusing on the opportunities of tomorrow rather than the problems of yesterday.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: When you are able to employ your will always for constructive purposes, you become the controller of your destiny.
Author: Paramahansa Yogananda

Quote: A race is a work of art that people can look at and be affected in as many ways they're capable of understanding.
Author: Steve Prefontaine

Quote: To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.
Author: Morihei Ueshiba

Quote: An unread book does nobody any good. Stories happen in the mind of a reader, not among symbols printed on a page.
Author: Brandon Mull

Quote: Don't mark up the Library's copy, you fool! Librarians are Unprankable. They'll track you down! They have skills!
Author: Charles Ogden

Quote: Fiction is like a spider's web, attached ever so lightly perhaps, but still attached to life at all four corners.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Give me books, French wine, fruit, fine weather and a little music played out of doors by somebody I do not know.
Author: John Keats

Quote: One must always be careful of books,"said Tessa, "and what is inside them, for words have the power to change us.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Science fiction films are not about science. They are about disaster, which is one of the oldest subjects of art.
Author: Susan Sontag

Quote: Are we so made that we have to take death in small doses daily or we could not go on with the business of living?
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Let me tell you something about dying: it's not as bad as they says.it's the coming-back-to-life part that hurts.
Author: Lauren Oliver

Quote: O weep for Adonis - He is dead.""Peace. He is not dead he doth not sleep - he hath wakened from the dream of life
Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

Quote: Oh Julie, wouldn't I know if you were dead? Wouldn't I feel it happening, like a jolt of electricity to my heart?
Author: Elizabeth Wein

Quote: We rehearse for the big death through the little death of orgasm, through erotic living. Death as transfiguration
Author: Peter Redgrove

Quote: A PHD is not the end of education. Education exists even among the bees who feed their queen only with the purest
Author: Sahndra Fon Dufe

Quote: But little Carlos's most important defense was not his good punch but rather the beginnings of a great education.
Author: Gina Capaldi

Quote: It is a thousand times better to have common sense without education than to have education without common sense.
Author: Robert G. Ingersoll

Quote: Privatizing our public schools makes as much sense as privatizing the fire department or or the police department
Author: Diane Ravitch

Quote: Always listen to the voice of your conscience. If your conscience conflicts with your faith, question everything.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: Faith, Princess,"the Prism Cat repeated. "It is a highly underrated weapon against the dark things in this world.
Author: Terry Brooks

Quote: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
Author: George Washington

Quote: Blunders, no, only friendship binds us to honesty - attracting crypts of mushrooms in the wake of our snowboards.
Author: Bradley Chicho

Quote: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!
Author: Marie de France

Quote: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts.
Author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

Quote: We were given the Scriptures to humble us into realizing that God is right, and the rest of us are just guessing.
Author: Rich Mullins

Quote: We're more concerned about our own "victory"over sin than we are about the fact that our sins grieve God's heart.
Author: Jerry Bridges

Quote: ...so i will greet youin a wayall loved thingsare meant to be greetedwith a tear in my heartand a poem in my eye.
Author: Sanober Khan

Quote: Do not think that one has to be sad in order to be militant, even though the thing one is fighting is abominable.
Author: Michel Foucault

Quote: In the whole history of the world there is but one thing that money cannot buy...to wit--the wag of a dog's tail.
Author: Josh Billings

Quote: one of the best and the most painful things about time traveling has been the opportunity to see my mother alive.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger

Quote: Science of happiness lies in our understanding. The secrets of happiness lie in our capacity to expand our heart.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: We try to fix the outside so much, but our control of the outer world is limited, temporary, and often, illusory.
Author: Matthieu Ricard

Quote: Any fool can hope when success lies plainly in view. It wants genuine strength to hope when matters are hopeless.
Author: Michael Flynn

Quote: Hope is trust in God's promises, faith that if we act now, the desired blessings will be fulfilled in the future.
Author: James E. Faust

Quote: I've learned that no matter how inspired, fired up and motivated you might be, the dark clouds will always set in
Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

Quote: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
Author: Will Durant

Quote: And, you know, I liked writing humor. Well, I should say, I wanted to write seriously, but it kept turning funny.
Author: Roseanne Barr

Quote: I believe entertainment can aspire to be art, and can become art, but if you set out to make art you're an idiot.
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: I love new clothes. If everyone could just wear new clothes everyday, I reckon depression wouldn't exist anymore.
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: If it's a penny for your thoughts and you put in your two cents worth, then someone, somewhere is making a penny.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: If you didn't grow up like I did then you don't know, and if you don't know it's probably better you don't judge.
Author: Junot Díaz

Quote: If you try and take a cat apart to see how it works, the first thing you have on your hands is a non-working cat.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: Jesus!"Luke exclaimed."Actually, it's just me,"said Simon. "Although I've been told the resemblance is startling.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: Me and Katy look adorkable in extraterrestrialhighway shirts. You would just look stupid. You can thank me later.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

Quote: Pray, v. To ask that the laws of the universe be annulled in behalf of a single petitioner, confessedly unworthy.
Author: Ambrose Bierce
