Quote: So my humor, I'd say, comes from a mixture of lowbrow comedy shows and highbrow theater. It's an interesting mix.
Author: Jasper Fforde

Quote: The first glass is for myself, the second for my friends, the third for good humor, and the forth for my enemies.
Author: William Temple

Quote: They say sarcasm is the lowest form of wit,"Valkyrie said. China glanced at her. "They've obviously never met me.
Author: Derek Landy

Quote: This is a mournful discovery.1)Those who agree with you are insane2)Those who do not agree with you are in power.
Author: Philip K. Dick

Quote: You could start a fire with the heat between you two.""You're mistaking bitter animosity for heartfelt affection.
Author: Michelle Hodkin

Quote: You used nunchucks on a moose?"Wolfe got a haunted look in his eyes. "I used all sorts of things on that bastard.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: ... just because [butterflies'] lives were short didn't mean they were tragic... See, they have a beautiful life.
Author: Lisa Genova

Quote: After all, if you do not resist the apparently inevitable, you will never know how inevitable the inevitable was.
Author: Terry Eagleton

Quote: And to all this she must yet add something more substantial, in the improvement of her mind by extensive reading.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Are you on our side...and want to be different, or are you on that side and want to throw a football at my head!?
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: Best friends are treasures. Hug them for their caring. Applaud their accomplishments. Laugh with them gratefully.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: But the past cannot be changed, and we carry our choices with us, forward, into the unknown. We can only move on.
Author: Libba Bray

Quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside while still alive. Never surrender.
Author: Tupac Shakur

Quote: Do an evening review at the end of the day to reflect on what went well, and what you'd do differently next time.
Author: Marilyn Suttle

Quote: First and foremost: a human being. If your definition of yourself is something else; maybe you should reconsider.
Author: Berivan Selim

Quote: Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: I am not worried, Harry,"said Dumbledore, his voice a little stronger despite the freezing water. "I am with you.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: I want to thank you, Lord, for life and all that's in it. Thank you for the day and for the hour, and the minute.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending."i love it so much
Author: Maria Robinson

Quote: Now you people have names. That's because you don't know who you are. We know who we are, so we don't need names.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Nurturing a feeling makes it proliferate. Choose wisely. Joy, kindness, love, & caring will illuminate your life.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Someone is always going to try to knock you down and take your place. It is up to you to fight for what you want.
Author: Teresa Mummert

Quote: Stop worrying about someone taking your spot. God already have it reserved. Do the work to get there and fill it!
Author: Yvonne Pierre

Quote: Successful people don't have fewer problems. They have determined that nothing will stop them from going forward.
Author: Ben Carson

Quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
Author: George Washington Burnap

Quote: True love begins when you accept yourself in your totality. Then, and only then, can you completely love another.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: When you've found another soul who see's in to your own...take good care of each other..and remember to be kind..
Author: Jackson Browne

Quote: You soak up my soul and mingle me. Each drop of my blood cries out to the earth. We are partners, blended as one.
Author: Rumi

Quote: An expert is someone who knows some of the worst mistakes that can be made in his subject, and how to avoid them.
Author: Werner Heisenberg

Quote: If it's knowledge and wisdom you want, then seek out the company of those who do real work for an honest purpose.
Author: Edward Abbey

Quote: New knowledge is the most valuable commodity on earth. The more truth we have to work with, the richer we become.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.I wish you all very good lives.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Because horror on Earth is real and it is every day. It is like a flower or like the sun; it cannot be contained.
Author: Alice Sebold

Quote: Dance above the surface of the world. Let your thoughts lift you into creativity that is not hampered by opinion.
Author: Red Haircrow

Quote: Everyone is handed adversity in life. No one's journey is easy. It's how they handle it that makes people unique.
Author: Kevin Conroy

Quote: I don't want to do anything. I don't even want to start this day because then I'll just be expected to finish it.
Author: Rainbow Rowell

Quote: I had a dream about you last night.. You were playing with chicken livers and told me everyone was in quarantine.
Author: Amy Summers

Quote: I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: I think what is interesting in life is all the cracks and all the flaws and all the moments that are not perfect.
Author: Clemence Poesy

Quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems -- not people; to focus your energies on answers -- not excuses.
Author: William Arthur Ward

Quote: Last Wednesday, I stupidly dropped my iPhone in the bath, and my life has sort of spiraled almost out of control.
Author: Patrick Stewart

Quote: No matter how long you train someone to be brave, you never know if they are or not until something real happens.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: Oh, man, if in real life I was as cool and suave as Coach Taylor and had all the answers, things would be easier.
Author: Kyle Chandler

Quote: That's the thing about life. A lot of the time, it isn't easy at all. We just have to try to make the best of it.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: The care of human life and happiness, and not their destruction, is the first and only object of good government.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: We'd met at a carefree time, a moment full of promise, in its place now were the harsh lessons of the real world.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: You have to take risks. We will only understand the miracle of life fully when we allow the unexpected to happen.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Voici mon secret. Il est très simple: on ne voit bien qu'avec le cœur. L'essentiel est invisible pour les yeux.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: Any kind of novelty or excitement drives up dopamine in the brain, and dopamine is associated with romantic love.
Author: Helen Fisher

Quote: I want to try making things right because picking up the pieces is way better than leaving them the way they are.
Author: Simone Elkeles

Quote: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Love and magic have a great deal in common. They enrich the soul, delight the heart. And they both take practice.
Author: Nora Roberts

Quote: Love, it never dies. It never goes away, it never fades, so long as you hang on to it. Love can make you immortal
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: My thoughts on gay marriage are that everyone has the right to love and be loved, and that's the position I take.
Author: Nick Jonas

Quote: No matter how much you think you love somebody, you'll step back when the pool of their blood edges up too close.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: The only sea I saw Was the seesaw sea With you riding on it. Lie down, lie easy. Let me shipwreck in your thighs.
Author: Dylan Thomas

Quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: Until this moment, I had not realized that someone could break your heart twice, along the very same fault lines.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: Why is it that words like these seem dull and cold? Is it because there is no word tender enough to be your name?
Author: James Joyce

Quote: Live to learn to love. Learn to love to live. Love to live to learn so that you may live the life that you yearn.
Author: Rico Dasheem

Quote: There is nothing so disobedient as an undisciplined mind, and there is nothing so obedient as a disciplined mind.
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: ‎"The less random stuff you hear about, the more room in your ears for music, that's what I always say"-Paisley
Author: Lynn Weingarten

Quote: Don't wait for a light to appear at the end of the tunnel, stride down there and light the bloody thing yourself.
Author: Sara Henderson

Quote: From now on, I don't care if my tea leaves spell 'Die, Ron, Die,' I'm chucking them in the bin where they belong.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes...you're Doing Something.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how.
Author: Ann Patchett

Quote: The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: These violent delights have violent endsAnd in their triump die, like fire and powderWhich, as they kiss, consume
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Life is like yoga; the only way you can enjoy it is by relaxing into any position you happen to find yourself in.
Author: Jon Wakeham

Quote: Of course there is no formula for success, except perhaps an unconditional acceptance of life, and what it brings
Author: Arthur Rubinstein

Quote: The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.
Author: Baruch Spinoza

Quote: You are a wonderful creation. You know more than you think you know, just as you know less than you want to know.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I must create a system, or be enslaved by another man's. I will not reason and compare: my business is to create.
Author: William Blake

Quote: My mouth is a fire escape.The words coming outdon't care that they are naked.There is something burning in there.
Author: Andrea Gibson

Quote: To write poetry and to commit suicide, apparently so contradictory, had really been the same, attempts at escape.
Author: John Fowles

Quote: Escóndeme en tus brazospor esta noche sola,mientras la lluvia rompecontra el mar y la tierrasu boca innumerable.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: Your beliefs have the power to unlock your inner genius or keep you from fully achieving your greatest potential.
Author: Deborah Day

Quote: Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob?"she asked cutting me off. "His name is 'Shut the hell up'.
Author: Stephenie Meyer

Quote: During moments of strife and 'dis-ease', check your flow and redirect your focus to that which is naturally good.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: No matter how dim the light filtering through the trees is, you can still try your best to grasp it. -Kaien Cross
Author: Matsuri Hino

Quote: It is with the soul that we grasp the essence of another human being, not with the mind, nor even with the heart.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: Still, she knows one thing for certain: never judge a relationship unless you are the one wrapped up in its arms.
Author: Alice Hoffman

Quote: When we face pain in relationships our first response is often to sever bonds rather than to maintain commitment.
Author: bell hooks

Quote: Almost any sect, cult, or religion will legislate its creed into law if it acquires the political power to do so.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Quote: Don't follow a defeated foe. Follow Christ. It is costly. You will be an exile in this age. But you will be free.
Author: John Piper

Quote: There is nothing inhuman, evil, or irrational which does not give some comfort, provided it is shared by a group.
Author: Erich Fromm

Quote: I didn't know what to call it, what was happening between us, but I liked it. It felt silly and fragile and good.
Author: Ransom Riggs

Quote: I won't be affected by your charm nor I will trap you into marriage. I've been there once, never again.- Kristine
Author: Martha Cecilia

Quote: She'd felt it before, she felt it now: the pull to fall in with him, to fall into him, to lose her sense of self.
Author: Marie Rutkoski

Quote: You see yourself as very average, ordinary. And there is nothing ordinary about you, Rachel."(Something Borrowed)
Author: Emily Giffin

Quote: I was thinking of how sometimes, trying to say the right thing to people, it's like some kind of brain surgery...
Author: M.T Anderson

Quote: It's almost as if each instant is our last and first. We are always dying, and always reborn. And that is living.
Author: Jonathan Weiner

Quote: Science is a first-rate piece of furniture for a man's upper chamber, if he has common sense on the ground floor.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

Quote: There are no forbidden questions in science, no matters too sensitive or delicate to be probed, no sacred truths.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Caelum non animum mutant qui trans mare currunt.(They change their sky, not their soul, who rush across the sea.)
Author: Horace

Quote: The soul is placed in the body like a rough diamond, and must be polished, or the luster of it will never appear.
Author: Daniel Defoe

Quote: Thoughts are as simple as the process…a message from the soul; conveyed through the heart; received in the mind
Author: Jeremy Aldana

Quote: As an Odd-Fish, it is not my job to be right,' said Sir Oort. 'It is my job to be wrong in new and exciting ways.
Author: James Kennedy

Quote: Flaming enthusiasm, backed by horse sense and persistence, is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: Happy people are ignoramuses and glory is nothing else but success, and to achieve it one only has to be cunning.
Author: Mikhail Lermontov

Quote: I don't want to be married to someone who feels inferior to my success or because I make more money than he does.
Author: Grace Kelly

Quote: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
Author: John D. Rockefeller

Quote: One needs more than ambition and talent to make a success of anything, really. There must be love and a vocation.
Author: Jessye Norman

Quote: Real success is not on the stage, but off the stage as a human being, and how you get along with your fellow man.
Author: Sammy Davis

Quote: The tower of success stands on the pillars of vision, action, patience and the character to withstand criticisms.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: I was in my bed trying to figure out why sometimes you can wake up and go back to sleep and other times you can't
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: Occasionally he stumbled over the truth, but hastily picked himself up and hurried on as if nothing had happened.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: Animals' rights as individuals are sacred, and no benefit to myself or my taste buds can trump their right to be.
Author: Eddie Lama

Quote: We don't 'crave' animal-based meat, dairy, and eggs, but we do crave fat, salt, flavor, texture, and familiarity.
Author: Colleen Patrick-Goudreau

Quote: I like to write when I feel spiteful. It is like having a good sneeze."(Letter to Cynthia Asquith, November 1913)
Author: D.H. Lawrence

Quote: It's a bizarre but wonderful feeling, to arrive dead center of a target you didn't even know you were aiming for.
Author: Lois McMaster Bujold

Quote: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.
Author: Osho

Quote: Don't measure yourself by what you have accomplished, but by what you should have accomplished with your ability.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: The more you are focused on time - past and future - the more you miss the Now, the most precious thing there is.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Work joyfully and peacefully, knowing that right thoughts and right efforts inevitably bring about right results.
Author: James Allen

Quote: A strong work of art really leaves people speechless. They feel a little angry because they don't understand it.
Author: Michael Heizer

Quote: Art is man's constant effort to create for himself a different order of reality from that which is given to him.
Author: Chinua Achebe

Quote: 'Crazy' is a term of art; 'Insane' is a term of law. Remember that, and you will save yourself a lot of trouble.
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quote: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: All that mankind has done, thought, gained, or been; it is lying as in magic preservation in the pages of books.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: Books are all the dreams we would most like to have and like dreams they have the power to change consciousness.
Author: Victor Nell

Quote: Books are love letters (or apologies) passed between us, adding a layer of conversation beyond our spoken words.
Author: Donalyn Miller

Quote: Epics are never written about libraries. They exist on whim; it depends on if the conquering army likes to read.
Author: Patricia A. McKillip

Quote: I took the volume to a table, opened its soft, ivory pages... and fell into it as into a pool during dry season.
Author: Janet Fitch

Quote: It [the book] was spinning a magic spell around her heart, sticky as a spider's web and enchantingly beautiful..
Author: Cornelia Funke

Quote: Luckily, I always travel with a book, just in case I have to wait on line for Santa, or some such inconvenience.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: We lusty bibliophiles know that reading, unlike just about anything else, is both good for you and loads of fun.
Author: Kevin Smokler

Quote: Life is better than death, I believe, if only because it is less boring, and because it has fresh peaches in it.
Author: Alice Walker

Quote: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous possessive love that grabs at what it can.
Author: Yann Martel

Quote: We all didn't come into to the world at the same time so it makes sense that we don't leave it at the same time.
Author: Lurlene McDaniel

Quote: As you can see, there are quite a number of things taught in school that one has to unlearn or at least correct.
Author: Ambeth R. Ocampo

Quote: Formal education teaches how to stand, but to see the rainbow you must come out and walk many steps on your own.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: In sum, then, "thinking about thinking"has to be a principal ingredient of any empowering practice of education.
Author: Jerome S. Bruner

Quote: That is the one eternal education: to be sure enough that something is true that you dare to tell it to a child.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: The aim of totalitarian education has never been to instill convictions but to destroy the capacity to form any.
Author: Hannah Arendt

Quote: When you study great teachers... you will learn much more from their caring and hard work than from their style.
Author: William Glasser

Quote: Fidelity is a living, breathing entity. On wobbly footing, it can wander, becoming something different entirely.
Author: Kay Goodstadt

Quote: Honey, nobody ever knows someone completely. You have to just enjoy what you do know and have faith in the rest.
Author: Erin McCarthy

Quote: Make rules and follow rules as needed, but don't focus on riles. Focus on faith. Focus on grace. Focus on Jesus.
Author: Judah Smith

Quote: Whatever has befallen you was not meant to escape you, and whatever has escaped you was not meant to befall you.
Author: عائض القرني

Quote: Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another.
Author: Eustace Budgell

Quote: How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Stop using the word 'bromance.' Can we please kill that stupid term? We're just friends. It's called friendship!
Author: Blake Shelton

Quote: The friendship we share grows amidst the craggy rock pond; reeds of water spray fireflies scented with bonfires.
Author: Bradley Chicho

Quote: Hitler: Thank you, whoever you are. I think you just saved my life.The Doctor: Believe me... It was an accident.
Author: Steven Moffat

Quote: I admire Shakespeare enormously. But since I can't be him, I'm glad that his marriage was unhappy and he's dead.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: I've been to Canada, and I've always gotten the impression that I could take the country over in about two days.
Author: Jon Stewart

Quote: Don't sit back and wait for God to do it all. Ask for His advice, but be prepared to do the hard yards yourself.
Author: Morris Gleitzman

Quote: For he who loves God without faith reflects on himself, while the person who loves God in faith reflects on God.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: God, who foresaw your tribulation, has specially armed you to go through it, not without pain but without stain.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: If we had more sleepless nights in prayer, there would be fewer souls to have a sleepless eternal night in hell.
Author: Leonard Ravenhill

Quote: There is but one good; that is God. Everything else is good when it looks to Him and bad when it turns from Him.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it.
Author: Andy Rooney

Quote: Happiness consists in always aspiring perfection, the pause in any level in perfection is the pause of happiness
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Some people would rather live in a hell they've got used to than in a paradise they've never experienced before.
Author: Urania Sarri

Quote: A lot of presidential memoirs, they say, are dull and self-serving. I hope mine is interesting and self-serving.
Author: William J. Clinton

Quote: Death is the easy part, the hard part is living and knowing you could be so much more then you're willing to be.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.
Author: Eric Hoffer

Quote: Fifty percent of people won't vote, and fifty percent don't read newspapers. I hope it's the same fifty percent.
Author: Gore Vidal

Quote: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: I hope to stand firm enough to not go backward, and yet not go forward fast enough to wreck the country's cause.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: I love the song 'I Hope You Dance' by Lee Ann Womack. I was going to write that song, but someone beat me to it.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: My greatest desire is that the hope that has overcome fear in my country will help vanquish it around the world.
Author: Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva

Quote: Always watch where you are going. Otherwise, you may step on a piece of the Forest that was left out by mistake.
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, it's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind.
Author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

Quote: I have noticed that the people who are late are often so much jollier than the people who have to wait for them.
Author: Edward Verrall Lucas

Quote: I have seen what a laugh can do. It can transform almost unbearable tears into something bearable, even hopeful.
Author: Bob Hope

Quote: I stared at him (Dionysus). "You're...you're married? But I thought you got in trouble for chasing a wood nymph-
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: I thought it sounded a bit like Percy singing... maybe you've got to attack him while he's in the shower, Harry.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: If you reject the food, ignore the customs, fear the religion, and avoid the people, you might better stay home.
Author: James A. Michener

Quote: It s amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.
Author: Jerry Seinfeld

Quote: Just believe everything I tell you, and it will all be very, very simple.'Ah, well, I'm not sure I believe that.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: Sometimes Americans don't quite get my sense of humor. My good ol' British sarcasm seems to go over their heads.
Author: Lee Westwood

Quote: The best way to keep children at home is to make the home atmosphere pleasant, and let the air out of the tires.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: There's a difference between preferring books to parties and preferring sixteen cats to seeing the light of day.
Author: Lauren Morrill

Quote: When humor works, it works because it's clarifying what people already feel. It has to come from someplace real.
Author: Tina Fey

Quote: When your children are teenagers, it's important to have a dog so that someone in the house is happy to see you.
Author: Nora Ephron

Quote: [The decay of Logic results from an] untroubled assumption that the particular is real and the universal is not.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed at some indefinite time in the future.
Author: George S. Patton Jr.

Quote: A man, whilst he is dreaming, believes in his dream; he is undeceived only when he is awakened from his slumber.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Always be like a water. Float in the times of pain or dance like waves along the wind which touches its surface.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: At times, it can feel like the loneliest place on Earth, because it's just us. Alone with our unanswered prayers
Author: Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

Quote: Do not be afraid. Do not be satisfied with mediocrity. Put out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: For every dilemma, find at least three or four possible solutions. The creative process leads to better results.
Author: Marilyn Suttle

Quote: How satisfying it is to leave a mark on a blank surface. To make a map of my movement - no matter how temporary.
Author: Craig Thompson

Quote: I asked her if I was black or white. She replied "You are a human being. Educate yourself or you'll be a nobody!
Author: James McBride

Quote: I hate you."I love you."You're a freak, you know that? Everyone says so. They always have."I'm trying not to be.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: If there never was a night or day and memories could fade away, then we'd be nothing left but the dreams we made
Author: Selena Gómez

Quote: It had never occurred to me that our lives, which had been so closely interwoven, could unravel with such speed.
Author: Kazuo Ishiguro

Quote: It was the moment I realized what music can do to people, how it can make you hurt and feel so good all at once.
Author: Nina LaCour

Quote: Know from whence you came. If you know whence you came, there are absolutely no limitations to where you can go.
Author: James Baldwin

Quote: Life is not about waiting for the storms to pass... It's about learning how to dance in the rain.- Vivian Greene
Author: Vivian Greene

Quote: Myth is much more important and true than history. History is just journalism and you know how reliable that is.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: The place to improve the world is first in one's own heart and head and hands, and then work outward from there.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: There are many rivers that we cross in our lifetime, unfortunately some of those rivers just don't have bridges.
Author: John R. Gouin

Quote: There are times in life when we're called to forget who we thought we were in order to become who we really are.
Author: Elle Sommer

Quote: When you are used to the kind of life -of never getting anything you want- you stop knowing what it is you want.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: You've got to show the world who you are before it tells you. Otherwise you become victim to someone you're not.
Author: Chris Colfer

Quote: What is more precious: a thousand answers derived from one question? Or, one answer…from a thousand questions?
Author: G.F. Smith

Quote: An expert is one who knows more and more about less and less until he knows absolutely everything about nothing.
Author: Nicholas Murray Butler

Quote: But shortcuts are dangerous; we cannot delude ourselves that our knowledge is further along than it actually is.
Author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi

Quote: Ignorance breeds monsters to fill up the vacancies of the soul that are unoccupied by the verities of knowledge.
Author: Horace Mann

Quote: One thing a man must have: either a naturally light disposition or a disposition lightened by art and knowledge.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: So we couldn't mingle with them, but we could eavesdrop. We got our knowledge that way--we caught it like germs.
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: After you find out all the things that can go wrong, your life becomes less about living and more about waiting.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Choosing to be positive and having a grateful attitude is going to determine how you're going to live your life.
Author: Joel Osteen

Quote: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I think people should have fun. And don't get so down on yourself. Enjoy life and be the best person you can be.
Author: Keke Palmer

Quote: In school, you're taught a lesson and then given a test. In life, you're given a test that teaches you a lesson.
Author: Tom Bodett

Quote: Instead of focusing on how much you can accomplish, focus on how much you can absolutely love what you're doing.
Author: Leo Babauta

Quote: Life is a series of collisions with the future; it is not the sum of what we have been, but what we yearn to be.
Author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

Quote: My reasons to liveWere my reasons to dieBut at least they were mineNow I've freedom unboundCut the laces of life
Author: Emilie Autumn

Quote: People are going to say what they want to say and think what they want to think, and I can't change their minds.
Author: Hilary Duff

Quote: Sometimes it's better to stop trying to make sense of things. Life isn't clear cut, there are always gray areas.
Author: Alexandra Adornetto

Quote: There are no classes in life for beginners: right away you are always asked to deal with what is most difficult.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: When I was young I thought that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old I know that it is.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Would you rather live one perfect day over and over or live your life with no perfect days but just decent ones?
Author: Jenny Han

Quote: You couldnt erase everything that caused you pain with recollection.Every memory was valuable; even the bad ones
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: You will have five hundred million little bells, and I shall have five hundred million springs of fresh water...
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: You've never lived what you are thinking, and that isn't good. Only the ideas we actually live are of any value.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: And I can fight only for something that I love, love only what I respect, and respect only what I at least know.
Author: Adolf Hitler

Quote: Because love, love is never finished. It circles and circles, the memories out of order and not always complete.
Author: Sara Zarr

Quote: But you cant shut everyone out. I mean you have to have someone to love. . .someone to hold on to. . . someone--
Author: Hubert Selby Jr.

Quote: I crossed a thousand leagues to come to you, and lost the best part of me along the way. Don't tell me to leave.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: I really don't even know you, and yet, in my life, you are forever entangled; to my history, inextricably bound.
Author: Sarah Ockler

Quote: I see when men love women. They give them but a little of their lives. But women when they love give everything.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day.
Author: Emily Brontë

Quote: It was the nicest thing she could imagine. It made her want to have his babies and give him both of her kidneys.
Author: Rainbow Rowell

Quote: There comes a time in your life when you have to choose to turn the page, write another book or simply close it.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: This is the miracle that happens every time to those who really love: the more they give, the more they possess.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: Unrequited love is the only possible way to give yourself to another without being held in indentured servitude.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: What I am is how I came out. No one's perfect and you just have to accept your flaws and learn to love yourself.
Author: Kelly Brook

Quote: What light is to the eyes - what air is to the lungs - what love is to the heart, liberty is to the soul of man.
Author: Robert Green Ingersoll

Quote: When you love someone, its never over. You move on, because you have to but you take them with you in your heart
Author: Elizabeth Chandler

Quote: I'm not a warrior or a goddess,” I said at last.Adrian leaned closer. “As far as I'm concerned, you're both.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.
Author: Alan Moore

Quote: But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands.
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Quote: Do not read as children do to enjoy themselves, or, as the ambitious do to educate themselves. No, read to live.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Ever had a flying burrito hit you? Well, it's a deadly projectile, right up there with cannonballs and grenades.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Everybody is identical in their secret unspoken belief that way deep down they are different from everyone else.
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: I think you should be a child for as long as you can. I have been successful for 74 years being able to do that.
Author: Bob Newhart

Quote: It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.
Author: Lois Lowry

Quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: We had to save you because you're the mockingjay, Katniss,"says Plutarch. "While you live, the revolution lives.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: If there were a party of those who aren't sure they're right, I'd belong to it. ~(Camus, as quoted by Tony Judt)
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: It is suicide to be abroad. But what it is to be at home, ... what it is to be at home? A lingering dissolution.
Author: Samuel Beckett

Quote: One of the penalties of refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.
Author: Plato

Quote: striid andWthdraw into yourself. Our master-reason asks no more than to act justly, and thereby to achieve calm.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The command of our language is crucial to focusing our thoughts and communicating them with precision to others.
Author: Felix Alba-Juez

Quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: The philosopher whose dealings are with divine order himself acquires the characteristics of order and divinity.
Author: Plato

Quote: The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Thought is what we start from: the simple, intimate, immediate datum. Matter is the inferred thing, the mystery.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: To become a true global citizen, one must abandon all notions of 'otherness' and instead embrace 'togetherness'.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: Exhaust the little moment. Soon it dies.And be it gash or gold it will not comeAgain in this identical disguise.
Author: Gwendolyn Brooks

Quote: She lends her pen,to thoughts of him,that flow from it,in her solitary.For she is his poet,And he is her poetry.
Author: Lang Leav

Quote: Its a mathematical fact that two negatives make a positive so even under adverse circumstances think positively.
Author: Amit Abraham

Quote: Art has always been the raft onto which we climb to save our sanity. I don't see a different purpose for it now.
Author: Dorothea Tanning

Quote: A relationship needs constant attention. It's a living thing, not just a habit. You've got to keep on top of it.
Author: Matt Dunn

Quote: Be a bit of a challenge; not because you're playing games but because you realize you're worth the extra effort.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: At this time of year it's easy to forget the true meaning of Christianity - the lies, the corruption, the abuse.
Author: Banksy

Quote: To terrify children with the image of hell, to consider women an inferior creation—is that good for the world?
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: I can't imagine a romance novel published today where the hero rapes the heroine and she falls in love with him.
Author: Julia Quinn

Quote: If music be the food of love, play on,Give me excess of it; that surfeiting,The appetite may sicken, and so die.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Once, he hadn't been able to touch her without causing himself pain. Now, it only hurt when he didn't touch her.
Author: Nalini Singh

Quote: An experiment is a question which science poses to Nature and a measurement is the recording of Nature's answer.
Author: Max Planck

Quote: By far the greatest danger of Artificial Intelligence is that people conclude too early that they understand it.
Author: Eliezer Yudkowsky

Quote: Sure, at some level scientists know nanobots will destroy mankind. They just can't resist seeing how it happens.
Author: Cracked.com

Quote: The important thing in science is not so much to obtain new facts as to discover new ways of thinking about them
Author: William Lawrence Bragg

Quote: ...quantum mechanics—the physics of our world—requires that you hold such pedestrian complaints in abeyance.
Author: Brian Greene

Quote: Every book has a soul, the soul of the person who wrote it and the soul of those who read it and dream about it.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: If you want to discover the true character of a person, you have only to observe what they are passionate about.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: ...it is well known that a vital ingredient of success is not knowing that what you're attempting can't be done.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: An entrepreneur assumes the risk and is dedicated and committed to the success of whatever he or she undertakes.
Author: Victor Kiam

Quote: Finding good partners is the key to success in anything: in business, in marriage and, especially, in investing.
Author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quote: If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Never mind what others do; do better than yourself, beat your own record from day to day, and you are a success.
Author: William J. H. Boetcker

Quote: Obama's endorsement of gay marriage is hardly as consequential as Johnson's legislative success on civil rights.
Author: Robert Dallek

Quote: Remember how far you've come, and you won't have to rely on a destiny for your future. It will come on your own.
Author: Shannon A. Thompson

Quote: Success in this world depends on knowing exactly how little effort each job is worth...distribution of energy...
Author: Evelyn Waugh

Quote: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: Success isn't measured by money or power or social rank. Success is measured by your discipline and inner peace.
Author: Mike Ditka

Quote: Success needs vision to see, passion to transcend, patience to withstand and the character to overcome failures.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: We're born with success. It is only others who point out our failures, and what they attribute to us as failure.
Author: Whoopi Goldberg

Quote: What you perceive as a failure today may actually be a crucial step towards the success you seek. Never give up.
Author: Richelle E. Goodrich

Quote: You have reached the pinnacle of success as soon as you become uninterested in money, compliments, or publicity.
Author: Thomas Wolfe

Quote: I ate civilization. It poisoned me; I was defiled. And then,"he added in a lower tone, "I ate my own wickedness.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: In the calculus of feelings, you never really know how one person's absence will affect you more than another's.
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: With a secret like that, at some point the secret itself becomes irrelevant. The fact that you kept it does not.
Author: Sara Gruen

Quote: Medicine is not healthcare, food is healthcare. Medicine is sick care. Let's all get that straight for a change.
Author: Karen Pendergrass

Quote: People get offended by animal rights campaigns. It's ludicrous. It's not as bad as mass animal death in factory.
Author: Richard Gere

Quote: Remember at all time that just as your life is precious to you, so too is all life precious to those living one.
Author: Mango Wodzak

Quote: Killing and eating animals is a betrayal of our own core humanity…killing an innocent goes against our nature.
Author: Evanna Lynch

Quote: errare humanum est, sed perseverare diabolicum: 'to err is human, but to persist (in the mistake) is diabolical.
Author: Seneca

Quote: I listen with attention to the judgment of all men;but so far as I can remember,I have followed none but my own.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: The man of wisdom is never of two minds;the man of benevolence never worries;the man of courage is never afraid.
Author: Confucius

Quote: There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man.
Author: Patrick Rothfuss

Quote: Part of the appeal of the fantastic is taking ridiculous ideas very seriously and pretending they're not absurd.
Author: China Miéville

Quote: The ability to dream is all I have to give. That is my responsibility; that is my burden. And even I grow tired.
Author: Harlan Ellison

Quote: I enjoy life when things are happening. I don't care if it's good things or bad things. That means you're alive.
Author: Joan Rivers

Quote: It's better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: It's your life; you don't need someone's permission to live the life you want. Be brave to live from your heart.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Routine life is unbearable, and most people only think about how to escape into the world of fantasy and dreams.
Author: Robert Greene

Quote: Success seems to be connected to action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.
Author: Conrad Hilton

Quote: Art is an invention of aesthetics, which in turn is an invention of philosophers... What we call art is a game.
Author: Octavio Paz

Quote: I am not a great cook, I am not a great artist, but I love art, and I love food, so I am the perfect traveller.
Author: Michael Palin

Quote: I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other way - things I had no words for.
Author: Georgia O'Keeffe

Quote: No art is less spontaneous than mine. What I do is the result of reflection and the study of the great masters.
Author: Edgar Degas

Quote: Pop Art looks out into the world. It doesn't look like a painting of something, it looks like the thing itself.
Author: Roy Lichtenstein

Quote: The art of the cuisine, when fully mastered, is the one human capability of which only good things can be said.
Author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

Quote: There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: To me, photography is the simultaneous recognition, in a fraction of a second, of the significance of an event.
Author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

Quote: In my view, nineteen pounds of old books are at least nineteen times as delicious as one pound of fresh caviar.
Author: Anne Fadiman

Quote: Literature can remind us that not all life is already written down: there are still so many stories to be told.
Author: Colum McCann

Quote: Maybe the only good thing about death is that you never have to relive it. You never have to remember the pain.
Author: Pittacus Lore

Quote: My life was going to flash before my eyes, but it decided to hide behind my eyes and quake with terror instead.
Author: Sarah Rees Brennan

Quote: Take what comes and live life without complaint. What will be, will be. Life is a woman's gift; death is God's.
Author: Nancy McKenzie

Quote: Apply yourself. Get all the education you can, but then...do something. Don't just stand there, make it happen.
Author: Lee Iacocca

Quote: Most often people seek in life occasions for persisting in their opinions rather than for educating themselves.
Author: André Gide

Quote: Self-education is the only possible education; the rest is mere veneer laid on the surface of a child's nature.
Author: Charlotte M. Mason

Quote: Your education is important because with only a few words you can show an employer the depth of your potential.
Author: Matthew T. Cross

Quote: As far as God goes, I _am_ a nonbeliever. Still am. But when it comes to a devil---well, that's something else.
Author: William Peter Blatty

Quote: I dont think that we're meant to understand it all the time. I think that sometimes we just have to have faith.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: In the beginning there was faith - which is childish; trust - which is vain; and illusion - which is dangerous.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: What we call rational grounds for our beliefs are often extremely irrational attempts to justify our instincts.
Author: Thomas Henry Huxley

Quote: I definitely have guys that I'm friends with that I have a crush on, and you don't want to ruin the friendship.
Author: Miranda Cosgrove

Quote: Marriage, for a woman at least, hampers the two things that made life to me glorious - friendship and learning.
Author: Jane Harrison

Quote: Ash is going to kick your ass, Daemon."Daemon's grin went up a notch. "Nah, she likes my ass too much for that.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

Quote: You mean she doesn't intend to blow me up before the ceremony?” said Kai,taking the box.“How disappointing.
Author: Marissa Meyer

Quote: All God's giants have been weak men who did great things for God because they reackoned on God being with them.
Author: James Hudson Taylor

Quote: I stared up at the sky and raised my middle finger, just in case God was watching. I don't like being spied on.
Author: Annabel Pitcher

Quote: O how we call each other namesYou call me schizophrenicI call you GodBut we do agree on oneDeluded are we both.
Author: Sunil Vidyarthi

Quote: Flowers always make people better, happier, and more helpful; they are sunshine, food and medicine to the mind.
Author: Luther Burbank

Quote: Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: Architecture is basically a container of something. I hope they will enjoy not so much the teacup, but the tea.
Author: Yoshio Taniguchi

Quote: I had to learn to live without you and I couldn't make sense of it, because I left so much of me inside of you.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: There I was, waiting, afraid I'd never experience the kind of joy yet to come, but hoping for it just the same.
Author: Elizabeth Berg

Quote: I like a man who can be a real friend, has a good sense of humor, a good pair of shoes and a healthy gold card.
Author: Victoria Beckham

Quote: I realize that humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.
Author: Anne Wilson Schaef

Quote: I will describe my eyes and then begin the story. My eyes are blue and resplendent. Now I will begin the story.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: I'm calling it the Watney Triangle because after what I've been through, shit on Mars should be named after me.
Author: Andy Weir

Quote: In my opinion, I think sarcasm and humor in a song, without turning it into a novelty song, is really charming.
Author: Alanis Morissette

Quote: It's probably a bad indicator of your lifestyle when you miss your ex-boyfriend because he's absolutely lethal.
Author: Charlaine Harris

Quote: Jace suggested that the cast of "Gilligan's Island"could go do something anatomically unlikely with themselves.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: My humor is a lot like Kristen Wiig's from 'Saturday Night Live' or 'Bridesmaids.' Quirky, off the beaten path.
Author: Nicole Ari Parker

Quote: Putting a little time aside for clean fun and good humor is very necessary to relieve the tensions of our time.
Author: Hattie McDaniel

Quote: Religious humor is not really my area, so I probably wouldn't do anything about that, or politics or something.
Author: Chris Lilley

Quote: The house smelled musty and damp, and a little sweet, as if it were haunted by the ghosts of long-dead cookies.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: This is Leo. I'm the... What's my title? Am I like, admiral, or captain, or...""Repair boy.""Very funny, Piper.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Whatever else an American believes or disbelieves about himself, he is absolutely sure he has a sense of humor.
Author: E. B. White

Quote: With humor, it's so subjective that trying to think of what the ideal reader would think would drive you crazy.
Author: Calvin Trillin

Quote: Buddha had said:"Each of us is a God. Each of us knows all. We need only open our minds to hear our own wisdom.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: Do not lose hold of your dreams or aspirations. For if you do, you may still exist but you have ceased to live.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Each of us is full of shit in our own special way. We are all shitty little snowflakes dancing in the universe.
Author: Lewis Black

Quote: I have a dream that one day little black boys and girls will be holding hands with little white boys and girls.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: If the thought inspires you, and it feels good and right...it is yours, alone, to exercise. So get right on it!
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: If the town were a black hole, I was the helpless star being sucked into oblivion. It was an oblivion I craved.
Author: J.D. Stroube

Quote: In other words, our opinions and our thoughts and feelings, anything we experience, need not define us forever.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: Inspiration is external and motivation is internal. It is up to me to provide the switch and you to flip it on!
Author: Tricia Cunningham

Quote: There is no such thing as a child who hates to read; there are only children who have not found the right book.
Author: Frank Serafini

Quote: They may try to stop you by their words and deeds, but like air you will rise above it all. You are unstoppable
Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

Quote: This is just rap. I'm not trying to make people think I'm some sort of scientific wizard or inspirational poet.
Author: Action Bronson

Quote: To find what you seek in the road of life, the best proverb of all is that which says:"Leave no stone unturned.
Author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

Quote: To live without philosophizing is in truth the same as keeping the eyes closed without attempting to open them.
Author: René Descartes

Quote: We're constantly being told what other people think we are, and that's why it is so important to know yourself.
Author: Sarah McLachlan

Quote: What if the kid you bullied at school, grew up, and turned out to be the only surgeon who could save your life?
Author: Lynette Mather

Quote: When you are like the tree, there is oneness with the Earth, Sun and Moon, but still steadfast in your purpose.
Author: Michelle Cruz-Rosado

Quote: When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: Whining is not only graceless, but can be dangerous. It can alert a brute that a victim is in the neighborhood.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: You can't substitute material things for love or for gentleness or for tenderness or for a sense of comradeship
Author: Mitch Albom

Quote: A escolha entre livros e pessoas sempre lhe fora fácil. Mil vezes enterrada em palavras do que em sentimentos.
Author: Sara Farinha

Quote: Life doesn´t come with any guarantees. You have to risk it to get the biscuit."- The Alchemist, Paulo Cohelo -
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Ideas were found by the freethinker, expressed by poet with the new words,formulated by scholar into knowledge.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: She said we all not only could know everything. We do. We just tell ourselves we don't to make it all bearable.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: [H]iding how you really feel and trying to make everyone happy doesn't make you nice, it just makes you a liar.
Author: Jenny O'Connell

Quote: A lot of my life happened in great, wonderful bursts of good fortune, and then I would race to be worthy of it.
Author: Julie Andrews

Quote: CLEMENTINE: This is it, Joel. It's going to be gone soon.JOEL: I know.CLEMENTINE: What do we do?JOEL: Enjoy it.
Author: Charlie Kaufman

Quote: Do not despise your own place and hour. Every place is under the stars, every place is the center of the world.
Author: John Burroughs

Quote: I went to a psychoanalyst. He explained things about my love life that I found very impressive... almost scary.
Author: Britney Spears

Quote: It is often said that before you die your life passes before your eyes. It is in fact true. It's called living.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Let the refining and improving of your own life keep you so busy that you have little time to criticize others.
Author: H. Jackson Brown

Quote: Life is too short to spend in negativity. So I have made a conscious effort to not be where I don't want to be.
Author: Hugh Dillon

Quote: Life would be infinitely happier if we could only be born at the age of eighty and gradually approach eighteen.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Now this might disturb you, but I find I'm OK by myself;and I don't need you or your benevolence to make sense.
Author: Morrissey

Quote: Sometimes, some lies that spoken with high confidencecould be more receptive than facts that spoken with doubt.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life - mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical.
Author: Julius Erving

Quote: The life where nothing was ever unexpected. Or inconvenient. Or unusual. The life without colour, pain or past.
Author: Lois Lowry

Quote: When you come out of the storm, you won't be the same person who walked in. That's what this storm's all about.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: Whoever said that the past isn't dead had it backward. It's the future that's already dead, already played out.
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.
Author: François de La Rochefoucauld

Quote: After all, life hasn't much to offer except youth, and I suppose for older people, the love of youth in others.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: and all I could think was that I would like to spend every morning for the rest of my life waking up beside her
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: I am a bit of a hopeless romantic. I really do have a faith and a belief in love, and when I love, I love hard.
Author: Melanie Fiona

Quote: I am no longer in love with her, that's certain, but maybe I love her. Love is so short, forgetting is so long.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: I don't call you handsome, sir, though I love you most dearly: far too dearly to flatter you. Don't flatter me.
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quote: I guess that's just part of loving people: You have to give things up. Sometimes you even have to give them up.
Author: Lauren Oliver

Quote: I still believe that love is the most powerful force in the world, even though I am yet to experience it fully.
Author: Rufus Wainwright

Quote: If you truly want to be respected by people you love, you must prove to them that you can survive without them.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson

Quote: Love is the delightful interval between meeting a beautiful girl and discovering that she looks like a haddock.
Author: John Barrymore

Quote: Love lasts about seven years. That's how long it takes for the cells of the body to totally replace themselves.
Author: Françoise Sagan

Quote: My mama told me in college, 'I love you, and you're God's child, but natural beauty will only take you so far.'
Author: Robin Roberts

Quote: See how she leans her cheek upon her hand. O, that I were a glove upon that hand That I might touch that cheek!
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: The minute I stopped trying to find the right girl, and started trying to become the right guy...the girl came.
Author: Jonathan Antin

Quote: The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: Then love knew it was called love. And when I lifted my eyes to your name, suddenly your heart showed me my way
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: When we lose one we love, our bitterest tears are called forth by the memory of hours when we loved not enough.
Author: Maurice Maeterlinck

Quote: You cannot be with someone just because you don't want to hurt him. You have your own happiness to think about.
Author: Melissa de la Cruz

Quote: You can't make everybody love you. It's an exercise in futility, and it's probably not even a good idea to try.
Author: Robert Crumb

Quote: You were you,and I was I;we were twobefore our time.I was yoursbefore I knew,and you have always been mine too.
Author: Lang Leav

Quote: Hope for love, pray for love, wish for love, dream for love…but don't put your life on hold waiting for love.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: We are not our mind or our thoughts. As long as we believe we are our mind, we are open to third-party control.
Author: Joseph Rain

Quote: When we do cross paths with people whose beliefs and attitudes conflict with our own, we are rarely challenged.
Author: Thomas Gilovich

Quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree.
Author: Michael Crichton

Quote: Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?
Author: Neil Jordan

Quote: My life amounts to no more than one drop in a limitless ocean. Yet what is any ocean, but a multitude of drops?
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: Peter would probably throw a party if I stopped breathing.''Well,' he says, 'I would only go if there was cake.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: She wasn't bitter. She was sad, though. But it was a hopeful kind of sad. The kind of sad that just takes time.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: There were things I wanted to tell him. But I knew they would hurt him. So I buried them, and let them hurt me.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: ...the fundamental things in a man are not the things he explains, but rather the things he forgets to explain.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: Don't fear the gods,Don't worry about death;What is good is easy to get, andWhat is terrible is easy to endure.
Author: Epicurus

Quote: Few among men are they who cross to the further shore. The others merely run up and down the bank on this side.
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: The certainty about the uncertain (in view to life) is that it will remain uncertain till the time its certain.
Author: Mayank Sharma

Quote: To live is to change, to acquire the words of a story, and that is the only celebration we mortals really know.
Author: Barbara Kingsolver

Quote: We need to walk to know sacred places, those around us and those within. We need to walk to remember the songs.
Author: Joseph Bruchac

Quote: When you use your energy and resources to punish people, you run out of energy and resources to protect people.
Author: Kelly Bryson

Quote: Without causality in the world, there is no point in educating people, or making any moral or political appeal.
Author: Felix Alba-Juez

Quote: You can believe in whatsoever you like, but the truth remains the truth, no matter how sweet the lie may taste.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson

Quote: A poet's mission is to make words do more work than they normally do, to make them work on more than one level.
Author: Jay-Z

Quote: If my poetry aims to achieve anything, it's to deliver people from the limited ways in which they see and feel.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: If you would hit the mark, you must aim a little above it;Every arrow that flies feels the attraction of earth.
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: Out of love,No regrets--Though the goodnessBe wasted forever.Out of love,No regrets--Though the returnBe never.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: Simply just BE GRATEFUL what you have today, there is millions who'are crying for the place where you are today
Author: Rashedur Rahman

Quote: [Marriage] happens as with cages: the birds without despair to get in, and those within despair of getting out.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: Dumped doesn't even begin to describe it. If you're going to use a trash metaphor, incinerated is more like it.
Author: Rachel Cohn

Quote: Each piece of glass is another piece of myself I gave to him. It's too bad I didn't keep any pieces for myself.
Author: Amanda Grace

Quote: Trying to fall out of love is like trying to climb a mountain. Blindfolded, on crutches, naked in a hail storm.
Author: Louise Caiola

Quote: All religions are equally sublime to the ignorant, useful to the politician, and ridiculous to the philosopher.
Author: Titus Lucretius Carus

Quote: There once was a time when all people believed in God and the church ruled. This time was called the Dark Ages.
Author: Richard Lederer

Quote: A handsome prince, such as yourself, deserves someone who is no less than one hundred percent dedicated to him.
Author: Colleen Houck

Quote: I'm ending this.''No. Come on. It's not worth it.''You are,' he said fiercely, looking at her.'You're worth it.
Author: Rainbow Rowell

Quote: It all comes down to who is by your side and who is willing to stand up for love even when it seems impossible.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: [we see that] science is eminently perfectible, and that each theory has constantly to give way to a fresh one.
Author: Jules Verne

Quote: In scientific thinking are always present elements of poetry. Science and music requires a thought homogeneous.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: A broken soul is not the absence of beauty, but a cracked and torn soul reeks of the sweet incense it contains.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: I am an empty mind with an empty body and with an empty soul. I am neither haunting for anything nor something.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: The soul, fortunately, has an interpreter - often an unconscious but still a faithful interpreter - in the eye.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: The steady soul and the ego pretender / walk with their arms round each other's shoulders / through the mirage.
Author: Jay Woodman

Quote: America is the most grandiose experiment the world has seen, but, I am afraid, it is not going to be a success.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: Everyone that enters through Him is secured and the person shall find pastures for himself. Jesus really cares!
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: I honestly think it is better to be a failure at something you love than to be a success at something you hate.
Author: George Burns

Quote: I wonder how many times people give up just before a breakthrough - when they are on the very brink of success.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: Lucky people will focus on what's in front of them rather than scrabbling about for what they're searching for.
Author: Steve Backley

Quote: My dad told me, 'It takes fifteen years to be an overnight success', and it took me seventeen and a half years.
Author: Adrien Brody

Quote: No matter how you define success, you will need to be resilient, empowered, authentic, and limber to get there.
Author: Joanie Connell

Quote: The real glory is being knocked to your knees and then coming back. That's real glory. Thats the essence of it.
Author: Vince Lombardi Jr.

Quote: To be successful, you must decide exactly what you want to accomplish, then resolve to pay the price to get it.
Author: Nelson Bunker Hunt

Quote: I just think if you don't say the honest thing, sometimes the honest thing never becomes true, you know, and I-
Author: John Green

Quote: Too many people out there tell us what we can and cannot do but…they don't know who we are, what's put in us.
Author: Alex Rogers

Quote: The veal calf is a by-product of dairying: there is a slice of veal in every glass of milk.
Author: Rynn Berry

Quote: How would you feel, if the day that you were born, somebody else had already planned the day of your execution?
Author: Gary Yourofsky

Quote: I hold that the more helpless a creature, the more entitled it is to protection by man from the cruelty of man.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Man is the only animal that can remain on friendly terms with the victims he intends to eat until he eats them.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.
Author: Nicolaus Copernicus

Quote: With every part you act, there must be a little of yourself in it. If there isn't, it's not acting. It's lying.
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.
Author: Caroline Gordon

Quote: A writer's goal is to weave the ordinary into fine silk and the truly extraordinary into diaphanous clarity ...
Author: C.J. Heck

Quote: I am simply of the opinion that you cannot be taught to write. You have to spend a lifetime in love with words.
Author: Craig Claiborne

Quote: I have always been a huge admirer of my own work. I'm one of the funniest and most entertaining writers I know.
Author: Mel Brooks

Quote: take a writer away from his typewriterand all you have leftisthe sicknesswhich started himtypingin thebeginning
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: Dark times lie ahead of us and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right.
Author: Albus Dumbledore

Quote: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing. The worst thing you can do is nothing.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: The first thing you learn in life is you're a fool. The last thing you learn in life is you're the same fool.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
Author: Sun Tzu

Quote: What a liberation to realize that 'the voice in my head' is not who I am. Who am I then? The one who sees that.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
Author: James Allen

Quote: As in nature, as in art, so in grace; it is rough treatment that gives souls, as well as stones, their luster.
Author: Thomas Guthrie

Quote: I used language because I wanted to offer content that people - not necessarily art people - could understand.
Author: Jenny Holzer

Quote: To make us feel small in the right way is a function of art; men can only make us feel small in the wrong way.
Author: E. M. Forster

Quote: It seems to me that anyone whose library consists of a Kindle lying on a table is some sort of bloodless nerd.
Author: Penelope Lively

Quote: Libraries will get you through times of no money better than money will get you through times of no libraries.
Author: Anne Herbert

Quote: Standing there, staring at the long shelves crammed with books, I felt myself relax and was suddenly at peace.
Author: Helene Hanff

Quote: I melted into the dream as if I had always been there. I knew where I had come from; I knew where I was going.
Author: Chelsie Shakespeare

Quote: Those were strange days, now that I look back at them. In the midst of life, everything revolved around death.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: When the suicide arrived at the sky, the people there asked him: "Why?"He replied: "Because no one admired me.
Author: Stephen Crane

Quote: It is very nearly impossible to become an educated person in a country so distrustful of the independent mind.
Author: James Baldwin

Quote: Often, a school is your best bet-perhaps not for education but certainly for protection from an undead attack.
Author: Max Brooks

Quote: Teaching kids how to feed themselves and how to live in a community responsibly is the center of an education.
Author: Alice Waters

Quote: Proverbs 9:10 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
Author: Bible KJV

Quote: We pray for the big things and forget to give thanks for the ordinary, small (and yet really not small) gifts.
Author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

Quote: Friendship is a disinterested commerce between equals; love, an abject intercourse between tyrants and slaves.
Author: Oliver Goldsmith

Quote: Plunderous is the palate I gift to you, openly I hug the universe of our friendship expanding its outer limit.
Author: Bradley Chicho

Quote: I lost a horse today.''That sounds careless. What happened?''She jumped off a cliff.''A cliff! Is that normal?
Author: Maggie Stiefvater

Quote: Now it was just the three of us: the leader, the warrior, and the kid about to wet his pants. Guess who I was.
Author: D.J. MacHale

Quote: Plus, in one of his e-mails, the guy said he didn't like pancakes. What kind of asshole doesn't like pancakes?
Author: A.J. Jacobs

Quote: She didn't care that people called her a bitch. 'It's just another word for feminist,' she told me with pride.
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: Break my heart for what breaks yoursEverything I am for Your Kingdom's causeAs I walk from earth into eternity
Author: Hillsong United

Quote: Greed is your god, Kaz."He almost laughed at that. "No, Inej. Greed bows to me. It is my servant and my lever.
Author: Leigh Bardugo

Quote: I won't put my ignorance on an altar and call it God. It feels like idolatry, like the worst kind of idolatry.
Author: Robert Charles Wilson

Quote: My feeling is, quite simply, that if there is a God, He has done such a bad jobthat he isn't worth discussing.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: Berhentilah mencari laki-laki untuk membuatmu baagia.Mulailah menjadi perempuan bahagia yang dicari laki-laki.
Author: Christian Simamora

Quote: Happiness is your nature. It is not wrong to desire it. What is wrong is seeking it outside when it is inside.
Author: Ramana Maharshi

Quote: It was a pity that people did not risk enough to speak out in behalf of one another's happiness and their own.
Author: Louis Zukofsky

Quote: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Quote: The formula of happiness and success is just, being actually yourself, in the most vivid possible way you can.
Author: Meryl Streep

Quote: There are two ways to get enough. One is to continue to accumulate more and more. The other is to desire less.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: Evil communication corrupts good manners. I hope to live to hear that good communication corrects bad manners.
Author: Benjamin Banneker

Quote: I hope people remember me as a guy who brought magic to the people. You know, pushed the boundaries of wonder.
Author: David Blaine

Quote: I hope people start to look at their lives as the most powerful, creative act they will ever offer this world.
Author: Tom Shadyac

Quote: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: What greater aspiration and challenge are there for a mother than the hope of raising a great son or daughter?
Author: Rose Kennedy

Quote: You are as young as your self-confidence, as old as your fears; as young as your hope, as old as your despair.
Author: Samuel Ullman

Quote: A well-developed sense of humor is the pole that adds balance to your steps as you walk the tightrope of life.
Author: William Arthur Ward

Quote: Bones has always been smart,"I muttered. "His intelligence was just camouflaged under a mountain of p**sy."Cat
Author: Jeaniene Frost

Quote: Do you know people who insist they like 'all kinds of music'? That actually means they like no kinds of music.
Author: Chuck Klosterman

Quote: Humor has been the balm of my life, but it's been reserved for those close to me, not part of the public Lana.
Author: Lana Turner

Quote: I don't know why it should be, I am sure; but the sight of another man asleep in bed when I am up, maddens me.
Author: Jerome K. Jerome

Quote: I just got out of the hospital. I was in a speed reading accident. I hit a book mark and flew across the room.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: I make fun of situations and try and find the humor in things, but it's never at the expense of the other guy.
Author: Bob Uecker

Quote: I think my sense of humor is Jewish. I'm smarter than most white people, which is kind of a Jewish thing, too.
Author: Jim Goad

Quote: I would so hate to be a first-person character! Always on your guard, always having people read your thoughts!
Author: Jasper Fforde

Quote: If I ever form a clan, we'll be the anti-cheerleaders and walk under the bleacher forming mild acts of mayhem.
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson

Quote: I'm the Super-sized McShizzle, man!"Leo said. "I'm Leo Valdez, bad boy supreme. And the ladies love a bad boy.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Katsa and Po were trying to drown each other and, judging from their hoots of laughter, enjoying it immensely.
Author: Kristin Cashore

Quote: My family has been amazing, and they understand how blessed I am. They've been able to keep my sense of humor.
Author: Karen Duffy

Quote: Never say a humorous thing to a man who does not possess humor. He will always use it in evidence against you.
Author: Herbert Beerbohm Tree

Quote: Only Irish coffee provides in a single glass all four essential food groups: alcohol, caffeine, sugar and fat.
Author: Alex Levine

Quote: Reyna sent me to get Percy,"Frank said. "Did Octavian accept you?""Yeah,"Percy said. "He slaughtered my panda.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: To me, sadness and humor aren't disrelated and humor is the best tool I've had against the sadness in my life.
Author: Mike Mills

Quote: When you say a friend has a sense of humor do you mean that he makes you laugh, or that he can make you laugh?
Author: Max Frisch

Quote: Down in the water, Octavian yelled, “Get me out of here! I'll kill you!”“Tempting,” Percy called down.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: A hero is not know by the number of battles he has won, but rather by the kind of battles he chooses to fight.
Author: Tonny K. Brown

Quote: Better to illuminate than merely to shine to deliver to others contemplated truths than merely to contemplate.
Author: Thomas Aquinas

Quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; its those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: Everything changed the day she figured out there was exactly enough time for the important things in her life.
Author: Brian Andreas

Quote: Fear is a probability by its own cause of actions, if we live by it we lose all the possibilities of endurance
Author: Saleem Durrani

Quote: God is never tired of bringing the sun out every morning, taking it in the evenings and bringing out the moon.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: I'd rather be interesting, original, & unique then follow the pack. Revel in who you truly are & be liberated!
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: In this world, people actually don't live a life for themselves but usually live a life for someone they love.
Author: Vinayak

Quote: Love cannot be hidden. It even shines in the darkest places."~ Carla Olson Gade, The Shadow Catcher's Daughter
Author: Carla Olson Gade

Quote: Love's core purpose is to always inspire us to become more wholesomely ourselves because of love's experience.
Author: H.L. Balcomb

Quote: Nothing great will ever be achieved without great men, and men are great only if they are determined to be so.
