Author: Charles de Gaulle

Quote: She was free in her wildness. She was a wanderess, a drop of free water. She belonged to no man and to no city
Author: Roman Payne

Quote: The conception of each star was at the point of no return; of a desperate soul struggling to master the winds!
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: The day we put an end to believing in hope will be the day we stop existing, for without hope, we are nothing.
Author: Kale Lawrence

Quote: The spirit and soul are the body and brain, which are destructible-that is precisely why they are so precious.
Author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

Quote: The way of the miracle-worker is to see all human behavior as one two things: either love, or a call for love.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: There is something good in all seeming failures. You are not to see that now. Time will reveal it. Be patient.
Author: Sivananda Saraswati

Quote: To forgive is the highest, most beautiful form of love. In return, you will receive untold peace and happiness
Author: Robert Muller

Quote: With your head full of brains and your shoes full of feet, you're too smart to go down any not-so-good street.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: You can take my life, but you'll never break me. So bring me your worst...And I will definitely give you mine.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

Quote: Your mother won a special reward,"she told me, "because everyone had a head in her pictures. We all applauded.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: Knowledge unlocks the door to the mysteries of our mistakes; wisdom guides us away from repeating them". HS/el
Author: Evinda Lepins

Quote: Parents are always more knowledgeable than their children, and children are always smarter than their parents.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: Skepsis wirft Fragen auf, die zu Nachforschungen führen. Das ist sehr hilfreich, um neue Dinge zu entwickeln.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live.
Author: Natalie Babbitt

Quote: Everyday is a bank account, and time is our currency. No one is rich, no one is poor, we've got 24 hours each.
Author: Christopher Rice

Quote: For a day, just for one day,Talk about that which disturbs no oneAnd bring some peace into yourBeautiful eyes.
Author: حافظ

Quote: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: I'm living by example by continuing on with my career and having a full, rich life, and I am incidentally gay.
Author: Portia de Rossi

Quote: In case you never get a second chance: don't be afraid!""And what if you do get a second chance?""You take it!
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: It's amazing how quickly nature consumes human places after we turn our backs on them. Life is a hungry thing.
Author: Scott Westerfeld

Quote: No, I regret nothing, all I regret is having been born, dying is such a long tiresome business I always found.
Author: Samuel Beckett

Quote: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: The ego relies on the familiar. It is reluctant to experience the unknown, which is they very essence of life.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed.
Author: Eminem

Quote: There is only one difference between a long life and a good dinner: that, in the dinner, the sweets come last.
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Quote: This is not the end, this is not even the beginning of the end, this is just perhaps the end of the beginning.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: We could do it, you know.""What?""Leave the district. Run off. Live in the woods. You and I, we could make it.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: What I really want out of life is to discover something new: something mankind didn't know was possible to do.
Author: Elizabeth Holmes

Quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
Author: Martin Luther King

Quote: Dexter, I love you so much. So, so much, and I probably always will. I just don't like you anymore. I'm sorry.
Author: David Nicholls

Quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire, Doubt that the sun doth move. Doubt truth to be a liar, But never doubt I love.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: He does something to me, that boy. Every time. It's his only detriment. He steps on my heart. He makes me cry.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: He loved her for almost everything she was & she decided that was enough to let him stay for a very long time.
Author: Brian Andreas

Quote: I'm in love with you, and I'm not in the business of denying myself the simple pleasure of saying true things.
Author: John Green

Quote: Love may forgive all infirmities and love still in spite of them: but Love cannot cease to will their removal.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: One of the best times for figuring out who you are & what you really want out of life? Right after a break-up.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: Relationships are all about trust and equality. If one person shares, then the other person should share, too.
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.
Author: Mary Oliver

Quote: Sometimes you know in your heart you love someone, but you have to go away before your head can figure it out.
Author: Sharon Creech

Quote: The more we love our friends, the less we flatter them; it is by excusing nothing that pure love shows itself.
Author: Moliere

Quote: You have a... remarkable memory.""I remember everything about you. You're the one who wasn't paying attention.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: I don't know what they are called, the spaces between seconds– but I think of you always in those intervals.
Author: Salvador Plascencia

Quote: In a general sense, I admit to valuing the worldviews of men under the age of 40 and women over the age of 30.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Sorry... my mind was wandering... one time it went all the way to Venus and ordered a meal I couldn't pay for.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you.
Author: Joan Powers

Quote: It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.
Author: Emilie Autumn

Quote: Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.
Author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

Quote: The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: The worst part of holding the memories is not the pain. It's the loneliness of it. Memories need to be shared.
Author: Lois Lowry

Quote: There are no happy endings.Endings are the saddest part, So just give me a happy middleAnd a very happy start.
Author: Shel Silverstein

Quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: You are not Atlas carrying the world on your shoulder. It is good to remember that the planet is carrying you.
Author: Vandana Shiva

Quote: A false-statement requires deceit and distortion for someone to buy it, but a truthful-statement sells itself.
Author: William Bailey

Quote: Everything that can be thought at all can be thought clearly. Everything that can be said can be said clearly.
Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

Quote: For this feeling of wonder shows that you are a philosopher, since wonder is the only beginning of philosophy.
Author: Plato

Quote: In the battle that is philosophy all the techniques of war, including looting and camouflage, are permissible.
Author: Louis Althusser

Quote: My advice to you is get married: if you find a good wife you'll be happy; if not, you'll become a philosopher.
Author: Socrates

Quote: My view is that if your philosophy is not unsettled daily then you are blind to all the universe has to offer.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: My world is about stories that entertain; emotions that move; people you'll remember; literature that matters.
Author: M.G. Crisci

Quote: Opinions alter, manners change, creeds rise and fall, but the moral law is written on the tablets of eternity.
Author: John Emerich Edward Dalberg-Acton

Quote: How dull it is to pause, to make an end,To rust unburnish'd, not to shine in use!As tho' to breathe were life!
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

Quote: So the freshness lives onin a lemon,in the sweet-smelling house of the rind,the proportions, arcane and acerb.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: Twas the night before Thanksgiving. All the food's in the oven. And I'm in the bedroom performin' self lovin'.
Author: Craig Ferguson

Quote: when man determined to destroy himself he picked the was of shall and finding only why smashed it into because
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: Show yourself to the darkness, they said, and then you will see your face."--Nero SlyvenskiALL LIGHT WILL FALL
Author: Almney King

Quote: The goal in life is not to try and live forever, but to create something that will forever in people's hearts.
Author: Karon Waddell

Quote: .."I don't even know her yet..but if she could see me right now, I'd want her to know that I love her.."~E.L.~
Author: Eric Ludy

Quote: Relationships are so much like the United States - they only really thrive when faced with an external threat.
Author: Laura Pedersen

Quote: You know a relationship has deteriorated past the point of salvage when one person detests another's gestures.
Author: Josephine Humphreys

Quote: You will be a great queen when you come back, you know. And someday you'll love me the way you love your wolf.
Author: Carrie Jones

Quote: I think it is safe to say that while the South is hardly Christ-centered, it is most certainly Christ-haunted.
Author: Flannery O'Connor

Quote: Religion is for those who don't want to go to hell, and spirituality is for those who have already been there.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: But I couldn't help myself, couldn't help the way I felt as I recalled the bliss and rush of a vampire's bite.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Listen carefully. I'd crush you like a bug for causing my wife one single moment of pain. Believe it. Fear it.
Author: J.D. Robb

Quote: My words are the kisses but many of the times they don't taste so good as the touch of your lips does to mine.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: She leaned into me, and when I closed my eyes, I knew I wanted nothing more than to hold her this way forever.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: The saddest line you scraped in your diary was not that you cried but those moments when we both shared smile.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: Hermione turned and beamed at Harry; her eyes, too, were full of tears."…then I declare you bonded for life.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Eratosthenes, the mapmaker who was the first man to accurately measure the size of the Earth, was a librarian.
Author: Ken Jennings

Quote: If the world should blow itself up, the last audible voice would be that of an expert saying it can't be done.
Author: Peter Ustinov

Quote: In questions of science, the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.
Author: Galileo Galilei

Quote: When things get too complicated, it sometimes makes sense to stop and wonder: Have I asked the right question?
Author: Enrico Bombieri

Quote: But that did not stop her heart from shattering into countless pieces or her soul from shredding into slivers.
Author: Farrah Naseem

Quote: It was such an unexpected and genuine smile that if I only had a soul I'm sure I would have felt quite guilty.
Author: Jeff Lindsay

Quote: All I can say is that I have arrived with the desire to be a success at Barca, that I am hungry to win titles.
Author: Luis Suarez

Quote: Curious that we spend more time congratulating people who have succeeded than encouraging people who have not.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: I go out there to win. People don't care if you die in this business. The only way I get back is with success.
Author: Michael Bay

Quote: I'm quite detached from failure and success. Once a shooting is done, I kind of close that chapter in my life.
Author: Ranbir Kapoor

Quote: People think that the opposite of success is failure, but it's not. Failure is part of the process of success.
Author: Randy Gage

Quote: Success has always been easy to measure. It is the distance between one's origins and one's final achievement.
Author: Michael Korda

Quote: Success is not only one thing. It's not only having a nice house in Beverly Hills and driving a nice Mercedes.
Author: Malik Bendjelloul

Quote: Success to me is being happy, truly fulfilled, being proud of myself, and doing different things all the time.
Author: Leighton Meester

Quote: The secret code of success is patience,a virtue that can not be replaced. It takes time to build great dreams.
Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

Quote: We think a wise person is someone who solves problems. Truth is, a wise person is someone who avoids problems.
Author: Prem Rawat

Quote: When you're around enormously successful people you realise their success isn't an accident - it's about work.
Author: Ryan Tedder

Quote: When you're busy, avoid taking the quickest action. Instead make the extra effort to truly serve the customer.
Author: Marilyn Suttle

Quote: your right standing with God and your connection to Him remains your strongest defense in the day of calamity.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: I was bold in the pursuit of knowledge, never fearing to follow truth and reason to whatever results they led.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Once you place that crown of liar on your head, you can take it off again, but it leaves a stain for all time.
Author: Terry Goodkind

Quote: Worship your body, beauty, and sexual allure and you will die a million deaths before they finally grieve you.
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: I hold that the more helpless a creature, the more entitled it is to protection by man from the cruelty of man
Author: Ghandi

Quote: I refuse to eat animals because I cannot nourish myself by the sufferings and by the death of other creatures.
Author: Edgar Kupfer-Koberwitz

Quote: The problem is that humans have victimized animals to such a degree that they are not even considered victims.
Author: Gary Yourofsky

Quote: Develop the winning edge; small differences in your performance can lead to large differences in your results.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: People talk to old people like they're children.'Oh you're very old aren't you?' Yeah I'm old. I'm not stupid.
Author: Craig Ferguson

Quote: Remember, purpose is about giving...All you can do with your life is to give it away in the service of others.
Author: Wayne W. Dyer

Quote: What do we any of us have but our illusions? And what do we ask of others but that we be allowed to keep them?
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: I receive Thee ransom of my soul. For love of Thee have I studied and kept vigil toiled preached and taught…
Author: Thomas Aquinas

Quote: And there was that poor sucker Flaubert rolling around on his floor for three days looking for the right word.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: Dive again and again into the river of uncertainty. Create in the dark, only then can you recognize the light.
Author: Jyrki Vainonen

Quote: Look, don't just stare at the pages,"I used to tell my students. "Become the characters. Live inside the book.
Author: Wally Lamb

Quote: When writing a novel a writer should create living people; people not characters. A character is a caricature.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly -- they'll go through anything. You read and you're pierced.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Writers cannot choose their own mood: with them it is not always hide-tide, nor --thank Heaven!--always Storm.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: Being spiritual has nothing to do with what you believe and everything to do with your state of consciousness.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Happiness is a choice and a skill and you can dedicate yourself to learning that skill and making that choice.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: If we are honest with ourselves, most of us will have to admit that we live out our lives in an ocean of fear.
Author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

Quote: Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.
Author: Gurbaksh Chahal

Quote: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
Author: Sun Tzu

Quote: Take the attitude of a student. Never be too big to ask questions. Never know too much to learn something new.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: Time and health are two precious assets that we don't recognize and appreciate until they have been depleted.
Author: Denis Waitley

Quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: When the bright angel dominates, out comes a great work of art, a Michelangelo David or a Beethoven symphony.
Author: Madeleine L'Engle

Quote: anyone who's worth anything reads just what he likes, as the mood takes him, and with extravagant enthusiasm.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: I went away in my head, into a book. That was where I went whenever real life was too hard or too inflexible.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: My last refuge, my books: simple pleasures, like finding wild onions by the side of a road, or requited love.
Author: Tracy Letts

Quote: The world is dark, and light is precious.Come closer, dear reader.You must trust me.I am telling you a story.
Author: Kate DiCamillo

Quote: I can't die yet, doctor. Not yet. I have things to do. Afterwords I'll have a whole lifetime in which to die.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: A letter Lewis wrote reveals an 18-year-old with the energy of a schoolboy and the tastes of an octogenarian.
Author: Philip Zaleski

Quote: Twelve-year-olds are eager to turn everything into arguments but don't have the cognitive skills to win them.
Author: Linda Perlstein

Quote: Dignity, and even holiness too, sometimes, are more questions of coat and waistcoat than some people imagine.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Many of the most powerful things in life are not tangible. All it takes is for you to close your eyes to see.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: My father chose my name , and my last name was chosen by my ancestors . That's enough, I myself choose my way
Author: Ali Shariati

Quote: Prejudice, a dirty word, and faith, a clean one, have something in common: they both begin where reason ends.
Author: Harper Lee

Quote: There had to be dark and muddy waters so that the sun could have something to background it's flashing glory.
Author: Betty Smith

Quote: I lend people money, but I'd never lend something that would jeopardise a friendship if I didn't get it back.
Author: Paloma Faith

Quote: My definition of a friend is somebody who adores you even though they know the things you're most ashamed of.
Author: Jodie Foster

Quote: And so that means...""We have to rob the Henley,"Simon said.Kat sank onto a truly uncomfortable sofa. "Again.
Author: Ally Carter

Quote: Bike lane: the section of the road that accommodates wide loads and has speed bumps to protect drunk drivers.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: But Dumbledore says he doesn't care what they do as long as they don't take him off the Chocolate Frog cards.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Love your wife, your servant and your enemy equally, and file her credit card bills under the "enemy' folder.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: Screw this. He'd blown his shot at nice-and-easy, which only left quick-and-brutal—my favorite way to play.
Author: Rachel Vincent

Quote: I think God is a callous bitch not making me a lesbian. I'm deeply disappointed by my sexual interest in men.
Author: Diamanda Galás

Quote: I want him to be happy. And I want you to be happy, too. Even if you can only find that happiness without me.
Author: S.J. Watson

Quote: Imagination doesn't always make you long for what you cannot have, but rather thrive in what you do not have.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: A King and Queen cannot support a crown with eyes looking down. Their universe expands as far as you can see.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Bad art has the power to deform a people just as good art generates new reflection, growth, vision, and hope.
Author: Michel O'Brien

Quote: Hope is the magic carpet that transports us from the present moment into the realm of infinite possibilities.
Author: H. Jackson Brown

Quote: In the middle of the night, there is always less hope; in the dawn of the morning, there is always more hope!
Author: Mehmet Murat ildan

Quote: My mother-in-law said, 'One day I will dance on your grave.' I said 'I hope you do; I will be buried at sea.'
Author: Les Dawson

Quote: To withdraw is not to run away, and to stay is no wise action, when there's more reason to fear than to hope.
Author: Miguel de Cervantes

Quote: We're only instruments of love, flowing through heaps of pain hoping one day we'd hatch a passion of our own.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: Any film which views the darker side of life, which is death with a sense of humor, is very much to my taste.
Author: Carter Burwell

Quote: April 1. This is the day upon which we are reminded of what we are on the other three hundred and sixty-four.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Everyone knows revenge is a dish best served when you've had enough time to build up enough vitriol and fury.
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: Humor was not important only for me, humor was important for this nation for centuries, to survive, you know.
Author: Milos Forman

Quote: I'm a big fan of independent girls who are strong-willed, vocal in their opinions, and have a sense of humor.
Author: David Lambert

Quote: Laughter, and the broader category of humor, are key elements in helping us go on with our life after a loss.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: Leonard Cohen has a way with words and with humor that remind me to lighten up, which I appreciate very much.
Author: Damien Rice

Quote: Marry me, he says. I got all my own teeth, I wash twice a year an I'll cut you in fer half the business here.
Author: Moira Young

Quote: My daughter doesn't even get my humor. She's like, 'Um, no. I don't get it, Dad. Mmm, no, not that one, Dad.'
Author: Kevin Hart

Quote: No adolescent ever wants to be understood, which is why they complain about being misunderstood all the time.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: Professional comedians, surprisingly, have a lack of humor. They're insensitive to the insanity of our times.
Author: Mort Sahl

Quote: The first ingredient in conversation is truth, the next good sense, the third good humor, and the fourth wit.
Author: William Temple

Quote: The 'Twilight' movies are great in their own right, but they certainly don't have any sense of humor to them.
Author: Mark Waters

Quote: Things can be funny only when we are in fun. When we're 'dead earnest,' humor is the only thing that is dead.
Author: Flip Wilson

Quote: To me, 'Scream' is a masterpiece on every level - the performances, the humor, the tone - it's just flawless.
Author: Marley Shelton

Quote: You saw my leg?""How can a man help what he sees?"he said. "And, if I could add, you possess a very fine leg.
Author: Shannon Hale

Quote: ... what you learn today, for no reason at all, will help you discover all the wonderful secrets of tomorrow.
Author: Norton Juster

Quote: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.
Author: Gilles Deleuze

Quote: Believe there is a great power silently working all things for good, behave yourself and never mind the rest.
Author: Beatrix Potter

Quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Fair means everyone gets what they need. And the only way to get what you need is to make it happen yourself.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Friendship is like peeing on yourself: everyone can see it, but only you get the warm feeling that it brings.
Author: Robert Bloch

Quote: God's extraordinary work is most often done by ordinary people in the seeming obscurity of a home and family.
Author: Neal A. Maxwell

Quote: I like to set my dreams high. That way, even if I only make it half way there, it's still pretty darned good.
Author: Elizabeth O. Dulemba

Quote: If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: In the end, all men die. How you lived will be far more important to the Almighty than what you accomplished.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: Just remember, the difference between being good versus being great is just a few points, inches, or seconds.
Author: Bruce H. Jackson

Quote: My heart, which is so full to overflowing, has often been solaced and refreshed by music when sick and weary.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: New Year - a new chapter, new verse, or just the same old story ? Ultimately we write it. The choice is ours.
Author: Alex Morritt

Quote: Saw a little girl touch a big bug and shout, "I conquered my fear! YES!"and calmly walk away. I was inspired.
Author: Nathan Fillion

Quote: Soul mate romance dissolves the superficial and touches your deepest heart with the delightful power of love.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: The good is the Enemy of the best. Until you depart from the good, you cannot enter God's best for your life.
Author: Pedro Okoro

Quote: The truth knocks on the door and you say, "Go away, I'm looking for the truth,"and so it goes away. Puzzling.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: There is no dishonor in losing the race. There is only dishonor in not racing because you are afraid to lose.
Author: Garth Stein

Quote: There is no pain and there are no sorrows. They no longer have permission to live in my today or my tomorrow.
Author: Steven Cuoco

Quote: We are built for the valley, for the ordinary stuff we are in, and that is where we have to prove our mettle.
Author: Oswald Chambers

Quote: You shouldn't judge someone until you've walk a mile through an underground tunnel in her uncomfortable shoes
Author: Ally Carter

Quote: Knowledge was like candy: you never turned it down, especially if you didn't have to work too hard to get it.
Author: Robert Liparulo

Quote: Mathematical Knowledge adds a manly Vigour to the Mind, frees it from Prejudice, Credulity, and Superstition.
Author: John Arbuthnot

Quote: The world is perishing for lack of the knowledge of God and the Church is famishing for want of His Presence.
Author: A.W. Tozer

Quote: We are generally treated based on how much or little we have, earn, or know—or seem to have, earn, or know.
Author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

Quote: All the stuff you can't wait to get away from, until it's not there anymore, and then you miss it like crazy.
Author: Morgan Matson

Quote: As we go through life we gradually discover who we are, but the more we discover, the more we lose ourselves.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: Every path is the right path. Everything could've been anything else. And it would have just as much meaning.
Author: Mr. Nobody

Quote: I am shamelessly biased about the people in my life, and it makes sense to me that other people are the same.
Author: Akhil Sharma

Quote: I only photograph myself at poignant moments in my life as a check of where I am and how large my thighs are.
Author: Sam Taylor-Johnson

Quote: I wish my school days could have dragged on a little longer, or that I could go back and do it later in life.
Author: Cara Delevingne

Quote: I'm sorry for my inability to let unimportant things go, for my inability to hold on to the important things.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: Lucu, terkadang manusia tidak menyadari apa yang sesungguhnya mereka inginkan sebelum benar-benar kehilangan.
Author: Windry Ramadhina

Quote: Now I've gone for too longLiving like I'm not aliveSo I'm going to start over tonightBeginning with you and I
Author: Hayley Williams

Quote: Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: The friends you make in college are friends you'll have for life, even if you don't talk for years at a time.
Author: Jessica Park

Quote: There is a plan and a purpose, a value to every life, no matter what its location, age, gender or disability.
Author: Sharron Angle

Quote: What we think determines what happens to us, so if we want to change our lives, we need to stretch our minds.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: You're only here for a short visit. Don't hurry, don't worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.
Author: Walter Hagen

Quote: Better than chocolate, being with you last night. Silly me, I thought that nothing was better than chocolate.
Author: E. Lockhart

Quote: But really, we also need to learn how to love one another as women. How to appreciate and respect each other.
Author: Chaka Khan

Quote: Everyone has choices to make; no one has the right to take those choices away from us. Not even out of love..
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: I feel like a part of my soul has loved you since the beginning of everything.Maybe we're from the same star.
Author: Emery Allen

Quote: If you claim to be a real friend then be real in your soul. If you claim to be fake then be an enemy instead.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: It is in the thirties that we want friends. In the forties we know they won't save us any more than love did.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Love one another, but make not a bond of love:Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: She did not believe he could have really gone, because for her, to leave the person you loved was impossible.
Author: Jodi Lynn Anderson

Quote: Submission is not about authority and it is not obedience; it is all about relationships of love and respect.
Author: Wm. Paul Young

Quote: The moral is that a career can be gone in an instant. And all you have in this world are the people you love.
Author: Ice Cube

Quote: Most of us go through each day looking for what we saw yesterday And, not surprisingly, that is what we find.
Author: James A. Kitchens

Quote: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up 'cause they're looking for ideas.
Author: Paula Poundstone

Quote: How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: Remain true to yourself, child. If you know your own heart, you will always have one friend who does not lie.
Author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

Quote: The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true.
Author: James Branch Cabell

Quote: You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Act only according to that maxim whereby you can at the same time will that it should become a universal law.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quote: Be the kind of person who catches the shit before it hits the fan, not the one who scrapes it off afterwards.
Author: Jonas Eriksson

Quote: For I have trained myself and am training myself always to be able to dance lightly in the service of thought
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: I believe that just because something didn't go the way you planned it once, it's no reason not to try again.
Author: Chantelle Shaw

Quote: If the rest of your brain were conscious, it would probably regard you as the pointy-haired boss from Dilbert
Author: Peter Watts

Quote: In our country religion is not different from philosophy and religion & philosophy don't differ from science.
Author: Virchand Gandhi

Quote: Maybe I'm strange and perverse, but I've always thought there was something sexy about a compelling argument.
Author: Therese Doucet

Quote: NIHILIST, n. A Russian who denies the existence of anything but Tolstoi. The leader of the school is Tolstoi.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: Once someone asked me, "What do you want to be your epitaph?"So I said, "Paulo Coelho died when he was alive.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Some want to live within the soundOf church or chapel bell;I want to run a rescue shop,Within a yard of hell.
Author: C.T. Studd

Quote: To learn is not to know; there are the learners and the learned. Memory makes the one, philosophy the others.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quote: Le but n'est rien, le développement est tout. Le spectacle ne veut en venir à rien d'autre qu'à lui-même.
Author: Guy Debord

Quote: Were prayers of murderers, when fighting on the “right side” of the war, ever heard—let alone answered?
Author: Kristina McMorris

Quote: A bank is a place where they lend you an umbrella in fair weather and ask for it back when it begins to rain.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: forsan et haec olim meminisse iuvabit.and perhaps it will be pleasing to have remembered these things one day
Author: Virgil

Quote: I am terrified by this dark thingThat sleeps in me;All day I feel its soft, feathery turnings, its malignity.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: Oh! kangaroos, sequins, chocolate sodas! / You really are beautiful! Pearls, / harmonicas, jujubes, aspirins!
Author: Frank O'Hara

Quote: Second FigSafe upon the solid rock the ugly houses stand: Come and see my shining palace built upon the sand!
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: I know it may not be an easy thing to do, but with the right person by their side, they can conquer anything.
Author: Stephanie Kaleto

Quote: Why don't we break up? I guess I stay with her because she stays with me. And that's not an easy thing to do.
Author: John Green

Quote: I can't understand why people use religion to hurt each other when there's already so much pain in the world.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Your cravings as a human animal do not become a prayer just because it is God whom you ask to attend to them.
Author: Dag Hammarskjöld

Quote: It called to him, a sweet heady beacon of femininity, fertility, and fuckability. His three favorite f-words.
Author: Christine Warren

Quote: You realise you're going to owe me dinner after this, right?”“How does McDonald's sound?”“Inadequate.
Author: Sarah Mayberry

Quote: Consider the Lichen. Lichens are just about the hardiest visible organisms on Earth, but the least ambitious.
Author: Bill Bryson

Quote: For a successful technology, reality must take precedence over public relations, for nature cannot be fooled.
Author: Richard Feynman

Quote: Here lies one from a distant star, but the soil is not alien to him, for in death he belongs to the universe.
Author: Clifford D. Simak

Quote: Science is always discovering odd scraps of magical wisdom and making a tremendous fuss about its cleverness.
Author: Aleister Crowley

Quote: The world keeps happening, in accordance with its rules; it's up to us to make sense of it and give it value.
Author: Sean Carroll

Quote: We are trying to prove ourselves wrong as quickly as possible, because only in that way can we find progress.
Author: Richard Feynman

Quote: When we look up at night and view the stars, everything we see is shinning because of distant nuclear fusion.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Positivity is a connectivity between Heart-to-Heart and not Mind-to-Mind as that is only equal Profitability.
Author: Anuj Somany

Quote: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.
Author: Jane D. Hull

Quote: Success goes to the ones who do. Get up. Show up. Throw up if you have to. Do it afraid, but do it no matter.
Author: Toni Sorenson

Quote: Success has nothing to do with what you gain in life or accomplish for yourself. It's what you do for others.
Author: Danny Thomas

Quote: Success is doing what you want to do, when you want, where you want, with whom you want, as much as you want.
Author: Anthony Robbins

Quote: The choice is yours. Don't let your pronouncements destroy your destiny rather let them build your future up!
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: The greatest reward for a man's failure is not necessarily the consequent success, but what he becomes by it.
Author: Ogwo David Emenike

Quote: When the actions becomes frequent than the words, success becomes heavier than the dreams. Do more, say less.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: You cannot score a goal when you are sitting on the bench. To do so, you have to dress up and enter the game.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: I am a lover of truth, a worshiper of freedom, a celebrant at the altar of language and purity and tolerance.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: If you feel obsessed to prove something to the world, then you'd need world attention to be able to prove it.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: In a room wherepeople unanimously maintaina conspiracy of silence,one word of truthsounds like a pistol shot.
Author: Czesław Miłosz

Quote: But magic is neither good nor evil. It is a tool, like a knife. Is a knife evil? Only if the wielder is evil.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Getting divorced just because you don't love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do.
Author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

Quote: I AM IGNORANT of absolute truth. But I am humble before my ignorance and therein lies my honor and my reward.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: Jasnah had once defined a fool as a person who ignored information because it disagreed with desired results.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: The most wonderful and the strongest things in the world, you know, are just the things which no one can see.
Author: Charles Kingsley

Quote: why can't we control our anger? because we love perfection. make a little room for imperfection in our lives.
Author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar

Quote: Aha! Today I shall become an author! And I will auth and auth and auth and make a squillion dollars, whoopee!
Author: Brian Jacques

Quote: But still I feel I waste a lot of time leaning on my elbow and thinking to myself, "alright sucker, now what?
Author: Peter S. Beagle

Quote: It's not the despair, Laura. I can take the despair. It's the hope I can't stand. ~ Brian Stimpson, Clockwise
Author: John Cleese

Quote: The most important thing about art is to work. Nothing else matters except sitting down every day and trying.
Author: Steven Pressfield

Quote: Writing is like prostitution. First you do it for love, and then for a few close friends, and then for money.
Author: Molière

Quote: Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Family not only needs to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also of those whom we'd give blood.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
Author: Denis Waitley

Quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
Author: Thomas Edison

Quote: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: Success is doing what you want to do, when you want, where you want, with whom you want, as much as you want.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Art is accusation, expression, passion. Art is a fight to the finish between black charcoal and white paper.
Author: Gunter Grass

Quote: Models are there to look like mannequins, not like real people. Art and illusion are supposed to be fantasy.
Author: Grace Jones

Quote: Should graffiti be judged on the same level as modern art? Of course not: It's way more important than that.
Author: Banksy

Quote: ... just as food is necessary to the life of the body, so good reading is necessary to the life of the soul.
Author: Pope John XXIII

Quote: His hands were weak and shaking from carrying far too many books from the bookshop. It was the best feeling.
Author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt

Quote: If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: She did not care very much for other little girls, but if she had plenty of books she could console herself.
Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

Quote: Birth and death: there was the same consciousness of heightened existence and of her own elevated importance
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Death, I had discovered long ago, was available in varying flavors, and none of them particularly palatable.
Author: Jasper Fforde

Quote: I loved my mother too,' I said. 'I still do. That's the thing - it never goes away, even if the person does.
Author: Anna Carey

Quote: What glitters may not be gold; and even wolves may smile; and fools will be led by promises to their deaths.
Author: Lauren Oliver

Quote: Education: that which reveals to the wise, and conceals from the stupid, the vast limits of their knowledge.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Flowers don't tell, they show. That's the way good books should be too."--Stephanie Skeem. Author of Flotsam
Author: Stephanie Skeem

Quote: when we are powerless to do a thing, it is a great joy that we can come and step inside the ability of Jesus
Author: Corrie ten Boom

Quote: Although the troops have struck us, we throw it all behind and are glad to meet you in peace and friendship.
Author: Black Kettle

Quote: Going through an illness and then death of a close friend has changed my attitudes to friendship enormously.
Author: Jane Green

Quote: I've got many close friends, but there's an awful lot about friendship that is not demonstrative in my case.
Author: Warren Christopher

Quote: and our few good times will be rare because we have the critical senseand are not easy to fool with laughter
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: As contraries are known by contraries, so is the delights of presence best known by the torments of absence.
Author: Alcibiades

Quote: Children are happy because they don't have a file in their minds called "All the Things That Could Go Wrong.
Author: Marianne Williamson

Quote: I think and think and think, I"ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: If you love a person, you should show it in adundance, not reserve it for special occasions like fine china.
Author: Bryan Cohen

Quote: Remember, happiness doesn't depend upon who you are or what you have, it depends solely upon what you think.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: The advance of regret can be so gradual that it is impossible to say "yesterday I was happy, today I am not.
Author: E.M. Forster

Quote: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Why not seize the pleasure at once? -- How often is happiness destroyed by preparation, foolish preparation!
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Drugs are the enemies of ambition and hope - and when we fight against drugs we are fighting for the future.
Author: Bob Riley

Quote: Great hope has no real footing unless one is willing to face into the doom that may also be on the way.p.207
Author: Norman Mailer

Quote: I am planting a tree in this bomb crater to remind us that in the midst of death, there is life... and hope.
Author: Robert S. Graetz

Quote: I'm pretty much looking for beauty all the time. It just seems like some days the light is better to see it.
Author: Melodie Ramone

Quote: It would be fun to do a reunion show. I hope we do it some day, but it better be soon. We're all getting on.
Author: William Christopher

Quote: Regardless of how black the page, he had always managed to turn it and move on to a new chapter in his life.
Author: Robert Masello

Quote: The lovers of the world are the ones who matter. Forget the rest. Jesus was a lover. He doesn't hate anyone.
Author: Scylar Tyberius

Quote: There are hurdles, there are handicaps, hardships you have to face in life, but you hope for a great future.
Author: Anil Kapoor

Quote: We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that's like saying you can never change your fate.
Author: Amy Tan

Quote: A lot of people say, 'Hey, God doesn't have a sense of humor.' Yes, He does. God has a great sense of humor.
Author: Si Robertson

Quote: Going round and around inside a dryer can be fatal, whereas pasta is rarely fatal. Unless Isabelle makes it.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: I see a light in the kitchen. Let us not deprive Molly any longer of the chance to deplore how thin you are.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: In the 'Hurt Locker' there's a lot of me in there, a sense of humor, a man of few words and a lot of action.
Author: Jeremy Renner

Quote: Lawful good to lawful evil!"said Simon, pleased."He's quoting Dungeons and Dragons,"said Clary. "Ignore him.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Poop humor is fun. If you do the toilet scenes well and commit to them, they can be really, really powerful.
Author: Sandra Bullock

Quote: The President has a wonderful sense of humor, which is one of the reasons it is so much fun to work for him.
Author: Karen Hughes

Quote: There seems to be no lengths to which humorless people will not go to analyze humor. It seems to worry them.
Author: Robert Benchley

Quote: You couldn't be satisfied with being an amateur asshole, could you, Jimbo! You had to go and turn pro on me!
Author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

Quote: ...even a tiny bit of deceit is dishonorable when it's used for selfish or cowardly reasons.- Mr. Penderwick
Author: Jeanne Birdsall

Quote: Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Give up to grace. The ocean takes care of each wave 'til it gets to shore. You need more help than you know.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Hidup harus terus berlanjut,tidak peduli seberapa menyakitkan atau membahagiakan, biar waktu yg menjadi obat
Author: Tere Liye

Quote: How quick and rushing life can sometimes seem, when at the same time it's so slow and sweet and everlasting.
Author: Graham Swift

Quote: I am never without my lyric book. If anything inspirational happens, I have it there so nothing's forgotten.
Author: Gabrielle Aplin

Quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: If you hear how wonderful you are often enough, you begin to believe it, no matter how you try to resist it.
Author: Ben Carson

Quote: No matter how plain a woman may be, if truth and honesty are written across her face, she will be beautiful.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: Patience Pays..Is true! But the greater truth is that it takes advance payment before it pays you in return!
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: There is force in the universe, which, if we permit it, will flow through us and produce miraculous results.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: There is nothing you can see that is not a Bashoflower; there is nothing you can think that is not the moon.
Author: Matsuo Basho

Quote: Too many people realize at the end of their lives that they've taken for granted those who really love them.
Author: Lesley M.M. Blume

Quote: Watch for the thing that will show itself to you. Because that thing, when you find it, will be your future.
Author: Arthur Golden

Quote: We follow the codes not because they bring gain, but because we loathe the people we would otherwise become.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: We must not be defined by what we do, but we must be what and who we are, then only happen to do what we do!
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams,it is still a beautiful world.Be cheerful.Strive to be happy.
Author: Max Ehrmann

Quote: Your own positive future begins in this moment. All you have is right now. Every goal is possible from here.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: If knowledge is power, let's spread it as widely as possible and dilute it to deny those who would abuse it.
Author: Stuart Aken

Quote: Valuing knowledge above all else results in a lust for power, and that leads men into dark and empty places.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: With words at your disposal, you can see more clearly. Finding the words is another step in learning to see.
Author: Robin Wall Kimmerer

Quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love and to work and to play and to look up at the stars.
Author: Henry Van Dyke

Quote: I always say that the times in my life when I've been happiest are the times when I've seen, like, a sunset.
Author: Chris Evans

Quote: It's strange how dreams get under your skin and give your heart a test for what's real and what's imaginary.
Author: Jason Mraz

Quote: Just when you think it can't get any worse, it can. And just when you think it can't get any better, it can.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: Life has but one true charm: the charm of the game. But what if we're indifferent to whether we win or lose?
Author: Charles Baudelaire

Quote: Life is all memory, except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Quote: Sacrifice is a part of life. It's supposed to be. It's not something to regret. It's something to aspire to.
Author: Mitch Albom

Quote: The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: The Internet is so big, so powerful and pointless that for some people it is a complete substitute for life.
Author: Andrew Brown

Quote: There's a period of life when we swallow a knowledge of ourselves and it becomes either good or sour inside.
Author: Pearl Bailey

Quote: When it comes to life the critical thing is whether you take things for granted or take them with gratitude.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: All of sudden, this shooting star went by, and all I could think was that they were listening to us somehow.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: And in the end, we were all just humans.. drunk on the idea that love, only love, could heal our brokenness.
Author: Christopher Poindexter

Quote: Cherish sunsets, wild creatures and wild places. Have a love affair with the wonder and beauty of the earth.
Author: Stewart Udall

Quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire;Doubt that the sun doth move;Doubt truth to be a liar;But never doubt I love .
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: I am beginning to understand,"said the little prince. "There is a flower... I think that she has tamed me...
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: I can honestly say I love getting older. Then again, I never put my glasses on before looking in the mirror.
Author: Cherie Lunghi

Quote: I fell in love with her when we were together, then fell deeper in love with her in the years we were apart.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: It ought to make us feel ashamed when we talk like we know what we're talking about when we talk about love.
Author: Raymond Carver

Quote: Limitless undying love which shines around me like a million suns it calls me on and on across the universe.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: Love meant jumping off a cliff and trusting that a certain person would be there to catch you at the bottom.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: Romance is thinking about your significant other, when you are supposed to be thinking about something else.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: Sex without love is a meaningless experience, but as far as meaningless experiences go its pretty damn good.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Someday you'll find someone special again. People who've been in love once usually do. It's in their nature.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: What if love wasn't the act of finding what you were missing but the give-and-take that made you both match?
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: The trouble with men is that they have limited minds. That's the troublewith women, too."["Existence"(1975)]
Author: Joanna Russ

Quote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
Author: James Baldwin

Quote: I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless. I am Divergent.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: I love you, not just for now, but for always, and I dream of the day that you'll take me in your arms again.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.
Author: Jack London

Quote: If you have two friends in your lifetime, you're lucky. If you have one good friend, you're more than lucky.
Author: S.E. Hinton

Quote: No, I'm just a very naughty boy. I do all sorts of bad things. I kick kittens. I make rude gestures at nuns.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.
Author: Michael Ondaatje

Quote: The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.
Author: Lorraine Hansberry

Quote: An inventor is a man who asks 'Why?' of the universe and lets nothing stand between the answer and his mind.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: God created philosophy for all the intellects that got bored of hearing the same bible stories every Sunday.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: If your doctrine changed for the better yet your character changed for the worse, you changed for the worse.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: The ethos of redemption is realized in self-mastery, by means of temperance, that is, continence of desires.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: What i took away from witnessing the broken climbers in Moshi was this: *Everything is easy until it isn't.*
Author: Josh Gates

Quote: why are we here?where do we come from?traditionally,these are questionsfor philosophy,but philosophy is dead
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: You may tend to get cancer from the thing that makes you want to smoke so much, not from the smoking itself.
Author: William Saroyan

Quote: Il est ce qui échappe à l'activité des hommes, à la reconsidération et à la correction de leur œuvre.
Author: Guy Debord

Quote: Far away, our dreams have nothing to do with what we do. The wind carries the night, and passes on, aimless.
Author: Mahmoud Darwish

Quote: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another til I drop.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: There's an old saying that applies to me: you can't lose a game if you don't play the game. (Act 1, scene 4)
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: To live only for some future goal is shallow. It's the sides of the mountain that sustain life, not the top.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: There is nothing to save, now all is lost,but a tiny core of stillness in the heartlike the eye of a violet.
Author: D.H. Lawrence

Quote: Your life experience is a moving picture, of which you are writer, director, performer, producer and critic.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Insanity is everyone expecting you not to fall apart when you find out everything you believed in was a lie.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: I think it [religion] is an art, the greatest one; an extension of the communion all the other arts attempt.
Author: Dodie Smith

Quote: We rely on faith only in the context of claims for which there is no sufficient sensory or logical evidence.
Author: Sam Harris

Quote: Yet I am stuck in the idea of romance, a dreamer; I want to actually fall in love with a man, then marry him
Author: Ottilie Weber

Quote: Do you think we can be friends?” I asked.He stared up at the ceiling. “Probably not, but we can pretend.
Author: Priya Ardis

Quote: Alfred Nobel stipulated that no distinction of race or colour will determine who received of his generosity.
Author: Abdus Salam

Quote: No one disputes that seeming order can come out of the application of simple rules. But who wrote the rules?
Author: Robert J. Sawyer

Quote: I was ripped from my body, I was less than spirit, less than the meanest ghost . . . but still, I was alive.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Believe it or not, I have about the same success rate as anyone else. Sometimes you hit, sometimes you miss.
Author: Seth MacFarlane

Quote: But I think it's more normal for my team to have no success than it is to win two consecutive European cups.
Author: Jose Mourinho

Quote: Every time a champion makes a decision they have a chance to learn something new, regardless of the outcome.
Author: Steve Backley

Quote: The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly.
Author: Cecil B. DeMille

Quote: There's no success story. Everybody's got a ghetto story. You always want to make it bigger than what it is.
Author: Bernie Mac

Quote: When you've succeeded, you'd say:'Indeed I'd to go through those hell before fit into all of this happiness.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: The human body has no more need for cows' milk than it does for dogs' milk, horses' milk, or giraffes' milk.
Author: Dr. Michael Klaper

Quote: We strive for a world where every earthling has the right to live and grow. That's why we don't eat animals.
Author: Ruby Roth

Quote: We strive for a world where every earthling has the right to live and grow. That's why we don't eat animals.
Author: Ruby Roth

Quote: He's acting as foolish as a kitten... but then, everyone's entitled to a little foolishness once in a while.
Author: Christopher Paolini

Quote: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not towisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
Author: Wallace Stegner

Quote: I writeNotFor the sake of gloryNot For the sake of fameNotFor the sake of successBut for the sake of my soul
Author: Beth Nimmo

Quote: If a writer stops observing he is finished. Experience is communicated by small details intimately observed.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Accept responsibility for your life. Know that it is you who will get you where you want to go, no one else.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: Contemplation often makes life miserable.  We should act more, think less, and stop watching ourselves live.
Author: Nicolas Chamfort

Quote: Give credit where credit is due: simply said, if you want loyalty and best effort, you must be thoughtful.
Author: Estee Lauder

Quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: The more rejection you get, the better you are, the more you've learned, the closer you are to your outcome.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: The only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience and ability.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: Trust is the glue that holds people together and is the lubricant that keeps an organization moving forward.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Art is always and everywhere the secret confession, and at the same time the immortal movement of its time.
Author: Karl Marx

Quote: Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.
Author: Mary Schmich

Quote: I decided on the spot that I would be an artist, and I assure you, it was no ordinary artist I had in mind.
Author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

Quote: Music is God's gift to man, the only art of Heaven given to earth, the only art of earth we take to Heaven.
Author: Walter Savage Landor

Quote: Religion is the masterpiece of the art of animal training, for it trains people as to how they shall think.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The mother art is architecture. Without an architecture of our own we have no soul of our own civilization.
Author: Frank Lloyd Wright

Quote: A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe.
Author: Madeleine L'Engle

Quote: A stereotype becomes a stereotype when a significant percentage of the population appears to conform to it.
Author: Kelley Armstrong

Quote: Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home.
Author: Anna Quindlen

Quote: I'm old-fashioned and think that reading books is the most glorious pastime that humankind has yet devised.
Author: Wisława Szymborska

Quote: Knowing I lov'd my books, he furnish'd me From mine own library with volumes that I prize above my dukedom.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Stories are important, the monster said. They can be more important than anything. If they carry the truth.
Author: Patrick Ness

Quote: The books - the generous friends who met me without suspicion - the merciful masters who never used me ill!
Author: Wilkie Collins

Quote: The world must be all fucked up,"he said then, "when men travel first class and literature goes as freight.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book.Books are well written, or badly written. That is all.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: If anyone stops us, as long as we mumble something pretentious about the glory of death, we should be fine.
Author: Derek Landy

Quote: Most men fear getting laughed at or humiliated by a romantic prospect while most women fear rape and death.
Author: Gavin de Becker

Quote: No matter what, I want to continue living with the awareness that I will die. Without that, I am not alive.
Author: Banana Yoshimoto

Quote: Sleep is a little death, dreams the whisperings of the Other, who would drag us all into his eternal night.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: Engagement provides opportunities to demonstrate how confrontation can be done both effectively and civilly
Author: Gregory S. Prince

Quote: I became convinced that noncooperation with evil is as much a moral obligation as is cooperation with good.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: It's better to dare to dream big and achieve half of your dreams than to dream small dreams and achieve all
Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

Quote: Does your love reach this far, God? And if it extends to heaven and beyond… why can't it seem to find me?
Author: Jenny B. Jones

Quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: [She wasn't] a logically reasoning woman, but God is good, and hearts may count in heaven as high as heads.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: he is both the source of my happiness and the one i want to share it with. i have to believe that's a sign.
Author: John Green

Quote: Indeed there has never been any explanation of the ebb and flow in our veins--of happiness and unhappiness.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: One should cultivate good habits of memory, for it is capable of making existence a Paradise or an Inferno.
Author: Baltasar Gracián

Quote: The only way to avoid being miserable is not to have enough leisure to wonder whether you are happy or not.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There you go...let it all slide out. Unhappiness can't stick in a person's soul when it's slick with tears.
Author: Shannon Hale

Quote: We are living in a time when flowers are trying to live on flowers, instead of on good rain and black loam.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: We talked for hours. He talked and I listened. It was like wind and sunlight. It blew all the cobwebs away.
Author: John Fowles

Quote: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
Author: Emil Zatopek

Quote: But that's just it; I can either focus on what I have lost, or what I have gained, and I choose the latter.
Author: Angie Smith

Quote: If there's a golf course in heaven, I hope it's like Augusta National. I just don't want an early tee time.
Author: Gary Player

Quote: Morning dew upon the grass,glistening in the sun.Yesterday's gone,tomorrow may come,but this day has begun.
Author: Calvin W. Allison

Quote: quote from Chase the Moon- Some people are just downright wicked, and sometimes evil wins - but not always.
Author: Lynn Hubbard

Quote: We have a hope of succeeding if we learn from our past mistakes and pull together to make the hard choices.
Author: Carl Levin

Quote: A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs. It's jolted by every pebble on the road.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: Awww,"Minho said. "That's almost as sweet as that time she slammed the end of a spear into your shuck face.
Author: James Dashner

Quote: But this room looked like it had been decorated by the unholy lovechild of Barbie and Strawberry Shortcake.
Author: Rachel Hawkins

Quote: I like to have a martini,Two at the very most.After three I'm under the table,after four I'm under my host.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: I went to a restaurant that serves "breakfast at any time"so I ordered French toast during the Renaissance.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: It takes a lot of time to be a genius. You have to sit around so much, doing nothing, really doing nothing.
Author: Gertrude Stein

Quote: It was amazing how many books one could fit into a room, assuming one didn't want to move around very much.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: Our first show, 'A Little Nightmare Music,' encompasses a lot of zany humor with beautiful classical music.
Author: Aleksey Igudesman

Quote: The key to humor is often self-loathing or sarcasm. In a sense, that's how self-loathing is made palatable.
Author: James Gray

Quote: We are like chameleons, we take our hue and the color of our moral character, from those who are around us.
Author: John Locke

Quote: Yeah, but the lost diadem,"said Michael Corner, rolling his eyes, "is lost, Luna. That's sort of the point.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Years from now, when I'm successful and happy, ...and he's in prison... I hope I'm not too mature to gloat.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: And I remembered something else that makes us human: faith, the only weapon in our arsenal to battle doubt.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: Day after day, day after day,We stuck, nor breath nor motion;As idle as a painted shipUpon a painted ocean.
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quote: Do you wait for things to happen, or do you make them happen yourself? I believe in writing your own story.
Author: Charlotte Eriksson

Quote: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
Author: Michael Jordan

Quote: If you start by promising what you don't even have yet, you'll lose your desire to work towards getting it.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: In the end, it is important to remember that we cannot become what we need to be, by remaining what we are.
Author: Max DePree

Quote: Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.[Inaugural Address, January 20 1961]
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Perhaps just to have loved was enough - just to have seen this world,and known it,through the eyes of love.
Author: Rosie Alison

Quote: Seek first the kingdom of heaven WITHIN, whereby lies an abundance of treasures and resources that you need
Author: Lisa Washington

Quote: The calling of an author is more than just to entertain, but also to share ones experiences with the world.
Author: M.J. Stoddard

Quote: The fact is not kill entire populations is able to infect entire regions of land and control the only cure.
Author: Ted Dekker

Quote: The government will see that human spaceflight is useful - for science and the economy - and inspirational.
Author: Helen Sharman

Quote: The kind of beauty I want most is the hard-to-get kind that comes from within - strength, courage, dignity.
Author: Ruby Dee

Quote: The man who writes about himself and his own time is the only man who writes about all people and all time.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is no greater insight into the future than recognizing...when we save our children, we save ourselves
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: There is only one day left, always starting over: It is given to us at dawn and taken away from us at dusk.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: Thou shalt not be a victim, thou shalt not be a perpetrator, but, above all, thou shalt not be a bystander.
Author: Yehuda Bauer

Quote: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: When all is said and done all anyone has left is their integrity at their core... Don't give that away too.
Author: Solange nicole

Quote: When you face a new challenge, remember the skills, talent, guts and resources that got you through before.
Author: Lynn A. Robinson

Quote: You can grow like a tall tree, when you enjoy the sun, wind, rain, storms and the stars in the dark nights.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: You're never as good as everyone tells you when you win, and you're never as bad as they say when you lose.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: Z is for Zany! Master the Zany habit of thinking backwards. it will help you become a really great thinker!
Author: Lucas Remmerswaal

Quote: Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, and knowledge without integrity is dangerous and dreadful.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: After you have wept and grieved for your physical losses, cherish the functions and the life you have left.
Author: Morrie Schwartz

Quote: An armed society is a polite society. Manners are good when one may have to back up his acts with his life.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?
Author: John Keats

Quote: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.
Author: Solomon Ortiz

Quote: God wants my life to be about being successful and being happy and blessing other people and being blessed.
Author: Miley Cyrus

Quote: Here's to freedom, cheers to art. Here's to having an excellent adventure and may the stopping never start.
Author: Jason Mraz

Quote: I don't chase after anyone, If you wanna walk out of my life, then I'll hold the fucking door open for you.
Author: Wiz Khalifa

Quote: I want to find that defining moment that you're satisfied and you've done what you want to do in your life.
Author: Tyson Gay

Quote: It is your responsibility to find fault with me, it is mine to hear you out. But don't expect me to change.
Author: John Irving

Quote: It's in literature that true life can be found. It's under the mask of fiction that you can tell the truth.
Author: Gao Xingjian

Quote: Living might mean taking chances, but they're worth taking. Loving might be a mistake. but its worth making
Author: Reba McEntire

Quote: Losing your life is not the worst thing that can happen. The worst thing is to lose your reason for living.
Author: Jo Nesbø

Quote: My mom, Irmelin, taught me the value of life. Her own life was saved by my grandmother during World War II.
Author: Leonardo DiCaprio

Quote: Never say 'I can't.' 'I can't' is a limit, and life is about breaking through limits. Say 'I will' instead.
Author: Heather Vogel Frederick

Quote: People don't like to think, if one thinks, one must reach conclusions. Conclusions are not always pleasant.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: Properly practiced, knitting soothes the troubled spirit, and it doesn't hurt the untroubled spirit either.
Author: Elizabeth Zimmermann

Quote: That's what people do who love you. They put their arms around you and love you when you're not so lovable.
Author: Deb Caletti

Quote: The bounties of space, of infinite outwardness, were three: empty heroics, low comedy, and pointless death.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.
Author: William James

Quote: The highest use of capital is not to make more money, but to make money do more for the betterment of life.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: After all my erstwhile dear, my no longer cherished; Need we say it was not love, just because it perished?
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: As lovers, the difference between men and women is that women can love all day long, but men only at times.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire;Doubt that the sun doth move;Doubt truth to be a liar;But never doubt I love.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Have you ever felt the longing for someone you could admire? For something, not to look down at, but up to?
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours.In all the world, there is no love for you like mine.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: It's so much easier to convince yourself you're madly in love with someone when you know nothing about him.
Author: Megan McCafferty

Quote: Love is needing someone. Love is putting up with someone's bad qualities because they somehow complete you.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: Nothing had changed. I was the stupid one again. I was the girl who never understood who she was to people.
Author: Carol Rifka Brunt

Quote: The need for love and intimacy is a fundamental human need, as primal as the need for food, water, and air.
Author: Dean Ornish

Quote: We were very different, and we disagreed about a lot of things, but he was always so interesting, you know?
Author: John Green

Quote: When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times.
Author: Mitch Albom

Quote: Why did he have to be so gorgeous? Why did he have to stand so close, and why did I still love him so much?
Author: Jeaniene Frost

Quote: Before I fellin love with words,with setting skies and singing birds—it was you I fellin love with first.
Author: Lang Leav

Quote: The mind is just like a muscle - the more you exercise it, the stronger it gets and the more it can expand.
Author: Idowu Koyenikan

Quote: You have to wait for your mind to catch up with whatever it is it's working on; then you can write a novel.
Author: James M. Cain

Quote: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: After all, Ginger Rogers did everything that Fred Astaire did. She just did it backwards and in high heels.
Author: Ann Richards

Quote: And then something invisible snapped insider her, and that which had come together commenced to fall apart.
Author: John Green

Quote: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind.
Author: Bernard M. Baruch

Quote: I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create.
Author: Maria Montessori

Quote: Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Civilization is only possible for deeply unpleasant animals. It is only an ape that can be truly civilized.
Author: Mark Rowlands

Quote: In my opinion, our health care system has failed when a doctor fails to treat an illness that is treatable.
Author: Kevin Alan Lee
