Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: People are more difficult to work with than machines. And when you break a person, he can't be fixed.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: That was one of the virtues of being a pessimist: nothing was ever as bad as you thought it would be.
Author: James Jones

Quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all the power we need inside ourselves already.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: You know, Minister, I disagree with Dumbledore on many counts...but you cannot deny he's got style...
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: All these years of thinking, ending up like this: In front of all this beauty, understanding nothing.
Author: Bruce Cockburn

Quote: Every great cause begins as a movement, becomes a business, and eventually degenerates into a racket.
Author: Eric Hoffer

Quote: He will essentially follow the language of the spectacle, for it is the only one he is familiar with.
Author: Guy Debord

Quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: If anyone on the verge of action should judge himself according to the outcome, he would never begin.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: If we thought more for ourselves we would have very many more bad books and very many more good ones.
Author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

Quote: Know you not that a good man does nothing for appearance sake, but for the sake of having done right?
Author: Epictetus

Quote: Philosophers can debate the meaning of life, but you need a Lord who can declare the meaning of life.
Author: Max Lucado

Quote: We have now sunk to a depth at which restatement of the obvious is the first duty of intelligent men.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: We hold the future still timidly, but perceive it for the first time as a function of our own action.
Author: J.D. Bernal

Quote: What is existence for but to be laughed at if men in their twenties have already attained the utmost?
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: la vida sólo puede ser entendida mirando hacia atrás; aunque deba ser vivida mirando hacia adelante
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: As the future ripens in the past,so the past rots in the future --a terrible festival of dead leaves.
Author: Anna Akhmatova

Quote: If I never meet you In this lifeLet me feel the lackA glance from your eyesThen my life Will be yours
Author: James Jones

Quote: Kerouac: You're ruining American poetry, O'Hara.O'Hara: That's more than you ever did for it, Kerouac
Author: Frank O'Hara

Quote: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: I don't think all writers are sad, she said.I think it's the other way around—all sad people write.
Author: Lang Leav

Quote: Rewriting the negative beliefs you have learned is the essence of becoming the director of your life.
Author: Deborah Day

Quote: A religion that takes no account of practical affairs and does not help to solve them is no religion.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Gods don't like people not doing much work. People who aren't busy all the time might start to think.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: That's the funny thing about religion: it doesn't matter what you say, you're going to upset someone.
Author: Lewis Black

Quote: A lot of men wouldn't like being called a romantic. It's not macho enough.'Quite often men are fools.
Author: P.C. Cast

Quote: I knew you would do me good in some way, at some time--I saw it in your eyes when I first beheld you.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: I'll affect you slowlyas if you were having a picnic in a dream. There will be no ants.It won't rain.
Author: Richard Brautigan

Quote: Neither of us says the word love, not once. It would be tempting fate; it would be romance, bad luck.
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: Most institutions demand unqualified faith; but the institution of science makes skepticism a virtue.
Author: Robert K. Merton

Quote: Scientists seek the lawfulness of events. It is the task of Religion to fit man into this lawfulness.
Author: Frank Herbert

Quote: The History Of The Universe In Three WordsCHAPTER ONEBang!CHAPTER TWOsssssCHAPTER THREEcrunch.THE END
Author: Iain M. Banks

Quote: Childhood should be carefree, playing in the sun; not living a nightmare in the darkness of the soul.
Author: Dave Pelzer

Quote: As an outside; don't worry about failure, because failure will take care of itself. Focus on success.
Author: Henry Cavill

Quote: Enjoy your sweat because hard work doesn't guarantee success, but without it you don't have a chance.
Author: Alex Rodriguez

Quote: I'd rather invest in an entrepreneur who has failed before than one who assumes success from day one.
Author: Kevin O'Leary

Quote: The French say you get hungry when you're eating, and I get inspired when I'm working. It's my engine
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: You measure the size of the accomplishment by the obstacles you have to overcome to reach your goals.
Author: Booker T. Washington

Quote: You've got to work hard for your success and you've got to have a steady presence. That's the secret.
Author: Kid Rock

Quote: Every decent con man knows that the simplest truth is more powerful than even the most elaborate lie.
Author: Ally Carter

Quote: It is a time of change,'' Sazed said. ''Perhaps it is also time to learn of other truths, other ways.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: There are a dozen views about everything until you know the answer. Then there's never more than one.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: If we each had to butcher our own meat, there would be a great increase in the number of vegetarians.
Author: Ernest Howard Crosby

Quote: We choose to eat meat and have therefore built slaughter houses for the animals and hospitals for us.
Author: Akbarali Jetha

Quote: You cannot live a nonviolent life as long as you are consuming violence. Please consider going vegan.
Author: Gary L. Francione

Quote: I have always felt that doubt was the beginning of wisdom, and the fear of God was the end of wisdom.
Author: Clarence Darrow

Quote: Lucy: You learn more when you lose Charlie Brown: Well then I must be the smartest person in world!!!
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Any word you have to hunt for in a thesaurus is the wrong word. There are no exceptions to this rule.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: No tears in the writer, no tears in the reader. No surprise in the writer, no surprise in the reader.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Wit is the sudden marriage of ideas which before their union were not perceived to have any relation.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: You can't put much on paper before you betray your secret self, try as you will to keep things civil.
Author: Patricia Hampl

Quote: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.
Author: James Allen

Quote: Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily, even if you had no title or position.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Before you speak, ask yourself, is it kind, is it necessary, is it true, does it improve the silence?
Author: Sathya Sai Baba

Quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak. Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: Failure is a prerequisite for great success. If you want success faster, double your rate of failure.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: First comes the shy wish. Then you must have the heart to have the dream. Then, you work, and work.
Author: Estee Lauder

Quote: Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow know what you truly want to become.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.
Author: Paramahansa Yogananda

Quote: He who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead; his eyes are closed.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Too much sanity may be madness and the maddest of all, to see life as it is and not as it should be.
Author: Miguel de Cervantes

Quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
Author: Laozi

Quote: Glory is a heavy burden, a murdering poison, and to bear it is an art. And to have that art is rare.
Author: Oriana Fallaci

Quote: I never called my work an 'art'. It's part of show business, the business of building entertainment.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Painting, n.: The art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather, and exposing them to the critic.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: Surrealism: An archaic term. Formerly an art movement. No longer distinguishable from everyday life.
Author: Brad Holland

Quote: The very essence of the creative is its novelty, and hence we have no standard by which to judge it.
Author: Carl Rogers

Quote: When artists make art, they shouldn't question whether it is permissible to do one thing or another.
Author: Sol LeWitt

Quote: Just the knowledge that a good book is awaiting one at the end of a long day makes that day happier.
Author: Kathleen Thompson Norris

Quote: Nothing ever invented provides such sustenance, such infinite reward for time spent, as a good book.
Author: David McCullough

Quote: Readers are bullied in schoolyards and in locker-rooms as much as in government offices and prisons.
Author: Alberto Manguel

Quote: Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: To prohibit the reading of certain books is to declare the inhabitants to be either fools or slaves.
Author: Claude Adrien Helvétius

Quote: . . . owning a dog always ended with this sadness because dogs just don't live as long as people do.
Author: John Grogan

Quote: Absence is a house so vast that inside you will pass through its walls and hang pictures on the air.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: He made me feel unhinged . . . like he could take me apart and put me back together again and again.
Author: Chelsie Shakespeare

Quote: My father told me once that the most important thing every man should know is what he would die for.
Author: Tana French

Quote: My idea of God is not a divine idea. It has to be shattered time after time. He shatters it Himself.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Everything can be explained to the people, on the single condition that you want them to understand.
Author: Frantz Fanon

Quote: Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence.
Author: Abigail Adams

Quote: In order to have faith in his own path, he does not need to prove that someone else's path is wrong.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Prayer [is] the quiet, persistent living of our life of desire and faith in the presence of our God.
Author: Andrew Murray

Quote: Some acts of faith, I believe, have the power to grant us something infinitely wiser than we imagine
Author: Ursula Hegi

Quote: Something about being rejected at Church Camp felt so much more awful than being rejected at school.
Author: Craig Thompson

Quote: That was the last cruel irony of Tobias's life: that he doomed the woman he would have died to save.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: The day you learn to be publically specific in your prayer, that is the day you will discover power.
Author: David Wilkerson

Quote: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.
Author: Thomas Aquinas

Quote: Friends confront each other sometimes, and sometimes the friendship lasts, and sometimes it doesn't.
Author: Brooke Elliott

Quote: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: My reputation is too important to put it aside for purposes of some friendship. We have a job to do.
Author: Stephanie Tubbs Jones

Quote: Restoration of friendship with Russia, our biggest neighbor, is necessary for our peace and economy.
Author: Bidzina Ivanishvili

Quote: There are no rules for friendship. It must be left to itself. We cannot force it any more than love.
Author: William Hazlitt

Quote: I certainly hadn't expected to walk away from today's trip with joint custody of a miniature dragon.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Family, friends and relationships are the blessings of the God. They are the best way to access God.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: He's not safe, but he's good (referring to Aslan, the Lion, in The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe)
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: It was by faith, nothing wavering, that Joseph saw God our Eternal Father and Jesus Christ, His Son.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: The fact of God is necessary for the fact of man. Think God away and man has no ground of existence.
Author: A.W. Tozer

Quote: There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Expectations make people miserable, so whatever yours are, lower them. You'll definitely be happier.
Author: Simone Elkeles

Quote: I've always believed that happiness is just around the corner. The trick is fining the right corner.
Author: Eric Weiner

Quote: Maybe if we stopped trying to achieve movie standards of greatness, we'd be happy with what we have.
Author: Amber L. Johnson

Quote: Some day you will find out that there is far more happiness in another's happiness than in your own.
Author: Honoré de Balzac

Quote: The best way to insure you achieve the greatest satisfaction out of life is to behave intentionally.
Author: Deborah Day

Quote: The pleasure of criticizing takes away from us the pleasure of being moved by some very fine things.
Author: Jean de La Bruyère

Quote: You are forgiven for your happiness and your successes only if you generously consent to share them.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: ...and that's when I get to wondering, what would happen if I told her she something good, ever day?
Author: Kathryn Stockett

Quote: Every night when I go to bed, I hope that I may never wake again, and every morning renews my grief.
Author: Franz Schubert

Quote: Hope is some extraordinary spiritual grace that God gives us to control our fears, not to oust them.
Author: Vincent McNabb

Quote: I don't know. I have incredible amounts of hope that things can change. It takes people who believe.
Author: Morgan Spurlock

Quote: We must free ourselves of the hope that the sea will ever rest. We must learn to sail in high winds.
Author: Aristotle Onassis

Quote: hope could betray you—but if you had no hope, life could actuallysurprise you in the best of ways.
Author: Amy Lane

Quote: It's not over if you're still here,” Chronicler said. “It's not a tragedy if you're still alive.
Author: Patrick Rothfuss

Quote: And so the dentist says 'Rinse.' So you lean over, and you're lookin' at this miniature toilet bowl.
Author: Bill Cosby

Quote: Begin at the beginning,"the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: Eat a live frog first thing in the morning and nothing worse will happen to you the rest of the day.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I always pass on good advice. It is the only thing to do with it. It is never of any use to oneself.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I can imagine no more comfortable frame of mind for the conduct of life than a humorous resignation.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: I think that sense of humor is important in marriage. A sense of humor gets people through marriage.
Author: Connie Britton

Quote: i told you he'd freak out, she siad. didn't i?ah, the i told you so, jace said. always a classy move
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: I was talking aloud to myself. A habit of the old: they choose the wisest person present to speak to
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: If I had to describe my sense of humor, I would say it's contemporary wit, you know what I'm saying?
Author: Tracy Morgan

Quote: If you can understand the humor in the drawing part you'll probably get the humor in the audio part.
Author: Eric San

Quote: In rough times, pathfinders rely on work, friends, humor and prayer. They develop a support network.
Author: Gail Sheehy

Quote: Keep your sense of humor, my friend; if you don't have a sense of humor it just isn't funny anymore.
Author: Wavy Gravy

Quote: Men love it. They have a sense of humor, whereas a lot of women are threatened or just don't get it.
Author: Lara Flynn Boyle

Quote: My stories are very somber, so I think I need the comic ingredient. Besides, life has so much humor.
Author: Manuel Puig

Quote: There are two kinds of people I don't trust: people who don't drink and people who collect stickers.
Author: Chelsea Handler

Quote: ...Next time you're faced with a choice, do the right thing. It hurts everyone less in the long run.
Author: Wendelin Van Draanen

Quote: A fool's mind is at the mercy of his tongue and a wise man's tongue is under the control ofhis mind.
Author: Hazrat Ali ibn Abu-Talib

Quote: Accept yourself: flaws, quirks, talents, secret thoughts, all of it, and experience true liberation.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: At that moment, the urge to be writing was stronger than any notion she had of what she might write.
Author: Ian McEwan

Quote: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.
Author: William James

Quote: Bukan mudah untuk berubah... dari tanpa arah ke sejadah, dari tepi jalanan ke sujud menghadap Tuhan.
Author: Hlovate

Quote: Do you have any advice for your readers?Lead the life that's yours instead of faking someone else's.
Author: Sandy Nathan

Quote: Don't waste your energy trying to change opinions ... Do your thing, and don't care if they like it.
Author: Tina Fey

Quote: I imagine what would happen if everyone turned their regrets into wishes, went around shouting them.
Author: Nina LaCour

Quote: I take thee at thy word:Call me but love, and I'll be new baptized;Henceforth I never will be Romeo.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: If you care about what you do and work hard at it, there isn't anything you can't do if you want to.
Author: Jim Henson

Quote: Is it easy? Usually not. But you don't forgive people for their benefit. You do it for your benefit.
Author: Andrew Matthews

Quote: It doesn't matter who you are, where you come from. The ability to triumph begins with you - always.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: Know that true change is demonstrated only by your actions around everyone, not just certain people.
Author: Tanya R. Liverman

Quote: Remember that a wish held fervently turns into belief, and a belief held diligently becomes reality.
Author: Jim Stovall

Quote: So what? You're another person, so of course you look different. What do you need to be ashamed for?
Author: Yana Toboso

Quote: Sometimes the only reason for us to be somewhere else is to see things from a different perspective.
Author: Leila Summers

Quote: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
Author: Francis of Assisi

Quote: The beauty of the world...has two edges, one of laughter, one of anguish, cutting the heart asunder.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: The greatest risk to man is not that he aims too high and misses, but that he aims too low and hits.
Author: Michaelangelo

Quote: The problem is not that you have problems; the problem is that you see having problems as a problem.
Author: Maurice Makalu

Quote: The tricky part about discovering our giftedness is that it may be in an area that feels unexpected.
Author: Meg Meeker

Quote: The ultimate reason for setting goals is to entice you to become the person it takes to achieve them
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Visualize this thing you want. See it, feel it, believe in it. Make your mental blueprint and begin.
Author: Robert Collier

Quote: When I was growing up I always wanted to be someone. Now I realize I should have been more specific.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: When we are aware of our weaknesses or negative tendencies, we open the opportunity to work on them.
Author: Allan Lokos

Quote: When you're screwing up and nobody says anything to you anymore, that means they've given up on you.
Author: Randy Pausch

Quote: You don't need to understand what the world is, just let your life flow with it and become something
Author: Jayson Engay

Quote: You will see that the things you desire most are the very things that bring you the greatest sorrow.
Author: Christopher Pike

Quote: Your life is a show and you're the star so don't let anyone walk on set and treat you like an extra.
Author: Lucas Mascotto-Carbone

Quote: I found a beautiful lane called "I know nothing". it leads it way ; all you got to do is walk in it.
Author: Gopichand Lagadapati

Quote: Then we shan't regard anyone as a lover of knowledge or wisdom who is fussy about what he studies…
Author: Plato

Quote: Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Everyday it gets easier to connect with an electronic device that it is to connect with real people.
Author: Pablo

Quote: How can I be substantial if I do not cast a shadow? I must have a dark side also If I am to be whole
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: I'm the one that has to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life, the way I want to.
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: Life is very interesting... in the end, some of your greatest pains, become your greatest strengths.
Author: Drew Barrymore

Quote: No one ever does live happily ever after, but we leave the children to find that out for themselves.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: One of the greatest journeys in life is overcoming insecurity and learning to truly not give a shit.
Author: J.A. Konrath

Quote: Our lives were just beginning, our favorite moment was right now, our favorite songs were unwritten.
Author: Rob Sheffield

Quote: The irony of life is that those who wear masks often tell us more truths than those with open faces.
Author: Marie Lu

Quote: The more of your private life you put into the public domain, the smaller your private life becomes.
Author: Kevin McCloud

Quote: The most satisfying thing in life is to have been able to give a large part of one's self to others.
Author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

Quote: The true hypocrite is the one who ceases to perceive his deception, the one who lies with sincerity.
Author: André Gide

Quote: There are many things worth living for, a few things worth dying for, and nothing worth killing for.
Author: Tom Robbins

Quote: To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.
Author: Yann Martel

Quote: Whoever loves becomes humble. Those who love have , so to speak , pawned a part of their narcissism.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: breathtaking, adj.Those mornings when we kiss and surrender for an hour before we say a single word.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: Good night, good night! parting is such sweet sorrow, That I shall say good night till it be morrow.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: He was contemplation and enthusiasm. Ambition and strong coffee. I could have looked at him forever.
Author: E. Lockhart

Quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the Heart's affections and the truth of the Imagination.
Author: John Keats

Quote: If people did not love one another, I really don't see what use there would be in having any spring.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: I'm the kind of boy that can fall in love with any girl because I love with the heart, not the eyes.
Author: Niall Horan

Quote: Let us not seek to satisfy our thirst for freedom by drinking from the cup of bitterness and hatred.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: Love is bullshit. Emotion is bullshit. I am a rock. A jerk. I'm an uncaring asshole and proud of it.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: There is no disguise which can hide love for long where it exists, or simulate it where it does not.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quote: What I know is, is that if you do work that you love, and the work fulfills you, the rest will come.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: You don't love someone because they're perfect, you love them in spite of the fact that they're not.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: You know that when I hate you, it is because I love you to a point of passion that unhinges my soul.
Author: Julie de Lespinasse

Quote: You're better than seven years of food. You're better than windows. You're even better than the sky.
Author: Shannon Hale

Quote: Everything that is really great and inspiring is created by the individual who can labor in freedom.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I am not the moon orbiting around your planet; I am the sun that will burn through your frozen mind.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Intelligence entails a strong mind, but genius entails a heart of a lion in tune with a strong mind.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Man's mind may be likened to a garden, which may be intelligently cultivated or allowed to run wild.
Author: James Allen

Quote: At some point, you just pull off the Band-Aid, and it hurts, but then it's over and you're relieved.
Author: John Green

Quote: I would venture to guess that Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: The farther you go...the harder it is to return. The world has many edges and it's easy to fall off.
Author: Anderson Cooper

Quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: The truth is life is full of joy and full of great sorrow, but you can't have one without the other.
Author: Andre Dubus III

Quote: When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family.
Author: Jim Butcher

Quote: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: A nation is a detour of nature to arrive at five or six great men- yes, and then to get around them.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: If you reveal your secrets to the wind,you should not blame the wind forrevealing them to the trees.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: If you wish to make Pythocles rich, do not add to his store of money, but subtract from his desires.
Author: Epicurus

Quote: Only that day dawns to which we are awake. There is more day to dawn. The sun is but a morning star.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Philosophizing is simply one way of being afraid, a cowardly pretense that doesn't get you anywhere.
Author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline

Quote: Question the answers, I repeated every class. Reevaluate your conclusions when the evidence changes.
Author: Craig M. Mullaney

Quote: The first method for estimating the intelligence of a ruler is to look at the men he has around him.
Author: Niccolò Machiavelli

Quote: The search for something permanent is one of the deepest of the instincts leading men to philosophy.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: With the truth, all given facts harmonize; but with what is false, the truth soon hits a wrong note.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The maturity of man—that means, to have reacquired the seriousness that one had as a child at play
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Following all the rules leaves a completed checklist. Following your heart achieves a completed you.
Author: Ray A. Davis

Quote: You were born with a song in the seat of your soul; let the life that you live be the singing of it.
Author: LaShaun Middlebrooks Collier

Quote: Scopul existenței fiecărui individ este plăcerea și cine o contestă ori e ipocrit, ori imbecil.
Author: Rodica Ojog-Braşoveanu

Quote: Because that was then and this is now. Because the past is gone, even though it defines the present.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: One of the most difficult things he'd ever done was turn away and leave her standing in the shadows.
Author: Rachel Gibson

Quote: Peace, sweet peace finally comes to men when they humbly yield to the gentle pressure of the Spirit.
Author: Spencer W. Kimball

Quote: To surrender to ignorance and call it God has always been premature, and it remains premature today.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: What is it you most dislike? Stupidity, especially in its nastiest forms of racism and superstition.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: Vane grabbed me. “DuLac, let's chat.”Chat. British-speak for “Stand still while I yell at you.
Author: Priya Ardis

Quote: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.
Author: Edwin Hubble

Quote: Nothing in the universe can travel at the speed of light, they say, forgetful of the shadow`s speed.
Author: Howard Nemerov

Quote: The aim of science is not to open the door to infinite wisdom, but to set a limit to infinite error.
Author: Bertolt Brecht

Quote: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: Encouragement of higher education for our youth is critical to the success of our collective future.
Author: Charles B. Rangel

Quote: If you find yourself drawn to an event against all logic, go. The universe is telling you something.
Author: Gloria Steinem

Quote: Like the British Constitution, she owes her success in practice to her inconsistencies in principle.
Author: Thomas Hardy

Quote: Never sit back and wait for a opportunity to find you, get up and search for one, it exists find it!
Author: Victoria Addino

Quote: One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.
Author: Arthur Ashe

Quote: People seldom see the halting and painful steps by which the most insignificant success is achieved.
Author: Anne Sullivan

Quote: Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Success or failure in business is caused more by the mental attitude even than by mental capacities.
Author: Walter Scott

Quote: The more defects a man may have, the older he is, the less lovable, the more resounding his success.
Author: Marquis de Sade

Quote: You've achieved success in your field when you don't know whether what you're doing is work or play.
Author: Warren Beatty

Quote: I always make sure that the world will prove me right. It gives me the freedom to contradict myself.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: In the end, Leck should have stuck to his lies. For it was the truth he almost told that killed him.
Author: Kristin Cashore

Quote: The ideals which have always shone before me and filled me with joy are goodness, beauty, and truth.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: It is not your right to deny animals their freedom so you can harm them, enslave them and kill them.
Author: Gary Yourofsky

Quote: I became a vegetarian after realizing that animals feel afraid, cold, hungry and unhappy like we do.
Author: Cesar Chavez

Quote: Nothing hurts a good soul and a kind heart more than to live amongst people who can't understand it.
Author: Ali Ibn Abi Taalib

Quote: Nothing hurts a good soul and a kind heart more than to live amongst people who can't understand it.
Author: Ali Ibn Abi Talib

Quote: Until he extends the circle of his compassion to all living things, man will not himself find peace.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: We choose to eat meat and have therefore built slaughterhouses for the animals and hospitals for us.
Author: Akbarali Jetha

Quote: When I see bacon, I see a pig, I see a little friend, and that's why I can't eat it. Simple as that.
Author: Paul McCartney

Quote: When I see bacon, I see a pig, I see a little friend, and that's why I can't eat it. Simple as that.
Author: Paul McCartney

Quote: I ask not for any crownBut that which all may win;Nor try to conquer any worldExcept the one within.
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Quote: It seems wisest to assume the worst from the beginning...and let anything better come as a surprise.
Author: Jules Verne

Quote: The pleasures arising from thinking and learning will make us think and learn all the more. 1153a 23
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform (or pause and reflect).
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: A good novel tells us the truth about its hero; but a bad novel tells us the truth about its author.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: All I need is a sheet of paperand something to write with, and thenI can turn the world upside down.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I need solitude for my writing; not 'like a hermit' - that wouldn't be enough - but like a dead man.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quote: Literature is strewn with the wreckage of those who have minded beyond reason the opinion of others.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Set your fantasies in the here and now and then, if challenged, claim to be writing Magical Realism.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: You don't write about the horrors of war. No. You write about a kid's burnt socks lying in the road.
Author: Richard Price

Quote: If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.
Author: Nikola Tesla

Quote: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: Most people achieved their greatest success one step beyond what looked like their greatest failure.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: The most virtuous are those who content themselves with being virtuous without seeking to appear so.
Author: Plato

Quote: To be truly positive in the eyes of some, you have to risk appearing negative in the eyes of others.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: When you have vision it affects your attitude. Your attitude is optimistic rather than pessimistic.
Author: Charles Swindoll

Quote: Yesterday is the past, tomorrow is the future, today is a gift - that's why it's called the present.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: It is very obvious that we are not influenced by “facts” but by our interpretation of the facts.
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression.
Author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

Quote: If you know somethin' well, you can always paint it but people would be better off buyin' chickens.
Author: Grandma Moses

Quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Whether it be personal or musical, I just think I'm a walking art piece, just a ball of creativity.
Author: Chris Brown

Quote: It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Libraries are not made; they grow. Good as it is to inherit a library, it is better to collect one.
Author: Augustine Birrell

Quote: My books are friends that never fail me."(Letter to his mother, Margaret A. Carlyle; 17 March 1817)
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: One book calls to another unexpectedly, creating alliances across different cultures and centuries.
Author: Alberto Manguel

Quote: There are good books which are only for adults.There are no good books which are only for children.
Author: W.H. Auden

Quote: There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books.
Author: Irving Stone

Quote: Mendacity is a system that we live in,"declares Brick. "Liquor is one way out an'death's the other.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Quote: The wages of sin are death, but by the time taxes are taken out, it's just sort of a tired feeling.
Author: Paula Poundstone

Quote: Thinking of death--strange, beautiful, terrible and a long way off--made me feel happier than ever.
Author: Dodie Smith

Quote: Create your own path.Don't blindly follow the massess... because most of the time the "M"is silent.
Author: Abhishek Shukla

Quote: Education becomes most rich and alive when it confronts the reality of moral conflict in the world.
Author: Howard Zinn

Quote: I do not want the peace which passeth understanding, I want the understanding which bringeth peace.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: And remember this most of all: when it is darkest, that is when you can see the stars most clearly.
Author: Kathleen McGowan

Quote: Each moment of worry, anxiety or stress represents lack of faith in miracles, for they never cease.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: I prefer a world with many beliefs and religions.It stimulates my faith to keep growing day by day.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: I came from a real tough neighborhood. Why, every time I shut the window I hurt somebody's fingers.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: I'm bad and I'm going to hell, and I don't care. I'd rather be in hell than anywhere where you are.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: Once I pulled a job, I was so stupid. I picked a guy's pocket on an airplane and made a run for it.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: The old woman was the kind who would not cut down a large old tree because it was a large old tree.
Author: Flannery O'Connor

Quote: Because you're a creation of God, you reflect the Divine qualities of creativity, wisdom, and love.
Author: Doreen Virtue

Quote: He knew only that his child was his warrant. He said: If he is not the word of God God never spoke.
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Quote: I think it pisses God off if you walk by the color purple in a field somewhere and don't notice it.
Author: Alice Walker

Quote: It is far more comforting to think God listened and said no, than to think that nobody's out there.
Author: Mitch Albom

Quote: To be a Christian means to forgive the inexcusable because God has forgiven the inexcusable in you.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: But the happiest people are the ones who understand that good things occur when one allows them to.
Author: Danny Wallace

Quote: God favors men and women who delight in being made worthy of happiness before the happiness itself.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: The pursuit of happiness is a most ridiculous phrase; if you pursue happiness you'll never find it.
Author: C.P. Snow

Quote: The quickest way to experiencing the peace inside, is to learn to recognize when I am not at peace.
Author: James Patrick McDonald

Quote: The really happy person is the one who can enjoy the scenery, even when they have to take a detour.
Author: James Hopwood Jeans

Quote: Who's happy? Happy is just what people think they are when they can't find anything to bitch about.
Author: Rasmenia Massoud

Quote: Having a sense of purpose is having a sense of self. A course to plot is a destination to hope for.
Author: Bryant H. McGill

Quote: Hope is itself a species of happiness, and, perhaps, the chief happiness, which this world affords.
Author: William Samuel Johnson

Quote: Hope, deceiving as it is, serves at least to lead us to the end of our lives by an agreeable route.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quote: I hope the wonder of what happens to my characters never goes away. That yearning keeps me writing.
Author: Kimberly Willis Holt

Quote: I threw my hands in the air and said show me something.He said, "if you dare come a little closer".
Author: Rihanna

Quote: I'm proud of my background, so I hope there will be more roles where Hispanics are being portrayed.
Author: Mario Lopez

Quote: Summertime. It was a song. It was a season. I wondered if that season would ever live inside of me.
Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

Quote: Together we can make a world where cancer no longer means living with fear, without hope, or worse.
Author: Patrick Swayze

Quote: With my pictures, what I hope is that it encourages the reader to imagine more pictures of his own.
Author: Quentin Blake

Quote: A cavalryman's horse should be smarter than he is. But the horse must never be alowed to know this.
Author: Steven Pressfield

Quote: Basically, all women are nurturers and healers, and all men are mental patients to varying degrees.
Author: Nelson DeMille

Quote: Canada is a myth people made up to entertain children, like the Tooth Fairy. There's no such place.
Author: Christopher Moore

Quote: Congratulations, you have a sense of humor. And to those who didn't: Go stick your head in the mud.
Author: Jesse Ventura

Quote: Guns are our friends because in a country without guns, I'm what's known as "prey."All females are.
Author: Ann Coulter

Quote: I believe that economists put decimal points in their forecasts to show they have a sense of humor.
Author: William Gilmore Simms

Quote: I don't think that because you die and move on to somewhere else that you lose your sense of humor.
Author: Peter Jackson

Quote: I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I try to stay in a constant state of confusion just because of the expression it leaves on my face.
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: If you drink much from a bottle marked 'poison' it is certain to disagree with you sooner or later.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own.
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: It never seems to occur to some people, that, like beauty, a sense of humor may sometimes be fatal.
Author: Edgar Rice Burroughs

Quote: It's easier to sit there and say you don't like feminists because they don't have a sense of humor.
Author: Joan Jett

Quote: Nothing in man is more serious than his sense of humor; it is the sign that he wants all the truth.
Author: Mark Van Doren

Quote: So, have a little fun. Soon enough you'll be dead and burning in Hell with the rest of your family.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: There are two types of people in this world. People who hate clowns...and clowns. (Bobby Pendragon)
Author: D.J. MacHale

Quote: Writing is like getting married. One should never commit oneself until one is amazed at one's luck.
Author: Iris Murdoch

Quote: Champions have the courage to keep turning the pages because they know a better chapter lies ahead.
Author: Paula White

Quote: Dreams are what keep us growing. They are what keep us alive. To give up, is to let our dreams die.
Author: Phil Mitchell

Quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
Author: Jimmy Dean

Quote: I don't look for love. Love looks for me.""Why?""Because it needs me. Because I'm not afraid of it.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: I want to be an inspirational model. I want people to look at me and say, 'Wow, she looks healthy.'
Author: Ireland Baldwin

Quote: If you don't go after what you want; you could spend your entire life settling for what you can get.
Author: Mo Stegall

Quote: It is books that are a key to the wide world; if you can't do anything else, read all that you can.
Author: Jane Hamilton

Quote: Knowing the precies answers is not as crucial as the certainty that the answers do, in fact, exist.
Author: Chris Heimerdinger

Quote: My happiness is not the means to any end. It is the end. It is its own goal. It is its own purpose.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: No matter how much falls on us, we keep plowing ahead. That's the only way to keep the roads clear.
Author: Greg Kincaid

Quote: No matter what happens, or how bad it seems today, life does go on, and it will be better tomorrow.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Optimists enrich the present, enhance the future,challenge the improbable and attain the impossible
Author: William Arthur Ward

Quote: Republicans are for both the man and the dollar, but in case of conflict the man before the dollar.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Sometimes the wisest choice is to avoid reading between the lines even though the message is clear.
Author: Berivan Selim

Quote: Start by doing what is necessary, then what is possible, and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
Author: Francis of Assisi

Quote: Those who travel to mountain-tops are half in love with themselves, and half in love with oblivion.
Author: Robert Macfarlane

Quote: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.
Author: Margaret Walker

Quote: Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
Author: Nido Qubein

Quote: I was born into Bolívar's labyrinth, and so I must believe in the hope of Rabelais' Great Perhaps.
Author: John Green

Quote: A home filled with nothing but yourself. It's heavy, that lightness. It's crushing, that emptiness.
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: Feeling lost, crazy and desperate belongs to a good life as much as optimism, certainty and reason.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: I believe there is another world waiting for us. A better world. And I'll be waiting for you there.
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: I can't imagine a person becoming a success who doesn't give this game of life everything he's got.
Author: Walter Cronkite

Quote: I remember my mother's prayers and they have always followed me. They have clung to me all my life.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: I want to keep my dreams, even bad ones, because without them, I might have nothing all night long.
Author: Joseph Heller

Quote: Loneliness adds beauty to life. It puts a special burn on sunsets and makes night air smell better.
Author: Henry Rollins

Quote: One can be very much in love with a woman without wishing to spend the rest of one's life with her.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: The only thing you have to do in this life is die,"said Mrs. Pinsky..."everything else is a choice.
Author: Karen Thompson Walker

Quote: The whole secret of life is to be interested in one thing profoundly and in a thousand things well.
Author: Horace Walpole

Quote: There are some places in life where you can only go alone. Embrace the beauty of your solo journey.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: Water and air, the two essential fluids on which all life depends, have become global garbage cans.
Author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

Quote: Well, I like to eat, sleep, drink, and be in love.I like to work, read, learn, and understand life.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: You've a good heart. Sometimes that's enough to see you safe wherever you go. But mostly, it's not.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: ...love is the sum of our choices, the strength of our commitments, the ties that bind us together.
Author: Emily Giffin

Quote: Do you think I'm pretty?I think you're beautifulBeautiful?You are so beautiful, it hurts sometimes.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Don't be reckless with other people's hearts. Don't put up with people who are reckless with yours.
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: Having an eye for beauty isn't the same thing as a weakness...except possibly when it comes to you.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: I had to touch you with my hands, I had to taste you with my tongue; one can't love and do nothing.
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: I think it is all a matter of love; the more you love a memory the stronger and stranger it becomes
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: If you like her, if she makes you happy, and if you feel like you know her---then don't let her go.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back they're yours; if they don't they never were.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: It's useless to hold a person to anything he says while he's in love, drunk, or running for office.
Author: Shirley MacLaine

Quote: Love consists of not looking each other in the eye, but of looking outwardly in the same direction.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: One ought to hold on to one's heart; for if one lets it go, one soon loses control of the head too.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Right now we are here, and nothing can mar our perfection, or steal the joy of this perfect moment.
Author: Audrey Niffenegger

Quote: The world is not comprehensible, but it is embraceable: through the embracing of one of its beings.
Author: Martin Buber

Quote: This time I wouldn't forget him, because I couldn't ever forgive him - for breaking my heart twice.
Author: James Patterson

Quote: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
Author: Satchel Paige

Quote: You have within you,right now,everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: A brain is only capable of what it could conceive, andit couldnt concieve what it hasnt experienced
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
Author: Rose Wilder Lane

Quote: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: In the world I amAlways a strangerI do not understand its languageIt does not understand my silence
Author: Bei Dao

Quote: It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: Please believe that one single positive dream is more important than a thousand negative realities.
Author: Adeline Yen Mah

Quote: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.
Author: William Wordsworth

Quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: You're wishin' too much, baby. You gotta stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone oughtta be.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: Believe me if you consult philosophy she will persuade you not to lit so long at your counting desk
Author: Seneca

Quote: Every passion borders on the chaotic, but the collector's passion borders on the chaos of memories.
Author: Walter Benjamin

Quote: If the world was made for us, then it BELONGS to us and we can do what we damn well please with it.
Author: Daniel Quinn

Quote: If time is precious, no book that will not improve by repeated readings deserves to be read at all.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather, we should thank God that such men lived.
Author: George S. Patton Jr.

Quote: One great function of the arts is to keep ideals alive in a culture that does not yet realize them.
Author: Susan Neiman

Quote: The most boring and unproductive question one can ask of any religion is whether or not it is true.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: when a language dies, a way of understanding the world dies with it, a way of looking at the world.
Author: George Steiner

Quote: You were born a child of light's wonderful secret— you return to the beauty you have always been.
Author: Aberjhani

Quote: My imagination makes me human and makes me a fool; it gives me all the world and exiles me from it.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quote: We were hooked when we woke.We had arms for each other.But I yearned to resumeMy dreams of another.
Author: Roman Payne

Quote: You dance inside my chest,where no one sees you,but sometimes I do, and thatsight becomes this art.
Author: Rumi

Quote: You had this expression on your face, like you weren't quite sure you were supposed to be on Earth.
Author: pleasefindthis

Quote: Being truly happy in life involves you feeling more in control of the direction your life is going.
Author: Deborah Day

Quote: Do you always ask me the same questions you ask him?""It depends on whether or not I get an answer.
Author: Anne Bishop

Quote: Women show men beauty in things beyond their ambitions. Women tell men to stop and smell the roses.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: I want everyone to wear what they want and mix it in their own way. That, to me, is what is modern.
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: Sleep frees our imaginations from the confines of its imprisonment. Last night I dreamt of penguins
Author: B.B. Taylor

Quote: Faithfulness in small things leads to faithfulness in great things, and never the other way around.
Author: Jerry L. Lewis

Quote: Hereafter she is only my sister in name; not because I disown her, but because she has disowned me.
Author: Emily Brontë

Quote: Men are jealous of every woman, even when they don't have the slightest interest in her themselves.
Author: Jan Neruda

Quote: One would go mad if one took the Bible seriously; but to take it seriously one must be already mad.
Author: Aleister Crowley

Quote: Religion is like a pair of shoes.....Find one that fits for you, but don't make me wear your shoes.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The only thing that is still free in this world is religion, which is why a lot of people "find it.
Author: Jimmy Buffett

Quote: One of the advantages of science is that one's work, ultimately, is either replicated or it is not.
Author: Kay Redfield Jamison

Quote: The greatest shortcoming of the human race is our inability to understand the exponential function.
Author: Albert A. Bartlett

Quote: Mr. Watson — Come here — I want to see you.[First intelligible words spoken over the telephone]
Author: Alexander Graham Bell

Quote: Fate and destiny are close woven within us and near them can be found the true genius of our lives.
Author: Michael Meade

Quote: I don't have a thing,"Tengo said, "except my soul.""Sounds like a job for Mephistopheles,"she said.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: If not for the success that medicine has made, I might be part of a much different story right now.
Author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

Quote: I'm either going to go completely mental, completely bankrupt, or have the best success of my life.
Author: Katy Perry

Quote: I've had my share of struggle. I believe, never take success to your head or failure to your heart.
Author: Randeep Hooda

Quote: Most great people have attained their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Success is due to our stretching to the challenges of life. Failure comes when we shrink from them.
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: the lesson of Buffett was: To succeed in a spectacular fashion you had to be spectacularly unusual.
Author: Michael Lewis

Quote: The only yardstick for success our society has is being a champion. No one remembers anything else.
Author: John Madden

Quote: We always reminisce about how everyone tried to get Diane Lane's attention, to very little success.
Author: Rob Lowe

Quote: When we give ourselves permission to fail..we at the same time, give ourselves permission to excel.
Author: Eloise Ristad

Quote: A thousand times I was ready to regret and take back my rash statement - yet it had been the truth.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: I love the stars.Because they can't say anything.I love the stars.Because they do not judge anyone.
Author: Natsuki Takaya

Quote: If what he said was the truth, it broke her heart. If what he said was a lie, it was broken anyway.
Author: Christine Feehan

Quote: If you give up what you want most for what you think you should want more, you'll end up miserable.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: Night is a time of rigor, but also of mercy. There are truths which one can see only when it's dark
Author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

Quote: You don't believe things because they make your life better, you believe them because they're true.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: I personally chose to go vegan because I educated myself on factory farming and cruelty to animals.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: I'm a vegan. I respect the environment, and I do my best to spread the importance of such an issue.
Author: Jared Leto

Quote: The greatness of a nation and it's moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
Author: Gandhi

Quote: In life, the hardest decisions often have to be made more than once. But each time, it gets easier.
Author: Matthew J. Kirby

Quote: Almost anyone can be an author; the business is to collect money and fame from this state of being.
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: Failure is usually boring. It is the credible but unrealized threat of failure that is interesting.
Author: Robin D. Laws

Quote: The more you read, the less apt you are to make a fool of yourself with your pen or word processor.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: The writer is either a practicing recluse or a delinquent, guilt-ridden one--or both. Usually both.
Author: Susan Sontag

Quote: You can't judge a book by it's cover but you can sure sell a bunch of books if you have a good one.
Author: Jayce O'Neal

Quote: A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Start the day with love, spend the day with love, fill the day with love and end the day with love.
Author: Sathya Sai Baba

Quote: Admiration for a quality or an art can be so strong that it deters us from striving to possess it.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: An artist carries on throughout his life a mysterious, uninterrupted conversation with his public.
Author: Maurice Chevalier

Quote: I am an artisan. I only became an artist when people watch what I do. That is when it becomes art.
Author: Rhys Ifans

Quote: I have discovered the art of deceiving diplomats. I tell them the truth and they never believe me.
Author: Camillo di Cavour

Quote: I have nothing to hide in art. The initial force alone can bring anyone to the end he must attain.
Author: Paul Cezanne

Quote: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

Quote: The question of truth is forever in the air, and people look for it with particular fervor in art.
Author: Duane Michals

Quote: When I make art, I think about its ability to connect with others, to bring them into the process.
Author: Jim Hodges

Quote: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: As we expand our knowledge of good books, we shrink the circle of men whose company we appreciate.
Author: Ludwig Feuerbach

Quote: Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let's not forget this.
Author: Dave Eggers

Quote: How do you explain to a nonreader that books aren't just things but treasured friends? Companions?
Author: Laura Jensen Walker

Quote: How many cities have revealed themselves to me in the marches I undertook in the pursuit of books!
Author: Walter Benjamin

Quote: My grandma always said that God made libraries so that people didn't have any excuse to be stupid.
Author: Joan Bauer

Quote: I forgive you,"I said. I said what I had to. I would die by pieces to save myself from real death.
Author: Alice Sebold

Quote: Nevertheless, life and death are mysterious states, and we know little of the resources of either.
Author: Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu

Quote: One dies only if he's not anymore in the hearts and minds of those who know him. - Monkey D. Luffy
Author: Eiichiro Oda

Quote: We're reaching for death on the end of a candle We're trying for something that's already found us
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: All of us must cross the line between ignorance and insight many times before we truly understand.
Author: David Hawkins

Quote: It is my mood which decides the weather, it is my mood which brings the tiny changes to humankind.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: Music and symbols, they're older than human race.Prehuman beings used them to teach early mankind.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: Someday, I hope that we will all be patriots of our planet and not just of our respective nations.
Author: Zoe Weil

Quote: The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing but newspapers.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Don't settle for anyone just to have a someone. Be patient. Have faith and wait for the right one.
Author: Elizabeth Bourgeret

Quote: God is the ultimate judge of what is truly in our souls. But we are requiered to forgive everyone.
Author: Bree Despain

Quote: Men cannot expect to do ill and fare well, but to find that done to them which they did to others.
Author: Matthew Henry

Quote: Nothing will unfold for us unless we move toward whatlooks to us like nothing: faith is a cascade.
Author: Alice Fulton

Quote: The life of faith is not a life of mounting up with wings, but a life of walking and not fainting.
Author: Oswald Chambers

Quote: The sacrifices of friendship were beautiful in her eyes as long as she was not asked to make them.
Author: Hector Hugh Munro

Quote: You've got to reach a hand of friendship across the aisle and across philosophies in this country.
Author: Joe Biden

Quote: Scoot over, man. I don't like you that much.""Dick. That's not what you said last night.""Bite me.
Author: Rachel Caine

Quote: It is when we notice the dirt that God is most present in us; it is the very sign of His presence.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: It may be a species of impudence to think that the way you understand God is the way God is. (60).
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Why should we build our happiness on the opinons of others, when we can find it in our own hearts?
Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Quote: Well, I am happy, and I won't fret, but it does seem as if the more one gets the more one wants…
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Quote: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right, even though I think it is hopeless.
Author: Chester Nimitz

Quote: However, I hope I am also judged on my accomplishments as an actor and not just on my pretty face!
Author: Jonathan Brandis

Quote: I have hope in people, in individuals. Because you don't know what's going to rise from the ruins.
Author: Joan Baez

Quote: Some people think I'm a total moron and I would hope most people think I'm very good at what I do.
Author: Dan Abrams

Quote: The difference between hope and despair is a different way of telling stories from the same facts.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: Don't care for her tongue, do you? How strange. I find it one of my favorite parts.Bones to Gregor
Author: Jeaniene Frost

Quote: Every time I annoy him he retreats into his No Mundanes Allowed tree house."Simon pointed at Jace.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: His sentences didn't seem to have any verbs, which was par for a politician. All nouns, no action.
Author: Jennifer Crusie

Quote: I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: I don't feel any need to play the role of the clown. In my private life I take a break from humor.
Author: Gad Elmaleh

Quote: I don't think my sense of humor has changed at all; I was born with this, for better or for worse.
Author: Ivan Reitman

Quote: I just can't listen to any more Wagner, you know...I'm starting to get the urge to conquer Poland.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: I put tape on the mirrors in my house so I don't accidentally walk through into another dimension.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: If a person with multiple personalities threatens suicide, is that considered a hostage situation?
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: If Marilyn Monroe was alive right now, what would she be doing?'Clawing at the roof of her coffin.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: If writers wrote as carelessly as some people talk, then adhasdh asdglaseuyt[bn[ pasdlgkhasdfasdf.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: If you need help bark like a dog."- Gendry. "That's stupid. If I need help I'll shout help."- Arya
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: Librarians are the secret masters of the world. They control information. Don't ever piss one off.
Author: Spider Robinson

Quote: Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: She's the sort of woman who lives for others - you can tell the others by their hunted expression.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Soap?""School of America in Paris"he explains. "SOAP".Nice. My father sent me here to be cleansed.
Author: Stephanie Perkins

Quote: There is only one cure for grey hair. It was invented by a Frenchman. It is called the guillotine.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now.""I was going to watch Project Runway.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: When people are in the midst of really heavy stuff and still have a sense of humor, I admire that.
Author: Ted Danson

Quote: Wikipedia is the first place I go when I'm looking for knowledge... or when I want to create some.
Author: Stephen Colbert

Quote: Wit - the salt with which the American humorist spoils his intellectual cookery by leaving it out.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: You'd be surprised how many people in the modern age no longer fear zombies as much as teletubies.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

Quote: Bring up the past only if it will help to build the future, otherwise its best to be left to sleep
Author: Tahir M Khan

Quote: Hang in there. It is astonishing how short a time it can take for very wonderful things to happen.
Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

Quote: He wept because he was afraid now that he could not save Gabriel. He no longer cared about himself
Author: Lois Lowry

Quote: I have found the paradox that if I love until it hurts, then there is no hurt, but only more love.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: I write only when inspiration strikes. Fortunately it strikes every morning at nine o'clock sharp.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: If you really want the key to success, start by doing the opposite of what everyone else is doing.
Author: Brad Szollose

Quote: Now, five years is nothing in a man's life except when he is very young and very old...- Wang Lung
Author: Pearl S. Buck

Quote: The place God calls you to is the place where your deep gladness and the world's deep hunger meet.
Author: Frederick Buechner

Quote: When someone tells me "no,"it doesn't mean I can't do it, it simply means I can't do it with them.
Author: Karen E. Quinones Miller

Quote: It is so hard to leave—until you leave. And then it is the easiest goddamned thing in the world.
Author: John Green

Quote: People do not meet by chance––they navigate their lives to certain people for certain reasons.
Author: Ruti Yudovich

Quote: Der Lehrer [...] gibt nicht von seiner Weisheit, sondern eher von seinem Glauben und seiner Liebe.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: No civilization, including Plato's, has ever been destroyed because its citizens learned too much.
Author: Robert McKee

Quote: The thing that's important to know is that you never know. You're always sort of feeling your way.
Author: Diane Arbus

Quote: Before I can tell my life what I want to do with it, I must listen to my life telling me who I am.
Author: Parker J. Palmer

Quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Don't worry about writing a book or getting famous or making money. Just lead an interesting life.
Author: Michael Morpurgo

Quote: Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: I am old enough to know only too well my good and bad qualities, which were often one in the same.
Author: Lisa See

Quote: I had a dream about you last night. We watched pornography together, but purely for the storyline.
Author: Michael Summers

Quote: I just want someone to hear what I have to say. And maybe if I talk long enough, it'll make sense.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: If you think somebody cares about you and believes your life is worth saving, how can you give up?
Author: Geraldine Ferraro

Quote: If you want to live a memorable life, you have to be the kind of person who remembers to remember.
Author: Joshua Foer

Quote: Life is half delicious yogurt, half crap, and your job is to keep the plastic spoon in the yogurt.
Author: Scott Adams

Quote: Most of us have the good or bad fortune of seeing our lives fall apart so slowly we barely notice.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: Nobody's life is ever all balanced. It's a conscious decision to choose your priorities every day.
Author: Elisabeth Hasselbeck

Quote: Once you bring life into the world, you must protect it. We must protect it by changing the world.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: One does no question miracles, or complain that they are no constructed perfectly to one's liking.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: The world is wide, and I will not waste my life in friction when it could be turned into momentum.

Quote: There are times I wish I were invisible. Which is silly, since I do everything I can to stand out.

Quote: There is something incredibly nostalgic and significant about the annual cascade of autumn leaves.
Author: Joe L. Wheeler

Quote: We die. That may be the meaning of life. But we do language. That may be the measure of our lives.

Quote: We should count time by heart-throbs. He most lives,Who thinks most, feels noblest, acts the best.
Author: Philip James Bailey

Quote: What I am telling you, before you begin my story, is this -- two things: I crave truth. And I lie.
Author: Tana French

Quote: You had to risk your life to get love. You had to get right to the edge of death to ever be saved.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick

Quote: Damn you, spoilt creature; I shan't make you love me any the more by giving myself away like this.
Author: Vita Sackville-West

Quote: For my part, I prefer my heart to be broken. It is so lovely, dawn-kaleidoscopic within the crack.
Author: D.H. Lawrence

Quote: I drive around the streetsan inch away from weeping,ashamed of my sentimentality andpossible love.

Quote: I'd kiss a frog even if there was no promise of a Prince Charming popping out of it. I love frogs.
Author: Cameron Diaz

Quote: I'd sell my soul to have you. In my whole life, you'll always be what I wanted most."~ Hardy Cates
Author: Lisa Kleypas

Quote: One of the things that makes me who I am is the loyalty I have to people I hold close to my heart.
Author: Simone Elkeles

Quote: She knew whose love she doubted. It wasn't her parents' and it wasn't her friends: It was her own.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: So don't you worry your pretty little mind because people throw rocks at things that shine. [Ours]

Quote: The love of family and the admiration of friends is much more important than wealth and privilege.
Author: Charles Kuralt

Quote: There is a looming chasm between what your brain knows and what your mind is capable of accessing.
Author: David Eagleman

Quote: And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too.
Author: Khaled Hosseini

Quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: One must live as if it would be forever, and as if one might die each moment. Always both at once.
Author: Mary Renault

Quote: Open your heart. Someone will come. Someone will come for you. But first you must open your heart.

Quote: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.

Quote: As long as your ideas of what's possible are limited by what's actual, no other idea has a chance.
Author: Susan Neiman

Quote: Reason is the power or capacity whereby we see or detect logical relationships among propositions.

Quote: When they have discovered truth in nature they fling it into a book, where it is even worse hands.

Quote: I am sore wounded but not slainI will lay me down and bleed a whileAnd then rise up to fight again
Author: John Dryden

Quote: Someday you will name me, then gently place those burning holy roses in my hair.[Songs of Longing]
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: Ya no la quiero, es cierto, pero tal vez la quiero.Es tan corto el amor, y es tan largo el olvido.

Quote: The greatest thing in this world is not so much where we stand as in what direction we are moving.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Even if toxic people are right about what is "good,"they are wrong if the approach is not healthy.

Quote: Some people come into our lives and leave footprints on our hearts and we are never ever the same.

Quote: There is nothing right or wrong in love. Where there is love, then there is nothing but only love.

Quote: When a man plays with your heart it is for one of two reasons: He knows he can or he is undecided.

Quote: And I, Nephi, took one of the daughters of Ishmael to wife.' Well Mr. Go-And-Do just went and did!

Quote: And Priests in black gowns, were walking their rounds, And binding with briars, my joys & desires.

Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: Never trust the translation or interpretation of something without first trusting its interpreter.

Quote: There seemed to be some correlation between devotion to God and a misguided zeal for marshmallows.

Quote: Anthony looked down at his evil clutches -- hands, he reminded himself, hands -- and grinned anew.

Quote: If I let myself love you, I won't throw myself in front of her. I'll throw myself in front of you.

Quote: Discovery consists of looking at the same thing as everyone else and thinking something different.

Quote: The atoms of the earth are formed inside of stars. Nothing really dies, everything is transformed.

Quote: Body needs variable of time to be able to settle presence of soul in this three-dimensional space.

Author: José Ortega y Gasset

Author: Romain Rolland

Quote: When you hate someone you used to love, and you think he's done something awful - he probably has.

Quote: But my memories are like a fire in winter—whenever I'm cold I can warm my hands at them.—Ditta
Author: Madeleine L'Engle

Quote: At the moment our human world is based on the suffering and destruction of millions of non-humans.
Author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: Ethics is in its unqualified form extended responsibility with regard to everything that has life.
Author: Brenda Davis RD

Quote: I always say that eating a plant based diet is the secret weapon of enhanced athletic performance.

Quote: I'm a vegan. I respect the environment and I do my best to spread the importance of such an issue.

Quote: I'm a vegan. I respect the environment and I do my best to spread the importance of such an issue.
Author: Jared Leto

Quote: Only when we have become non-violent towards all life will we have learned to live well ourselves,
Author: Cesar Chavez

Quote: Only when we have become non-violent towards all life will we have learned to live well ourselves.
Author: Cesar Chavez

Quote: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Never underestimate your power to change yourself; never overestimate your power to change others.
Author: Wayne W. Dyer

Quote: Ordinary people merely think how they shall 'spend' their time; a man of talent tries to 'use' it.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: there is only one way under high heaven to get the best of an argument - and that is to avoid it .
Author: Dale Carnegie

Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: We must not think of the things we could do with, but only of the things that we can't do without.
Author: Jerome K. Jerome

Author: Rumi

Quote: Always suffer delusions of grandeur with your art. What you are unable to face will never hurt you
Author: Ginnetta Correli
