Quote: The writer, when he is also an artist, is someone who admits what others don't dare reveal.
Author: Elia Kazan

Quote: They teach you there's a boundary line to music. But, man, there's no boundary line to art.
Author: Charlie Parker

Quote: A book is more than the sum of its materials. It is an artifact of the human mind and hand.
Author: Geraldine Brooks

Quote: I should rather have you than a heap of gold, even if it were very comfortable to sleep on.
Author: Naomi Novik

Quote: [O]ur honeymoon will shine our life long: its beams will only fade over your grave or mine.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: Because no one needs to live for ever. I think that sometimes you can outstay your welcome.
Author: Gemma Malley

Quote: Everybody has got to die, but I have always believed an exception would be made in my case.
Author: William Saroyan

Quote: I don't eat friggin' lobster or anything like that. Because they're alive when you kill it.
Author: Nicole "Snooki"Polizzi

Quote: It would be wrong to refuse to face the fact that everything is fundamentally sick and sad.
Author: Thomas Bernhard

Quote: When he said to give him the sword, I don't think he meant for you to stick it in his guts.
Author: Kevin Hearne

Quote: Education without values, as useful as it is, seems rather to make man a more clever devil.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Education: the inculcation of the incomprehensible into the indifferent by the incompetent.
Author: John Maynard Keynes

Quote: Everyone should read, we say, but we act as if only those with special talent should write.
Author: Roy Peter Clark

Quote: Intelligence and education that hasn't been tempered by human affection isn't worth a damn.
Author: Daniel Keyes

Quote: Throwing herself into learning helped Miri ignore the painful chill of solitude around her.
Author: Shannon Hale

Quote: You will not reap the fruit of individuality in your children if you clone their education.
Author: Marilyn Howshall

Quote: Faith is a fine inventionWhen gentlemen can see,But microscopes are prudentIn an emergency.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: I can only say that I am nothing but a poor sinner, trusting in Christ alone for salvation.
Author: Robert E. Lee

Quote: I have found more inspiration in the cottages of fishermen than in the palaces of the rich.
Author: Wilfred Grenfell

Quote: In seven days God had created the Earth. In a single day mankind had turned it upside down.
Author: Kristina McMorris

Quote: Lincoln grew immeasurably as he came to think of himself as an “instrument of God's will.
Author: Joe L. Wheeler

Quote: Acquaintances we meet, enjoy, and can easily leave behind; but friendship grows deep roots.
Author: H. Jackson Brown

Quote: All who consult on doubtful matters, should be void of hatred, friendship, anger, and pity.
Author: Sallust

Quote: I've learned that friendship does not equate business, business does not equate friendship.
Author: Jill Scott

Quote: Sweet is the scene where genial friendship plays the pleasing game of interchanging praise.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

Quote: The most important thing for me is to have real friendship between Egyptians and Americans.
Author: Mohammed Morsi

Quote: When the world is so complicated, the simple gift of friendship is within all of our hands.
Author: Maria Shriver

Quote: Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don't laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: If there were an international butt competition, Eric would win, hands down—or cheeks up.
Author: Charlaine Harris

Quote: God is the reason I'm surviving, but he's sure used you in my life wonderfully. I love you.
Author: Esther Earl

Quote: In God there is no hunger that needs to be filled, only plenteousness that desires to give.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: It is a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Our own front door can be a wonderful thing, or a sight we dread; rarely is it only a door.
Author: Jeanette Winterson

Quote: Taking a risk to survive isn't that impressive. Taking a risk to be happy, that takes guts.
Author: Sarah Noffke

Quote: The secret of happiness is to face the fact that the world is horrible, horrible, horrible.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: We must have the stubbornness to accept our gladness in the ruthless furnace of this world.
Author: Jack Gilbert

Quote: I met a boy whose eyes showed me that the past, present and future were all the same thing.
Author: Jennifer Elisabeth

Quote: I think the most important thing is to keep active and to hope that your mind stays active.
Author: Jane Goodall

Quote: Keep your eyes on the future, because that's where the answers are. It's where the hope is.
Author: Holly Cupala

Quote: Man wants to live, but it is useless to hope that this desire will dictate all his actions.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: One resolution I have made, and try always to keep, is this: "To rise above little things'.
Author: John Burroughs

Quote: Sixty-four thousand dollars for a question, I hope they are asking you the meaning of life.
Author: Paul Scofield

Quote: The worst enemy of human hope is not brute facts, but men of brains who will not face them.
Author: Max Eastman

Quote: Ah, pay no heed if your enemies laugh. They'll not be able to once you lop off their heads.
Author: Christopher Paolini

Quote: Always have a sense of humor about life - you'll need it - but always be courteous to boot.
Author: Peter Jennings

Quote: Are you a female dog?""What?"Massie asked. "Why?""Because you are acting like a real bitch!
Author: Lisi Harrison

Quote: Don't bite off more than you can chew because nobody looks attractive spitting it back out.
Author: Carroll Bryant

Quote: I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: I didn't know that idiocy caused people to just start spontaneously bleeding from the nose.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: I took a speed-reading course and read War and Peace in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Like a welcome summer rain, humor may suddenly cleanse and cool the earth, the air and you.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: Now Darkstripe,' Graypaw hissed to Firepaw under his breath, 'is neither young, nor pretty.
Author: Erin Hunter

Quote: One time I actually cleaned out my closet so good I ended up on the cover of Time magazine.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: Perhaps I can stay by the fire and mend your socks and scream if I hear any strange noises.
Author: Kristin Cashore

Quote: Tasers are a one-size-fits-all paranormal butt-kicking option. Mine's pink withrhinestones.
Author: Kiersten White

Quote: That's kind of a leap, but the Russian judge gave you a nine point five for style, so okay.
Author: Rachel Caine

Quote: We are, in the comics, the last frontier of good, wholesome family humor and entertainment.
Author: Bil Keane

Quote: Anything that makes weak - physically, intellectually and spiritually, reject it as poison.
Author: Swami Vivekananda

Quote: Champions are made from something they have deep inside of them-a desire, a dream, a vison.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Energy comes not from your muscle neither from your heart. It comes from your inner source.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: I can do nothing without His help. Oh, Lord, what ignorance thinking everything was wealth.
Author: Venus Angelica Perez

Quote: If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: In fact, I wouldn't really call this a Gospel album, I call it more an inspirational album.
Author: Smokey Robinson

Quote: It's not whether your glass is empty or full, it's what you do with it that really matters.
Author: Sue Nelson Buckley

Quote: Life might take you down different roads. But each of you gets to decide which one to take.
Author: Gayle Forman

Quote: Our hearts have been made for you, O God, and they shall never rest until they rest in you.
Author: Augustine of Hippo

Quote: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
Author: Swami Sivananda

Quote: Set goals that make your heart sing. Then achieving them is an experience of uplifting joy.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: The fact that you are still alive assures you that God has something for you to accomplish.
Author: Rodney A. Winters

Quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Afinal, o que seriam mais umas horas sem a admissão de culpa do homem? Uma gota no oceano.
Author: Sara Farinha

Quote: ‎"Belki de hayat yanlış anlayınca güzeldi. Sadece yanlış anlayınca. Ama her şeyi.
Author: Hakan Günday

Quote: As the Promethean fire which banished Darkness, so Knowledge bears the Power and the Light.
Author: Leanna Renee Hieber

Quote: originality and a feeling of one's own dignity are achieved only through work and struggle.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quote: While wisdom dictates the need for education, education does not necessarily make one wise.
Author: Ben Carson

Quote: A library is the delivery room for the birth of ideas, a place where history comes to life.
Author: Norman Cousins

Quote: All of life is peaks and valleys. Don't let the peaks get too high and the valleys too low.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: At least one thing was consistent about her life: It just kept on getting more complicated.
Author: Scott Westerfeld

Quote: Each of us is a unique strand in the intricate web of life and here to make a contribution.
Author: Deepak Chopra

Quote: He had the look of one who had drunk the cup of life and found a dead beetle at the bottom.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: If you can do what you do best and be happy, you're further along in life than most people.
Author: Leonardo DiCaprio

Quote: It's not true that life is one damn thing after another; it's one damn thing over and over.
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: The story of life is quicker than the blink of an eye, the story of love is hello, goodbye.
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: There are ships sailing to many ports, but not a single one goes where life is not painful.
Author: Fernando Pessoa

Quote: There are things you can't walk away from. Not if you want to live with yourself afterward.
Author: Jim Butcher

Quote: You were made by God and for God and until you understand that, life will never make sense.
Author: Rick Warren

Quote: Ah me, but where are now the songs I sangWhen life was sweet because you call'd them sweet?
Author: Christina Rossetti

Quote: As love without esteem is capricious and volatile; esteem without love is languid and cold.
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quote: Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common sense.
Author: Helen Rowland

Quote: He is beauty, inside and out.He is the silver lining in a world of darkness.He is my light.
Author: Marie Lu

Quote: If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever.
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

Quote: In real love you want the other person's good. In romantic love, you want the other person.
Author: Margaret Chase Smith

Quote: It is very difficult to live among people you love and hold back from offering them advice.
Author: Anne Tyler

Quote: Just for the record, she still loves you. She wouldn't bother to torture you if she didn't.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.
Author: Washington Irving

Quote: The mark of a true crush... is that you fall in love first and grope for reasons afterward.
Author: Shana Alexander

Quote: The spiritualization of sensuality is called love: it is a great triumph over Christianity.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: There are many little ways to enlarge your child's world. Love of books is the best of all.
Author: Jackie Kennedy

Quote: There could have been no two hearts so open, no tastes so similar, no feelings so in unison
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: There will be no more British guys. Unless they are members of the royal family, of course.
Author: Meg Cabot

Quote: We can live without religion and meditation, but we cannot survive without human affection.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: What's your heart telling you to do?I don't know.'Maybe, you're trying too hard to hear it.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: You can be in love and you can be in a relationship. But they're not always the same thing.
Author: pleasefindthis

Quote: We are who we are, be­cause of those we choose to love and be­cause of those who love us.
Author: Kate Mosse

Quote: I feel…and I have reason to believe…that we could come to mean something to each other.
Author: Colleen Houck

Quote: I once visited a village of primitive people.At village, I felt time and life moved slower.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: The only way for you to keep your mind straight is to run from those who would confuse you.
Author: Kristin Cashore

Quote: Cruelty does not make a person dishonest, the same way bravery does not make a person kind.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: Dimitri: "Why did you come here?"Rose: "Because you hit me on the head and dragged me here.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Ideas are easy. It's the execution of ideas that really separates the sheep from the goats.
Author: Sue Grafton

Quote: If you were music, I would listen to you ceaselessly, and my low spirits would brighten up.
Author: Anna Akhmatova

Quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.
Author: Edward Abbey

Quote: How could they see anything but the shadows if they were never allowed to move their heads?
Author: Plato

Quote: I will try it until i get it right. I will try it until i am no longer trying but doing it.
Author: De philosopher Dj Kyos

Quote: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!
Author: Adolf Hitler

Quote: Ignorance isn't a sword. It's a weight that drags a soul swirling to the bottom of the sea.
Author: Melodie Ramone

Quote: The darkening of the world makes the irrationality of art rational: radically darkened art.
Author: Theodor W. Adorno

Quote: The point of modernity is to live a life without illusions while not becoming disillusioned
Author: Antonio Gramsci

Quote: where the telescope ends the microscope begins, and who can say which has the wider vision?
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: I act as the tongue of you,... tied in your mouth . . . . in mine it begins to be loosened.
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Lovers find secret placesinside this violent worldwhere they make transactions with beauty.
Author: Rumi

Quote: The petty man wants to use God for himself; the ambitious man wants God to use him for God.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: If you've delayed achieving your goals, have you ever asked yourself, "What's stopping you?
Author: Elizabeth Parker

Quote: There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
Author: Jawaharlal Nehru

Quote: What are you prepared to give for your dream? If it is not everything...stop pipe dreaming.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Forgiveness isn't something I'm preoccupied with — turning the other cheek isn't my trip.
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: I had a dream about you last night.. You were in the amazon rain forest yipping like a dog.
Author: Amy Summers

Quote: Are there any religions on your list that include the slaughter of noblemen as a holy duty?
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: It seemed there was always a close correlation between true believers and high body counts.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: One's own religion is after all a matter between oneself and one's Maker and no one else's.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: People no longer try to decipher the mystery of life but choose instead to be a part of it.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: We are not human beings on a spiritual journey. We are spiritual beings on a human journey.
Author: Stephen R. Covey

Quote: I hope I haven't given you the impression that I consider kissing intrinsically irrational.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: I tried to think of something to say. Excuse me? Hello? Marry me? Anything would have done.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: She, as no other ever could, reached every corner of his heart. His joy, and his salvation.
Author: J.D. Robb

Quote: When they see us dance. When they see how you look at me. When they see how I smile at you.
Author: Philippa Gregory

Quote: Dream is not that which you see while sleeping it is something that does not let you sleep.
Author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Physics is like sex: sure, it may give some practical results, but that's not why we do it.
Author: Richard Feynman

Quote: Science is what we understand well enough to explain to a computer; art is everything else.
Author: Donald Ervin Knuth

Quote: The steam engine has done much more for science than science has done for the steam engine.
Author: William Thomson

Quote: I felt like some part of my soul was ripped out and put under a microscope for criticizing.
Author: Alysha Speer

Quote: Sometimes your light shines so bright that it blinds people from seeing who you really are.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: You are beholdenTo the truthIt is the wayIt is the pathIt is your destinyTo be trueIs to be
Author: Karen Hackel

Quote: About the only problem with success is that it does not teach you how to deal with failure.
Author: Tommy Lasorda

Quote: Erase self-doubt by working to build your strengths instead of focusing on your weaknesses.
Author: Rodolfo Costa

Quote: From success you get a lot of things, but not that great inside thing that love brings you.
Author: Samuel Goldwyn

Quote: I believe any success in life is made by going into an area with a blind, furious optimism.
Author: Sylvester Stallone

Quote: I thought doing reality TV would be the greatest success of my life or the biggest mistake.
Author: Bethenny Frankel

Quote: it is easy to surpass a predecessor, but difficult to avoid being surpassed by a successor.
Author: Eiji Yoshikawa

Quote: Past performance speaks a tremendous amount about one's ability and likelihood for success.
Author: Mark Spitz

Quote: Success is about enjoying what you have and where you are, while pursuing achievable goals.
Author: Bo Bennett

Quote: Success is sweet and sweeter if long delayed and gotten through many struggles and defeats.
Author: Amos Bronson Alcott

Quote: The key ingredient to any kind of happiness or success is to never give less than your best
Author: Russell Simmons

Quote: If you want to lead an extraordinary life, find out what the ordinary do–and don't do it.
Author: Tommy Newberry

Quote: And just when I though things were starting to get better, everything had gone wrong again.
Author: Rachel Ward

Quote: I would rather be a devil in alliance with truth, than an angel in alliance with falsehood.
Author: Ludwig Feuerbach

Quote: Life's wildest moment---she kneels on the sidewalk. Everything else she does is lies, lies.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: Love doesn't always come when you want it to. Sometimes it just happens, despite your will.
Author: V.C. Andrews

Quote: The moment you make someone promise anything is the same moment you ask them to lie to you.
Author: Molly Ringwald

Quote: The truth is messy. It's raw and uncomfortable. You can't blame people for preferring lies.
Author: Holly Black

Quote: What an odd thing a diary is: the things you omit are more important than those you put in.
Author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quote: As I improved my diet, I started to learn to love myself, probably for the first time ever.
Author: Frank Ferrante

Quote: Refrain at all times from such foods as cannot be procured without violence and oppression.
Author: Thomas Tryon

Quote: When you feel the suffering of every living thing in your own heart, that is consciousness.
Author: Bhagavad Gita

Quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy axe without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
Author: Anne Bradstreet

Quote: Happiness is never there to stay [...] Happiness is merely a respite offered by inquietude.
Author: André Maurois

Quote: Liberty without Learning is always in peril and Learning without Liberty is always in vain.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Mama used to say, you have to know someone a thousand days before you can glimpse her soul.
Author: Shannon Hale

Quote: There are questions I'm still not wise enough to answer, just wise enough to no longer ask.
Author: George Jones

Quote: ...there would be punishment and pain, and there would be happiness, too. That was writing.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: Maybe the hardest thing in writing is simply to tell the truth about things as we see them.
Author: John Steinbeck

Quote: One can be absolutely truthful and sincere even though admittedly the most outrageous liar.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: Writing is like making love. Don't worry about the orgasm, just concentrate on the process.
Author: Isabel Allende

Quote: Writing is the only thing that when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.
Author: Gloria Steinem

Quote: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.
Author: Denis Waitley

Quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dream.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Most people spend more time and energy going around problems than in trying to solve them.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
Author: Thomas Edison

Quote: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

Quote: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: Some of us learn from other people's mistakes and the rest of us have to be other people.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh

Quote: The swift wind of compromise is a lot more devastating than the sudden jolt of misfortune.
Author: Charles Swindoll

Quote: You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: We cannot expect to be happy always... by experiencing evil as well as good we become wise.
Author: Hans Christian Andersen

Quote: Art imitates life and, sometimes, life imitates art. It's a weird combination of elements.
Author: Bruce Willis

Quote: Creative without strategy is called 'art.' Creative with strategy is called 'advertising.'
Author: Jef I. Richards

Quote: 'Healing,' Papa would tell me, 'is not a science, but the intuitive art of wooing nature.'
Author: W. H. Auden

Quote: What other people may find in poetry or art museums, I find in the flight of a good drive.
Author: Arnold Palmer

Quote: Books are a hard-bound drug with no danger of an overdose. I am the happy victim of books.
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: Books so special and rare and yours that advertising your affection feels like a betrayal.
Author: John Green

Quote: One little Indian left all alone, he went out and hanged himself and then there were none.
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: I still loved Granny. It flowed out of my chest. With Granny gone, where would my love go?
Author: Jessica Maria Tuccelli

Quote: It is good that a man's enemies want him dead, for it proves he has lived a life of worth.
Author: Forrest Carter

Quote: It's not contagious, you know. Death is as natural as life. It's part of the deal we made.
Author: Mitch Albom

Quote: The heaviness of loss in her heart hadn't eased, but there was room there for humour, too.
Author: Nalo Hopkinson

Quote: When we die, we will turn into songs, and we will hear each other and remember each other.
Author: Rob Sheffield

Quote: A state that does not educate and train women is like a man who only trains his right arm.
Author: Jostein Gaarder

Quote: All men who have turned out worth anything have had the chief hand in their own education.
Author: Walter Scott

Quote: Educate a boy, and you educate an individual. Educate a girl, and you educate a community.
Author: Adelaide Hoodless

Quote: She got on with her education. In her opinion, school kept on trying to interfere with it.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Some people get an education without going to college. The rest get it after they get out.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: The best education consists in immunizing people against systematic attempts at education.
Author: Paul Karl Feyerabend

Quote: To reap a return in ten years, plant trees. To reap a return in 100, cultivate the people.
Author: Hồ Chí Minh

Quote: Whenever you read a good book, somewhere in the world a door opens to allow in more light.
Author: Vera Nazarian

Quote: Your life can be different, Young Ju. Study and be strong. In America, women have choices.
Author: An Na

Quote: It is not the strength of your faith but the object of your faith that actually saves you.
Author: Timothy Keller

Quote: just show a little humility. If you know your weaknesses you will not be enslaved by them.
Author: Fiorella De Maria

Quote: Maybe that's why life is so precious. No rewind or fast forward...just patience and faith.
Author: Cristina Marrero

Quote: Stone, steel, dominions pass,Faith too, no wonder;So leave alone the grassThat I am under.
Author: A.E. Housman

Quote: Without the voice of reason, every faith is its own curse."(History Will Teach Us Nothing)
Author: Sting

Quote: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
Author: Anton Chekhov

Quote: To some it may be a thrill to be known, to me it's a thrill to start a friendship even up.
Author: Christopher Knight

Quote: There is only one good definition of God: the freedom that allows other freedoms to exist.
Author: John Fowles

Quote: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Maybe this is a characteristic of happy people. An ability to be entertained by the world.
Author: Clare Morrall

Quote: Sometimes I wish life was written pencil so we could erase it and write it all over again.
Author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi

Quote: The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or joy.
Author: Alan Lightman

Quote: True happiness is when the love that is within us finds expression in external activities.
Author: Mata Amritanandamayi

Quote: You must never forget that greatness does not guarantee happiness but goodness always does
Author: Sri Chinmoy

Quote: At the end of the day, we must go forward with hope and not backward by fear and division.
Author: Jesse Jackson

Quote: Beauty products always cheer me up and give me hope. If it makes you feel pretty, why not?
Author: Salma Hayek

Quote: I hope that one day when I'll go back to Pakistan, I will build a university like Harvard.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: I would hope that understanding and reconciliation are not limited to the 19th hole alone.
Author: Gerald R. Ford

Quote: In the night of death, hope sees a star, and listening love can hear the rustle of a wing.
Author: Robert Green Ingersoll

Quote: Marriage is like putting your hand into a bag of snakes in the hope of pulling out an eel.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: A sense of humor is good for you. Have you ever heard of a laughing hyena with heart burn?
Author: Bob Hope

Quote: Anybody with a sense of humor is going to put on my album and laugh from beginning to end.
Author: Eminem

Quote: Evelyn was an insomniac so when they say she died in her sleep, you have to question that.
Author: Garrison Keillor

Quote: Half the battle is that people have to like you before you say one joke, one bit of humor.
Author: Don Rickles

Quote: Humor brings insight and tolerance. Irony brings a deeper and less friendly understanding.
Author: Agnes Repplier

Quote: Humor is a very important thing. It is a natural predilection. It is an emotional release.
Author: Ray Stevenson

Quote: I can't abide people who go soft over animals and then cheat every human they come across!
Author: Diana Wynne Jones

Quote: I can't live without a sense of humor. I need to be laughing and entertained at all times.
Author: Carlos Ponce

Quote: I hate to think that all my current experiences will someday become stories with no point.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: I have a very dark sense of humor. I swear. I have a very playful relationship with Jesus.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: If after reading this book you come to my home and brutally murder me, I do not blame you.
Author: Jesse Andrews

Quote: Inconceivable!""You keep using that word. I do not think it means what you think it means.
Author: William Goldman

Quote: It's not that I want you to go, it's just that I don't want you to stay."- China Sorrows -
Author: Derek Landy

Quote: Next to power without honor, the most dangerous thing in the world is power without humor.
Author: Eric Sevareid

Quote: Some people say my humor focuses too much on stereotypes. It doesn't. It focuses on facts.
Author: Sarah Silverman

Quote: That's one of the remarkable things about life. It's never so bad that it can't get worse.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.
Author: Erma Bombeck

Quote: Writing is the only profession where no one considers you ridiculous if you earn no money.
Author: Jules Renard

Quote: You see, that's another thing that my parents gave me: an enormously great sense of humor.
Author: Liza Minnelli

Quote: You should try not to talk so much, friend. You'll sound far less stupid that way.- Breeze
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: Beauty exists not in what is seen and remembered, but in what is felt and never forgotten.
Author: Johnathan Jena

Quote: blindness is a private matter between a person and the eyes with which he or she was born.
Author: José Saramago

Quote: Choosing kindness is the ultimate expression of evolved consciousness. Grow by being kind.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Cut not the wings of your dreams, for they are the heartbeat and the freedom of your soul.
Author: Flavia

Quote: Do you not then hear this horrible scream all around you that people usually call silence.
Author: Werner Herzog

Quote: Don't turn over the rocks if you don't want to see the pale creatures who live under them.
Author: Janet Fitch

Quote: Gather the best you have to offer and create a heartfelt, prosperous life full of purpose.
Author: Gail McMeekin

Quote: Hold yourself to a higher standard than anyone else expects of you. Never excuse yourself.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: Hope is the light that flickers and burns eternally, when you remain steadfast with faith.
Author: Virginia Martin

Quote: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.
Author: John Cage

Quote: I remembered the fox. One runs the risk of crying a bit if one allows oneself to be tamed.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: If I never got to make a living doing what I loved, I'd still do it--for fun and for free.
Author: Susan E. Isaacs

Quote: I'm scared of losing this web we're in. This elusive, indefinable, opposite of loneliness.
Author: Marina Keegan

Quote: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: In the final analysis it is between you and God, it was never between you and them anyway.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: It's a lie to think you're not good enough. It's a lie to think you're not worth anything.
Author: Nick Vujicic

Quote: It's hard to tell where reality ends and illusions begins. They blend - then they separate
Author: Lind Goodman

Quote: I've gotta get out of the basement. I've gotta see the world. I've gotta make a difference
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: Love is the only thing that we can carry with us when we go, and it makes the end so easy.
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Quote: Our biggest regrets are not for the things we have done but for the things we haven't done
Author: Chad Michael Murray

Quote: People need not fear the unknown if they are capable of achieving what they need and want.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Sometimes a little discomfort in the beginning can save a whole lot of pain down the road.
Author: Wendelin Van Draanen

Quote: Sometimes being happy takes effort. Invest time and energy in yourself and your happiness.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: That's why it's called a practice. We have to practice a practice if it is to be of value.
Author: Allan Lokos

Quote: There's nothing greater than having a heart filled with love...& eyes filled with light:-)
Author: J. L. Hunt

Quote: To achieve extraordinary dreams you sometimes have to go through extraordinary nightmares.
Author: Matshona Dhliwayo

Quote: We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.
Author: Alan Turing

Quote: We pencil-sketch our previous life so we can contrast it to the technicolor of the moment.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it.Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!
Author: John Anster

Quote: When facts give way to faith, then and only then have you unlock the possibilities within!
Author: TemitOpe Ibrahim

Quote: You have to salvage what you can, even if you're the one who buried it in the first place.
Author: Kelly Link

Quote: You're only human. You live once and life is wonderful so eat the damn red velvet cupcake!
Author: Emma Stone

Quote: If you're feeling helpless, help someone. ”― Aung San Suu Kyi (from Freedom from Fear)
Author: Aung San Suu Kyi

Quote: I am a man who knows nothing, guesses sometimes, finds frequently and who's always amazed.
Author: Villiers de L'Isle-Adam

Quote: Knowledge is a Bed of Roses; for Every Beautiful Flower, there are a Dozen Thorns to Match
Author: Joshua Caleb

Quote: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow.
Author: Ronald E. Osborn

Quote: We give up our backs and allow religious myths to apply the rear naked choke to our minds.
Author: Cameron Conaway

Quote: We need learn what we need to learn, know what we need to know, and do what we need to do.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: ...I like stories very much,” the priest said. “They help me understand myself better.
Author: Simon Van Booy

Quote: Despite your best efforts, people are going to be hurt when it's time for them to be hurt.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: Don't take life too seriously. Punch it in the face when it needs a good hit. Laugh at it.
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: I don't like dreams or reality. I like when dreams become reality because that is my life.
Author: Jean Paul Gaultier

Quote: I feel like a big faker because I've been putting my life back together, and nobody knows.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.
Author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

Quote: I made up my mind not to care so much about the destination, and simply enjoy the journey.
Author: David Archuleta

Quote: Life is but a memory Happened long ago. Theatre full of sadness For a long forgotten show.
Author: Nick Drake

Quote: Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass...It's about learning to dance in the rain.
Author: Vivian Greene

Quote: Music is love, love is music, music is life, and I love my life. Thank you and good night.
Author: A. J. McLean

Quote: Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash.
Author: Leonard Cohen

Quote: The hardest thing about the road not taken is that you never know where it might have led.
Author: Lisa Wingate

Quote: The purpose of human life is to serve, and to show compassion and the will to help others.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: The true object of all human life is play. Earth is a task garden; heaven is a playground.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: There's no such thing as ruining your life. Life's a pretty resilient thing, it turns out.
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: There's nothing more embarrassing than to have earned the disfavor of a perceptive animal.
Author: Michael Chabon

Quote: Through all of living have much joy and laughter, life is to be enjoyed, not just endured.
Author: Gordon B. Hinckley

Quote: We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be.
Author: May Sarton

Quote: When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?'
Author: Sydney J. Harris

Quote: You need to make a commitment, and once you make it, then life will give you some answers.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: Don't be trapped by dogma — which is living with the results of other people's thinking.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Absence is to love what wind is to fire; it extinguishes the small, it inflames the great.
Author: Roger de Bussy-Rabutin

Quote: and the two of them loved each other for a long time in silence without making love again.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: For love is no part of the dreamworld. Love belongs to Desire, and Desire is always cruel.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Love is a promise, love is a souvenir, once given never forgotten, never let it disappear.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Only time can heal your broken heart. Just as only time can heal his broken arms and legs.
Author: Jim Henson

Quote: Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.
Author: José N. Harris

Quote: This is what happened in love. One of you cried a lot and then both of you grew sarcastic.
Author: Lorrie Moore

Quote: We provide food that customers love, day after day after day. People just want more of it.
Author: Ray Kroc

Quote: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: When I really love someone, I can only show it by making aggressive and bad-taste remarks.
Author: Slavoj Zizek

Quote: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
Author: Buddha

Quote: You're imperfect, and you're wired for struggle, but you are worthy of love and belonging.
Author: Brene Brown

Quote: Yours is the light by which my spirit's born: - you are my sun, my moon, and all my stars.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: Like the soil, mind is fertilized while it lies fallow, until a new burst of bloom ensues.
Author: John Dewey

Quote: A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful.
Author: Maurice Sendak

Quote: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: How did you die?""We er....drowned in a bathtub.""All three of you?""It was a big bathtub.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: If you were half as funny as you think you are, you'd be twice as funny as you really are.
Author: H.N. Turteltaub

Quote: If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary.
Author: David Sedaris

Quote: In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Just for the record, the weather today is calm and sunny, but the air is full of bullshit.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: There is no surer foundation for a beautiful friendship than a mutual taste in literature.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: You can love someone so much...But you can never love people as much as you can miss them.
Author: John Green

Quote: Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: If you cannot find an element of Humour in something, your not taking it seriously enough.
Author: Ilyas Kassam

Quote: It is just as crazy not to be crazy about Christ as it is to be crazy about anything else.
Author: Peter Kreeft

Quote: It's the truth, even if it didn't happen......if they don't exist, how can a man see them?
Author: Ken Kesey

Quote: Learned we may be with another man's learning: we can only be wise with wisdom of our own.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: No woman in maternity confinement can have stranger and more impatient wishes than I have.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: the body is wiser than its inhabitants. the body is the soul. the body is god's messenger.
Author: Erica Jong

Quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The more details, depth and thought you put into your ideas the more valuable they become.
Author: Simon Zingerman

Quote: There's no way you can kill someone and get to the other side of the experience unchanged.
Author: Charlaine Harris

Quote: Whoever is going to listen to the philosophers needs a considerable practice in listening.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: I will soothe you and heal you,I will bring you roses.I too have been covered with thorns.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Some men are born sodomites, some achieve sodomy, and some have sodomy thrust upon them...
Author: Aleister Crowley

Quote: From someone who doesn't want to share your destiny, you should neither accept a cigarette
Author: Cesare Pavese

Quote: I had a dream about you last night.. You kept screaming at Ted Danson to pour you a drink.
Author: Amy Summers

Quote: You're only responsible for being honest, not for someone else's reaction to your honesty.
Author: Kelli Jae Baeli

Quote: Do not abandon yourselves to despair. We are the Easter people and hallelujah is our song.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: As a rule of thumb, it was always safer if the Commander-in-Chief formulated a risky plan.
Author: Rowena Cherry

Quote: I'm not the same person I was before, and I am deathly afraid I will never be her again...
Author: Jodi LaPalm

Quote: She said it was beautiful to be loved, and that it made everything on earth look brighter.
Author: Fanny Fern

Quote: Yeah, tell me I'm a bottle of single malt scotch, she thought. That's the way to my heart.
Author: L.J. Smith

Quote: His work seems to confirm my old axiom: it is useless to try to keep the whole body alive.
Author: Adolfo Bioy Casares

Quote: A ști anumite lucruri pe de rost îți conferă capacitatea unei înțelegeri superioare.
Author: Jean-Claude Carrière

Quote: He offered her power, money, status...a giant prison, all in exchange for only...her soul.
Author: Coco J. Ginger

Quote: Idris: Are all people like this?The Doctor: Like what?Idris: So much bigger on the inside.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Rummaging in our souls, we often dig up something that ought to have lain there unnoticed.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Doubts in your mind are a much greater roadblock to success than obstacles on the journey.
Author: Orrin Woodward

Quote: For true success ask yourself these four questions: Why? Why not? Why not me? Why not now?
Author: James Allen

Quote: I am fully aware that everybody has a right to succeed, and success should be with ethics.
Author: Sharad Pawar

Quote: I can give you a six-word formula for success: Think things through - then follow through.
Author: Eddie Rickenbacker

Quote: I felt sure we could gain the upper hand by putting ourselves in the mindset of the Incas.
Author: Tahir Shah

Quote: I think you can have 10,000 explanations for failure, but no good explanation for success.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: I was obliged to be industrious. Whoever is equally industrious will succeed equally well.
Author: Johann Sebastian Bach

Quote: Success in golf depends less on strength of body than upon strength of mind and character.
Author: Arnold Palmer

Quote: Success is not a function of the size of your title but the richness of your contribution.
Author: Robin S. Sharma

Quote: To burn always with this hard gemlike flame, to maintain this ecstasy, is success in life.
Author: Walter Pater

Quote: Don't change your mind just because people are offended; change your mind if you're wrong.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Great is truth, but still greater, from a practical point of view, is silence about truth.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: I can be forced to live without happiness, but I will never consent to live without honor.
Author: Pierre Corneille

Quote: If a man has so much heat he burns your skin when he touches you, he's the devil. Run away
Author: Sarah Addison Allen

Quote: Never apologize for showing your feelings. When you do, you are apologizing for the truth.
Author: José N. Harris

Quote: The truth that makes men free is for the most part the truth which men prefer not to hear.
Author: Herbert Agar

Quote: The words kept coming back to him, statement of a mystical truth and a palpable absurdity.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: Nobody can possibly be so hungry that they need to take a life in order to feel satisfied.
Author: Morrissey

Quote: I decided to pick the diet that I thought would maximize my chances of long-term survival.
Author: Al Gore

Quote: But what minutes! Count them by sensation, and not by calendars, and each moment is a day.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Even as a solid rock is unshaken by the wind, so are the wise unshaken by praise or blame.
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: Humans will never be in charge of this world, as long as dust and weeds do as they please.
Author: Nancy B. Brewer

Quote: I have studied many philosophers and many cats. The wisdom of cats is infinitely superior.
Author: Hippolyte Taine

Quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Never pause unless you have a reason for it, but when you pause, pause as long as you can.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: Perhaps the logical conclusion of everyone looking the same is everyone thinking the same.
Author: Scott Westerfeld

Quote: Wisdom says we are nothing. Love says we are everything. Between these two our life flows.
Author: Jack Kornfield

Quote: We all have scars, Mia; they are supposed to make you stronger, not paralyze you.” ~Cole
Author: Tina Carreiro

Quote: I never exactly made a book. It's rather like taking dictation. I was given things to say.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: If you are not afraid of the voices inside you, you will not fear the critics outside you.
Author: Natalie Goldberg

Quote: You do what you were made to do. Some of us were made to read and write. Thanks be to God.
Author: Nancy M. Malone

Quote: Among the things you can give and still keep are your word, a smile, and a grateful heart.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Instead of being intimidated by the limitations, be inspired to find new ways around them.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: Life must be rich and full of loving-it's no good otherwise, no good at all, for anyone.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: Never take your position for granted and never let any favors you receive go to your head.
Author: Robert Greene

Quote: Some people are old at 18 and some are young at 90. Time is a concept that humans created.
Author: Yoko Ono

Quote: The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don't know anything about.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The important thing is not what one is born with but what use one makes of that equipment.
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: The key to success is to focus our conscious mind on things we desire not things we fear.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: What people say, what people do, and what they say they do are entirely different things.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: Art is the unceasing effort to compete with the beauty of flowers - and never succeeding.
Author: Gian Carlo Menotti

Quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: Great art is never produced for its own sake. It is too difficult to be worth the effort.
Author: Robert Quillen

Quote: I think of my peace paintings as one long poem, with each painting being a single stanza.
Author: Robert Indiana

Quote: Books and doors are the same thing. You open them, and you go through into another world.
Author: Jeanette Winterson

Quote: Books are like imprisoned souls till someone takes them down from a shelf and frees them.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: Books are my friends, my companions. They make me laugh and cry and find meaning in life.
Author: Christopher Paolini

Quote: I love everything that is old; old friends, old times, old manners, old books, old wines.
Author: Oliver Goldsmith

Quote: Now begin in the middle, and later learn the beginning; the end will take care of itself.
Author: Harlan Ellison

Quote: Remind me not to piss you off Red. You might aim for the heart and shoot me in the balls.
Author: Nora Roberts

Quote: The reading of all good books is like conversation with the finest men of past centuries.
Author: René Descartes

Quote: Where should I go?"-Alice. "That depends on where you want to end up."- The Cheshire Cat.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: A tomb now suffices him for whom the world was not enough.[Alexander's tombstone epitaph]
Author: Alexander the Great

Quote: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Instruction does much, but encouragement everything."(Letter to A.F. Oeser, Nov. 9, 1768)
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Learning is an ornament in prosperity, a refuge in adversity, and a provision in old age.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Samuel Johnson said Alexander Pope's translation of the Iliad, "tuned the English tongue.
Author: Harold Bloom

Quote: Could a body broken and blood spilled two thousand years ago restore my own damaged life?
Author: Frederica Mathewes-Green

Quote: Trust and faith bring joy to life and help relationships grow to their maximum potential.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: Why then should witless man so much misweeneThat nothing is but that which he hath seene?
Author: Edmund Spenser

Quote: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
Author: Charles de Montesquieu

Quote: I really wasn't even aware that Batman and Superman had this kind of grudging friendship.
Author: Mark Valley

Quote: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

Quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.
Author: Francesco Guicciardini

Quote: The steady discipline of intimate friendship with Jesus results in men becoming like Him.
Author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

Quote: aren't you, uh... reproducing?"sure, we love reproducing it's one of our favorite things.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Don't put your wand there, boy! ... Better wizards than you have lost buttocks, you know!
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Tantalus made a wild grab, but the marshmallow committed suicide, diving into the flames.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: They love their hair because they're not smart enough to love something more interesting.
Author: John Green

Quote: And believe me, a good piece of chicken can make anybody believe in the existence of God.
Author: Sherman Alexie

Quote: Do not fight the thing in detail: turn from it. Look ONLY at your Lord. Sing. Read. Work.
Author: Amy Carmichael

Quote: He who defends with love will be secure; Heaven will save him, and protect him with love.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Much blood has been spilled over words, and a great deal of it over the word "God.' (125)
Author: Jean-Yves Leloup

Quote: Happiness doesn't always come from a pursuit. Sometimes it comes when we least expect it.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Happiness. Simple as a glass of chocolate or tortuous as the heart. Bitter. Sweet. Alive.
Author: Joanne Harris

Quote: I don't want to be the one who says life is beautiful. I want to be the one who feels it.
Author: Marty Rubin

Quote: If one were to build the house of happiness, the largest space would be the waiting room.
Author: Jules Renard

Quote: Our purest form of joy comes when people we envy get hurt. That most genuine form of joy.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: The lesson will always repeat itself, unless you see yourself as the problem--not others.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: To serve is beautiful, but only if it is done with joy and a whole heart and a free mind.
Author: Pearl S. Buck

Quote: A person, who no matter how desperate the situation, gives others hope, is a true leader.
Author: Daisaku Ikeda

Quote: All I can do is leave it in God's hands and hope that my fans feel where I'm coming from.
Author: Aaliyah

Quote: Doubt is the ally of hope, not its enemy, and together they made all the blessing he had.
Author: Barry Unsworth

Quote: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward, but he who has hope for it is a fool.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Hope is like peace. It is not a gift from God. It is a gift only we can give one another.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: I hope people think of me as a bit older. I do have a beard. That makes me look very old.
Author: Jack Whitehall

Quote: I hope that I will be the last victim in China's long record of treating words as crimes.
Author: Liu Xiaobo

Quote: I thought that the light-house looked lovely as hope,That star on life's tremulous ocean.
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: Love, hope, fear, faith - these make humanity; These are its sign and note and character.
Author: Robert Browning

Quote: Pray, hope, and don't worry. Worry is useless. God is merciful and will hear your prayer.
Author: Padre Pio

Quote: Pregnancy is something that I always love. It's about hope and the future and a new baby.
Author: Carine Roitfeld

Quote: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.
Author: Edward Kennedy

Quote: We are now on the threshold of a newer movement, with a newer hope and a new inspiration.
Author: James Larkin

Quote: What hope is there?"I asked. "If even angels fall, what hope is there for the rest of us?
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: With all honesty, somewhere between the hello and the dreams I saw you in I fell in love.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: …a cynic who was still saddened whenever his jaundiced view of mankind was confirmed...
Author: Sharon Kay Penman

Quote: A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: A gun. I had been brought down by a gun. It was practically comical. Cheaters, I thought.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Busy' is another word for 'asshole'. 'Asshole' is another word for the guy you're dating.
Author: Greg Behrendt

Quote: Even people that I agree with can do something that would be a target for a bit of humor.
Author: Jonathan Shapiro

Quote: Humor can be an incredible lacerating and effective weapon. And that is the way I use it.
Author: Carl Hiaasen

Quote: I hang out with the 'nerdy' people - they have a different sense of humor than most kids.
Author: Liam Aiken

Quote: I think superheroes are heroes with flaws, and in their flaws, there is a sense of humor.
Author: Peter Segal

Quote: I'd never met coffee that wasn't wonderful. It was just a matter of how wonderful it was.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton

Quote: If I ever meet myself,' said Zaphod, 'I'll hit myself so hard I won't know what's hit me.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.
Author: Madonna

Quote: Never knock on death's door. Ring the doorbell then run. He totally hates that. - T-shirt
Author: Darynda Jones

Quote: Oh... Adrian, I've got one more favor to ask you. A big one.""Fondue?"he asked hopefully.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Piece of Heaven?""No, that other place I'm going to go to for thinking what I'm thinking.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times -- always with the same person.
Author: Mignon McLaughlin

Quote: And thus we see that by small means the Lord can bring about great things"- 1 Nephi 16:29
Author: Joseph Smith Jr.

Quote: Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: Contrary to what we've been told, life is simple. We complicate matters with our choices.
Author: Michelle Richardson

Quote: Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.
Author: Napoléon Bonaparte

Quote: Don't get set into one form, adapt it and build your own, and let it grow, be like water.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: Enjoy every ounce of your life, get high and be sincere to anybody that comes around you.
Author: Salman Aditya

Quote: Fear is what keeps the walls up, so open the gate and let what you want, in when you want
Author: Joshua Wright

Quote: Focus your heart, mind, and soul on joy and you'll find ultimate success and fulfillment.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: God's joy can fill our days with gladness until we receive the answer we are waiting for.
Author: Suzanne Elizabeth Anderson

Quote: I want to be like Gandhi and Martin Luther King and John Lennon but i want to STAY ALIVE.
Author: Madonna

Quote: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: If we ever forget that we're one nation under God, then we will be one nation gone under.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Listen within to find shining poetry and hear extraordinary music. You are a work of art.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: My experiences have taught me that things rarely improve with a simple change of scenery.
Author: Pittacus Lore

Quote: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Nothing's a better cure for writer's block than to eat ice cream right out of the carton.
Author: Don Roff

Quote: Prayer is the sign of your weakness. Rely on your inner strength. You will be the winner.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: Stop thinking of yourself as a victim. You were a target that is now no longer being hit.
Author: Thomas Sheridan

Quote: The world is before you, and you need not take it or leave it as it was when you came in.
Author: James Baldwin

Quote: There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors.
Author: Adrienne Rich

Quote: Tidak semua yang kita inginkan harus terjadi seketika. Kita tidak hidup di dunia dongeng.
Author: Tere Liye

Quote: Time changes all things; there is no reason why language should escape this universal law
Author: Ferdinand de Saussure

Quote: We have just enough religion to make us hate, but not enough to make us love one another.
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
Author: John Muir

Quote: You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: I only hope that we never lose sight of one thing — that it was all started by a mouse.
Author: Walt Disney Company

Quote: As our circle of knowledge expands, so does the circumference of darkness surrounding it.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: To sense the peace of extinguished passionHappiness in not knowing the ultimate knowledge
Author: Dejan Stojanovic

Quote: Alle Wege führen zur Erkenntnis der Nichtigkeit aller Dinge, aber keiner führt zurück.
Author: Juli Zeh

Quote: ...you must always be yourself, and do things at your own pace. Someday, you'll catch up.
Author: Natsuki Takaya

Quote: Difficult times always create opportunities for you to experience more love in your life.
Author: Barbara de Angelis

Quote: I scream for everything that has gone wrong. I scream for everything broken in our lives.
Author: Marie Lu

Quote: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.
Author: Ansel Adams

Quote: Life has become immeasurably better since I have been forced to stop taking it seriously.
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quote: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: my friends don't seem to be friends at all but people whose phone numbers I haven't lost.
Author: Nick Hornby

Quote: Nearly all the best things that came to me in life have been unexpected, unplanned by me.
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quote: Oh, God of Dust and Rainbows,Help us to seeThat without the dust the rainbowWould not be.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: Pack a pillow and blanket and see as much of the world as you can.You will not regret it.
Author: Jhumpa Lahiri

Quote: Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: The more I live, the more I learn. The more I learn, the more I realize, the less I know.
Author: Michel Legrand

Quote: The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: The trouble with life isn't that there is no answer, it's that there are so many answers.
Author: Ruth Benedict

Quote: There's so much destruction all over the world - and all you can do is complain about ME!
Author: Morrissey

Quote: Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness.Listen to it carefully.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: ..."better to have loved and lost"bullshit. Don't show me paradise and then burn it down.
Author: Harlan Coben

Quote: A friend of mine once defined love as finding someone you can talk to late into the night
Author: James Patterson

Quote: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.
Author: Ingrid Bergman

Quote: Do what you love. Know your own bone; gnaw at it, bury it, unearth it, and gnaw it still.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Ever since time began, people have recognized their true Love by the light in their eyes.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: He loved her, he loved her, and until he'd loved her she had never minded being alone....
Author: Truman Capote

Quote: I love everything that's old, - old friends, old times, old manners, old books, old wine.
Author: Oliver Goldsmith

Quote: I reserve the right to love many different people at once, and to change my prince often.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: If love is blind, then maybe a blind person that loves has a greater understanding of it.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Quote: The love of our private friends is the only preparatory exercise for the love of all men.
Author: John Henry Newman

Quote: When you love someone, you don't have a choice. Love takes your choices away.- Clary Fray
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: You were the missing piece of my soul, the breath in my lungs, and the blood in my veins.
Author: J.A. Redmerski

Quote: A great memory does not make a mind, any more than a dictionary is a piece of literature.
Author: John Henry Newman

Quote: At that moment I had no mind to change, or not change, or throw against the nearest wall.
Author: James Patterson

Quote: Personally, I do not believe the human mind has any limits but those we impose ourselves.
Author: Louis L'Amour

Quote: Sometimes, being true to yourself means changing your mind. Self changes, and you follow.
Author: Vera Nazarian

Quote: The only way somebody can have control over our mind is if we don't have control over it.
Author: Joseph Rain

Quote: A love like that was a serious illness, an illness from which you never entirely recover.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge.
Author: China Miéville

Quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
Author: Judy Garland

Quote: Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Dress shabbily and they remember the dress; dress impeccably and they remember the woman.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quote: I can write the saddest poem of all tonight. I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Imagine smiling after a slap in the face. Then think of doing it twenty-four hours a day.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: Oh, I wouldn't mind, Hazel Grace. It would be a privilege to have my heart broken by you.
Author: John Green

Quote: Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot,Nothing is going to get better. It's not.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Wow,"Thalia muttered. "Apollo is hot.""He's the sun god,"I said."That's not what I meant.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Miss Abbott, don't worry over me. Some people are born not to do things. I'm one of them.
Author: E.M. Forster

Quote: There is your truth and there is my truth. As for the universal truth, it does not exist.
Author: Amish Tripathi

Quote: ...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?
Author: Vincent van Gogh

Quote: A Word is DeadA word is deadWhen it is said,Some say.I say it justBegins to liveThat day.
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: Flutter like a hummingbird, Dive like an eagle, Ain't no bird that's my equal. - Twilight
Author: Kathryn Lasky

Quote: Look in my face; my name is Might-have-been; I am also call'd No-more, Too-late, Farewell
Author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

Quote: Whatever the imagination seizes as Beauty must be truth -whether it existed before or not
Author: John Keats

Quote: And perhaps it is the greater grief, after all, to be left on earth when another is gone.
Author: Madeline Miller

Quote: My eyes kept skipping back to her, drawn to her face like a lone candle flame in the dark
Author: Alexandra Bracken

Quote: I had a dream about you last night... You tried to propose with a digital ceramic heater.
Author: Amy Summers

Quote: Are you going to kiss me?"I blabbered stupidly."I'm working up the nerve,"he said softly.
Author: Liz Reinhardt

Quote: It is as if Quincey has replaced the sun in my universe and it is around him that I spin.
Author: Kate Cary

Quote: DNA is like a computer program but far, far more advanced than any software ever created.
Author: Bill Gates

Quote: As to women, I agree that each has three or four souls, but none of them a reasoning one.
Author: Henryk Sienkiewicz

Quote: So the unwanting soulsees what's hidden,and the ever-wanting soulsees only what it wants.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: The essence of all things determines souls that are fit to send messages for their kinds.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: A failure establishes only this, that our determination to succeed was not strong enough.
Author: C.N. Bovee

Quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Belief in oneself is one of the most important bricks in building any successful venture.
Author: Lydia M. Child

Quote: Do not let your grand ambitions stand in the way of small but meaningful accomplishments.
Author: Bryant McGill

Quote: I'd rather be a failure in something that I love than a success in something that I hate.
Author: George Burns

Quote: In order to succeed, your desire for success should be greater than your fear of failure.
Author: Bill Cosby

Quote: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others to succeed.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: One secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Some people dream of success, while other people get up every morning and make it happen.
Author: Wayne Huizenga

Quote: Success is a state of mind. If you want success, start thinking of yourself as a success.
Author: Joyce Brothers

Quote: Success represents the 1% of your work which results from the 99% that is called failure.
Author: Soichiro Honda

Quote: The key to flow is to pursue an activity for its own sake, not for the rewards it brings.
Author: Susan Cain

Quote: The key to success is to focus our conscious mind on things we desire not things we fear.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: The secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Words are directed to your personalities namely; - God, your hearers, devil and yourself.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job, and not be paid for it.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: Young man, the secret of my success is that an early age I discovered that I was not God.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

Quote: I don't think there's anything wrong with telling the truth. I know it isn't fashionable.
Author: Craig Ferguson

Quote: I shouldn't believe anything I say, if I were you-and that includes what I just told you.
Author: Jasper Fforde

Quote: Being vegan helped me realize I can say and do what I believe is right. That is powerful.
Author: Alicia Silverstone

Quote: I am grateful to realize that my desires do not entitle me to add to another's suffering.
Author: Zoe Weil

Quote: I am grateful to realize that my desires do not entitle me to add to another's suffering.
Author: Zoe Weil

Quote: I hope someday everyone will care about all animals, not just the "cute and cuddly' ones.
Author: Joanne McArthur

Quote: Mankind does not have dominion over the Earth, mankind has a relationship with the Earth.
Author: J. Adam Snyder

Quote: Saving one animal won't change the world. But it'll change the world for that one animal.
Author: Unknown

Quote: If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: I've learned .... That opportunities are never lost; someone will take the ones you miss.
Author: Andy Rooney

Quote: Perhaps the hardest lesson to learn is not to be attached to the results of your actions.
Author: Joan Borysenko

Quote: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: When you're in a Slump,you're not in for much fun.Un-slumping yourselfis not easily done.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; Skill is knowing how to do it, and Virtue is doing it.
Author: David Starr Jordan

Quote: A small daily task, if it be really daily, will beat the labours of a spasmodic Hercules.
Author: Anthony Trollope

Quote: Get it down. Take chances. It may be bad, but it's the only way you can do anything good.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: If I could sum it up in 50 words, I wouldn't have needed to write a whole novel about it.
Author: Patrick Rothfuss

Quote: One should never use exclamation points in writing. It is like laughing at your own joke.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: The trouble with writing fiction is that it has to make sense, whereas real life doesn't.
Author: Iain M. Banks

Quote: The world is a hellish place, and bad writing is destroying the quality of our suffering.
Author: Tom Waits

Quote: Write,' she said, 'as if you'll never be read. That way you'll be sure to tell the truth.
Author: Lori Lansens

Quote: A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Death and life have their determined appointments; riches and honors depend upon heaven.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small.
Author: Laozi

Quote: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
Author: St. Jerome

Quote: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: He who permits himself to tell a lie once, finds it much easier to do it the second time.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Life and death are of supreme importance. Time swiftly passes by and opportunity is lost.
Author: Dogen

Quote: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: The happiest people in the world are those who feel absolutely terrific about themselves.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
Author: W. Clement Stone

Quote: Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: You cannot change your destination overnight but you can change your direction overnight.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: A work of art is a world in itself reflecting senses and emotions of the artist's world.
Author: Hans Hofmann

Quote: Architecture is basically the design of interiors, the art of organizing interior space.
Author: Philip Johnson

Quote: I think all art is about control - the encounter between control and the uncontrollable.
Author: Richard Avedon

Quote: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Book burnings. Always the forerunners. Heralds of the stake, the ovens, the mass graves.
Author: Geraldine Brooks

Quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: I would like my personal reading map to resemble a map of the British Empire circa 1900.
Author: Nick Hornby

Quote: I'd volunteer to go to prison, as long as there are books. Because with books I am free.
Author: Mohammad Hatta

Quote: If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.
Author: François Mauriac

Quote: When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes.
Author: Desiderius Erasmus

Quote: The book thief has struck for the first time – the beginning of an illustrious career.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: I hate to lend a book I love…it never seems quite the same when it comes back to me…
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Quote: And I could have died right then. And considering how things went, I really should have.
Author: Ned Vizzini

Quote: Death and what came after death was no great mystery to Sabriel. She just wished it was.
Author: Garth Nix

Quote: Do you wanna play? Everyone's dead, so I got bored. Did you come to play with me?--Wrath
Author: Hiromu Arakawa

Quote: The day of my birth, my death began its walk. It is walking toward me, without hurrying.
Author: Jean Cocteau

Quote: The death of a beautiful woman is, unquestionably, the most poetical topic in the world.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: This is the secret that none dares tell who fights for a cause. Dying, we are all alike.
Author: Jacqueline Carey

Quote: What does education often do? It makes a straight-cut ditch of a free, meandering brook.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Conscious faith is freedom. Emotional faith is slavery. Mechanical faith is foolishness.
Author: G.I. Gurdjieff

Quote: Faith doesn't get you around problems in life and relationships, it gets you through it.
Author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett

Quote: I ate some emotional soup in my childhood and have spent a lifetime trying to digest it.
Author: Billy Ray Chitwood

Quote: Intellect is a part of a good faith. Intellect is the light, the heart is the direction.
