Author: Tariq Ramadan

Quote: It seems we are all too vulnerable to having our heart lead us astray from what is right
Author: Abigail Reynolds

Quote: The Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, said, When Allah loves a people, He tries them.
Author: Leila Aboulela

Quote: Aristotle uses a mother's love for her child as the prime example of love or friendship.
Author: Mortimer Adler

Quote: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
Author: Lord Byron

Quote: I had three chairs in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Our friends interpret the world and ourselves to us, if we take them tenderly and truly.
Author: Amos Bronson Alcott

Quote: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: She was hearing the words. They just weren't registering on her Richter scale of sanity.
Author: Dakota Cassidy

Quote: And he, like many jaded people, had few pleasures left in life save good food and drink.
Author: Honoré de Balzac

Quote: Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind.
Author: Daphne du Maurier

Quote: Happiness without freedom, or freedom without happiness. There was no third alternative.
Author: Yevgeny Zamyatin

Quote: if you feel happy, Smile with all your heart. if you're down, smile with all your might.
Author: Paul Ian Guillermo

Quote: It's about the quality of the worry,"I said. "I have happier worries now than I used to.
Author: David Gilmour

Quote: Why did you look at the sunset?'Philip answered with his mouth full:Because I was happy.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.
Author: Brad Henry

Quote: Absence from whom we love is worse than death, and frustrates hope severer than despair.
Author: William Cowper

Quote: Education exposes young people to a broader world, a world full of opportunity and hope.
Author: Christine Gregoire

Quote: Faith has to do with things that are not seen and hope with things that are not at hand.
Author: Thomas Aquinas

Quote: How wonderful that we have met with a paradox. Now we have some hope of making progress.
Author: Niels Bohr

Quote: In the end, I hope there's a little note somewhere that says I designed a good computer.
Author: Steve Wozniak

Quote: When I consider life, it is all a cheat. Yet fooled with hope, people favor this deceit.
Author: John Dryden

Quote: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.
Author: W. C. Fields

Quote: Would that death were like this. Would that one would sleep and sleep and sleep forever.
Author: Anne Rice

Quote: I just want your voice aimed at me again. I want to absorb the direction of your eyes…
Author: Jennifer Elisabeth

Quote: A pessimist is a man who thinks everybody is as nasty as himself, and hates them for it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Denzel Washington has a great sense of humor. He did all those 'Nutty Professor' movies.
Author: Seth MacFarlane

Quote: Gabi to Marcus "I can't believe out of one hundred thousand sperm, you were the fastest!
Author: Cherise Sinclair

Quote: have i gone mad?im afraid so, but let me tell you something, the best people usualy are.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: Hey, Rosalie? Do you know how to drown a blonde? Stick a mirror to the bottom of a pool.
Author: Stephenie Meyer

Quote: Humor does not rescue us from unhappiness, but enables us to move back from it a little.
Author: Mason Cooley

Quote: I consider myself to have a decent sense of humor. What's life without a sense of humor?
Author: Mayer Hawthorne

Quote: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.
Author: Mae West

Quote: If Jesus came back and saw what was being done in his name, he'd never stop throwing up.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: I'm tired of this back-slappin' "isn't humanity neat"bullshit. We're a virus with shoes.
Author: Bill Hicks

Quote: Kids. You gotta love them. I adore children. A little salt, a squeeze of lemon--perfect.
Author: Jim Butcher

Quote: My father could be very witty, even if the humor was always on the darker side of irony.
Author: Maurice Sendak

Quote: That's why they call it the American Dream, because you have to be asleep to believe it.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: What's in a name, anyway? That which we call a nose by any other name would still smell.
Author: Reduced Shakespeare Company

Quote: What's the whole point of being pretty on the outside when you're so ugly on the inside?
Author: Jess C. Scott

Quote: When you see what some girls marry, you realize how they must hate to work for a living.
Author: Helen Rowland

Quote: when you're not looking, somebody'll sneak up and write "Fuck you"right under your nose.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
Author: Earl Nightingale

Quote: And in the end it is not the years in your life that count, it's the life in your years.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: At dawn of man, many words of inspiration.At the end, there will be words of revelation.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: Because I don't live in either my past or my future.I'm interested only in the present".
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Gradually the healing took place, seeming as it always does that it wasn't taking place.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quote: I am buoyant and expansive and uncontainable--but I always was so, only I never knew it!
Author: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni

Quote: I don't think anyone, until their soul leaves their body, is past the point of no return
Author: Tom Hiddleston

Quote: I had always felt life first as a story: and if there is a story there is a story-teller
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: I was kind of excited to go to jail for the first time and I learnt some great dialogue.
Author: Quentin Tarantino

Quote: If the only prayer you say throughout your life is "Thank You,"then that will be enough.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: Inspirations never go in for long engagements; they demand immediate marriage to action.
Author: Brendan Francis Brown

Quote: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: Life will just not wait for us to live it:We are in it, now, and Now is the time to Live
Author: Michelle Geaney

Quote: My name is Salmon, like the fish; first name, Susie. I was fourteen when I was murdered.
Author: Alice Sebold

Quote: Nothing ever really goes away--it just changes into something else. Something beautiful.
Author: Sarah Ockler

Quote: Small is the number of them that see with their own eyes and feel with their own hearts.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person's determination.
Author: Tommy Lasorda

Quote: The greatest blessing granted to mankind come by way of madness, which is a divine gift.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The individual who says it is not possible should move out of the way of those doing it.
Author: Tricia Cunningham

Quote: The secret ingredients to true happiness? Decisive optimism and personal responsibility.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: There are a thousand hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at the root.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
Author: William Arthur Ward

Quote: Why are there trees I never walk under but large and melodious thoughts descend upon me?
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Yet he who reigns within himself, and rulesPassions, desires, and fears, is more a king.
Author: John Milton

Quote: Beware you be not swallowed up in books! An ounce of love is worth a pound of knowledge.
Author: John Wesley

Quote: I think a lot of psychopaths are just geniuses who drove so fast that they lost control.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Learning is not the accumulation of knowledge, but rather, one thing only: understanding
Author: Donna Jo Napoli

Quote: Suffering is a form of knowledge. It tells us what is wrong with our world.- David Smail
Author: Richard House

Quote: Niemand kann euch etwas eröffnen, das nicht schon im Dämmern eures Wissens schlummert.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: ...because love is continual interrogation. I don't know of a better definition of love.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quote: Do you know what your problem is? You can't live with the idea that someone might leave.
Author: John Green

Quote: He's not your prince charming if he doesn't make sure you know that you're his princess.
Author: Demi Lovato

Quote: If you want something, you don't wait for the world to deal it out for you. You take it.
Author: Poppy Z. Brite

Quote: it takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeded.
Author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

Quote: Life is growth. If we stop growing, technically and spiritually, we are as good as dead.
Author: Morihei Ueshiba

Quote: Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Life is not over because you have diabetes. Make the most of what you have, be grateful.
Author: Dale Evans

Quote: Life is too short, or too long, for me to allow myself the luxury of living it so badly.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Life starts out with everyone clapping when you take a poo and goes downhill from there.
Author: Sloane Crosley

Quote: Life's greatest gift is the freedom it leaves you to step out of it whenever you choose.
Author: André Breton

Quote: Maybe you could be mine / or maybe we'll be entwined / aimless in this sexless foreplay.
Author: Jess C. Scott

Quote: Never complain, never explain. Resist the temptation to defend yourself or make excuses.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Never stop smiling not even when you're sad, someone might fall in love with your smile.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.
Author: Edmund Burke

Quote: The universe may not always play fair, but at least it's got a hell of a sense of humor.
Author: Candace Bushnell

Quote: There will be time, there will be timeTo prepare a face to meet the faces that you meet.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: To build up a library is to create a life. It's never just a random collection of books.
Author: Carlos María Domínguez

Quote: To kind of go through life not caring is a spectacular attribute. It's one I wish I had.
Author: Neil Cross

Quote: Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is Youer than You.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: What we like to think of ourselves and what we really are rarely have much in common....
Author: Stephen King

Quote: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: You need to find a way to live your life, that it doesn't make a mockery of your values.
Author: Bill Ayers

Quote: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: But whateverHoweverWhenever this ends I want you to knowThat right nowI love you forever
Author: Andrea Gibson

Quote: He who loves with purity considers not the gift of the lover, but the love of the giver.
Author: Thomas a Kempis

Quote: I didn't care who kissed you first as long as I kissed you last."-George from If We Kiss
Author: Rachel Vail

Quote: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them humanity cannot survive.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Love involves a peculiar unfathomable combination of understanding and misunderstanding.
Author: Diane Arbus

Quote: Love is a combination of care, commitment, knowledge, responsibility, respect and trust.
Author: bell hooks

Quote: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
Author: James A. Baldwin

Quote: My father gave me the greatest gift anyone could give another person, he believed in me.
Author: Jim Valvano

Quote: Never trust anyone completely but God. Love people, but put your full trust only in God.
Author: Lawrence Welk

Quote: The sun's gone dim, and the moon's gone black. For I loved him, and he didn't love back.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: Who could refrain that had a heart to love and in that heart courage to make love known?
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: You smiled and talked to me of nothing and I felt that for this I had been waiting long.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: A veiled Mind is more enticing than all the nude men lining up the Seine, during Summer.
Author: AainaA-Ridtz

Quote: Books are those faithful mirrors that reflect to our mind the minds of sages and heroes.
Author: Edward Gibbon

Quote: You are a placebo responder. Your body plays tricks on your mind. You cannot be trusted.
Author: Ben Goldacre

Quote: My mind's flight rises beneath the seagull's wings …then ocean is my motherland I feel
Author: Munia Khan

Quote: And I like large parties. They're so intimate. At small parties there isn't any privacy.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
Author: Rumi

Quote: God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.
Author: Noël Coward

Quote: Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: When a man gives his opinion, he's a man. When a woman gives her opinion, she's a bitch.
Author: Bette Davis

Quote: Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: Do you hate people?”“I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: Entertainment is temporary happiness, but the real happiness is permanent entertainment.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: Failures and mistakes are lessons to be learned from. They are opportunities for growth.
Author: Avis J. Williams

Quote: It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Knowledge was scattered treasure, education organized it into art, commerce and science.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: No man was ever yet a great poet, without at the same time being a profound philosopher.
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quote: Non est ad astra mollis e terris via"- "There is no easy way from the earth to the stars
Author: Seneca

Quote: On the whole human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.
Author: George Orwell

Quote: The danger today is in believing there are no sick people, there is only a sick society.
Author: Fulton J. Sheen

Quote: Dont tout «avoir» effectif doit tirer son prestige immédiat et sa fonction dernière.
Author: Guy Debord

Quote: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Cheap little rhymesA cheap little tuneAre sometimes as dangerousAs a sliver of the moon.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: Haiku is not a shriek, a howl, a sigh, or a yawn; rather, it is the deep breath of life.
Author: Santōka Taneda

Quote: I am stuffing your mouth with yourpromises and watching you vomit them out upon my face.
Author: Anne Sexton

Quote: I can't think of anything more disheartening than living a life without a clear purpose.
Author: Daniel Willey

Quote: Making a dream into reality begins with what you have, not with what you are waiting on.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Some things are just like riding a bicycle; you jump on, pedal, and hope you don't fall.
Author: Henry Mosquera

Quote: The positive vibrations of unregulated joy, peace, happiness and tranquility is freedom.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: We are all connected. When one arm or foot is poisoned, the whole body becomes infected.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: A good place to meet a man is at the dry cleaner. These men usually have jobs and bathe.
Author: Rita Rudner

Quote: Aim at Heaven and you will get Earth 'thrown in': aim at Earth and you will get neither.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: God doesn't need to punish us. He just grants us a long enough life to punish ourselves.
Author: Barbara Kingsolver

Quote: If I were asked for a one-sentence sound bite on religion, I would say I was against it.
Author: Salman Rushdie

Quote: [Bobby Tom] finally understood Gracie's function in his life. She was God's joke on him.
Author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

Quote: If not for me being stoned and clinging to a taco, it would have been terribly romantic.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Innocence invites protection, yet we might be smarter to protect ourselves against it...
Author: Megan Johns

Quote: My house seems remarkably full of people,"he observed. "Is it possible we were expected.
Author: Georgette Heyer

Quote: Achieving success is a challenge but so is struggling so you may as well choose success.
Author: Rob Liano

Quote: Create your world with God's Word in your mouth just say it and it will be accomplished!
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: My songs are the door to every dream I've ever had and every success I've ever achieved.
Author: Dolly Parton

Quote: Nothing is impossible, Everything should be possible when we trying for achieve the goal
Author: Sanjeev Murukan

Quote: Spend enough time around success and failure, and you learn a reverence for possibility.
Author: Dale Dauten

Quote: The backbone of success is...hard work, determination, good planning, and perserverence.
Author: Mia Hamm

Quote: There could be no honor in a sure success, but much might be wrested from a sure defeat.
Author: Ann Landers

Quote: No boundary or barrier surrounds the heart of a person that loves their self and others.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: What would happen if one woman told the truth about her life?The world would split open.
Author: Muriel Rukeyser

Quote: Being vegan helped me realize I can say and do what I believe is right. That's powerful.
Author: Alicia Silverstone

Quote: We cannot have peace among men whose hearts find delight in killing any living creature.
Author: Rachel Carson

Quote: When diet is wrong, medicine is of no use. When diet is correct, medicine is of no need.
Author: Ayurvedic proverb

Quote: A person's rightful due is to be treated as an object of love, not as an object for use.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: A point of view can be a dangerous luxury when substituted for insight andunderstanding.
Author: Marshall McLuhan

Quote: Granny was an old-fashioned witch. She didn't do good for people, she did right by them.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: I will no longer mutilate and destroy myself in order to find a secret behind the ruins.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: The imagination needs moodling,--long, inefficient happy idling, dawdling and puttering.
Author: Brenda Ueland

Quote: A flower falls, even though we love it; and a weed grows, even though we do not love it.
Author: Dogen

Quote: Don't think money does everything or you are going to end up doing everything for money.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It ain't where you start in life, it's where you end up, and what you did along the way.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: It is indeed a radical act of love just to sit down and be quiet for a time by yourself.
Author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

Quote: No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Sometimes letting things go is an act of far greater power than defending or hanging on.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: The dead receive more flowers than the living because regret is stronger than gratitude.
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: The more you are grateful for what you have the more you will have to be grateful for.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.
Author: Sathya Sai Baba

Quote: There exists only the present instant; a Now which always and without end is itself new.
Author: Meister Eckhart

Quote: To achieve, you need thought. You have to know what you are doing and that's real power.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: To be in harmony with the wholeness of things is not to have anxiety over imperfections.
Author: Dogen

Quote: Animation is not the art of drawings that move but the art of movements that are drawn.
Author: Norman McLaren

Quote: Art requires neither complaisance nor politeness; nothing but faith, faith and freedom.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Film will only became an art when its materials are as inexpensive as pencil and paper.
Author: Jean Cocteau

Quote: Many artists and scholars have pointed out that ultimately art depends on human nature.
Author: Steven Pinker

Quote: Of what use were the arts if they were only the reproduction and the imitation of life?
Author: Alfred de Vigny

Quote: Reason clears and plants the wilderness of the imagination to harvest the wheat of art.
Author: Austin O'Malley

Quote: Simplicity and repose are the qualities that measure the true value of any work of art.
Author: Frank Lloyd Wright

Quote: The art of medicine was to be properly learned only from its practice and its exercise.
Author: Thomas Sydenham

Quote: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change and to preserve change amid order.
Author: Alfred North Whitehead

Quote: Women are our most miraculous muse, an enchanted intangibility that encourages all art.
Author: CeeLo Green

Quote: You must not fight too often with one enemy, or you will teach him all your art of war.
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: Always buy pornographic books in hardback because they're easier to hold with one hand.
Author: Robert Clark

Quote: And what would they be scared of? There's nothing to fear in a perfect world, is there?
Author: Catherine Fisher

Quote: Good books, like good friends, are few and chosen; the more select, the more enjoyable.
Author: Amos Bronson Alcott

Quote: They had only ever discussed books but what, in this life, is more personal than books?
Author: Gabrielle Zevin

Quote: Maybe you should say goodbye, Cal.''No.''It might be important.''It might make her die.
Author: Jenny Downham

Quote: Still, they have one thing I envy. Humans, if nothing else, have the good sense to die.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: When it comes to death, we know that laughter and tears are pretty much the same thing.
Author: Sherman Alexie

Quote: A beautiful bright blue sky; up above so high; how happy i am; to feel fully satisfied.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: In order to fix it, you need a passionate anger about something that doesn't work well.
Author: James Dyson

Quote: The most effective kind of education is that a child should play amongst lovely things.
Author: Plato

Quote: Logic kills. Faith burns. Better to be the one with the torch than the one on the pyre.
Author: Chris Galford

Quote: I hope to continue my friendship with France and its filmmakers for many years to come.
Author: Harvey Weinstein

Quote: One of the great things personally coming to Hawai'i is my friendship of Jim Nicholson.
Author: Dan Fouts

Quote: Peace, commerce and honest friendship with all nations; entangling alliances with none.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
Author: Jean de la Bruyere

Quote: She already had a headache-she didn't want to add 'get tortured' to today's to-do list.
Author: C.C. Hunter

Quote: CONFESSION NO. 18 Girls just want to have fun…and live to tell about it the next day.
Author: Ronda Thompson

Quote: Maxon: “To be clear, no one agrees with you.”America: “To be clear, I don't care.
Author: Kiera Cass

Quote: And my God will supply all your needs according to His riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars,  The deeper the grief, the closer is God!
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quote: You will never glory in God till first of all God has killed your glorying in yourself.
Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

Quote: Action and personal happiness have no truck with each other; they are eternally at war.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: He saw in happiness the seeds of independence, and in independence the seeds of revolt.
Author: Mervyn Peake

Quote: Non-violence, which is the quality of the heart, cannot come by an appeal to the brain.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: ...and we'll see what happens when we say Yes while this rigor mortis world screams No.
Author: Isaac Marion

Quote: A lot of tragedy can befall us, but there's always something else; there's always hope.
Author: Chris Pine

Quote: Being a cheerful hobbit, he had not needed hope, as long as despair could be postponed.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: I came to the conclusion that unrealized hopes, even small ones, were always wrenching.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: One day I hope to open my own day-care center. My passion for kids is through the roof.
Author: Cam Newton

Quote: We wrote verses that condemned us, with no hope of pardon, to the most bitter solitude.
Author: Salvatore Quasimodo

Quote: When you get ill do not get nervous about it and try as much as possible to be hopeful.
Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S

Quote: Bands from Akron have a sense of humor and don't tend to take themselves too seriously.
Author: Dan Auerbach

Quote: Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

Quote: Believe it or not, there's a lot of humor in 'Mad Men.' Especially in the dark moments.
Author: Matthew Weiner

Quote: He'd been wrong, there was a light at the end of the tunnel, and it was a flamethrower.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: I am not always good and noble. I am the hero of this story, but I have my off moments.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: I don't think it's possible to have a sense of tragedy without having a sense of humor.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: If you look back, Mozart, Haydn and Beethoven were mixing music and humor all the time.
Author: Richard Hyung-ki Joo

Quote: It's a reflex. Hear a bell, get food. See an undead, throw a knife. Same thing, really.
Author: Ilona Andrews

Quote: Leaving us with Eric is like hiring a babysitter who spends his time sharpening knives.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?
Author: Julie Kagawa

Quote: One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas I'll never know.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: She said this in the same way you might say Fields of Punishment or Hades's gym shorts.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Sometimes it takes ten seconds to see some humor in your dilemmas, sometimes ten years.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: Talking with you is sort of the conversational equivalent of an out of body experience.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: The road to creativity passes so close to the madhouse and often detours or ends there.
Author: Ernest Becker

Quote: Unrequited love is so boring. Weeping under a blue-black sky is for suckers or maniacs.
Author: Alice Hoffman

Quote: So why in the name of Merlin's saggy left —”“Don't talk to your mother like that.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: A man, though wise, should never be ashamed of learning more, and must unbend his mind.
Author: Sophocles

Quote: All men want, not something to do with, but something to do, or rather something to be.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Celebrate who you are in your deepest heart. Love yourself and the world will love you.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Denying yourself a life of personal freedom is denying yourself of a life worth living.
Author: Michelle Cruz-Rosado

Quote: Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul.
Author: Thomas Merton

Quote: Everyday gratitude sweetens what appears flavorless and brightens all that appears dim.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Evil exists in us all, Torak. Some fight it. Some feed it. That's how it's always been.
Author: Michelle Paver

Quote: Fallon affected my body in weird ways. But only because she's different, I told myself.
Author: Penelope Douglas

Quote: For every moment of triumph, for every instance of beauty, many souls must be trampled.
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quote: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
Author: Vincent van Gogh

Quote: Happiness depends more on the inward disposition of mind than on outward circumstances.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: I said to the almond tree, 'Friend, speak to me of God,' and the almond tree blossomed.
Author: Nikos Kazantzakis

Quote: I trust that everything happens for a reason, even if we are not wise enough to see it.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: In the end you can't always choose what to keep. You can only choose how you let it go.
Author: Ally Condie

Quote: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Learn as if you were not reaching your goal and as though you were scared of missing it
Author: Confucius

Quote: Man is a slow, sloppy, and brilliant thinker; computers are fast, accurate, and stupid.
Author: John Pfeiffer

Quote: My love is something valuable to me which I ought not to throw away without reflection.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: Peace of mind comes when we exercise our right to be honest, especially with ourselves.
Author: Jack R. Rose

Quote: Reach high, for stars lie hidden in you. Dream deep, for every dream precedes the goal.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Searching outside of you is Samsara (the world). Searching within you leads to Nirvana.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: Shallow men believe in luck or in circumstance. Strong men believe in cause and effect.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The Sewing Machine CharmTo A Life Bound by Family, The Thread That Ties Us All Together
Author: Viola Shipman

Quote: The Universe doesn't like secrets. It conspires to reveal the truth, to lead you to it.
Author: Lisa Unger

Quote: The whales do not sing because they have an answer, they sing because they have a song.
Author: Gregory Colbert

Quote: There are only two forces at work in this world- black and white. Only people are grey.
Author: Chris Heimerdinger

Quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
Author: Edith Wharton

Quote: With my ninth mind I resurrect my firstand dance slow to the music of my soul made new.
Author: Aberjhani

Quote: You can dramatize your ideas in business or in any other aspect of your life. It's easy
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: You don't have the right to complain about your life if you're not willing to change it
Author: Tori Toth

Quote: You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: My stomach is rather content, now that I think about it. 'Tis my mind that is starving.
Author: Hannah Ashworth

Quote: All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Because, sometimes, things happen to people and they're not equipped to deal with them.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Excellence/Perfection is not a destination; it is a continuous journey that never ends.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors for you where there were only walls.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: Forget regret, or life is yours to miss. No other path, no other way, no day but today.
Author: Jonathan Larson

Quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I am my own sanctuary and I can be reborn as many times as I choose throughout my life.
Author: Lady Gaga

Quote: Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results.
Author: Narcotics Anonymous

Quote: It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: Life is a journey that must be traveled no matter how bad the roads and accommodations.
Author: Oliver Goldsmith

Quote: Life is so constructed that an event does not, cannot, will not, match the expectation.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: Life's like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.
Author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

Quote: Part of me suspects that I'm a loser, and the other part of me thinks I'm God Almighty.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Sometimes people are beautiful.Not in looks.Not in what they say.Just in what they are.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: The Wine of Life keeps oozing drop by drop, The Leaves of Life keep falling one by one.
Author: Edward Fitzgerald

Quote: There is no thing as a single-issue struggle because we do not live single-issue lives.
Author: Audre Lorde

Quote: Tried living in the real world instead of a shell, but I was bored before I even began.
Author: Morrissey

Quote: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
Author: Osho

Quote: Was it hard?"I ask.Letting go?"Not as hard as holding on to something that wasn't real.
Author: Lisa Schroeder

Quote: You don't win races by wishing, you win them by running faster than everyone else does.
Author: Philip Pullman

Quote: You make a choice in your life, and it affects your life in all the ways, good and bad.
Author: John Mayer

Quote: I'm not aspiring to be someone else – If I'm me for the rest of my life then so be it
Author: Terry Lander

Quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
Author: Mignon McLaughlin

Quote: A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.
Author: Max Lucado

Quote: Do not swear by the moon, for she changes constantly. then your love would also change.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Don't ever think I fell for you, or fell over you. I didn't fall in love, I rose in it.
Author: Toni Morrison

Quote: Gestures, in love, are incomparably more attractive, effective and valuable than words.
Author: Francois Rabelais

Quote: I just can't seem to write songs about peace and love. Yeah right, how do you get that?
Author: Siobhan Fahey

Quote: I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.
Author: Stephanie Perkins

Quote: If you love something set it free, but don't be surprised if it comes back with herpes.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: I'm guilty of giving people more chances than they deserve but when I'm done, I'm done.
Author: Turcois Ominek

Quote: It's the kind of kiss that inspires stars to climb into the sky and light up the world.
Author: Tahereh Mafi

Quote: Just because love don't look the way you think it should, don't mean you don't have it.
Author: Leslye Walton

Quote: Love takes off the masks we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
Author: James Baldwin

Quote: Love the trees until their leaves fall off, then encourage them to try again next year.
Author: Chad Sugg

Quote: What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.
Author: Stieg Larsson

Quote: When someone beats a rug,the blows are not against the rug, but against the dust in it.
Author: Rumi

Quote: You are terrifying and strange and beautiful. Something not everyone knows how to love.
Author: Warsan Shire

Quote: You may choose to look the other way but you can never say again that you did not know.
Author: William Wilberforce

Quote: Sweet are the thoughts that savour of content, The quiet mind is richer than a crown...
Author: Robert Greene

Quote: Temptation is stronger in the minds of people who are in doubt. Prayer makes it weaker.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart knows what the heart knows
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Your mind can be either your prison or your palace. What you make it is yours to decide
Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

Quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.
Author: P.C. Cast

Quote: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: It's strange because sometimes, I read a book, and I think I am the people in the book.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be.
Author: John Cheever

Quote: My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life.
Author: Ian Fleming

Quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.
Author: Edith Wharton

Quote: Whenever my environment had failed to support or nourish me, I had clutched at books...
Author: Richard Wright

Quote: A doctrine of expression rather than one of suppression makes a stronger appeal to man.
Author: Holly Estil Cunningham

Quote: A stone is heavy and the sand is weighty; but a fool's wrath is heavier than them both.
Author: Frank Herbert

Quote: The same word we love and hate, leaves in different directions, taking different paths.
Author: Dejan Stojanovic

Quote: The trouble was that he was talking in philosophy but they were listening in gibberish.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Then the lover, who is true and no counterfeit, must of necessity be loved by his love.
Author: Plato

Quote: They lived like monkeys still, while their new god powers lay around them in the weeds.
Author: Kim Stanley Robinson

Quote: They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder. I think the same could be said for time.
Author: Jake Vander Ark

Quote: But far more numerous was the herd of such,Who think too little, and who talk too much.
Author: John Dryden

Quote: I don't wish to be everything to everyone, but I would like to be something to someone.
Author: Javan

Quote: I really don't know what "I love you"means.I think it means "Don't leave me here alone.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: If poetry comes not as naturally as the leaves to a tree it had better not come at all.
Author: John Keats

Quote: Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: Of the many forms that silence takes, the most memorable is the dry husk of the cicada.
Author: Jon Davis

Quote: This is the city, and I am one of the citizens/Whatever interests the rest interests me
Author: Walt Whitman

Quote: Beliefs that are good promote your potential and enhance your unique special qualities.
Author: Deborah Day

Quote: I'm not unhappy,"he said. "Only people with no purpose are unhappy. I've got a purpose.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Create your own style… let it be unique for yourself and yet identifiable for others.
Author: Anna Wintour

Quote: Shall there be truth between us, as two men? Not as friends, but as enemies and equals?
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Terkadang,yang tak bisa kamu lupakan adalah seseorang yang tak pernah bisa kamu miliki.
Author: Christian Simamora

Quote: I have a problem with people who take the Constitution loosely and the Bible literally.
Author: Bill Maher

Quote: Oh, Adam's sons, how cleverly you defend yourselves against all that might do you good!
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Religions die when they are proved to be true. Science is the record of dead religions.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: The worst moment for the atheist is when he is really thankful and has nobody to thank.
Author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

Quote: Let's still be friends"(things that are never true in a break up, but you have to say).
Author: Lauren Leto

Quote: Star-crossed lovers desperate to get home together. Two hearts beating as one. Romance.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: The tune was sad, as the best of Ireland was, melancholy and lovely as a lover's tears.
Author: Nora Roberts

Quote: You're dangerous,” he says.“Why?”“Because you make me believe in the impossible
Author: Simone Elkeles

Quote: The bright sun was extinguish'd, and the starsDid wander darkling in the eternal space.
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: We are not born into the world. We are born into something that we make into the world.
Author: Michael Talbot

Quote: Our hearts speak the same language but more importantly our souls share the same voice.
Author: Nikki Rowe

Quote: What happened to you?"she asked."Ben was feeling artistic. Wanted to rearrange my face.
Author: Stacey Kade

Quote: It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.
Author: Bill Gates

Quote: Success to me is having ten honeydew melons and eating only the top half of each slice.
Author: Barbra Streisand

Quote: Think little goals and expect little achievements. Think big goals and win big success.
Author: David Joseph Schwartz

Quote: Where would his torture be, indeed, if at every step the hope of succeeding upheld him?
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: You cannot control the past but you have control over the life you build going forward.
Author: Nancy D. Butler

Quote: All cynics are disappointed idealists. The more stars in the eyes, the harder the fall.
Author: Josh Lanyon

Quote: All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: Facts are like cows. If you look them in the face long enough, they generally run away.
Author: Dorothy L. Sayers

Quote: Faith and Reason are like two wings of the human spirit by which is soars to the truth.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: I felt lonely and content at the same time. I believe that is a rare kind of happiness.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: It's hard to throw away history. It was like you were throwing away a part of yourself.
Author: Jenny Han

Quote: It's partly true, too, but it isn't all true. People always think something's all true.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: Much of what was said did not matter, and that much of what mattered could not be said.
Author: Katherine Boo

Quote: What comes into our minds when we think about God is the most important thing about us.
Author: A.W. Tozer

Quote: Vegetarians and vegans (including athletes) 'meet and exceed requirements' for protein.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: Humanity's true moral test is its attitude towards those who are at its mercy: animals.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quote: I became a vegetarian out of compassion for animals and to live as healthy as possible.
Author: Davey Havok

Quote: Humans were meant to eat meat to survive? Do you know you're talking to a living vegan?
Author: Unknown

Quote: I love animals. All animals. I wouldn't hurt a cat or a dog - or a chicken, or a cow...
Author: Peter Dinklage

Quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it's time to pause and reflect.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it's time to pause and reflect.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: You may choose to look the other way, but you can never say again that you didn't know.
Author: William Wilberforce

Quote: It's always hard to lose somebody. It leaves a hole in you heart that never grows back.
Author: Kevin Brooks

Quote: The only way to move from your reality to God's reality is through people who love you.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: To risk life to save a smile on a face of a woman or a child is the secret of chivalry.
Author: Dejan Stojanovic

Quote: Travel brings wisdom only to the wise. It renders the ignorant more ignorant than ever.
Author: Joe Abercrombie

Quote: A non-writing writer is a monster courting insanity."[Letter to Max Brod, July 5, 1922]
Author: Franz Kafka

Quote: All that I hope to say in books, all that I ever hope to say, is that I love the world.
Author: E.B. White

Quote: Every word a woman writes changes the story of the world, revises the official version.
Author: Carolyn See

Quote: I cringe when critics say I'm a master of the popular novel. What's an unpopular novel?
Author: Irwin Shaw

Quote: I love writing. I love the swirl and swing of words as they tangle with human emotions.
Author: James A. Michener

Quote: My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: Absorb what is useful, discard what is useless and add what is specifically your own.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: It's not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.

Quote: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Note that this journey is uniquely yours, no one elses. So the path has to be your own.
Author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

Quote: Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: The man who moved the mountain was the one who began carrying away the smallest stones.
Author: Zen Proverb

Quote: The more reasons you have for achieving your goal, the more determined you will become.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
Author: Osho

Quote: When you know what you want, and you want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Your happiness is what truly matters most. Do what you have to do in order to be happy.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Art is a step from what is obvious and well-known toward what is arcane and concealed.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: Art is not a handicraft, it is the transmission of feeling the artist has experienced.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Next to the Word of God, the noble art of music is the greatest treasure in the world.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: Only in art will the lion lie down with the lamb, and the rose grow without the thorn.
Author: Martin Amis

Quote: Painting seems like some kind of peculiar miracle that I need to have again and again.
Author: Philip Guston

Quote: The works must be conceived with fire in the soul but executed with clinical coolness.
Author: Joan Miro

Quote: What I wish to show when I paint is the way I see things with my eyes and in my heart.
Author: Raoul Dufy

Quote: Most of what makes a book 'good' is that we are reading it at the right moment for us.
Author: Alain de Botton

Quote: The ability to read awoke inside of me some long dormant craving to be mentally alive.
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: You want to remember that while you're judging the book, the book is also judging you.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: It's only in drugs or death we'll see anything new, and death is just too controlling.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Let us endeavor so to live that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Life is about moving, it's about change. And when things stop doing that they're dead.
Author: Twyla Tharp

Quote: My wallpaper and I are fighting a duel to the death. One or the other of us has to go.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: [T]eaching has been for me an education (Lord knows what it has been for my students).

Quote: Education: learning to find your purpose. Upon finding your purpose: what did I learn?
Author: Bauvard

Quote: He was one of those young men who possess an impressive store of facts, but no truths.
Author: John Howard Griffin

Quote: Learning is important. It is a way to make a life better for yourself and your family.
Author: Rosie Thomas

Quote: Some people have a heart to do evil and they don't care if you're Muslim or Christian.
Author: Tucker Elliot

Quote: Dans les sociétés vernaculaires, l'éducation est homéotélique vis-à-vis de Gaïa
Author: Edouard Goldsmith

Quote: Faith is an oasis in the heart which will never be reached by the caravan of thinking.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: He is the light in my life and the rock beneath my feet. (Referring to the Lord Jesus)
Author: Kimberly McRae

Quote: Reason is in fact the path to faith, and faith takes over when reason can say no more.
Author: Thomas Merton

Quote: Fan the sinking flame of hilarity with the wing of friendship; and pass the rosy wine.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Friendship is inexplicable, it should not be explained if one doesn't want to kill it.

Quote: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.
Author: Jean de La Fontaine

Quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: If they wanted their shit stirred, then stirred their shit was jolly well going to be.
Author: Stephen Clarke

Quote: People who practice freedom of expression are terrorizing our grammatical way of life.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: The word "genius"isn't applicable in football. A Genius is a guy like Norman Einstein.
Author: Joe Theismann

Quote: Well, don't expect us to be too impressed. We just saw Finnick Odair in his underwear.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: A lonely day is God's way of saying that he wants to spend some quality time with you.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: I know I'm not God, are you? Don't be silly.God? God? Everybody's God? Don't be silly.
Author: Allen Ginsberg

Quote: Kuikaribisha amani ya Mungu katika maisha yangu kumenisaidia. Naishi mbinguni duniani.
Author: Enock Maregesi

Quote: There is no God, Nature sufficeth unto herself; in no wise hath she need of an author.
Author: Marquis de Sade

Quote: Humanity does not ask us to be happy. It merely asks us to be brilliant on its behalf.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: Mother earth cried so much that she has pool of tears more than the land of happiness.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: But Hopes are Shy Birds flying at a great distance seldom reached by the best of Guns.
Author: John James Audubon

Quote: Each life experience poses this question: how do you want to be changed because of me?
Author: Mollie Marti

Quote: Hope is possible, when you decide to believe that what you are hoping for is possible.
Author: Patti Snodgrass

Quote: In the unlikely story that is America, there has never been anything false about hope.
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: It is above all by the imagination that we achieve perception and compassion and hope.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quote: Neither should a ship rely on one small anchor, nor should life rest on a single hope.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: Remember, Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: The beauty of a fragment is that it still supports the hope of brilliant completeness.
Author: Tobias Wolff

Quote: There is hope for the future because God has a sense of humor and we are funny to God.
Author: Bill Cosby

Quote: To hope for nothing, to expect nothing, to demand nothing. This is analytical despair.
Author: James Hillman

Quote: We are laying the foundations of a government, which we hope may outlast the Pyramids.
Author: Caleb Cushing

Quote: When I am dead, I hope it may be said: His sins were scarlet, but his books were read.
Author: Hilaire Belloc

Quote: You can actually create the life you want. It all depends on how daring you desire it.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

Quote: You never know who you're inspiring or uninspiring. People notice more than you think.
Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana

Quote: You're not a bad person, you're just a little bit different and I'm a sucker for that.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: …told herself likewise not to hope. But it was too late. Hope had already entered…
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Un atkal krīt zvaigzne un ceļas cerība. Kā bizonis ceļas cerība, kā baldriāns.
Author: Imants Ziedonis

Quote: Georgie, stop trying to resurrect the shoes. They were never alive in the first place.
Author: Ilona Andrews

Quote: Gimme an S! A T! An O! A C! Followed by a K-H-O-L-M! What's it spell? HEAD FUCK.- Jane
Author: J.R. Ward

Quote: Holey? You have the the whole world of ear-related humor before you, you go for holey?
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Humor expands our limited picture frame and gets us to see more than just our problem.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: Humor levels the playing field. I understood that early on - that was something I had.
Author: Robert Mankoff

Quote: Humor starts like a wildfire, but then continues on, smoldering, smoldering for years.
Author: Robert Orben

Quote: I made this [letter] very long, because I did not have the leisure to make it shorter.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: I think it would be hard to go the distance in this business without a sense of humor.
Author: Patricia Clarkson

Quote: I want someone who can keep me on my toes, has a good sense of humor and a good heart.
Author: Carmen Electra

Quote: If I behave as though this is a completely normal situation, then maybe it will be ...
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: In the first place God made idiots. This was for practice. Then he made school boards.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: It is the ability to take a joke, not make one, that proves you have a sense of humor.
Author: Max Eastman

Quote: Never, under any circumstances, take a sleeping pill and a laxative on the same night.
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: Some pains are physical, and some pains are mental, but the one that's both is dental.
Author: Ogden Nash

Quote: The length of a film should be directly related to the endurance of the human bladder.
Author: Alfred Hitchcock

Quote: The mind is a complex and many-layered thing, Potter... or at least, most minds are...
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: The people in New York - their humor is on a level that goes, uh, very deep, you know?
Author: Elaine Stritch

Quote: You're not right in the head, and nor am I, and this is why....this is why I like you.
Author: Morrissey

Quote: All art requires is courage and the commitment to eat lots of biscuits. D Ellis / 2016
Author: David Ellis

Quote: And if you think you're alone. Put on my music. Because I'm going to be there for you.
Author: Demi Lovato

Quote: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: being afraid to take chances is scarier than actually doing things that challenge you.
Author: Simone Elkeles

Quote: Destiny is a name often given in retrospect to choices that had dramatic consequences.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Get up, stand up, Stand up for your rights. Get up, stand up, Don't give up the fight.
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: I'm not going to die because I failed as someone else. I'm going to succeed as myself.
Author: Margaret Cho

Quote: Learning without thinking is useless, but thinking without learning is very dangerous!
Author: Sukarno

Quote: Let no feeling of discouragement preyupon you, and in the end you are sure to succeed.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Life is a journey, not a destination; there are no mistakes, just chances we've taken.
Author: India.Arie

Quote: Life is one fool thing after another whereas love is two fool things after each other.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Love yourself, even a little bit each day, and your life will bloom into infinite joy.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Negative desires can cause no evil if you do not allow yourself to be seduced by them.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: no matter how ugly the world gets or how stupid it shows me it is, I always have faith
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: One of the simplest ways to stay happy is letting go of the things that makes you sad.
Author: daily dose

Quote: Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.
Author: Lois McMaster Bujold

Quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: Swirl into joy today by sharing your caring with the world. Be a pillar of positivity.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: The Dragonfly CharmEmbrace The Magic of Nature & Life Will Be Filled with Good Fortune
Author: Viola Shipman

Quote: The life given us, by nature is short; but the memory of a well-spent life is eternal.
Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

Quote: The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven..
Author: John Milton

Quote: The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and let it come in.
Author: Morrie Schwartz.

Quote: The results you deserve depend on your will to make your success happen."-Steven Cuoco
Author: Steven Cuoco

Quote: There is no rest in the heart of God until He knows that you are at resh in His grace.
Author: Lloyd John Ogilvie

Quote: We cannot be sure of having something to live for unless we are willing to die for it.
Author: Ernesto Che Guevara

Quote: We may have done what the devil said we did, but we are NOT who the devil says we are!
Author: April Cofield Essix

Quote: When you make the dream of your heart a treasure of heaven, it holds an eternal value.

Quote: Writing means not just staring ugliness in the face, but finding a way to embrace  it.

Quote: In a time of turbulence and change, it is more true than ever that knowledge is power.

Quote: In search of Truth the hopeful zealot goes,But all the sadder tums, the more he knows!
Author: H.P. Lovecraft

Quote: Qui plussait, plus se tait. French, you know. The more a man knows, the less he talks.
Author: Madeleine L'Engle

Quote: Don't let life discourage you; everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was.
Author: Richard L. Evans

Quote: Every man should believe in something.If not..he would doubt everything, even himself.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: Hanya orang-orang dengan hati damailah yang boleh menerima kejadian buruk dengan lega.
Author: Tere Liye

Quote: Having perfected our disguise, we spend our lives searching for someone we don't fool.
Author: Robert Brault

Quote: I came here looking for a Great Perhaps, for real friends and a more-than-minor life..
Author: John Green

Quote: I look back on my life like a good day's work, it was done and I am satisfied with it.
Author: Grandma Moses

Quote: If you would only recognize that life is hard, things would be so much easier for you.
Author: Louis D. Brandeis

Quote: In all of living, have much fun and laughter. Life is to be enjoyed, not just endured.
Author: Gordon B. Hinckley

Quote: Life is a series of surprises and would not be worth taking or keeping if it were not.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Once you leave out all the bullshit they teach you in school, life gets really simple.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The greatest trap in our life is not success, popularity or power, but self-rejection.
Author: Henri Nouwen

Quote: They're animals, all right. But why are you so goddam sure that makes us human beings?

Quote: Things will get easier, people's minds will change, and you should be alive to see it.

Quote: Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: Don't be afraid to lose him, because if a man truly loves you, he's not going anywhere
Author: Steve Harvey

Quote: He's more myself than I am. Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
Author: Emily Brontë

Quote: I'm not sure this is a world I belong in anymore. I'm not sure that I want to wake up.

Quote: Love comes with a knife, not some shy question, and not with fears for its reputation!

Quote: True love cannot be found where it does not exist, nor can it be denied where it does.

Quote: Tucker: Why would you tell me now if it's against the rules?Clara: Because I love you.
Author: Cynthia Hand

Quote: Well my gun fires seven different shades of shit, so what's your favorite color, punk?

Quote: When you love someone, you say their name different. Like it's safe inside your mouth.

Quote: When you love you wish to do things for. You wish to sacrifice for. You wish to serve.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: You don't love because: you love despite; not for the virtues, but despite the faults.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: You'd be surprised what people will do for money that they wouldn't do forlove.Myrnin.
Author: Rachel Caine

Quote: There is no UFO and also there is no alien, at least not in common mind nor reference.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: You can do what you decide to do — but you cannot decide what you will decide to do.
Author: Sam Harris

Quote: All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Charm is the ability to make someone else think that both of you are pretty wonderful.
Author: Kathleen Winsor

Quote: I just did some calculations and I've been able to determine that you're full of shit.
Author: John Green

Quote: If I'm honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.

Quote: If there's a single lesson that life teaches us, it's that wishing doesn't make it so.

Quote: Make your mistakes, take your chances, look silly, but keep on going. Don't freeze up.
Author: Thomas Wolfe

Quote: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.

Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: We all die. The goal isn't to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: What is the point of being alive if you don't at least try to do something remarkable?
Author: John Green

Author: Michel Onfray

Quote: You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read...
Author: Keri Hulme

Quote: Libraries were full of ideas–perhaps the most dangerous and powerful of all weapons.
Author: Sarah J. Maas

Quote: Can all this just be an accident? Or could there be some alien intelligence behind it?
Author: Gene Roddenberry

Quote: Everything smaller than Heaven bores us because only Heaven is bigger than our hearts.
Author: Peter Kreeft

Quote: I can always choose, but I ought to know that if I do not choose, I am still choosing.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's there are few
Author: Shunryu Suzuki

Quote: Saepe creat molles aspera spina rosas"- "Often the prickly thorn produces tender roses
Author: Ovid

Quote: The awful thing is that if i can forget they're people, it will be no different at all
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: The Revolution introduced me to art, and in turn, art introduced me to the Revolution!
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Thought is so cunning, so clever, that it distorts everything for its own convenience.
Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

Quote: We never realize just how many other lives we can help when their paths cross our own.
Author: Wil Zeus

Quote: We...sin not because we want what is evil, but because we want what isn't good enough.
Author: Scott Hahn

Quote: Whoever wishes to become a philosopher must learn not to be frightened by absurdities.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: You know, I think that only if one feels immensely important can one feel truly light.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: One merit of poetry few persons will deny: it says more and in fewer words than prose.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: There are two ways to dislike poetry: One is to dislike it; the other is to read Pope.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: We have seen the best minds of our generation destroyed by boredom at poetry readings.
Author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

Quote: And so sepúlchred in such pomp dost lie,That kings for such a tomb would wish to die.
Author: John Milton

Quote: Listen for the call of your destiny, and when it comes, release your plans and follow.
Author: Mollie Marti

Quote: Yet it's not for want of future that I'm here, he thought. It's for want of a present.
Author: John le Carré

Quote: A change in thought can change a lot. A change thought can untie and untangle the knot
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: Always be wary of people who use quotes. I don't know who said that.' - Murdoc Niccals
Author: Gorillaz

Quote: berhati-hatilah kalo menghujat para maling dan pelacur. "Because we might do the same.
Author: Rama Wibi

Quote: Do not only think about it, but feel about it, also, before taking appropriate action.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Some lean back. But those who lean forward are poised to cross the finish-line, first!
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Though I think and speak of greater becoming, I, too, am an infinite work in progress.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: War Game. You can count the dead, but will never have a winner or a loser. #Thinkpeace
Author: Secli G

Quote: In any relationship in which two people become one, the end result is two half people.
Author: Wayne W. Dyer

Quote: Women cannot complain about men anymore until they start getting better taste in them.
Author: Bill Maher

Quote: A young man who wishes to remain a sound atheist cannot be too careful of his reading.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: I have as much authority as the Pope. I just don't have as many people who believe it.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: If I had to choose a religion, the sun as the universal giver of life would be my god.
Author: Napoléon Bonaparte

Quote: Only priests and fools are fearless and I've never been on the best of terms with God.
Author: Patrick Rothfuss

Quote: Suffer love! A good ephitet! I do suffer love indeed, for I love thee against my will.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Who are you?"I asked."You know who I am,"he replied. "I'm yours."~Clea / Sage, pg. 105
Author: Hilary Duff

Quote: If I looked like him,” Tara said. “I'd want to have sex with myself. All the time.
Author: Jill Shalvis

Quote: All we know of the Missing Link is that he is missing - and he won't be missed either.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: He who hears the rippling of rivers in these degenerate days will not utterly despair.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Hominids typically haven't so much adapted to change, as they have accommodated to it.
Author: Ian Tattersall

Quote: It is interesting to note how many of the great scientific discoveries begin as myths.
Author: Rollo May

Quote: stronger than mountains.a place where my heart feels the safest- underneath his shirt.
Author: Sanober Khan

Quote: The wealth of a soul is measured by how much it can feel... its poverty by how little.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

Quote: To know intense joy without a strong bodily frame, one must have an enthusiastic soul.
Author: George Eliot

Quote: Words are a pretext. It is the inner bond that draws one person to another, not words.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Gnostic tales tell of the homesickness of the soul, its yearning for its own milieu…
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
Author: Bill Cosby

Quote: If you remain static and wait for success to come to you it will certainly not happen.
Author: Steve Backley

Quote: In all our deeds, the proper value and respect for time determines success or failure.
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: Learning to celebrate success is a key component of learning how to win in the market.
Author: Douglas Conant

Quote: No one succeeds without effort... Those who succeed owe their success to perseverance.
Author: Ramana Maharshi

Quote: Success cannot come from standstill men. Methods change and men must change with them.
Author: James Cash Penney

Quote: Success in training the boy depends largely on the Scoutmaster's own personal example.
Author: Robert Baden-Powell

Quote: The minute you start talking about what you're going to do if you lose, you have lost.
Author: George P. Shultz

Quote: You know you made it, when people you know, tell people they know, that you know them.
Author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

Quote: Because even though the truth can set you free, that doesn't mean it won't be painful.
Author: Ally Carter

Quote: People often claim to hunger for truth, but seldom like the taste when it's served up.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: The laughter of the world is merely loneliness pathetically trying to reassure itself.
Author: Neal A. Maxwell

Quote: Tolerance! The virtue that makes one bite his tongue so that he can tear out his hair.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Beauty is truth, truth beauty,—that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know
Author: John Keats

Quote: Vegan is just pure love. Love for animals, love for the planet, and love for yourself.
Author: Mischa Temaul

Quote: Ask not of things to shed their veils. Unveil yourselves, and things will be unveiled.
Author: Mikhail Naimy

Quote: If lightning is the anger of the gods, then the gods are concerned mostly about trees.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: If you don't feel it, flee from it. Go where you are celebrated, not merely tolerated.
Author: Paul F. Davis

Quote: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
Author: Walter Lippmann

Quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: well, sometimes to get what you want the most, you have to do what you want the least.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: Make it dark, make it grim, make it tough, but then, for the love of God, tell a joke.
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Quote: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
Author: Paramahansa Yogananda

Quote: I believe that potential is unlimited - success depends on daring to act on dreams.
Author: Estee Lauder

Quote: I think self-awareness is probably the most important thing towards being a champion.
Author: Billie Jean King

Quote: If you see a get rich quick scheme, that's someone else trying to get rich off of you.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: It is dangerous to be right in matters on which the established authorities are wrong.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others succeed.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: Optimism is the one quality more associated with success and happiness than any other.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Quality is more important than quantity. One home run is much better than two doubles.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: You can start changing our world for the better daily, no matter how small the action.
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quote: An original artist is unable to copy. So he has only to copy in order to be original.
Author: Jean Cocteau

Quote: Any authentic work of art must start an argument between the artist and his audience.
Author: Rebecca West

Quote: Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: I think you can do anything with comics that you could do in just about any art form.
Author: Harvey Pekar

Quote: My love of fine art increased - the more of it I saw, the more of it I wanted to see.
Author: J. Paul Getty

Quote: Riding a race bike is an art - a thing that you do because you feel something inside.
Author: Valentino Rossi

Quote: The art of statesmanship is to foresee the inevitable and to expedite its occurrence.
Author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand

Quote: A book is a dream that you hold in your hands."(As quoted on BookRiot, June 18, 2013)
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Prometheus, thief of light, giver of light, bound by the gods, must have been a book.
Author: Mark Z. Danielewski

Quote: We buy books because we believe we're buying the time to read them.[Inside Out (VH1)]
Author: Warren Zevon

Quote: And then I did what I had never done in his presence, much less in his arms. I cried.
Author: Erich Segal

Quote: Life is a sexually transmitted disease and the mortality rate is one hundred percent.
Author: R.D. Laing

Quote: My God, if I had a heart, I would write my hate on ice, and wait for the sun to show.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: Well I'd certainly hate to interrupt your pleasant night stroll with my sudden death.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: What a school thinks about its library is a measure of what it feels about education.
Author: Harold Howe

Quote: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; unbelief, in denying them.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Even if things aren't going the way we want right now, we will always get through it.
Author: Stacey T. Hunt

Quote: Persistence. Perfection. Patience. Power. Prioritize your passion. It keeps you sane.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: All love that has not friendship for its base, is like a mansion built upon the sand.
Author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

Quote: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

Quote: I'm tired, I'm hungry and I have a head in a bag,"I warned him. "Do not fuck with me.
Author: Karen Chance

Quote: Want to dance? We have music this time. And I don't have to punch you when we finish.
Author: Amy Tintera

Quote: You're far too prickly tempered to be a mistress. You're far better suited as a wife.
Author: Lisa Kleypas

Quote: And why does this same God tell me how to raise my children when he had to drown his?
Author: Robert G. Ingersoll

Quote: If I convert it's because it's better that a believer dies than that an atheist does.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: Nature and Nature's laws lay hid in night:God said, Let Newton be! and all was light.
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: People keep looking for the perfect one, but perfection is an attribute of God alone.
Author: Farahad Zama

Quote: Prayer will make a man cease from sin, or sin will entice a man to cease from prayer.
Author: John Bunyan

Quote: Relying on God has to begin all over again every day as if nothing had yet been done.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Children are gifts. They are not ours for the breaking. They are ours for the making.
Author: Dan Pearce

Quote: Don't be afraid to be who you are bacause you are the only person who knows you best.
Author: Saredo Ali

Quote: Hide yourself in God, so when a man wants to find you he will have to go there first.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: I enjoy melancholic music and art. They take me to places I don't normally get to go.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Reading messed with my brain in an unaccountable way. It made me happy; or something.
Author: Salvatore Scibona

Quote: The happiness of love is in action; its test is what one is willing to do for others.
Author: Lew Wallace

Quote: Truly amazing, what people can get used to, as long as there are a few compensations.
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: We buy things we don't need with money we don't have to impress people we don't like.
Author: Dave Ramsey

Quote: We can't be so desperate for love that we forget where we can always find it; within.
Author: Alexandra Elle

Quote: Creativity comes from trust. Trust your instincts. And never hope more than you work.
Author: Rita Mae Brown

Quote: Hope is a necessity for normal life and the major weapon against the suicide impulse.
Author: Karl A. Menninger

Quote: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering, 'It will be happier.'
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
