Quote: I hope people remember me for the kind of person that I am, not because of what I do.
Author: Sean Faris

Quote: If you hope for happiness in the world, hope for it from God, and not from the world.
Author: David Brainerd

Quote: Its dark and I'm reading my scars because our moments remind me of where I should be.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: So that's the dissenter's hope: that they are writing not for today but for tomorrow.
Author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

Quote: What can you do how much can you give to bring grace and salvation unto even one soul
Author: Bree Despain

Quote: With every choice you create the life you'll live; with every decision you design it.
Author: Mollie Marti

Quote: Yes, in spite of all, Some shape of beauty moves away the pall From our dark spirits.
Author: John Keats

Quote: Cameron Crowe can write dialogue and shoot it with warmth and humor like nobody else.
Author: Emma McLaughlin

Quote: FABLEHAVEN: None who enter will leave unchanged. Trespassers will be turned to stone.
Author: Brandon Mull

Quote: Four be the things I'd have been better without: love, curiosity, freckles and doubt.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: I find any sort of acting that doesn't have any humor in it is mind-numbingly boring.
Author: Andrew Scott

Quote: I got my sense of humor from my grandmother. You know, my grandmother was very funny.
Author: Paul Mooney

Quote: I really believe, or want to believe, really I am nuts, otherwise I'll never be sane.
Author: Allen Ginsberg

Quote: I think hiccup cures were really invented for the amusement of the patient's friends.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: If a man says something in the woods and there are no women there, is he still wrong?
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: If you were me, then I'd be you, and if I were you, then I'd hide somewhere far away.
Author: Eoin Colfer

Quote: I've met a lot of people who've lost their jobs and they still have a sense of humor.
Author: Louis C. K.

Quote: Last night I dreamt that somebody loved me.No hope, no harm; just another false alarm
Author: Morrissey

Quote: My sense of humor is a turkey, and I pull it out of the oven and baste it in reality.
Author: Tracy Morgan

Quote: One can never speak enough of the virtues, the dangers, the power of shared laughter.
Author: Francoise Sagan

Quote: Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: Poirot,"I said. "I have been thinking.""An admirable exercise my friend. Continue it.
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: Remember, we're madly in love, so it's all right to kiss me anytime you feel like it.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: Right,"she said, "We're going to the Land of the Dead and I shouldn't think negative.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: The impossible often has a kind of integrity to it which the merely improbable lacks.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: There's plenty of room for humor in politics, God knows, but it's a serious business.
Author: Al Franken

Quote: They laugh at me because I'm different; I laugh at them because they're all the same.
Author: Kurt Cobain

Quote: Times are bad. Children no longer obey their parents, and everyone is writing a book.
Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

Quote: What I'm expecting is for you to behave like the gentleman I always thought you were.
Author: Wendelin Van Draanen

Quote: You can't study comedy; it's within you. It's a personality. My humor is an attitude.
Author: Don Rickles

Quote: We'll never survive!” “Nonsense. You're only saying that because no one ever has.
Author: William Goldman

Quote: A single day is enough to make us a little larger or, another time, a little smaller.
Author: Paul Klee

Quote: A wise man always has something to say, whereas a fool always needs to say something.
Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S

Quote: Anybody can make the simple complecated. Creativity is making the complecated simple.
Author: Charles Mingus

Quote: Be brave, follow dreams, say fuck you to everybody and fight for what you believe in.
Author: Jared Leto

Quote: Binatang itu bicara, makan -- tapi tak mengerti dirinya sendiri. Dan aku begitu juga.
Author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer

Quote: Deeply respecting yourself is the first step toward having a deep respect for others.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Dreaming is the poetry of Life, and we must be forgiven if we indulge in it a little.
Author: John Galsworthy

Quote: First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: For a true artist, difficulties become opportunities and clouds become solid present.
Author: Alejandro Jodorowsky

Quote: HopeSmiles from the threshold of the year to come, Whispering 'it will be happier'...
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

Quote: I arise full of eagerness and energy, knowing well what achievement lies ahead of me.
Author: Zane Grey

Quote: I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: I swear, the best things come to me by accident! Or should I say, effortless destiny?
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: I want to dream a dream so wonderful that I'll wake up sorry that it wasn't a memory.
Author: Robin M. Helm

Quote: If you are willing to go out on a limb, the tree of life holds endless possibilities.
Author: Angel Sharum

Quote: If you seek creative ideas go walking.Angels whisper to a man when he goes fora walk.
Author: Raymond I. Myers

Quote: jika seluruh hidupmu kau lesakkan dalam satu benda, terpikir olehmu benda apakah itu?
Author: Lisa Febriyanti

Quote: Just go with it', he thought. 'You won't figure out anything if you give in to fear'.
Author: James Dashner

Quote: Most good things have already been said far too many times and just need to be lived.
Author: Shane Claiborne

Quote: Never give advice unless you have walked the walk, because anybody can talk the talk.
Author: Valencia Mackie

Quote: Right now, we're living in an ugly chapter of our lives, but books always get better!
Author: Chris Colfer

Quote: S is for SCARY! Fear is driven out by action! Bad habits are overcome by good habits.
Author: Lucas Remmerswaal

Quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Sometimes God makes better choices for us than we could have ever made for ourselves.
Author: Jennifer Hudson Taylor

Quote: Spirituality exist in testing and experiencing the depth of inner peace consistently.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: Start writing, no matter what. The water does not flow until the faucet is turned on.
Author: Louis L'Amour

Quote: Stay true to yourself and listen to your inner voice. It will lead you to your dream.
Author: James Ross

Quote: Tongues in trees, books in running brooks, sermons in stones, and good in everything.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: We can never know what might have been but what is to come is another matter entirely
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: We train the mind so that we can enjoy greater peace, happiness, wisdom & equanimity.
Author: Allan Lokos

Quote: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
Author: John Lennon

Quote: I don't want anyone to hold back who they are. It's not okay… it's not a good thing
Author: Connor Franta

Quote: An educated man should know everything about something and something about everything
Author: C.V. Wedgwood

Quote: For the things of this world cannot be made known without a knowledge of mathematics.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: I've learned one thing-people who know the least anyways seem to know it the loudest.
Author: Al Capp

Quote: Thought must be divided against itself before it can come to any knowledge of itself.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Books can be dangerous. The best ones should be labeled "This could change your life.
Author: Helen Exley

Quote: Challenging the meaning of life is the truest expression of the state of being human.
Author: Viktor E. Frankl

Quote: For the happiest life, days should be rigorously planned, nights left open to chance.
Author: Mignon McLaughlin

Quote: Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: I am a great admirer of mystery and magic. Look at this life - all mystery and magic.
Author: Harry Houdini

Quote: I don't ever give my opinion. Opinions I have about anything are in my personal life.
Author: Al Pacino

Quote: I think, that if the world were a bit more like ComicCon, it would be a better place.
Author: Matt Smith

Quote: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: It kills me how these days everyone has clinical justification for their strangeness.
Author: Miguel Syjuco

Quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity, or registering wrongs.
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quote: Life is full of grief, to exactly the degree we allow ourselves to love other people.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: Most of the basic material a writer works with is acquired before the age of fifteen.
Author: Willa Cather

Quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life - to be happy - it's all that matters.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: The trick is to enjoy life. Don't wish away your days, waiting for better ones ahead.
Author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

Quote: Whether we fall by ambition, blood, or lustLike diamonds we are cut with our own dust
Author: John Webster

Quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it's all that matters.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Ang great love mo, hindi mo makakatuluyan. Ang makakatuluyan mo ay yung correct love.
Author: Ricky Lee

Quote: He didn't realize that love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves its own mark.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: I imagine a line, a white line, painted on the sand and on the ocean, from me to you.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: I love myself, the way I look, my body, but sometimes I can't help but feel insecure.
Author: Lea Michele

Quote: I'm saying I'm in love with you! I've been in love with you this whole bleeding year!
Author: Stephanie Perkins

Quote: Love can rebuild the world, they say, so everything's possible when it comes to love.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: Love is a gross exaggeration of the difference between one person and everybody else.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Love is but the discovery of ourselves in others, and the delight in the recognition.
Author: Alexander Smith

Quote: Loving someone and having them love you back is the most precious thing in the world.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: Soulmate"is an overused term, but a true soul connection is very rare, and very real.
Author: Hilary Duff

Quote: Stronger than lover's love is lover's hate. Incurable, in each, the wounds they make.
Author: Euripides

Quote: To enlarge or illustrate this power and effect of love is to set a candle in the sun.
Author: Robert Burton

Quote: Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: What I love about my husband is that he really allows me to be the best person I can.
Author: Georgina Chapman

Quote: What if I were smiling and running into your arms? Would you see then what I see now?
Author: Jon Krakauer

Quote: Zen masters say you cannot see your reflection in running water, only in still water.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: I am very confident. I look confident. I act confident. I speak in a confident way...
Author: Milton H. Erickson

Quote: Open the window of your mind. Allow the fresh air,new lights and new truths to enter.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: The most fruitful and natural exercise for our minds is, in my opinion, conversation.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: Yoga means addition - addition of energy, strength and beauty to body, mind and soul.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: If you're losing your soul and you know it, then you've still got a soul left to lose
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: The future is now. It's time to grow up and be strong. Tomorrow may well be too late.
Author: Neil LaBute

Quote: Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you.
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quote: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.
Author: Charles Lamb

Quote: Even a soul submerged in sleep is hard at work and helps make something of the world.
Author: Heraclitus

Quote: I surround myself with things that make me happy. Why? Because ... it makes me happy.
Author: Kelly Epperson

Quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.
Author: Plato

Quote: Those who are without compassion cannot see what is seen with the eyes of compassion.
Author: Hanh Nhat Thich

Quote: Don't you know no one can escapethe power of creatures reaching outwith breath alone?
Author: Marina Tsvetaeva

Quote: Green was the silence, wet was the light,the month of June trembled like a butterfly.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: My head is full of fireand grief and my tongueruns wild, piercedwith shards of glass.
Author: Federico García Lorca

Quote: No one but Night, with tears on her dark face, watches beside me in this windy place.
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: Poetry is just so emo."he said. "Oh, the pain. The pain. It always rains. In my soul.
Author: John Green

Quote: Transform from being a fault-finder and blamer to a happiness-finder and appreciator.
Author: Maddy Malhotra

Quote: Your purpose in life is to find your purpose and give your whole heart and soul to it
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: People have incredible nerve to do terrible things, but never actually admit to them.
Author: Henry Mosquera

Quote: People don't get to our ages without having pasts. I'm more interested in the future.
Author: Robyn Donald

Quote: To save face, it's better not to ask sex from the ex, but to give everything the axe.
Author: Anthony Liccione

Quote: I'm an atheist, and a militant atheist when religion starts impacting on legislation.
Author: Daniel Radcliffe

Quote: Here's what I know: death abducts the dying, but grief steals from those left behind.
Author: Katherine Owen

Quote: Our relationship wasn't the sun, the moon, the stars, but it wasn't bullshit, either.
Author: Junot Díaz

Quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Science ask facts and religion ask faith, humans are confused between life and death.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: Failure is not our only punishment for laziness; there is also the success of others.
Author: Jules Renard

Quote: If you have a successful run, everything comes to you. Nothing succeeds like success.
Author: John Barry

Quote: If you want to give yourself a fair chance to succeed, never expect too much too soon
Author: Po Bronson

Quote: My success was not based so much on any great intelligence but on great common sense.
Author: Helen Gurley Brown

Quote: Successful people play the part of being successful consistently in all that they do.
Author: Lorii Myers

Quote: The measure of a society is not only what it does but the quality of its aspirations.
Author: Wade Davis

Quote: The most absurd and reckless aspirations have sometimes led to extraordinary success.
Author: Luc de Clapiers

Quote: When we are connected to the source, we will not be afraid of any task set before us.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: When you know what you want, and you want it bad enough, you'll find a way to get it.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: You know you made it, when your friends tell their friends that you are their friend.
Author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

Quote: That is all very senseless, but this senselessness has a pretty mouth, and it smiles.
Author: Robert Walser

Quote: The truth is like salt. Men want to taste a little, but too much makes everyone sick.
Author: Joe Abercrombie

Quote: To realize the truth, you have to cross the boundaries of all religions and prophets.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: You know there's no such thing as a complete lie. There's always some truth in there.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: Veganism is a powerful step anyone can take to make this world a more peaceful place.
Author: Unknown

Quote: How would we fare psychologically if the walls of slaughterhouses were made of glass?
Author: Tom Regan

Quote: I choose not to make a graveyard of my body with the rotting corpses of dead animals.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: I did not become a vegetarian for my health, I did it for the health of the chickens.
Author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

Quote: If you visit the killing floor of a slaughterhouse, it will brand your soul for life.
Author: Howard Lyman

Quote: One to change a few. A few to change many. Many to change the world. Starts with one.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Science that fails to embrace all living beings is far more dangerous than any virus!
Author: Steve Simmons

Quote: The soul is the same in all living creatures, although the body of each is different.
Author: Hippocrates

Quote: To get mud off your hands, use soap and water. To get blood off your hands, go vegan.
Author: John Sakars

Quote: A person is wise if he listens to millions of advice and doesn't implement any of it.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson

Quote: Forget the years, forget distinctions. Leap into the boundless and make it your home!
Author: Zhuangzi

Quote: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.
Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Quote: You must become the producer, director and actor in the unfolding story of your life.
Author: Wayne W. Dyer

Quote: Fancies are like shadows...you can't cage them, they're such wayward, dancing things.
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Quote: Grand. There's a word I really hate. It's a phony. I could puke every time I hear it.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: I think like a genius, I write like a distinguished author, and I speak like a child.
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: It's harder to write in the third person but the advantage is you move around better.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: You don't deserve my image in your head. You don't deserve my memories in your chest.
Author: Coco J. Ginger

Quote: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: Even though you are on the right track - you will get run over if you just sit there.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: If it entertains you now but will bore you someday, it's a distraction. Keep looking.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: Life is like playing the violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: Mind is the creator of everything. You should therefore guide it to create only good.
Author: Paramahansa Yogananda

Quote: Only when you can be extremely pliable and soft can you be extremely hard and strong.
Author: Zen Proverb

Quote: Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves.
Author: Amelia Earhart

Quote: The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
Author: John Lennon

Quote: An artist cannot speak about his art any more than a plant can discuss horticulture.
Author: Jean Cocteau

Quote: Art reflects society. Cinema doesn't dictate - you portray what the society demands.
Author: Sonam Kapoor

Quote: Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
Author: Scott Adams

Quote: Gossip is the art of saying nothing in a way that leaves practically nothing unsaid.
Author: Walter Winchell

Quote: I do not want art for a few any more than education for a few, or freedom for a few.
Author: William Morris

Quote: If you cannot learn to love real art, at least learn to hate sham art and reject it.
Author: William Morris

Quote: Modesty: the gentle art of enhancing your charm by pretending not to be aware of it.
Author: Oliver Herford

Quote: Painting is the passage from the chaos of the emotions to the order of the possible.
Author: Balthus

Quote: Religion is the everlasting dialogue between humanity and God. Art is its soliloquy.
Author: Franz Werfel

Quote: The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: A book is a mirror: if an ape looks into it an apostle is hardly likely to look out.
Author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

Quote: in this land some of us fuck more than we die but most of us die better than we fuck
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: Life isn't fair. A fair's a place where you eat corn dogs and ride the ferris wheel.
Author: Jennifer Brown

Quote: The thought that I might kill myself formed in my mind coolly as a tree or a flower.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: We're all dead the moment we're born. Just, some of us get there faster than others.
Author: Alex Scarrow

Quote: I have a pretty large experience of boys, and you're a bad set of fellows. Now mind!
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.
Author: Frank Zappa

Quote: The task of the modern educator is not to cut down jungles, but to irrigate deserts.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: There is no school equal to a decent home and no teacher equal to a virtuous parent.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: To educate a person in the mind but not in morals is to educate a menace to society.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: You educate a man; you educate a man. You educate a woman; you educate a generation.
Author: Brigham Young

Quote: A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: I believe in my mask-- The man I made up is meI believe in my dance-- And my destiny
Author: Sam Shepard

Quote: Realize that if a door closed, it's because what was behind it wasn't meant for you.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: Sometimes we can focus so much on nothing that we make it a big something of nothing
Author: Ricky Maye

Quote: We were as Hansel and Gretel and we ventured out into the black forest of the world.
Author: Patti Smith

Quote: You cannot reason people out of a position that they did not reason themselves into.
Author: Ben Goldacre

Quote: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
Author: Dag Hammarskjold

Quote: Friendship! Mysterious cement of the soul, Sweet'ner of life, and solder of society.
Author: Robert Blair

Quote: Laughter is not a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is the best ending for one.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: The Doctor: I've seen bigger.Clara: Really?The Doctor: Are you joking? It's massive!
Author: Steven Moffat

Quote: Dylan Jerome,"the lawyer admits, "wanted to sue God for not caring enough about him.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: I wish all those who've found God, would tell the rest of us where he's been hiding.
Author: Quentin R. Bufogle

Quote: Sometimes the Lord allows us to go through tough times so we learn to rely upon Him.
Author: Shirley Corder

Quote: The world looks like something God had just imaged for his own pleasure, doesn't it?
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Quote: We can never know who or what we are till we know at least something of what God is.
Author: A.W. Tozer

Quote: A disciplined mind leads to happiness, and an undisciplined mind leads to suffering.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: No one can grant you happiness. Happiness is a choice we all have the power to make.
Author: Dean Koontz

Quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Quote: Where happiness was not a possibility, the illusion of it was always more important.
Author: Colum McCann

Quote: You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: And when all your faith is gone let it be me, if it's a friend you need let it be me
Author: Ray Lamontagne

Quote: Excuse me, I feel interrupted and I think I've overdose from the idea of loving you.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: I find peace when I'm confused, I find hope when I'm let down, not in me but in you.
Author: Switchfoot

Quote: May be its mine bad-luck Or yours not to get me But I still have hope Of being yours
Author: Hasil Paudyal

Quote: Mile by mile, it's a trial; yard by yard, it's hard; but inch by inch, it's a cinch.
Author: Gabrielle Giffords

Quote: Nor dread nor hope attendA dying animal;A man awaits his endDreading and hoping all.
Author: W.B. Yeats

Quote: Sometimes people need to know they could be forgiven to have the strength to change.
Author: J. Leigh Bralick

Quote: Tell me there is still good in the world. Tell me there is still hope for all of us.
Author: Marie Lu

Quote: The comfortable estate of widowhood is the only hope that keeps up a wife's spirits.
Author: John Gay

Quote: We are all serving a life sentence, and good behavior is our only hope for a pardon.
Author: Douglas Horton

Quote: Rien ne va arrêter ma quête pour te trouver"No one will stop my quest to find you.
Author: Susane Colasanti

Quote: A sense of humor is the ability to understand a joke - and that the joke is oneself.
Author: Clifton Fadiman

Quote: Any customer can have a car painted any colour that he wants so long as it is black.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Do you ever think if people heard our conversations they'd lock us up?"All the time.
Author: Wendy Mass

Quote: Humor distorts nothing, and only false gods are laughed off their earthly pedestals.
Author: Agnes Repplier

Quote: I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it.
Author: Flannery O'Connor

Quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: I'm not a vegetarian because I love animals, I'm a vegetarian because I hate plants.
Author: A. Whitney Brown

Quote: I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Love, as wonderful and horrible as it is, has at its center a kind of pitiful humor.
Author: Tim O'Brien

Quote: Married people should not be quick to hear what is said by either when in ill humor.
Author: Samuel Richardson

Quote: My type of humor is me not caring whether people know what I'm talking about or not.
Author: John Hodgman

Quote: The world isn't fair, Calvin.""I know Dad, but why isn't it ever unfair in my favor?
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Throw in the humor, throw in that personality, try things you wouldn't normally try.
Author: Melinda Clarke

Quote: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
Author: Mel Brooks

Quote: You leave me tied up like a dog? Then you had better remember that this bitch bites!
Author: Kresley Cole

Quote: You've got no sense of humor.""I'm going to laugh really hard after I kick your ass.
Author: J.D. Robb

Quote: Adapt what is useful, reject what is useless, and add what is specifically your own.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: Anyone can smile on their best day. I like to meet a man who can smile on his WORST.
Author: Lauren Graham

Quote: Be uniquely you. Stand out. Shine. Be colorful. The world needs your prismatic soul!
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Being defeated is often a temporary condition. Giving up is what makes it permanent.
Author: Marilyn Vos Savant

Quote: Choose love and joy as much as you can in each moment and watch your life transform.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
Author: Democritus

Quote: If a picture paints a thousand words, then a let a picture inspire a thousand words.
Author: Nicholas Boyd Crutchley

Quote: If you dare nothing, then when the day is over, nothing is all you will have gained.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: It doesn't matter how great your shoes are if you don't accomplish anything in them.
Author: Martina Boone

Quote: It is not enough to be industrious; so are the ants. What are you industrious about?
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Jealousy is the lock that closes your heart, understanding is the key that opens it.
Author: Ken Petti

Quote: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
Author: André Gide

Quote: Obstacles are those frightening things you see when you take you eyes off your goal.
Author: Henry James

Quote: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: One who has reached a goal no longer travels the road"(Pauline Christianity, p. 111)
Author: John Ziesler

Quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: Pay attention to the intricate patterns of your existence that you take for granted.
Author: Doug Dillon

Quote: Pride is a funny thing; it can make what is truly worthless appear to be a treasure.
Author: Alice Hoffman

Quote: Remember that the happiest people are not those getting more, but those giving more.
Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

Quote: sometimes knowing when to give up is the real test of character...-annabelle granger
Author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

Quote: The hardest battle you are ever going to have to fight is the battle to be just you.
Author: Leo Buscaglia

Quote: What we can change is our perceptions, which have the effect of changing everything.
Author: Donna Quesada

Quote: You can't understand where someone's going unless you understand where they've been.
Author: Jerry B. Jenkins

Quote: Ma már nem gondolom, hogy út, szenvedés, fáradtság nélkül célba lehet jutni.
Author: Tolvaly Ferenc

Quote: Maybe knowledge is as fundamental, or even more fundamental than [material] reality.
Author: Anton Zeilinger

Quote: Those at too great a distance may, I am well are, mistake ignorance for perspective.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: You have learnt something. That always feels at first as if you have lost something.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Por muchas cosas que se sepan, siempre habrá un número mayor de cosas por conocer.
Author: Sonia Fernández-Vidal

Quote: A life without a lonely place, that is, without a quiet center, becomes destructive.
Author: Henri Nouwen

Quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
Author: George Moore

Quote: An ability to look into the confusing mess of life and see things for what they are.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a weary world.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: I am the Way, the Truth, and the Life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
Author: Jesus Christ

Quote: I can chase you, and I can catch you,but there is nothing I can do to make you mine.
Author: Morrissey

Quote: I had a dream about you last night.. you were trying to give coordinates to an apple
Author: Nicole McKay

Quote: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
Author: Meister Eckhart

Quote: If you need something from somebody always give that person a way to hand it to you.
Author: Sue Monk Kidd

Quote: If you spend your whole life waiting for the storm, you'll never enjoy the sunshine.
Author: Morris West

Quote: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: It's faith in something and enthusiasm for something that makes a life worth living.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

Quote: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
Author: Buddha

Quote: Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be.
Author: Bob Dylan

Quote: Life is partly what we make it, and partly what it is made by the friends we choose.
Author: Tehyi Hsieh

Quote: Look for the good in every person and every situation. You'll almost always find it.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: My only advice is to stay aware, listen carefully, and yell for help if you need it.
Author: Judy Blume

Quote: The mistakes I've made are dead to me. But I can't take back the things I never did.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.
Author: Stephanie Perkins

Quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: The trouble is if you don't spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.
Author: Peter Shaffer

Quote: Your time is way too valuable to be wasting on people that can't accept who you are.
Author: Turcois Ominek

Quote: And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: I don't think we get a choice in who we fall for,"Ian whispers. "I think we just do.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: I love going to the movie theatre, seeing live comedy, and going to amusement parks.
Author: Jennette McCurdy

Quote: I love the feeling of the fresh air on my face and the wind blowing through my hair.
Author: Evel Knievel

Quote: I understood that the Church had a Heart, and that this Heart was burning with love.
Author: Therese of Lisieux

Quote: If a man hasn't what's necessary to make a woman love him, it's his fault, not hers.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: If you aren't the woman I think you are, then this isn't the world I thought it was.
Author: Arthur Golden

Quote: Love you will find only where you may show yourself weak without provoking strength.
Author: Theodor Adorno

Quote: Often it is the most deserving people who cannot help loving those who destroy them.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: The only creatures that are evolved enough to convey pure love are dogs and infants.
Author: Johnny Depp

Quote: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Quote: I would not bend.They could not make me Pliable.My mind was strong.My mind was mine.
Author: Janice Hardy

Quote: It is the vocation of the Christian in every generation to out-think all opposition.
Author: Elton Trueblood

Quote: Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.
Author: Tahereh Mafi

Quote: Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.
Author: John Updike

Quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.
Author: Henry Thomas Buckle

Quote: I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: I have spread my dreams under your feet.Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
Author: W.B. Yeats

Quote: I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read.
Author: Nicholson Baker

Quote: If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: It was the kind of kiss that mademe know that I was never so happy in my whole life.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: The difference between sex and love is that sex relieves tension and love causes it.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: those who escape hellhowevernever talk aboutitand nothing muchbothers themafterthat.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: Yes, and I'm sure the arena will be full of bags of flour for me to chuck at people.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: You said you were going for a walk!? What kind of walk takes six hours?""A long one?
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: ...as I get older, I find myself insisting on my right to be philosophically sloppy.
Author: Helen Simonson

Quote: A serious and good philosophical work could be written consisting entirely of jokes.
Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

Quote: Empty is the argument of the philosopher which does not relieve any human suffering.
Author: Epicurus

Quote: I refuse to let the standards of evil people chip away at my capacity for integrity.
Author: Stefan Molyneux

Quote: Instinct is a makeshift, an admission of helplessness before the problem of reality.
Author: Leo Frobenius

Quote: The most incomprehensible thing about the world is that it is at all comprehensible.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: There would be no society if living together depended upon understanding each other.
Author: Eric Hoffer

Quote: Truth is neither ojectivity nor the balanced view; truth is a selfless subjectivity.
Author: Knut Hamsun

Quote: What's the use of complaining about something you have no intentions of changing it?
Author: Mario L Castellanos

Quote: A poet is, before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language.
Author: W.H. Auden

Quote: It's important to have your private enjoyments because sometimes that's all we have.
Author: Kay Ryan

Quote: Our state cannot be severed, we are one,One flesh; to lose thee were to lose myself.
Author: John Milton

Quote: Real poetry, is to lead a beautiful life. To live poetry is better than to write it.
Author: Matsuo Bashō

Quote: To wake the soul by tender strokes of art,To raise the genius, and to mend the heart
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: Choose your thoughts and beliefs wisely.Be your own best friend, and not your enemy.
Author: Maddy Malhotra

Quote: I'm no longer quite sure what the question is, but I do know that the answer is Yes.
Author: Leonard Bernstein

Quote: The failure to think positively can weigh on a cancer patient like a second disease.
Author: Barbara Ehrenreich

Quote: Nothing is more creative... nor destructive... than a brilliant mind with a purpose.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: Get busy watering your own grass so as not to notice whether it's greener elsewhere.
Author: Karon Waddell

Quote: If you want something you have never had, you must do something you have never done.
Author: Isra Sravenheart

Quote: Inspirational quotes are dances of light that shine in dark places during your life.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Not every instance requires a response. Truth resides silently in the seat of power.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Don't answer the door in a wedding dress and veil, he might not think you're joking.
Author: Amy Sedaris

Quote: Just because he likes the same bizzaro crap as you doesn't mean he's your soul mate.
Author: Rachel Hansen

Quote: You can't truly hate someone until you've cared about them. Until you've loved them.
Author: Kirsten Hubbard

Quote: You'll blow up a helicopter, but you won't go out with me? What is  wrong  with you?
Author: Meg Cabot

Quote: It doesn't matter that you didn't believe in us,"said Mr. Ibis. "We believed in you.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: They say religion is about love, but you wonder how much of it really is about fear.
Author: Deb Caletti

Quote: You will face your greatest opposition when you are closest to your biggest miracle.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Have you any other objection than your belief of my indifference?"- Elizabeth Bennet
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: He'd used the amulet to read my thoughts again. I pictured smacking him in the face.
Author: Priya Ardis

Quote: What is real and what is not is for your heart to decide and for your heart to know.
Author: Colleen Houck

Quote: All what we think and know is an illusion. Nothing exists. Everything is an opinion.
Author: Ash Vaz

Quote: One possibility is: God is nothing but the power of the universe to organize itself.
Author: Lee Smolin

Quote: All those who are around me are the bridge to my success, so they are all important.
Author: Manny Pacquiao

Quote: Even if you are on the right track, but just sit there, you will still get run over.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: I've always believed that one woman's success can only help another woman's success.
Author: Gloria Vanderbilt

Quote: Life will be a whole lot better if we understand what our salvation in Christ means.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: Should-haves solve nothing. It's the next thing to happen that needs thinking about.
Author: Alexandra Ripley

Quote: Success in life comes not from holding a good hand, but in playing a poor hand well.
Author: Denis Waitley

Quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.[Eddie Scissons]
Author: W.P. Kinsella

Quote: Success is the progressive realization of predetermined, worthwhile, personal goals.
Author: Paul J. Meyer

Quote: That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: The key to Turkey's success has been its ability to reinvent itself as times change.
Author: Stephen Kinzer

Quote: The very first step towards success in any occupation is to become interested in it.
Author: William Osler

Quote: In fact, it is more correct to say that Truth is God, than to say that God is Truth.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Mothers were the only ones you could depend on to tell the whole, unvarnished truth.
Author: Margaret Dilloway

Quote: Over time, hidden truths morph in the dark soil of deceit into something much worse.
Author: Patti Callahan Henry

Quote: Writing fiction is the act of weaving a series of lies to arrive at a greater truth.
Author: Khaled Hosseini

Quote: I choose not to make a graveyard of my body for the rotting corpses of dead animals.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: If you can live happily and healthily without harming animals then why wouldn't you?
Author: Unknown

Quote: The essence of wisdom is to know when to be doing, and when it's useless even to try
Author: Mary Stewart

Quote: Everyone in the South has no time for reading because they are all too busy writing.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: Only those things are beautiful which are inspired by madness and written by reason.
Author: André Gide

Quote: Always keep your eyes open. Keep watching. Because whatever you see can inspire you.
Author: Grace Coddington

Quote: Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.
Author: Amelia Earhart

Quote: Do not follow the ideas of others, but learn to listen to the voice within yourself.
Author: Dogen

Quote: Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
Author: Meister Eckhart

Quote: If you always do what you've always done, you'll always get what you've always got.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Leaders think and talk about solutions. Followers think and talk about the problems.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Many roads lead to the path, but basically there are only two: reason and practice.
Author: Bodhidharma

Quote: Never give up work. Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: The future belongs to those who learn more skills and combine them in creative ways.
Author: Robert Greene

Quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: You never know when a moment and a few sincere words can have an impact on a life.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Art is the stored honey of the human soul, gathered on wings of misery and travail.
Author: Theodore Dreiser

Quote: Every production of an artist should be the expression of an adventure of his soul.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: I don't think there's any artist of any value who doesn't doubt what they're doing.
Author: Francis Ford Coppola

Quote: I think you can leave the arts, superior or inferior, to the conscience of mankind.
Author: William Butler Yeats

Quote: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The whole art of war consists of guessing at what is on the other side of the hill.
Author: Arthur Wellesley

Quote: Books are like mirrors: if a fool looks in, you cannot expect a genius to look out.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: I only read biographies, metaphysics and psychology. I can dream up my own fiction.
Author: Mae West

Quote: One of the great things about books is sometimes there are some fantastic pictures.
Author: George W. Bush

Quote: Some of these things are true and some of them lies. But they are all good stories.
Author: Hilary Mantel

Quote: Stephenie Meyer: Her vampires are sparkly, which I think we can all agree is wrong.
Author: Christopher Moore

Quote: The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: He wipes tears off my face and then snot. He uses his hands. He loves me that much.
Author: Nina LaCour

Quote: If you treat every situation as a life and death matter, you'll die a lot of times.
Author: Dean Smith

Quote: We have only a little time to please the living. But all eternity to love the dead.
Author: Sophocles

Quote: ...madaming teacher sa labas ng eskwelahan. desisyon mo kung kanino ka magpapaturo.
Author: Bob Ong

Quote: Education isn't for getting a job. It's about developing yourself as a human being.
Author: Liz Berry

Quote: Public education was not founded to give society what it wants. Quite the opposite.
Author: May Sarton

Quote: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Faith is, at one and the same time, absolutely necessary and altogether impossible.
Author: Stanisław Lem

Quote: I perceive God everywhere in His works. I sense Him in me; I see Him all around me.
Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Quote: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us, as the confidence of their help.
Author: Epicurus

Quote: The rare few, who, early in life have rid themselves of the friendship of the many.
Author: James Whistler

Quote: What I actually want to call you is a hell of a lot more unprintable than your name
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: How do you know when you're God?""When I pray to him I find I am talking to myself.
Author: Peter Barnes

Quote: I don't know if God exists, but it would be better for His reputation if He didn't.
Author: Jules Renard

Quote: We almost made it to thirty seconds without an insult. I think we set a new record.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

Quote: Your angel cannot protect you against that which neither god nor the devil had made
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Happiness is a risk. If you're not a little scared, then you're not doing it right.
Author: Sarah Addison Allen

Quote: Happiness when sustained too long in print can rightly be construed as sappiness...
Author: Millard Kaufman

Quote: The secret of a happy life is respect. Respect for yourself and respect for others.
Author: Ayad Akhtar

Quote: Hopeful thinking can get you out of your fear zone and into your appreciation zone.
Author: Martha Beck

Quote: Once a day has begun eventfully, it generally carries on being every bit as lively.
Author: Albert Ehrenstein

Quote: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: All I know is just what I read in the papers, and that's an alibi for my ignorance.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: Americans are pragmatic, relatively uncomplicated, hearty and given to broad humor.
Author: Herb Caen

Quote: As with most of life's problems, this one can be solved by a box of pure radiation.
Author: Andy Weir

Quote: Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business.
Author: Tom Robbins

Quote: Five syllables,"Apollo said, counting them on his fingers. "That would be real bad.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Humor can alter any situation and help us cope at the very instant we are laughing.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: I think humor is important for all of us, and a great comedian is a great treasure.
Author: Leila Josefowicz

Quote: I'd said it before and meant it: Alive or undead, the love of my life was a badass.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: If anger were mileage, I'd be a very frequent flyer, right up there in First Class.
Author: Gina Barreca

Quote: I've had a very laughable career and what has seen me through is my sense of humor.
Author: Linda Gray

Quote: Look at me!Look at me!Look at me NOW!It is fun to have funBut you have to know how.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: My dad used to say that life's a journey, but somebody screwed up and lost the map.
Author: Rachel Caine

Quote: People in real life don't get ballplayers' humor, the way we talk in the clubhouse.
Author: Justin Verlander

Quote: People talk too much. Humans aren't descended from monkeys. They come from parrots.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: Right,"Sadie said. "And Set will just stand there calmly while I read him to death.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
Author: H.L. Mencken

Quote: 'The Sundial' is written with the kind of humor that would make a guillotine laugh.
Author: Victor LaValle

Quote: Yakka foob mog. Grug pubbawup zink wattoom gazork. Chumble spuzz. I love loopholes.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: I was raised right — I talk about people behind their backs. It's called manners.
Author: Kathy Griffin

Quote: A crossbow?” Pigeon asked.I left my battle-ax in my other jeans,” the man said.
Author: Brandon Mull

Quote: Any ideas, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Brimstone once told me that to stay true in the face of evil is a feat of strength.
Author: Laini Taylor

Quote: Dig deep and empower yourself today. Stand in your inner strength. Be uniquely you.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Don't worry about the negative people may say about you. Learn from it and move on.
Author: Amanda Penland

Quote: Forever friends are a treasure chest of understanding and compassion. Cherish them.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Give thanks for what you are today and go on fighting for what you gone be tomorrow
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: God sleeps in the minerals, awakens in plants, walks in animals, and thinks in man.
Author: Arthur Young

Quote: Having the best doesn't make you the best but producing the best makes you the best
Author: ejembi louis

Quote: I do not believe in taking the right decision, I take a decision and make it right.
Author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

Quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: No thought is a stupid thought, those who are thoughtless are thought of as stupid.
Author: Nate Spears

Quote: Sometimes the best of gods gift's arrive by the shattering of all the window panes.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Sometimes you must stand still in order to get moving to where GOD wants you to go.
Author: D.A. McBride

Quote: Sometimes, the most graceful way to handle something is to be decidedly ungraceful.
Author: Kristi Ling

Quote: Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You have to set yourself on fire.
Author: Arnold H. Glasow

Quote: Take the breath of the new dawn and make it part of you. It will give you strength.
Author: Hopi Nation

Quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: The Hot Air Balloon CharmLife Can Be Filled with Adventure If You Let Yourself Soar
Author: Viola Shipman

Quote: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: Treat yourself today! You are a unique, sparkling, spectacular soul. Celebrate you!
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: waktu kita di bumi ini sakral adanya, dan kita seharusnya merayakan setiap detiknya
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: We can accept and embrace our pasts as part of the path that shaped who we are now.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: We have to live a life that is more revolutionary than that of the revolutionaries.
Author: Brother Andrew

Quote: We relish news of our heroes, forgetting that we are extraordinary to somebody too.
Author: Helen Hayes

Quote: you don't have to be great to get started, but you have to get started to be great.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: Life demands flow… Like a water, if you stop here you will be nothing for anyone.
Author: Meenakshi

Quote: Peace's gravitational force – a force of possibility!” from Cinderella In Focus
Author: H.L. Balcomb

Quote: Let men be men and let women be women and the world will revolve around its purpose
Author: Ikechukwu Izuakor

Quote: Often the hands will solve a mystery that the intellect has struggled with in vain.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: The only person who is educated is the one who has learned how to learn and change.
Author: Carl R. Rogers

Quote: Birthdays could be such a bummer when you were older than the country you lived in.
Author: Lynsay Sands

Quote: Distance sometimes lets you know who is worth keeping, and who is worth letting go.
Author: Lana Del Rey

Quote: Hearing voices no one else can hear isn't a good sign, even in the wizarding world.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: I have a deeply hidden and inarticulate desire for something beyond the daily life.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Life is an experiment in which you may fail or succeed. Explore more, expect least.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: Life is like an onion; you peel it off one layer at a time, and sometimes you weep.
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quote: No human should mislead another by promising them something they know to be untrue.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.
Author: François de La Rochefoucauld

Quote: Once you say you're going to settle for second, that's what happens to you in life.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Sometimes life is too hard to be alone, and sometimes life is too good to be alone.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: The trouble with being in the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone and a funny bone.
Author: Reba McEntire

Quote: We all have two lives. The second one starts when we realize that we only have one.
Author: Tom Hiddleston

Quote: What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness.
Author: John Steinbeck

Quote: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: All the problem of women, starts with men. All the problem of men, ends with women.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: Anyone who loves in the expectation of being loved in return is wasting their time.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Everything want to be loved. Us sing and dance and holler, just trying to be loved.
Author: Alice Walker

Quote: Friendship is selfless love, care, respect, and honor not a profitable opportunity.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.
Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

Quote: I threw myself into that fire, threw myself into it, into him, and let myself burn.
Author: Sarah J. Maas

Quote: It doesn't matter who you are or what you look like, so long as somebody loves you.
Author: Roald Dahl

Quote: Life is like an onion. You peel it off one layer at a time, and sometimes you weep.
Author: Carl Sandburg

Quote: Looking back, I have this to regret, that too often when I loved, I did not say so.
Author: Ray Stannard Baker

Quote: Love makes the world go round? Not at all. Whiskey makes it go round twice as fast.
Author: Compton Mackenzie

Quote: Love: the sickest of Irony's sick jokes. The place where logic and order go to die.
Author: Christopher Moore

Quote: Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Mine was the twilight and the morning. Mine was a world of rooftops and love songs.
Author: Roman Payne

Quote: some people fall in love over and over again while some people can only do it once.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: They had an ordinary life, full of ordinary things-if love can ever be called that.
Author: Leigh Bardugo

Quote: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three parts dead.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: Try as you will, you cannot annihilate that eternal relic of the human heart, love.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: We're staying together,"he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: You who suffer because you love, love still more. To die of love, is to live by it.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Never say goodbye because goodbye means going away and going away means forgetting.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Quote: The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
Author: Andy Warhol

Quote: Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing.
Author: Harper Lee

Quote: We'll be friends forever, won't we, Pooh?"asked Piglet."Even longer,"Pooh answered.
Author: Larry Clemmons

Quote: Ending a novel is almost like putting a child to sleep—it can't be done abruptly.
Author: Colm Tóibín

Quote: ...the only way to judge a philosophy is to examine the lives of those who live it.
Author: Karl Friedrich

Quote: A family man shouldn't trade his peace for profits, it is the job of a businessman.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: All is mystery; but he is a slave who will not struggle to penetrate the dark veil.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: In the name of Bacon will you chicken me up that egg.Shall I swallow cave-phantoms?
Author: Samuel Beckett

Quote: The end may justify the means as long as there is something that justifies the end.
Author: Leon Trotsky

Quote: We are citizens of the world. The tragedy of our times is that we do not know this.
Author: Woodrow Wilson

Quote: A moment or an eternity—did it matter? Life, undefeated, existed and could exist.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: Anyone who has no need of anybody but himself is either a beast or a God."Aristotle
Author: Bruce Wayne Sullivan

Quote: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of beauty.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: I've triedto become someone else for a while,only to discover that he, too, was me.
Author: Stephen Dunn

Quote: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field.I'll meet you there.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Poetry puts starch in your backbone so you can stand, so you can compose your life.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: There is darkness in light, there is pain in joy, and there are thorns on the rose.
Author: Cate Tiernan

Quote: You shall create beauty not to excite the sensesbut to give sustenance to the soul.
Author: Gabriela Mistral

Quote: You will come away bruised.You will come away bruisedbut this will give you poetry.
Author: Yrsa Daley-Ward

Quote: I choose many voices to consider and reckon with, rather than just one to tolerate.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: The woman is the most perfect doll that i have dressed with delight and admiration.
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: If thou dost seek to have what thou dost hide,By self-example mayst thou be denied.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: All Christian language about the future is a set of signposts pointing into a mist.
Author: N.T. Wright

Quote: Theology is the effort to explain the unknowable in terms of the not worth knowing.
Author: H.L. Mencken

Quote: If death is your lover, you don't got to be afraid ever that he will ever leave you
Author: Francesca Lia Block

Quote: If you thought that science was certain - well, that is just an error on your part.
Author: Richard Feynman

Quote: Miracles are not contrary to nature but only contrary to what we know about nature.
Author: Augustine of Hippo

Quote: As to diseases, make a habit of two things — to help, or at least, to do no harm.
Author: Hippocrates

Quote: I can no longer be sure whether the psyche is in me or whether I'm in the psyche...
Author: James Hillman

Quote: I could see her will leaving and death seeping through her skin to skewer her soul.
Author: J.D. Stroube

Quote: The soul who does not live to give the best, deny the sacred self of full strength.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

Quote: Always remember that striving and struggle precede success, even in the dictionary.
Author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

Quote: Fame always brings loneliness. Success is as ice cold and lonely as the North Pole.
Author: Vicki Baum

Quote: I am unique...I play by a different set of rules; I am not intimidated by anything.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: My biggest failure is 'Metal Gear.' It's my biggest failure and my biggest success.
Author: Hideo Kojima

Quote: No matter how good you get you can always get better, and that's the exciting part.
Author: Tiger Woods

Quote: Success is achieved by developing our strengths, not by eliminating our weaknesses.
Author: Marilyn vos Savant

Quote: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: Success is the space one occupies in the newspaper. Success is one day's insolence.
Author: Elias Canetti

Quote: Those who have succeeded at anything and don't mention luck are kidding themselves.
Author: Larry King

Quote: Wasifu wa viongozi wa Kolonia Santita ni siri kwa sababu siri ni siri ya mafanikio.
Author: Enock Maregesi

Quote: When the awareness of what is achievable brushes your life, your journey has begun.
Author: Lorii Myers

Quote: Within the hearts men, loyalty and consideration are esteemed greater than success.
Author: Bryant H. McGill

Quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Don't worry about being effective. Just concentrate on being faithful to the truth.
Author: Dorothy Day

Quote: He who has truth at his heart need never fear the want of persuasion on his tongue.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: It is error alone which needs the support of government. Truth can stand by itself.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: The person you hurt the most in this world was the person that brought you into it.
Author: Vannary Rang

Quote: Behind every beautiful fur coat, there is a story. "It is a bloody, barbaric story.
Author: Mary Tyler Moore

Quote: Clearly, animals know more than we think, and think a great deal more than we know.
Author: Irene M. Pepperberg

Quote: Look into their eyes and tell them 'I'm sorry, you have to die, but I need to eat.'
Author: Jenn V Keller-Lowe

Quote: The idea that some lives matter less is the root of all that is wrong in the world.
Author: Dr Paul Farmer

Quote: Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist.
Author: Michael Levine

Quote: Our wisdom comes from our experience,and our experience comes from our foolishness.
Author: Sacha Guitry

Quote: The human person finds his perfection "in seeking and loving what is true and good.
Author: Pope Benedict XVI

Quote: A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.
Author: Thomas Mann

Quote: An original writer is not one who imitates nobody, but one whom nobody can imitate.
Author: François-René de Chateaubriand

Quote: Anyone who is going to be a writer knows enough at fifteen to write several novels.
Author: May Sarton

Quote: I am aware of being in a beautiful prison, from which I can only escape by writing.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.
Author: Philip José Farmer

Quote: No iron can stab the heart with such force as a period put just at the right place.
Author: Isaac Babel

Quote: The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: The true alchemists do not change lead into gold; they change the world into words.
Author: William H. Gass

Quote: There's nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and open a vein.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: They say living well is the best revenge but sometimes writing well is even better.
Author: James Franco

Quote: Write only if you cannot live without writing. Write only what you alone can write.
Author: Elie Wiesel

Quote: You may not be able to change the world, but at least you can embarrass the guilty.
Author: Jessica Mitford

Quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.
Author: Zen Proverb

Quote: Even when a friend does something you do not like, he continues to be your friend.
Author: Genghis Khan

Quote: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: I have lost friends, some by death...others by sheer inability to cross the street.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: It is useless to attempt to reason a man out of a thing he was never reasoned into.
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quote: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
Author: Hans Christian Andersen

Quote: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: One of the most difficult things is not to change society - but to change yourself.
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quote: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: The power to make and break habits and learning how to do that is really important.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: There are more people who wish to be loved than there are who are willing to love.
Author: Nicolas Chamfort

Quote: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: When you know what you want, and want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: You purchase pain with all that joy can give and die of nothing but a rage to live.
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: I was wise enough to never grow up while fooling most people into believing I had.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.
Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

Quote: Art! Who comprehends her? With whom can one consult concerning this great goddess?
Author: Ludwig van Beethoven

Quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Fashion is only the attempt to realize art in living forms and social intercourse.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: I see myself and many artists like me as the torchbearers through these dark ages.
Author: John Zorn

Quote: If Art relates itself to an Object, it becomes descriptive, divisionist, literary.
Author: Robert Delaunay

Quote: Only in art will the lion lie down with the lamb, and the rose grow without thorn.
Author: Martin Amis

Quote: I think it's the books that you read when you're young that live with you forever.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one's own self.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quote: You have to remember that it is impossible to commit a crime while reading a book.
Author: John Waters

Quote: But she's wrong about hell. You don't have to wait until you're dead to get there.
Author: Susan Beth Pfeffer

Quote: Death has his favorites, like anyone. Those who are beloved of Death will not die.
Author: Holly Black

Quote: Did you get notes for me?""No", Ronan replied,"I thought you were dead in a ditch.
Author: Maggie Stiefvater

Quote: If no one knows when a person is going to die, how can we say he died prematurely?
Author: George Carlin

Quote: I've got death inside me. It's just a question of whether or not I can outlive it.
Author: Don DeLillo

Quote: A teacher who loves learning earns the right and the ability to help others learn.
Author: Ruth Beechick

Quote: All that I've learned, I've forgotten. The little that I still know, I've guessed.
Author: Nicolas Chamfort

Quote: It is clearly absurd to limit the term 'education' to a person's formal schooling.
Author: Murray N. Rothbard

Quote: But maybe it's what the world needs. A little less sense, and a little more faith.
Author: Rachel Joyce

Quote: Christianity is not about how much faith you have. Its about Who your faith is in.
Author: Mike Donahey

Quote: Perchance you who pronounce my sentence are in greater fear than I who receive it.
Author: Giordano Bruno

Quote: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: I would like to raise my glass to friendship between Russia and the United States.
Author: Richard Lugar

Quote: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.
Author: H. Jackson Brown

Quote: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and have her nonsense respected.
Author: Charles Lamb

Quote: When the bank asks me about my assets, I include my friendship with Regis Philbin.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: Yes, because a vampire slumber party is the pinnacle of safety conscious behavior.
Author: Stephenie Meyer

Quote: Don't forget to pray today because God did not forget to wake you up this morning.
Author: Oswald Chambers

Quote: I may not be where I want to be but I'm thankful for not being where I used to be.
Author: Habeeb Akande

Quote: Our identity rests in God's relentless tenderness for us revealed in Jesus Christ.
Author: Brennan Manning

Quote: Statistics, likelihoods, and probabilities mean everything to men, nothing to God.
Author: Richelle E. Goodrich

Quote: There were a lot of gods. Gods always come in handy, they justify almost anything.
Author: Margaret Atwood

Quote: Happiness does not depend on outward circumstances, but on the state of the heart.
Author: J.C. Ryle

Quote: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting some on yourself.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I'm a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: It is the very mark of the spirit of rebellion to crave for happiness in this life
Author: Henrik Ibsen

Quote: Money can't buy happiness but it can buy a huge yacht that sails right next to it.
Author: David Lee Roth

Quote: Really high-minded people are indifferent to happiness, especially other people's.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance. The wise grows it under his feet.
Author: James Oppenheim

Quote: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.
Author: Doris Mortman

Quote: [Iris] squeezed his hand. "Don't lose hope, Frank. Rainbows always stand for hope.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: A man devoid of hope and conscious of being so has ceased to belong to the future.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: A winner is not someone who wins. It's someone who tries and isn't afraid to lose.
Author: Nusrat Sultana

Quote: Be still, sad heart! and cease repining;Behind the clouds is the sun still shining
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: Hope in reality is the worst of all evils because it prolongs the torments of man.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Hope is the power of being cheerful in circumstances that we know to be desperate.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: I would hope my legacy would be bringing smiles to faces. Happiness with my music.
Author: Janet Jackson

Quote: The one thing I would hope would go on my tombstone is, 'I made my parents proud.'
Author: Roger Goodell

Quote: To be unbroken, what would that be?If words that were spoken, had not shattered me
Author: ZOEgirl

Quote: Tous mes anciens amours vont me revenir.'- All my old loves will be returned to me
Author: Carolyn Turgeon

Quote: With no positivity, there is no hope; with no negativity, there is no improvement.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: You do not get what you wish for, unless it be known to the source of your desire.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: A literary academic can no more pass a bookstore than an alcoholic can pass a bar.
Author: Carolyn G. Heilbrun

Quote: I don't really dissect comedy. Nothing kills off humor more than overanalyzing it.
Author: David Steinberg

Quote: I have the humor of a 9-year-old boy, and sometimes I've had laughing fits on-air.
Author: Megyn Kelly

Quote: If a black cat crosses your path, it signifies that the animal is going somewhere.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: If I shot an arrow and thought about an ass, would it surprise you if it hit Erik?
Author: P.C. Cast

Quote: I've learned to have a sense of humor about myself. Lord knows everyone else does!
Author: Debbie Gibson

Quote: Maybe our girlfriends are our soulmates and guys are just people to have fun with.
Author: Candace Bushnell

Quote: Me and Matt love to argue, but in general our sense of humor is pretty much alike.
Author: Trey Parker

Quote: People who know me know I have a sense of humor that can really push the envelope.
Author: Carmen Electra

Quote: Personally, I'm always ready to learn, although I do not always like being taught.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: The idealist hopes. The romantic sees doom. The postmodernist sees doom and hopes.
Author: Bauvard

Quote: The miracle isn't that I finished. The miracle is that I had the courage to start.
