Author: John Bingham

Quote: There is a fine line between fishing and just standing on the shore like an idiot.
Author: Steven Wright

Quote: There will be no yelling at people who are bleeding themselves to unconsciousness.
Author: Kristin Cashore

Quote: Three be the things I shall never attain: Envy, content, and sufficient champagne.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: When I'm out of politics I'm going to run a business, it'll be called rent-a-spine
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: A deadline is negative inspiration. Still, it's better than no inspiration at all.
Author: Rita Mae Brown

Quote: A respectable appearance is sufficient to make people more interested in your soul
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: Anything creative requires a bit of acting,and filling in blanks with imagination.
Author: Christina Westover

Quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Each man should frame life so that at some future hour fact and his dreaming meet.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use to be anything else.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: If we don't change the direction we are headed, we will end up where we are going.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.
Author: Emmet Fox

Quote: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it.
Author: Amelia Barr

Quote: It was like the beginning of life and laughter. It was the real meaning of the sun
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: Light is more important than the lantern,The poem more important than the notebook
Author: Nizar Qabbani

Quote: Love so joyfully and freely given can never be taken away. It is never truly gone.
Author: Cameron Dokey

Quote: Maybe some things aren't meant to be known. maybe there just meant to be accepted.
Author: Wendy Mass

Quote: Never let a problem to be solved, become more important than a person to be loved.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: Suffering usually relates to wanting things to be different from the way they are.
Author: Allan Lokos

Quote: That's the trouble with loving a wild thing: You're always left watching the door.
Author: Edith Pattou

Quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
Author: Alice Walker

Quote: The only difference between you and God is that you have forgotten you are divine.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: Unless we have something worth dying for, Atretes, we've nothing worth living for.
Author: Francine Rivers

Quote: We make patterns, we share moments. Sometimes, I think I'm the only one to see it.
Author: Jenny Downham

Quote: When something can be read without effort, great effort has gone into its writing.
Author: Enrique Jardiel Poncela

Quote: Knowledge is knowing the depth of the ocean. Wisdom is knowing till where to swim.
Author: Saleem Sharma

Quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: I love you, even if there isn't any me, or any love, or even any life. I love you.
Author: Zelda Fitzgerald

Quote: if youre never scared, or embarased, or hurt, it means you never take any chances.
Author: Julia Sorel

Quote: Life is a great sunrise. I do not see why death should not be an even greater one.
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: My aim in life isn't so much the pursuit of happiness as the happiness of pursuit.
Author: Charles Saatchi

Quote: The great object of life is sensation- to feel that we exist, even though in pain.
Author: George Gordon Byron

Quote: Those guys who want to have the Mohawk...which, to me, is the new business casual.
Author: Gerard Way

Quote: To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone and a funnybone.
Author: Reba McEntire

Quote: We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: When one realizes that his life is worthless he either commits suicide or travels.
Author: Edward Dahlberg

Quote: When she is happy, she can't stop talking, when she is sad she doesn't say a word.
Author: Ann Brashares

Quote: When your sad--like really sad--you only want to be with other people who are sad.
Author: Nick Hornby

Quote: You will receive everything you need when you stop asking for what you do not need
Author: Nisargadatta Maharaj

Quote: And yet another moral occurs to me now: Make love when you can. It's good for you.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: He didn't marry you to become king. He became king because he wanted to marry you.
Author: Megan Whalen Turner

Quote: Her existence alone was excuse enough to justify the creation of the entire world.
Author: Stephenie Meyer

Quote: I once loved a girl who almost loved me, but not as much as she loved John Cusack.
Author: Chuck Klosterman

Quote: I was his exception, and as much as I had tried to fight my feelings, he was mine.
Author: Jamie McGuire

Quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Love places someone else in the centre of your being and your own self is blurred.
Author: Mohsin Hamid

Quote: Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: Sometimes you're afraid to fall in love with a chick, but she sucks you in anyway.
Author: Sammy Hagar

Quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
Author: Theodore Hesburgh

Quote: The music in his laughter had a way of rounding off the missing notes in her soul.
Author: Gloria Naylor

Quote: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
Author: Tom Robbins

Quote: When we are in love we seem to ourselves quite different from what we were before.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: Your naked body should only belong to those who fall in love with your naked soul.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quote: I mean, I have the feeling that something in my mind is poisoning everything else.
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: ...you can hate a place with all your heart and soul and still be homesick for it.
Author: Joseph Mitchell

Quote: Beneath the makeup and behind the smile I am just a girl who wishes for the world.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),It's always our self we find in the sea.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.
Author: Toni Morrison

Quote: I always worried someone would notice me, and then when no one did, I felt lonely.
Author: Curtis Sittenfeld

Quote: I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.
Author: Walter Tevis

Quote: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: It takes ten times as long to put yourself back together as it does to fall apart.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

Quote: No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it.
Author: Elizabeth Peters

Quote: She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it).
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.
Author: Nora Roberts

Quote: The silence depressed me. It wasn't the silence of silence. It was my own silence.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: We should all start to live before we get too old. Fear is stupid. So are regrets.
Author: Marilyn Monroe

Quote: You are so busy being YOU that you have no idea how utterly unprecedented you are.
Author: John Green

Quote: It is an ironic habit of human beings to run faster when they have lost their way.
Author: Rollo May

Quote: Love' is the only weapon I have, I will defend with love, I will attack with love.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: Our ability to adapt is amazing. Our ability to change isn't quite as spectacular.
Author: Lisa Lutz

Quote: Plus d'un qui n'a pu liberer ses propres chaines a su pourtant en liberer son ami.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: The fundament upon which all our knowledge and learning rests is the inexplicable.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: The love of money is the root of all evil, therefore selfishness must be the seed.
Author: M.D. Birmingham

Quote: The most unlucky generation is the one which couldn't produce a hero to look upto.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: The pianokeys are black and whitebut they sound like a million colors in your mind
Author: Maria Cristina Mena

Quote: Thoughts become things. If you see it in your mind, you will hold it in your hand.
Author: Bob Proctor

Quote: To write well, express yourself like the common people, but think like a wise man.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: You are an aperture through which the universe is looking at and exploring itself.
Author: Alan W. Watts

Quote: You only live twice:Once when you are bornAnd once when you look death in the face
Author: Ian Fleming

Quote: There's only one rule that I know of, babies—God damn it, you've got to be kind.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: I live not in dreams but in contemplation of a reality that is perhaps the future.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: so much dependsupona red wheelbarrowglazed with rainwaterbeside the whitechickens.
Author: William Carlos Williams

Quote: the saddest thing is to bea minute to someone,when you've made them your eternity.
Author: Sanober Khan

Quote: Life, for the living, is a gift of opportunity; an exercise of the will to choose.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: What you do teaches faster, and has a lasting impression, far beyond what you say.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Books are a poor substitute for female companionship, but they are easier to find.
Author: Patrick Rothfuss

Quote: All the cunning of the devil is exercised in trying to tear us away from the word.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: Be courageous and He shall strengthen your heart, all of you who hope in the Lord.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Mayonnaise: One of the sauces which serve the French in place of a state religion.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: religion is no longer the opium of the people but the vitamin pills of the feeble.
Author: Régis Debray

Quote: Religious moderation is the product of secular knowledge and scriptural ignorance.
Author: Sam Harris

Quote: I think of you only twice a day - when I am alone and when I am with someone else.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: It's taken me all this time, all this loss, to realize what really matters is now.
Author: Suzanne Young

Quote: Never sleep with a lady only once, especially in the case of an older lady.-'Rhett
Author: Rowena Cherry

Quote: To see the years touch ye gives me joy", he whispered, "for it means that ye live.
Author: Diana Gabaldon

Quote: Al-Qur'an is not a book of Science, "S-C-I-E-N-C-E' but a book of Signs "S-I-G-N-S
Author: Zakir Naik

Quote: Do you know what we call opinion in the absence of evidence? We call it prejudice.
Author: Michael Crichton

Quote: If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Not only is the Universe stranger than we think, it is stranger than we can think.
Author: Werner Heisenberg

Quote: Philosophy of science is about as useful to scientists as ornithology is to birds.
Author: Richard Feynman

Quote: Some piously record 'In the beginning God', but I say 'In the beginning hydrogen'.
Author: Harlow Shapley

Quote: The Universe is not only queerer than we suppose, but queerer than we can suppose.
Author: J.B.S. Haldane

Quote: Romance is the sweetening of the soulWith fragrance offered by the stricken heart.
Author: Wole Soyinka

Quote: The Wrong we have Done, Thought, or Intended Will wreak its Vengeance onOur SOULS.
Author: C.G. Jung

Quote: Being happy is of the utmost importance. Success in anything is through happiness.
Author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

Quote: Beware of those who are bitter, for they will never allow you to enjoy your fruit.

Quote: If you want to be successful, you must respect one rule. NEVER TO LIE TO YOURSELF.

Quote: Mix with positive-minded people as a means to tap into your unexploited potential.

Quote: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.

Quote: Success breeds complacency. Complacency breeds failure. Only the paranoid survive.
Author: Andy Grove

Author: Malcolm Forbes

Quote: Success leaves clues, and if you sow the same seeds, you'll reap the same rewards.

Quote: The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.

Quote: Try not to become a person of success, but rather try to become a person of value.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I would have offered you a forest of truth, but you wish to speak of a single leaf
Author: David Gemmell

Quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: If you have no intention of loving or being loved, the whole journey is pointless.
Author: Kate DiCamillo

Quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: It's often only in the lies we refuse to speak that any truth can be heard at all.
Author: Karen Marie Moning

Quote: There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.
Author: Michelle Hodkin

Quote: If you truly care about animal rights and have a passion for it, take some action.
Author: Mac Danzig

Quote: Behind every beautiful fur coat, there is a story. It is a bloody, barbaric story.
Author: Mary Tyler Moore

Quote: Cheap meat is the problem. The answer is to replace meat recipes with vegan meals.
Author: Ingrid Newkirk

Quote: If you think that being vegan is difficult, imagine being a factory farmed animal.
Author: Davegan Raza

Quote: If you think that being vegan is difficult, imagine being a factory-farmed animal.
Author: Davegan Raza

Quote: Everybody gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense.
Author: Gertrude Stein

Quote: Hold fast to dreams,For if dreams dieLife is a broken-winged bird,That cannot fly.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: Humor can get in under the door while seriousness is still fumbling at the handle.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: If Peter Pan had been real, he would've gone mad and killed everyone in Neverland.
Author: Amanda Hocking

Quote: The next best thing to being wise oneself is to live in a circle of those who are.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: All words are masks and the lovelier they are, the more they are meant to conceal.
Author: Steven Millhauser

Quote: Description begins in the writer's imagination, but should finish in the reader's.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Everybody does have a book in them, but in most cases that's where it should stay.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn.
Author: Anne Frank

Quote: I read the way a person might swim, to save his or her life. I wrote that way too.
Author: Mary Oliver

Quote: I'm an aspiring writer.' I hate that phrase. You're either a writer or you're not.
Author: Jake Black

Quote: When all the details fit in perfectly, something is probably wrong with the story.
Author: Charles Baxter

Quote: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration, the rest of us just get up and got to work.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Enthusiasm is a vital element toward the individual success of every man or woman.
Author: Conrad Hilton

Quote: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: Ideas do not reach perfection in a day, no matter how much study is put upon them.
Author: Alexander Graham Bell

Quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Nothing is more creative...nor destructive...than a brilliant mind with a purpose.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence
Author: Hans Christian Andersen

Quote: The more often a stupidity is repeated, the more it gets the appearance of wisdom.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: A beautiful lady is an accident of nature. A beautiful old lady is a work of art.
Author: Louis Nizer

Quote: Art is a way to express yourself and through that you can escape a bad situation.
Author: Russell Simmons

Quote: Art is individualism, and individualism is a disturbing and disintegrating force.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Art is like baby shoes. When you coat them with gold, they can no longer be worn.
Author: John Updike

Quote: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.

Quote: Oh, if it be to choose and call thee mine, love, thou art every day my Valentine!

Quote: She had lost the art of conversation but not, unfortunately, the power of speech.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The momentous thing in human life is the art of winning the soul to good or evil.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: To send light into the darkness of men's hearts - such is the duty of the artist.

Quote: Whenever we witness art in a building, we are aware of an energy contained by it.

Quote: Books are like truth serum-- if you don't read, you can't figure out what's real.

Quote: I read because one life isn't enough, and in the page of a book I can be anybody.

Quote: It was like walking into a treasure trove of books, hoarded by pirate librarians.

Quote: It's too late to apologize for I have already forgiven you."-FitzChivalry Farseer
Author: Robin Hobb

Quote: Reading is my favourite occupation, when I have leisure for it and books to read.
Author: Anne Brontë

Quote: Can't clean up after you anymore, baby brother, so don't punk out. Make it count.
Author: Rachel Vincent

Quote: Criminals do not die by the hands of the law. They die by the hands of other men.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Death is the most sophisticated form of beauty, and the most difficult to accept.

Quote: Dying should come easy:like a freight train youdon't hear whenyour back isturned.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: If it means my death, I don't care, because even death will be a sort of freedom.
Author: Catherine Fisher

Quote: John Lennon said life was what happened while you made other plans. So was death.
Author: Richard Castle

Quote: That is not dead which can eternal lie,And with strange aeons even death may die.
Author: H.P. Lovecraft

Quote: What will I be doing in twenty years' time? I'll be dead, darling! Are you crazy?
Author: Freddie Mercury

Quote: When the body escaped mutilation, seldom did the heart go to the grave unscarred.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Zalos: 'The world is full of massive things in motion. Little creatures get hurt.
Author: Robert Fanney

Quote: Like many highly educated people, I didn't have much in the way of actual skills.
Author: J. Maarten Troost

Quote: The success of my rule does not rely on my ability to recite obscure Latin verse.
Author: Sherry Thomas

Quote: Any faith that must be supported by the evidence of the senses is not real faith.
Author: A.W. Tozer

Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: Faith gives you an inner strength and a sense of balance and perspective in life.
Author: Gregory Peck

Quote: Fear tries to get us to give up but faith takes us all the way through to victory
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: If the Almighty directs our steps, we've no need to look back over our shoulders.
Author: Liz Curtis Higgs

Quote: Our hearts of stone become hearts of flesh when we learn where the outcast weeps.
Author: Brennan Manning

Quote: People have a hunger to experience the spectacular, but the Lord is supernatural.

Quote: Perhaps it is our obligation to be noble before it is our obligation to be happy.

Quote: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
