Quote: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
Author: James F. Byrnes

Quote: It is wise to apply the oil of refined politeness to the mechanism of friendship.
Author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

Quote: I regard the afterlife to be a fairy story for people that are afraid of the dark
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: Love the animals: God has given them the rudiments of thought and joy untroubled.
Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Quote: You cannot conceive, nor can I, of the appalling strangeness of the mercy of God.
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: For the likes of you, the path to happiness is one mean son of a bitch of a path.
Author: Dean Koontz

Quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
Author: Socrates

Quote: I've learned .... That when you harbor bitterness, happiness will dock elsewhere.
Author: Andy Rooney

Quote: There are two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: There were two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: those who do not know how to see the precious things in life will never be happy.
Author: Alex Flinn

Quote: We have everything we need to be happy, but we aren't happy. Something's missing.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: We're young, we're not monsters, no fools: we'll conquer happiness for ourselves.
Author: Ivan Turgenev

Quote: [A] person whose head is bowed and whose eyes are heavy cannot look at the light.
Author: Christine de Pizan

Quote: A dream is the bearer of a new possibility, the enlarged horizon, the great hope.
Author: Howard Thurman

Quote: A propensity to hope and joy is real riches; one to fear and sorrow real poverty.
Author: David Hume

Quote: And worse I may be yet: the worst is notSo long as we can say 'This is the worst.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Children are the world's most valuable resource and its best hope for the future.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Maybe the future is like rowing for shore. Your only choice is to try or give up.
Author: Kristen Chandler

Quote: Selfishness must always be forgiven you know, because there is no hope of a cure.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: The key is loveIt is the gatewayTo hopeTo joyTo enhanced livingLove is the answer
Author: Karen Hackel

Quote: There is no hope for the hopeless but there is always some love for the loveless.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: A sense of humor saves your life, and being able to make friends wherever you go.
Author: Jason O'Mara

Quote: Coffee is a way of stealing time that should by rights belong to your older self.
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on TheeAnd I'll forgive Thy great big one on me.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Hell may have all the best composers, but heaven has all the best choreographers.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: I may not be smart enough to do everything, but I am dumb enough to try anything.
Author: Geoff Johns

Quote: Insult is powerful. Insult begets both rage and humor and often at the same time.
Author: Suzanne Fields

Quote: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: No man's life, liberty, or property are safe while the legislature is in session.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Sometimes I make myself laugh, but that's because I appreciate my sense of humor.
Author: Regina Hall

Quote: Sydney spent a lot of time on my bed these days.Unfortunately, it wasn't with me.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: The leading cause of death among fashion models is falling through street grates.
Author: Dave Barry

Quote: There's no half-singing in the shower, you're either a rock star or an opera diva
Author: Josh Groban

Quote: To achieve great things, two things are needed: a plan and not quite enough time.
Author: Leonard Bernstein

Quote: Truth would quickly cease to be stranger than fiction, once we got as used to it.
Author: H.L. Mencken

Quote: You're Hell's Angels, then? What chapter are you from?''REVELATIONS. CHAPTER SIX.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: All water has a perfect memory and is forever trying to get back to where it was.
Author: Toni Morrison

Quote: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration, the rest of us just get up and go to work.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Be real, rare, refreshing you! Fan the flames of self love and ignite your light!
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway, that's brave.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: Better to be called something positive and inspirational than something negative.
Author: Donnie Yen

Quote: Congratulations!Today is your day.You're off to Great Places!You're off and away!
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Fiction is a solution, the best solution, to the problem of existential solitude.
Author: Jonathan Franzen

Quote: Five tender apricots in a blue bowl, a brief and exact promise of things to come.
Author: Frances Mayes

Quote: Getting something and having the wits to use it...those are two different things.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: H is for Habit, winners make a habit of doing the things losers don't want to do.
Author: Lucas Remmerswaal

Quote: I don't dream at night, I dream at day, I dream all day; I'm dreaming for living.
Author: Steven Spielberg

Quote: I thought 'Moulin Rouge' was inspirational, and 'Jesus Christ Superstar' I loved.
Author: Pierce Brosnan

Quote: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
Author: Thomas A. Edison

Quote: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have the time to do it over?
Author: John Wooden

Quote: Ignore all hatred and criticism. Live for what you create, and die protecting it.
Author: Lady Gaga

Quote: It is in the quiet that you gain perspective when you have to deal with the loud.
Author: Todd Stocker

Quote: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for the truth.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Seeing a miracle will inspire you, but knowing you are a miracle will change you.
Author: Deborah Brodie

Quote: Simbol, huruf dan angka adalah alat, sedangkan gagasan adalah roh sebuah tulisan.
Author: I. Made Iwan Darmawan

Quote: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: The rights of every man are diminished when the rights of one man are threatened.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: The world should have been in Technicolour, but seemed more like black and white.
Author: Kenneth Oppel

Quote: There are few sources of energy so powerful as a procrastinating college student.
Author: Paul Graham

Quote: There is a road from the eye to the heart that does not go through the intellect.
Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: There's nothing more inspiring than the complexity and beauty of the human heart.
Author: Cynthia Hand

Quote: We all need to be mocked from time to time, lest we take ourselves too seriously.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: we are not leaving anyone behind we have to stick togheter in order to stay safe.
Author: Allan Frewin Jones

Quote: We dance round in a ring and suppose,But the Secret sits in the middle and knows.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.
Author: Confucius

Quote: with my last Breathe,i will hope,for i know my hope is placed in the right place.
Author: Jonathan Eriah

Quote: I don't pretend to know everything; I just only speak on matters I know I'll win.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: I set out to discover the why of it, and to transform my pleasure into knowledge.
Author: Charles Baudelaire

Quote: The tragedy is that there are many walking encyclopedias who are living failures.
Author: Shiv Khera

Quote: What we most love is not what we know, but what knows us and draws us. . . . (78)
Author: Ravi Ravindra

Quote: All people know the same truth. Our lives consist of how we choose to distort it.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Don't own so much clutter that you will be relieved to see your house catch fire.
Author: Wendell Berry

Quote: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: I do not forget any good deed done to me & I do not carry a grudge for a bad one.
Author: Viktor E. Frankl

Quote: I don't think that there are any limits to how excellent we could make life seem.
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: I'm not that lazy, but I don't need that much money. I lead a fairly simple life.
Author: Karl Pilkington

Quote: Life goes on. Get over it. You're still young. It'll get better. Blah, Blah, Blah
Author: David Levithan

Quote: Life is never fair, and perhaps it is a good thing for most of us that it is not.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Life is ten percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: One always has a better book in one's mind than one can manage to get onto paper.
Author: Michael Cunningham

Quote: Our most significant opportunities will be found in times of greatest difficulty.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: Rule of life. If you bother to ask someone's advice, then bother to listen to it.
Author: Sophie Kinsella

Quote: The absence of the will to live is, alas, not sufficient to make one want to die.
Author: Michel Houellebecq

Quote: Those who have failed to work toward the truth have missed the purpose of living.
Author: Gautama Buddha

Quote: To me, if life boils down to one thing, it's movement. To live is to keep moving.
Author: Jerry Seinfeld

Quote: We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: When life doesn't meet your expectations, it was important to take it with grace.
Author: Patricia Briggs

Quote: With the price of life these days, you've got to get everything for free you can.
Author: Carl Rogers

Quote: You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need.
Author: Vernon Howard

Quote: You have succeeded in life when all you really WANT is only what you really NEED.
Author: Vernon Howard

Quote: A bend in the road is not the end of the road…Unless you fail to make the turn.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once.
Author: John Green

Quote: Before I met my husband, I'd never fallen in love. I'd stepped in it a few times.
Author: Rita Rudner

Quote: I know enough to know that no woman should ever marry a man who hated his mother.
Author: Martha Gellhorn

Quote: I loved him as we always love for the first time; with idolatry and wild passion.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I think what motivates people is not great hate, but great love for other people.
Author: Huey Newton

Quote: If you do not love me I shall not be loved If I do not love you I shall not love.
Author: Samuel Beckett

Quote: If you don't love the Dodgers, there's a good chance you may not get into Heaven.
Author: Tommy Lasorda

Quote: If you love me as you say you do,' she whispered, 'make it so that I am at peace.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
Author: Francis of Assisi

Quote: Love consists in this, that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other.
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: Love is the best school, but the tuition is high and the homework can be painful.
Author: Diane Ackerman

Quote: Love... it surrounds every being and extends slowly to embrace all that shall be.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: My love is meatloaf flavored. I just wish my meatloaf was also meatloaf flavored.
Author: Dora J. Arod

Quote: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
Author: Saint Augustine

Quote: That I shall love always, I argue theethat love is life,and life hath immortality
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quote: The day the power of love overrules the love of power, the world will know peace.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.
Author: Dalai Lama XIV

Quote: This is a good sign, having a broken heart. It means we have tried for something.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: To love abundantly is to live abundantly, and to love forever is to live forever.
Author: Henry Drummond

Quote: Tonight I can write the saddest linesI loved her, and sometimes she loved me too.
Author: Pablo Neruda

Quote: What we all want, really, is to be loved. That craving drives our worst behavior.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: Where you go, I shall go; where you die, I shall die, and there will I be buried.
Author: Rosamund Hodge

Quote: You'll never be able to let him go. You'll always feel wrong about being with me.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: He's a wallflower. You see things. You keep quiet about them. And you understand.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Quote: I don't go out with strangers,"I said."Good thing I do. I'll pick you up at five.
Author: Becca Fitzpatrick

Quote: Just because you have the emotional range of a teaspoon doesn't mean we all have.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin

Quote: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Quote: The most beautiful makeup of a woman is passion. But cosmetics are easier to buy.
Author: Yves Saint-Laurent

Quote: This was another of our fears: that Life wouldn't turn out to be like Literature.
Author: Julian Barnes

Quote: You know, one of the tragedies of real life is that there is no background music.
Author: Annie Proulx

Quote: Change is not always growth, but growth is often rooted in change.Drizzt Do'Urden
Author: R.A. Salvatore

Quote: Faith is not belief in spite of evidence but a life in scorn of the consequences.
Author: Clarence Jordan

Quote: We are all teachers, we all have knowledge and experiences that can teach others.
Author: Avis J. Williams

Quote: We are alone. Live our lives, lacking anything better to do. Devise reason later.
Author: Alan Moore

Quote: Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: may came home with a smooth round stoneas small as a world and as large as alone.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: Pity me that the heart is slow to learnWhat the swift mind beholds at every turn.
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: Some people grumble that roses have thorns; I am grateful that thorns have roses.
Author: Alphonse Karr

Quote: Get busy with the issue! In this regard, time is not friendly…nor should it be.
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: When you stop expecting people to be perfect, you can like them for who they are.
Author: Donald Miller

Quote: You wouldn't believe that so much could change just because a relationship ended.
Author: Nick Hornby

Quote: Your first impulse is to share good news, your second is to club someone with it.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: I think it is very good when people suffer. To me that is like the kiss of Jesus.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: I want God to play in my bloodstream the way sunlight amuses itself on the water.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: Reflection is the lamp of the heart. If it departs, the heart will have no light.
Author: ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻAlawī al-Ḥaddād

Quote: The laws of physics is the canvas God laid down on which to paint his masterpiece
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: We are not worshipping anyone or anything, we are simply communing with creation.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: His hands may have been the one to heal you, but it will be mine that awaken you.
Author: Charlotte Featherstone

Quote: It doesn't matter. I love you. That's it. That's all. I hope to hell it's enough.
Author: Maya Banks

Quote: Kalau kamu percaya takdir, aminkan dalam hati, kita bertemu lagi suatu hari nanti
Author: Robin Wijaya

Quote: What really happened doesn't matter. What matters is how we agree to remember it.
Author: Leila Sales

Quote: When I'm with you, bells go off in my head like a moving truck that's backing up.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: You're okay now... You're okay because I'll be holding you like this from now on.
Author: Matsuri Hino

Quote: Nature composes some of her loveliest poems for the microscope and the telescope.
Author: Theodore Roszak

Quote: The Theory of Evolution has more holes in it than a dam made out of Swiss cheese.
Author: Eoin Colfer

Quote: Sometimes it takes great suffering to pierce the soul and open it up to greatness
Author: Jocelyn Murray

Quote: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: There are words in the soul of a newborn baby, wanting and waiting to be written.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: What drains your spirit drains your body. What fuels your spirit fuels your body.
Author: Caroline Myss

Quote: But I like not these great success of yours; for I know how jealous are the gods.
Author: Herodotus

Quote: Communication - the human connection - is the key to personal and career success.
Author: Paul J. Meyer

Quote: God is not a thief. That which steals, kills and destroys is the devil - not God!
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: I constantly think I'm a fraud - that this success is not warranted or justified.
Author: David Chang

Quote: I have seven children by six different mothers. Maybe success was too good to me.
Author: Eazy-E

Quote: I'm an addict, I'm addicted to success. Thankfully, there's no rehab for success.
Author: Lil Wayne

Quote: In a balanced organization, working towards a common objective, there is success.
Author: Arthur Helps

Quote: In order to succeed you must fail, so that you know what not to do the next time.
Author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

Quote: In this world it is not what we take up, but what we give up, that makes us rich.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: Money and success don't change people; they merely amplify what is already there.
Author: Will Smith

Quote: Success sometimes may be defined as a disaster put on hold. Qualified. Has to be.
Author: Nadine Gordimer

Quote: What is success? It is being able to go to bed each night with your soul at peace
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: When the Prince comes into your life, you will stop thinking and start reasoning.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: Worship is the marriage of two Spirits - the Spirit of God and the Spirit of man.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: You don't need to go running from pillar to post looking for what God looks like.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: A lie, sometimes, can be truer than the truth, which is why fiction gets written.
Author: Tim O'Brien

Quote: I believe that ignorance is the root of all evil.And that no one knows the truth.
Author: Molly Ivins

Quote: Life shouldn't be about the either/or. We're capable of more than that, you know?
Author: Sarah Dessen

Quote: People always say life is too short for regrets. But the truth is, it's too long.
Author: Sarah Addison Allen

Quote: People are the only animals that drink the milk of the mother of another species.
Author: Michael Klaper

Quote: People are the only animals that drink the milk of the mother of another species.
Author: Michael Klaper

Quote: Protecting the weak is the first step to enlightenment and being truly civilized.
Author: Gary Yourofsky

Quote: There are two kinds of cardiologists: vegans and those who haven't read the data.
Author: Dr. Kim Allan Williams

Quote: Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance, order, rhythm and harmony.
Author: Orison Swett Marden

Quote: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise.
Author: Sara Teasdale

Quote: If your wife locks you out of the house, you don't have a problem with your door.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: Revision means throwing out the boring crap and making what's left sound natural.
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson

Quote: When you reduce a woman to writing, she makes you think of a thousand other women
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: Writing is like going underwater - thank you for being there when I come back up.
Author: Ali Shaw

Quote: You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write.
Author: Saul Bellow

Quote: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.
Author: Charles Darwin

Quote: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.
Author: Laurence J. Peter

Quote: Be the silent watcher of your thoughts and behavior. You are beneath the thinker.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
Author: Socrates

Quote: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
Author: Thomas Edison

Quote: It doesn't matter how much you want. What really matters is how much you want it.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: It's necessary to get the losers out of your life if you want to live your dream.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself.
Author: Alan Watts

Quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: Study logic and math, because once you've mastered them, you won't fear any book.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: The best teacher is experience and not through someone's distorted point of view.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
Author: James Matthew Barrie

Quote: The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: There are dark shadows on the earth, but its lights are stronger in the contrast.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
Author: James Matthew Barrie

Quote: You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: You can avoid reality, but you cannot avoid the consequences of avoiding reality.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Art has the power to transform, to illuminate, to educate, inspire and motivate.
Author: Harvey Fierstein

Quote: I'm afraid that if you look at a thing long enough, it loses all of its meaning.
Author: Andy Warhol

Quote: Only through art can we emerge from ourselves and know what another person sees.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: Words may be false and full of art; Sighs are the natural language of the heart.
Author: Thomas Shadwell

Quote: And what is the use of a book,"thought Alice, "without pictures or conversation?
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: For books continue each other, in spite of our habit of judging them separately.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: Maybe Heaven will be a library and then I might get to finish my "to-read' list.
Author: Kellie Elmore

Quote: There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.
Author: Christopher Morley

Quote: Death doesn't care about personalities - he's more interested in meeting quotas.
Author: Jasper Fforde

Quote: From my rotting body, flowers shall grow and I am in them, and that is eternity.
Author: Edvard Munch

Quote: Nothing is permanent. The only thing any of us have in common is the inevitable.
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: The evil that men do lives after them;The good is oft interred with their bones.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Some men die for lack of love…some die because of it. Think about it."- Daemon
Author: Anne Bishop

Quote: Body and spirit, I surrendered whole, To harsh Instructors- and received a soul.
Author: Rudyard Kipling

Quote: Study without desire spoils the memory, and it retains nothing that it takes in.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: The learning process is something you can incite, literally incite, like a riot.
Author: Audre Lorde

Quote: To educate the peasantry, three things are needed: schools, schools and schools.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Feet sandaled with dreams tread paths of vision leading to wisdom's sharp peaks.
Author: Aberjhani

Quote: It is not as much about who you used to be, as it is about who you choose to be.
Author: Sanhita Baruah

Quote: No matter how hard it is, or how hard it gets, don't ever, ever, ever lose hope!
Author: Jim Yackel

Quote: Faith ― acceptance of which we imagine to be true, that which we cannot prove.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: O Diabo, invejoso, fez o homem confundir fé com religião e amor com casamento.
Author: Machado de Assis

Quote: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
Author: Len Wein

Quote: Friendship's the wine of life: but friendship new... is neither strong nor pure.
Author: Edward Young

Quote: General benevolence, but not general friendship, made a man what he ought to be.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: I love life in spite of all that mars it. I love friendship, jokes and laughter.
Author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

Quote: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.
Author: John Webster

Quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
Author: Alice Walker

Quote: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.
Author: Mariella Frostrup

Quote: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
Author: David Storey

Quote: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
Author: Giotto di Bondone

Quote: You can't build anything with a flimsy foundation. Friendship is the foundation.
Author: Hill Harper

Quote: Other crack teams get bat boomerangs and wall-climbing powers; we get Aquatruck.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Roses are red, violets are blue, I have five fingers, the middle one is for you.
Author: Gena Showalter

Quote: Who are you and how did you get in here?""I'm a locksmith. And, I'm a locksmith.
Author: Leslie Nielsen

Quote: God doesn't bless us just to make us happy; He blesses us to make us a blessing.
Author: Warren W. Wiersbe

Quote: It's all God's will: you can die in your sleep, and God can spare you in battle.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: No man can be called friendless who has God and the companionship of good books.
Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

Quote: There is never a moment when God is not in control. Relax! He's got you covered.
Author: Mandy Hale

Quote: They ought to make it a binding clause that if you find God you get to keep Him.
Author: Philip K. Dick

Quote: Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.
Author: William James

Quote: Action may not always bring happiness; but there is no happiness without action.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand, They danced by the light of the moon.
Author: Edward Lear

Quote: Expect more get less and feel sadness Or expect less get more and feel happiness
Author: Vijay Dhameliya

Quote: You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestation of your own blessings.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert

Quote: All kids need is a little help, a little hope and somebody who believes in them.
Author: Magic Johnson

Quote: Hope was always out ahead of fact, possibility obscured the outlines of reality.
Author: Wallace Stegner

Quote: I wonder how you're supposed to know the exact moment when there's no more hope.
Author: Sara Zarr

Quote: Maybe what this is. What we have, is something that will save us from ourselves.
Author: Robert M. Drake

Quote: A genius. A criminal mastermind. A millionaire. And he is only twelve years old.
Author: Eoin Colfer

Quote: Among my friends, I'm not a little Boy Scout, and they love my humor, thank God.
Author: Don Rickles

Quote: But Grover's voice was already growing fainter. "Sweet dreams. Don't let me die!
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Funny thing about glass. When you broke the shit up, it got pissed and bit back.
Author: J.R. Ward

Quote: Getting married is like trading in the adoration of many for the sarcasm of one.
Author: Mae West

Quote: I don't understand how somebody wouldn't have a sense of humor about themselves.
Author: John Malkovich

Quote: I find intelligence sexy. I find a sense of humor sexy. I find sensitivity sexy.
Author: Nicole Appleton

Quote: I have a good sense of humor. I think everything we do should have whimsy in it.
Author: Judith Leiber

Quote: If she can't spell, why is she a librarian? Librarians should know how to spell.
Author: Beverly Cleary

Quote: Leo: I'm almost out of gas! Woah, that came out wrong. I meant the burning kind!
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Opera is when a guy gets stabbed in the back and, instead of bleeding, he sings.
Author: Robert Benchley

Quote: Sometimes I find I'm wearing a divided, split brain in terms of drama and humor.
Author: Ridley Scott

Quote: Sometimes in the most tragic situation, something just profoundly funny happens.
Author: David Hyde Pierce

Quote: Touch her, and I'll freeze your testicles off and put them in a jar. Understand?
Author: Julie Kagawa

Quote: You see, that is the sad, sorry, terrible thing about sarcasm.It's really funny.
Author: Brandon Sanderson

Quote: Oh, dear God and baby Jesus in the manger, my eyes!” Dee shrieked. “My eyes!
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

Quote: A wise man first thinks and then speaks and a fool speaks first and then thinks.
Author: Hazrat Ali ibn Abu-Talib

Quote: An artist without ideas is a mendicant; barren, he goes begging among the hours.
Author: Irving Stone

Quote: An idea, like a ghost, must be spoken to a little before it will explain itself.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Chase your dreams until you catch them...and then dream, catch, and dream again!
Author: Dee Marie

Quote: Connecting our hearts through love yields a nectar so sweet we are forever full.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Create your best life with your consciously chosen thoughts, words, and actions.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: don't be afraid of being different, be afraid of being the same as everyone else
Author: Unknown

Quote: Every time you read a book, a tree smiles knowing that there's life after death.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: Fear is inevitable, I have to accept that, but I cannot allow it to paralyze me.
Author: Isabel Allende

Quote: God made the world round so we would never be able to see too far down the road.
Author: Karen Blixen

Quote: I never did give them hell. I just told the truth, and they thought it was hell.
Author: Harry S. Truman

Quote: I wanted to figure out why I was so busy, but I couldn't find the time to do it.
Author: Todd Stocker

Quote: I would rather have 30 minutes of "wonderful"than a lifetime of nothing special.
Author: Julia L. Roberts

Quote: If a man has not discovered something that he will die for, he isn't fit to live
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: If my mind can conceive it, and my heart can believe it - then I can achieve it.
Author: Muhammad Ali

Quote: If you can't run, you crawl. If you can't crawl-- you find someone to carry you.
Author: Joss Whedon

Quote: In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
Author: John Bunyan

Quote: Is life too short to be taking this shit, or is life too short to be minding it?
Author: Violet Weingarten

Quote: It is not a daily increase, but a daily decrease. Hack away at the inessentials.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: It used to be about trying to do something. Now it's about trying to be someone.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Let All Your Life's Experiences Lead To More Writing & Encourage More Reading..!
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: Life is 10 percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: Live your life as a curious student and you will discover how fascinating it is.
Author: Elena Ornig

Quote: Love the moment and the energy of that moment will spread beyond all boundaries.
Author: Corita Kent

Quote: One must still have chaos in oneself to be able to give birth to a dancing star.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Thanksgiving is a joyous invitation to shower the world with love and gratitude.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: The best discoveries always happened to the people who weren't looking for them.
Author: Morgan Matson

Quote: The choices one makes, not one's blood, determine one's destiny - John Steinbeck
Author: Laxmi Hariharan

Quote: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: Weekends don't count unless you spend them doing something completely pointless.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: Whereever you end up;"Jack whispered into my ear."I wish you clear skies. Always
Author: Wendy Mass

Quote: Yes, terrible things happen, but sometimes those terrible things- they save you.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Every other knowledge is harmful to him who does not have knowledge of goodness.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: Knowing trees, I came to realize, understand and appreciate the act of patience.
Author: Ogwo David Emenike

Quote: Knowledge is a tool, and like all tools, its impact is in the hands of the user.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: The advancement and diffusion of knowledge is the only guardian of true liberty.
Author: James Madison

Quote: A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: And though you think the world is at your feet, it can rise up and tread on you.
Author: Ian McEwan

Quote: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: Can a person steal happiness? Or is just another internal, infernal human trick?
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: Everything that had happened was shockingly beautiful, enough to make you crazy.
Author: Banana Yoshimoto

Quote: Failure at some point in your life is inevitable, but giving up is unforgivable.
Author: Joe Biden

Quote: Human life is but a series of footnotes to a vast obscure unfinished masterpiece
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Quote: I don't believe in the after life, although I am bringing a change of underwear.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: I seem to have run in a great circle, and met myself again on the starting line.
Author: Jeanette Winterson

Quote: If there were such a thing as terminal literalism, you'd have died in childhood.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: If you live each day as it was your last, someday you'll most certainly be right
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: If you try to change it, you will ruin it. Try to hold it, and you will lose it.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: I'm just a regular person who believes life is simple, and I like a simple life.
Author: Manny Pacquiao

Quote: I've grown up a lot, I'm on my own, and I've learned some valuable life lessons.
Author: Zac Efron

Quote: Knowing that you are completely forgiven destroys the power of sin in your life.
Author: Joseph Prince

Quote: Life's pain. You just have to get over as much of it as you can.-Isabel Culpeper
Author: Maggie Stiefvater

Quote: Most people have never learned that one of the main aims in life is to enjoy it.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: So much working, reading, thinking, living to do! A lifetime is not long enough.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: Suspect each moment, for it is a thief, tiptoeing away with more than it brings.
Author: John Updike

Quote: The spiritual life does not remove us from the world but leads us deeper into it
Author: Henri J.M. Nouwen

Quote: There are two ways to live a life either forget everything or, remember nothing.
Author: Santosh Kalwar

Quote: To be able to look back upon one's past life with satisfaction is to live twice.
Author: Lord Acton

Quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: You cannot live your life looking at yourself from someone else's point of view.
Author: Penelope Cruz

Quote: Your life is the fruit of your own doing. You have no one to blame but yourself.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: And yet,to say the truth, reason and love keep little company together nowadays.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Do I love you because you're beautiful, or are you beautiful because I love you?
Author: Richard Rodgers

Quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: He brought out the worst in me, and was the best thing that ever happened to me.
Author: Coco J. Ginger

Quote: I love Christopher Bailey and Burberry, Mulberry for bags, and Hudson for jeans.
Author: Cara Delevingne

Quote: I need the thing that happens when your brain shuts off and your heart turns on.
Author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

Quote: I pray you, do not fall in love with me, for I am falser than vows made in wine.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: I wonder if fears ever really go away, or if they just lose their power over us.
Author: Veronica Roth

Quote: If you ever looked at me once with what I know is in you, I would be your slave.
Author: Emily Brontë

Quote: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.
Author: André Gide

Quote: It's easy to cry when you realize that everyone you love will reject you or die.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Love is a sacred reserve of energy; it is like the blood of spiritual evolution.
Author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

Quote: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
Author: Erich Fromm

Quote: Love is when he gives you a piece of your soul, that you never knew was missing.
Author: Torquato Tasso

Quote: Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze.
Author: Elinor Glyn

Quote: The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: When he died, all things soft and beautiful and bright would be buried with him.
Author: Madeline Miller

Quote: When it comes to men, deal with them as they are, not how you'd like them to be.
Author: Greg Behrendt

Quote: You are the most important thing to me now. The most important thing to me ever.
Author: Stephenie Meyer

Quote: You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Books open your mind, broaden your mind, and strengthen you as nothing else can.
Author: William Feather

Quote: but her mind feels feverish as it races through the crowded hallways of the past
Author: Thrity Umrigar

Quote: I thought about having a proper room,breathing life into it, and nobody minding.
Author: Jenny Valentine

Quote: O the mind, mind has mountains; cliffs of fallFrightful, sheer, no-man-fathomed.
Author: Gerard Manley Hopkins

Quote: What chance combination of shadow and sound and his own thoughts had created it?
Author: Patricia Highsmith

Quote: All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Do not go gentle into that good night.Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
Author: Dylan Thomas

Quote: Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am.
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: I wish I could freeze this moment, right here, right now and live in it forever.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson

Quote: I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?
Author: Tennessee Williams

Quote: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.
Author: Jane Yolen

Quote: My nightmares are usually about losing you. I'm okay once I realize you're here.
Author: Suzanne Collins

Quote: Nothing of me is original. I am the combined effort of everyone I've ever known.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Remember if people talk behind your back, it only means you are two steps ahead.
Author: Fannie Flagg

Quote: Sometimes,' said Pooh, 'the smallest things take up the most room in your heart.
Author: A.A. Milne

Quote: The present changes the past. Looking back you do not find what you left behind.
Author: Kiran Desai

Quote: There was nowhere to go but everywhere, so just keep on rolling under the stars.
Author: Jack Kerouac

Quote: We'd get sick on too many cookies, but ever so much sicker on no cookies at all.
Author: Sinclair Lewis

Quote: Comedy aims at representing men as worse, Tragedy as better than in actual life.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Even English Language doesn't provide you with the Synonyms of the word Success.
Author: Kshitij Shringi

Quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
Author: Plato

Quote: Flexibility makes buildings to be stronger, imagine what it can do to your soul.
Author: Carlos Barrios

Quote: He alone is free who lives with free consent under the entire guidance of reason
Author: Baruch Spinoza

Quote: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who overcomes his enemies.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: I do not know how to teach philosophy without becoming a disturber of the peace.
Author: Baruch Spinoza

Quote: If a man has character, he has also his typical experience, which always recurs.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Rousseau identified reason as the disease for which it pretended to be the cure.
Author: Robert Zaretsky

Quote: Subjectivity is strange to Science, while Relativity is an objective part of it.
Author: Felix Alba-Juez

Quote: Veel van wat aanvankelijk alleen in de verbeelding bestaat, wordt werkelijkheid.
Author: Arthur Japin

Quote: We did all the tourist crap, but I just wanted to sit in a cafe and watch people
Author: Sara Shepard

Quote: Whoever cannot seek the unforeseen sees nothing for the known way is an impasse.
Author: Heraclitus

Quote: L'étude du beau est un duel où l'artiste crie de frayeur avant d'être vaincu.
Author: Charles Baudelaire

Quote: because some thingssometimesaren't ours to hold,but just beautiful to listen to.
Author: Sanober Khan

Quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: There are things known and there are things unknownand in between are the doors.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: Where the bright seraphim in burning rowTheir loud uplifted angel trumpets blow.
Author: John Milton

Quote: Betrayal and dishonor is usually an inside job. Keep it 'sucka-free', loved one!
Author: T.F. Hodge

Quote: Life without Music would be a Mistake. Life without Books would be Catastrophic!
Author: Nandini Deka

Quote: You can't condemn an entire species of people because of the actions of one man.
Author: Elizabeth Richards

Quote: He needs "space"and "time,"as if this were physics and not a human relationship.
Author: Kathryn Stockett

Quote: I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.
Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

Quote: I used to loathe ambivalence; now I adore it. Ambivalence is my new best friend.
Author: Suzanne Finnamore

Quote: I will never claim to know what you are thinking. I only hope I am on your mind.
Author: Amanda Mosher

Quote: I'm done. I don't need anything more out of life. I have you, and that's enough.
Author: Alessandra Torre

Quote: There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.
Author: Shmuley Boteach

Quote: When all one person do is complain, people don't want to talk or listen to them.
Author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett

Quote: God, come down, if you're really there -Well, you're the one who claims to care!
Author: Morrissey

Quote: He who does not reflect his life back to God in gratitude does not know himself.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.
Author: Dan Brown

Quote: You would not have called to me unless I had been calling to you,"said the Lion.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Asuka...you're really cute. When I look at you...I start wanting to protect you.
Author: Aya Kanno

Quote: Hades was the personification of dark and dangerous--a living, breathing Batman.
Author: P.C. Cast

Quote: Picnics are very dear to those who are in the first stage of the tender passion.
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: Sometimes letting go is the only way to find out who you're meant to hold on to.
Author: J. Sterling

Quote: If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: Nothing is too wonderful to be true if it be consistent with the laws of nature.
Author: Michael Faraday

Quote: The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: When man becomes greater than nature, nature, which gave us birth, will respond.
Author: Loren Eiseley

Quote: Attachment-abhorrence is an "effect' and ignorance (of the self) is the "cause'!
Author: Dada Bhagwan

Quote: Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer, and practice it.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: I believe that one key to success is to accept truth, no matter how it's spoken.
Author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quote: If you find it in your heart to care for somebody else, you will have succeeded.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Men judge us by the success of our efforts. God looks at the efforts themselves.
Author: Charlotte Bronte

Quote: Our business in life is not to succeed, but to continue to fail in good spirits.
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Quote: People can change anything they want to, and that means everything in the world.
Author: Joe Strummer

Quote: Perseverance - a lowly virtue whereby mediocrity achieves an inglorious success.
Author: Ambrose Bierce

Quote: Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
Author: Arnold H. Glasow

Quote: Supreme excellence consists of breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting.
Author: Sun Tzu

Quote: To succeed in the world it is not enough to be stupid - one must also be polite.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: You can actually recreate your world with the Word of the Creator in your mouth.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: If names be not correct, language is not in accordance with the truth of things.
Author: Confucius

Quote: More people would learn from their mistakes if they weren't so busy denying them
Author: Harold J. Smith

Quote: Submit to God and be at peace with him; in this way prosperity will come to you.
Author: Anonymous

Quote: The biggest changes in a women's nature are brought by love; in man, by ambition
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: What was the point of even having a conversation when words couldn't be trusted?
Author: James Dashner

Quote: When one experiences truth, the madness of finding fault with others disappears.
Author: S.N. Goenka

Quote: I suddenly realized that what was on my plate were living things, with feelings.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: Cruelty might be very human, and it might be cultural, but it's not acceptable.
Author: Jodie Foster

Quote: Do the best you can until you know better. Then when you know better, do better.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: for a woman knows the face of the man she loves like a sailor knows the open sea
Author: Honoré de Balzac

Quote: Many's the man/ who thought himself wise/ but what he needed/ he did not know...
Author: Richard Wagner

Quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom in learning from books as well as from nature.
Author: Mortimer J. Adler

Quote: Always mystify, torture, mislead, and surprise the audience as much as possible.
Author: Don Roff

Quote: Finishing a book is just like you took a child out in the back yard and shot it.
Author: Truman Capote

Quote: It's a wonderful thing to be able to create your own world whenever you want to.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: My books are water; those of the great geniuses is wine. Everybody drinks water.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: My life looked good on paper - where, in fact, almost all of it was being lived.
Author: Martin Amis

Quote: Seperti apakah Anda? Menurut saya, paling tidak Anda adalah apa yang Anda tulis.
Author: Helvy Tiana Rosa

Quote: A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Better to die fighting for freedom than be a prisoner all the days of your life.
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: Don't bother people for help without first trying to solve the problem yourself.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: Don't shortchange yourself when it comes to investing in your own better future.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: Even if you stumble and fall down, it doesn't mean you've chosen the wrong path.
Author: Zen Proverb

Quote: Expect the best of yourself, and then do what is necessary to make it a reality.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: Giving is living. If you stop wanting to give, there's nothing more to live for.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: I am thankful to all those who said no. It's because of them, I did it myself.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: Nourish the mind like you would your body. The mind cannot survive on junk food.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
Author: T.S. Eliot

Quote: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune or temporary defeat.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Supreme excellence consists of breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting.
Author: Sun Tzu

Quote: Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other people's hands.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: The goal of an artist is to create the definitive work that cannot be surpassed.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: The thing about smart people is that they seem like crazy people to dumb people.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: When the world pushes you to your knees, you're in the perfect position to pray.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Art ought never to be considered except in its relations with its ideal beauty.
Author: Alfred de Vigny

Quote: Dancers are a work of art - they are the canvas on which their work is painted.
Author: Patrick Duffy

Quote: Fine art is that in which the hand, the head, and the heart of man go together.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: I really believe there are things nobody would see if I didn't photograph them.
Author: Diane Arbus

Quote: My goal is to be one with the music. I just dedicate my whole life to this art.
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: My imagination can picture no fairer happiness than to continue living for art.
Author: Clara Schumann

Quote: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.
Author: Christopher Marlowe

Quote: The art of leadership is saying no, not saying yes. It is very easy to say yes.
Author: Tony Blair

Quote: A book is a wonderful present. Though it may grow worn, it will never grow old.
Author: Jane Yolen

Quote: All books are either dreams or swords,You can cut, or you can drug, with words.
Author: Amy Lowell

Quote: Books are to me as homemade tattoos are to an inmate. Can't get enough of them.
Author: Laurie Notaro

Quote: Buying a book is not about obtaining a possession, but about securing a portal.
Author: Laura Miller

Quote: Often on a wet day I begin counting up; what I've read and what I haven't read.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones.
Author: Joseph Joubert

Quote: When you handle books all day long, every new one is a friend and a temptation.
Author: Elizabeth Kostova

Quote: Don't wake me for the end of the world unless it has very good special effects.
Author: Roger Zelazny

Quote: Makhluk kecil kembalilah. Dari tiada ke tiada. Berbahagialah dalam ketiadaanmu.
Author: Soe Hok Gie

Quote: No one can say that death found in me a willing comrade, or that I went easily.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: But artists didn't need to achieve "firsts", and Hughes wanted to be an artist.
Author: Diane Wood Middlebrook

Quote: He couldn't be a doctor, or he would have a quieter and more persuasive manner.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: in reality there is no such thing out of profit and loss .education is commerce
Author: litymunshi

Quote: Most doctors are prisoners of their education and shackled by their profession.
Author: Richard Diaz

Quote: ... challenge the church to do better, be more of who Christ wants us to be ...
Author: Justin Lee

Quote: Follow the evidence to where it leads, even if the conclusion is uncomfortable.
Author: Steven James

Quote: The only real fall of man is his noneucharistic life in a noneucharistic world.
Author: Alexander Schmemann

Quote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: I think the way to keep a friendship is to respect that everybody is different.
Author: Emma Bunton

Quote: Nobody ever chooses the already unfortunate as objects of his loyal friendship.
Author: Lucan

Quote: Real friendship, like real poetry, is extremely rare - and precious as a pearl.
Author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

Quote: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: He said "cool"like I say a Spanish word when I'm not sure of the pronunciation.
Author: Kelley Armstrong

Quote: I must have killed a lot of cows in a past life for Karma to hate me this much.
Author: Katie McGarry

Quote: You will not pass!” Roman thundered.Great. Now he had decided he was Gandalf.
Author: Ilona Andrews

Quote: Be a sinner and sin boldly, but believe and rejoice in Christ even more boldly.
Author: Martin Luther

Quote: Only 8% of our worry will come to pass. 92% of our worry is wasted. DON'T PANIC
Author: Mark Gorman

Quote: All animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: Beauty is the purest feeling of the soul. Beauty arises when soul is satisfied.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: Everyone chases after happiness, not noticing that happiness is at their heels.
Author: Bertolt Brecht

Quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quote: I do not think we have a "right"to happiness. If happiness happens, say thanks.
Author: Marlene Dietrich

Quote: Art is longing. You never arrive, but you keep going in the hope that you will.
Author: Anselm Kiefer

Quote: But what we call our despair is often only the painful eagerness of unfed hope.
Author: George Eliot

Quote: Fear is the glue that keeps you stuck. Faith is the solvent that sets you free.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: God is our Father and loves us, even when his silence remains incomprehensible.
Author: Pope Benedict XVI

Quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast: Man never is, but always to be blest.
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: If there's only one nation in the sky, shouldn't all passports be valid for it?
Author: Yann Martel

Quote: I'm going to sit back, light up, and hope I don't chew the cigarette to pieces.
Author: Vin Scully

Quote: The reason I never give up hope is because everything is so basically hopeless.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: You deny them hope... You are telling them that Jesus loves them, but not much.
Author: Harper Lee

Quote: Death, taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them.
Author: Margaret Mitchell

Quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
Author: George Burns

Quote: I could tell that my parents hated me. My bath toys were a toaster and a radio.
Author: Rodney Dangerfield

Quote: I did not attend his funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: I hate girls that giggle all the time... You hate any girl that David looks at.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didn't know.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: If somebody is not on the same page with me humor wise, I can't give them that.
Author: Stephan Pastis

Quote: I'm not the smartest fellow in the world, but I can sure pick smart colleagues.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quote: In conversation, humor is worth more than wit and easiness more than knowledge.
Author: George Herbert

Quote: One thing my family has shown me is that having a sense of humor is everything.
Author: Zoey Deutch

Quote: Run first,' Shane said. 'Mourn later.'It was the perfect motto for Morganville.
Author: Rachel Caine

Quote: The reason I talk to myself is because I'm the only one whose answers I accept.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Unseen in the background, Fate was quietly slipping lead into the boxing-glove.
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: We seemed to be trapped in an episode of One Life To Waste. It's all very dull.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: You look disappointed to see me, Zach,"Macey teased. "Don't you like my jacket?
Author: Ally Carter

Quote: A birth-date is a reminder to celebrate the life as well as to update the life.
Author: Amit Kalantri

Quote: Be the Light you seek so desperately in your life and chase away that darkness.
Author: Solange nicole

Quote: Be wary of strong drink, it can make you shoot at the tax collector...and miss.
Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Quote: Didn't anyone ever tell you that the mouth is the front gate of all misfortune?
Author: Andrew Davidson

Quote: Dream, Dream DreamDreams transform into thoughts And thoughts result in action.
Author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: Forgive me for being so ordinary while claiming to know so extraordinary a God.
Author: Jim Elliot

Quote: I enjoy growing older and wiser and learning from my mistakes every single day.
Author: Ellen DeGeneres

Quote: I have looked into your eyes with my eyes. I have put my heart near your heart.
Author: Pope John XXIII

Quote: I want all my senses engaged. Let me absorb the world's variety and uniqueness.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: If you want to be proud of yourself, then do things in which you can take pride
Author: Karen Horney

Quote: In order to be creative rules cannot exist. The creative mind deserves no less.
Author: Steven Cuoco

Quote: Indeed, the more we find to love, the more we add to the measure of our hearts.
Author: Lloyd Alexander

Quote: It is better to fill your head with useless knowledge than no knowledge at all.
Author: Jim Hinckley

Quote: It is only by risking our persons from one hour to another that we live at all.
Author: William James

Quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Passion to a person is what gas is to a car. Without it, you won't go anywhere!
Author: Alex Haditaghi

Quote: Receiving is good but giving is much better. Nevertheless, sharing is the best.
Author: Shahrizad Shafian

Quote: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: Swords can win territories but not hearts, forces can bend heads but not minds.
Author: Mirza Tahir Ahmad

Quote: the holiest place on earth is where an ancient hatred has become apresent love.
Author: Helen Shucman

Quote: Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
Author: J.M. Barrie

Quote: To be in your children's memories tomorrow,You have to be in their lives today.
Author: Barbara Johnson

Quote: We can't choose our fate, but we can choose others. Be careful in knowing that.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: When the world pushes you to your knees, you're in the perfect position to pray
Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S

Quote: Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.
Author: Earl Nightingale

Quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you'll be criticized anyway.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: L'esercizio rende perfetti, ma nessuno è perfetto, quindi perché esercitarsi?
Author: Billie Joe Armstrong

Quote: Pursue knowledge as though it is your life-blood, then you will know greatness!
Author: Monique Rockliffe

Quote: The man who sees both sides of a question is a man who sees absolutely nothing.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
Author: Charles Darwin

Quote: Dead, we are revealed in our true dimensions, and they are surprisingly modest.
Author: Michael Cunningham

Quote: He who is not everyday conquering some fear has not learned the secret of life.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I don't judge people. It blurs out the center of my attention,my focus, myself.
Author: Toba Beta

Quote: I have always wanted a bunny and I'll always have a rabbit the rest of my life.
Author: Amy Sedaris

Quote: I said "Somebody should do something about that."Then I realized I am somebody.
Author: Lily Tomlin

Quote: If we do not find anything very pleasant, at least we shall find something new.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: If you cannot find peace within yourself, you will never find it anywhere else.
Author: Marvin Gaye

Quote: If you can't control your peanut butter, you can't expect to control your life.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.
Author: Bill Watterson

Quote: Just because you're scarred for life doesn't mean you should be scared to live.
Author: Brian Celio

Quote: Learn to drive?""Never,"said Quentin. "My mission in life is to be a passenger.
Author: Diana Wynne Jones

Quote: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
Author: Martin Luther King

Quote: Man starts over again everyday, in spite of all he knows, against all he knows.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quote: Thank you for life, and all the little ups and downs that make it worth living.
Author: Travis Barker

Quote: The act of taking the first step is what separates the winners from the losers.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: The fact that life has no meaning is a reason to live --moreover, the only one.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quote: There comes a point in every man's life when he has to say: 'Enough is enough.'
Author: Lance Armstrong

Quote: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already 3-parts dead.
Author: Bertrand Russell

Quote: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: For the two of us, home isn't a place. It is a person. And we are finally home.
Author: Stephanie Perkins

Quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.
Author: Orhan Pamuk

Quote: He who loves, flies, runs, and rejoices; he is free and nothing holds him back.
Author: Henri Matisse

Quote: I love you more than songs can say, but I can't keep running after yesterday...
Author: John Mayer

Quote: I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it.
Author: Audrey Hepburn

Quote: I'd rather be a failure at something I love than a success at something I hate.
Author: George Burns

Quote: I'll follow thee and make a heaven of hell,To die upon the hand I love so well.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

Quote: Love is only a dirty trick played on us to achieve continuation of the species.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods.
Author: Plato

Quote: One loves truly only once in a lifetime, Julian, even if one isn't aware of it.
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

Quote: Perhaps people like us cannot love. Ordinary people can - that is their secret.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: Surely it was a good way to die, in the place of someone else, someone I loved.
Author: Stephenie Meyer

Quote: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,And all the sweet serenity of books
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: the world is not a pleasant place to be without someone to hold and be held by.
Author: Nikki Giovanni

Quote: There is no love without forgiveness, and there is no forgiveness without love.
Author: Bryant H. McGill

Quote: There's only one thing that can heal the heart... Only one... It's love, Gaara.
Author: Masashi Kishimoto

Quote: What sexual preference do you hope she has?” “Happiness.” Isnt that cool?
Author: Francesca Lia Block

Quote: ... a mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Quote: Orthodoxy is a relaxation of the mind accompanied by a stiffening of the heart.
Author: Edward Abbey

Quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Forget safety.Live where you fear to live.Destroy your reputation.Be notorious.
Author: Rumi

Quote: If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.
Author: Sherman Alexie

Quote: Let everything happen to youBeauty and terrorJust keep goingNo feeling is final
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke

Quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
Author: Edmund Burke

Quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: There are no wrong turnings. Only paths we had not known we were meant to walk.
Author: Guy Gavriel Kay

Quote: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget.
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Quote: Believe in the wonderment of life, the magic of love, and the reality of death.
Author: Carroll Bryant

Quote: Have you ever noticed how "What the hell' is always the right decision to make?
Author: Terry Johnson

Quote: If you're going to kick authority in the teeth, you might as well use two feet.
Author: Keith Richards

Quote: It is culture that is the bully."Orn Ald yos'Senchul to Theo Waitley, Saltation
Author: Sharon Lee

Quote: Mereka yang berani adalah mereka yang telah berkorban menemukan dirinya sendiri
Author: Ikbal Maulana

Quote: No man is crushed by misfortune unless he has first been deceived by prosperity
Author: Seneca

Quote: The best proof that He will never cease to love us lies in that He never began.
Author: Geerhardus Vos

Quote: The cynic sees only cynicism, the depressive can taint creation with one glance
Author: Anna Funder

Quote: The summer's flower is to the summer sweetThough to itself it only live and die
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: We may be living past and future lives at the same time we are living this one.
Author: Doug Dillon

Quote: Il n'y a de réalité que dans l'action.(There is no reality except in action.)
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: I am solitary as grass. What is it I miss?Shall I ever find it, whatever it is?
Author: Sylvia Plath

Quote: In fact she herself once blamed meKyprogeneiabecause I prayed this word:I want.
Author: Sappho

Quote: Licence my roving hands, and let them go Before, behind, between, above, below.
Author: John Donne

Quote: Transform, from a fault-finder and blamer to a solution-finder and appreciator.
Author: Maddy Malhotra

Quote: The journey of the sun and moon is predictable, but yours is your ultimate art.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: ‎"Based on a true story"? No, thanks. I prefer "based on a true imagination".
Author: Enkelejd Lamaj

Quote: ..he may love you, he may miss you, but ultimately he's just not that into you.
Author: Greg Behrendt

Quote: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.
Author: Taylor Swift

Quote: People are meant to go through life two by two. 'Tain't natural to be lonesome.
Author: Thornton Wilder

Quote: What you want most you push away from you.You want more than you care to admit.
Author: Tarjei Vesaas

Quote: You know your problem, Quentin? You keep expecting people not to be themselves.
Author: John Green

Quote: God has judged me all my life. But that is God's privilege, my lady. Not yours.
Author: Barbara Hambly

Quote: He has done things that caused me to doubt His wisdom, but never His existence.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: If God created us in his own image, we have more than reciprocated."(Notebooks)
Author: Voltaire

Quote: If there is a God, atheism must seem to Him as less of an insult than religion.
Author: Edmond de Goncourt

Quote: It is very expensive to give bad medical care to poor people in a rich country.
Author: Paul Farmer

Quote: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.
Author: Christopher Hitchens

Quote: I'm not a body with a soul, I'm a soul that has a visible part called the body.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Who knew that the path to a womans heart was through the soul of an honest man?
Author: Melissa de la Cruz

Quote: ...success is not a comparison of what we have done with what others have done.
Author: Myles Munroe

Quote: Are you the fruit of redemption? If yes, then make a delightful noise unto Him.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: However things may seem, no evil thing is success and no good thing is failure.
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quote: One is never ready for success. It consecrates and looses you at the same time.
Author: Isabelle Adjani

Quote: The number of ways to live in one lifetime is limitless. So why limit yourself?
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.
Author: Irving Berlin

Quote: There is simply no substitute for hard work when it comes to achieving success.
Author: Heather Bresch

Quote: Try to look at your weakness and convert it into your strength. That's success.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: A faith that cannot survive collision with the truth is not worth many regrets.
Author: Arthur C. Clarke

Quote: A person can go along quite awhile if they get a good day every once and again.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
Author: Robert Orben

Quote: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure truth.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: To tell the truth is very difficult, and young people are rarely capable of it.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain't going away.
Author: Elvis Presley

Quote: Cruelty might be very human, and it might be cultural, but it's not acceptable.
Author: Jodi Foster

Quote: Cruelty might be very human, and it might be cultural, but it's not acceptable.
Author: Jodie Foster

Quote: If you think eating meat is just a personal choice, you are forgetting someone.
Author: Unknown

Quote: The concept that you are not ingesting rotting flesh sort of sums it up for me.
Author: Bryan Adams

Quote: The question is not, Can they reason? nor, Can they talk? but, Can they suffer?
Author: Jeremy Bentham

Quote: The question is not, Can they reason? Nor, Can they talk? But, Can they suffer?
Author: Jeremy Bentham

Quote: The wild, cruel beast is not behind the bars of the cage. He is in front of it.
Author: Axel Munthe

Quote: A day unemployed is like a bagel- even when it's bad, it's still pretty good...
Author: CrimethInc.

Quote: Do not look for happiness outside yourself. The awakened seek happiness inside.
Author: Peter Deunov

Quote: Earthlings went on being friendly, when they should have been thinking instead.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine.
Author: H.L. Mencken

Quote: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: A short story must have a single mood and every sentence must build towards it.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: Don't waste time waiting for inspiration. Begin, and inspiration will find you.
Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

Quote: I shall live badly if I do not write, and I shall write badly if I do not live.
Author: Françoise Sagan

Quote: We must do our work for its own sake, not for fortune or attention or applause.
Author: Steven Pressfield

Quote: Writing is an affair of yearning for great voyages and hauling on frayed ropes.
Author: Israel Shenker

Quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
Author: Yoko Ono

Quote: A good teacher opens the door for you, but you must enter the room by yourself.
Author: Zen Proverb

Quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
Author: Charles Darwin

Quote: All animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Do not bite at the bait of pleasure, till you know there is no hook beneath it.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Do not use life to give life to death. Do not use death to bring death to life.
Author: Zhuangzi

Quote: Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: Everyone you meet is fighting a battle you know nothing about. Be kind. Always.
Author: Robin Williams

Quote: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.

Quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.

Quote: Falling down is not failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.

Quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Quote: It's easy to be a critic, but being a doer requires effort, risk, and change.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.

Quote: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul.

Quote: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.

Quote: The act of taking the first step is what separates the winners from the losers.

Quote: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
