Quote: We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors.

Quote: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.
Author: Vince Lombardi

Quote: When you are tough on yourself, life is going to be infinitely easier on you.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: You have to make time, even for something as universal as staring at the stars.

Quote: You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.

Quote: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.

Quote: You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.

Quote: Drawing is like making an expressive gesture with the advantage of permanence.

Quote: Good art provides people with a vocabulary about things they can't articulate.

Quote: I realize that protest paintings are not exactly in vogue, but I've done many.

Quote: I try to keep a low profile in general. Not with my art, but just as a person.

Quote: In art, the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can imagine.

Quote: It may be that the deep necessity of art is the examination of self-deception.
Author: Robert Motherwell

Quote: Rationalism is the enemy of art, though necessary as a basis for architecture.
Author: Arthur Erickson

Quote: The business of art is to reveal the relation between man and his environment.
Author: D. H. Lawrence

Quote: You can't do sketches enough. Sketch everything and keep your curiosity fresh.
Author: John Singer Sargent

Quote: Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it.
Author: P.J. O'Rourke

Quote: Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind.

Quote: Books don't offer real escape, but they can stop a mind scratching itself raw.

Quote: The odd thing about people who had many books was how they always wanted more.
Author: Patricia A. McKillip

Quote: I believe that more people would be alive today if there were a death penalty.

Quote: Reality means you live until you die...the real truth is nobody wants reality.

Quote: Those who shun the whimsy of things will experience rigor mortis before death.

Quote: Waking up was a daily cruelty, an affront, and she avoided it by not sleeping.
Author: Gregory Maguire

Quote: Yes, it's a well-known fact about you: you're like death, you take everything.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quote: education is consistency .still we forget to add our words in to this old page
Author: litymunshi

Quote: Education is what remains when we have forgotten all that we have been taught.
Author: George Savile

Quote: Genius is an exceedingly common human quality, probably natural to most of us.
Author: John Taylor Gatto

Quote: Observe & accept what ever arises & know that everything is as it needs to be.
Author: Allan Lokos

Quote: She was torn between her customer service training and her youthful certitude.

Quote: To me education is a leading out of what is already there in the pupil's soul.
Author: Muriel Spark

Quote: As goes the family, so goes the faith; as goes the faith, so goes the culture.
Author: Kenneth L. Gentry Jr.

Quote: Faith isn't absence of doubt. It's belief without proof, not without question.
Author: Rosemary Clement-Moore

Quote: Boy, you knock on the devil's door and he will head slam you through the wall.
Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

Quote: Shane looked…pale. Pale and shaken and—how predictable was this?—pissed.
Author: Rachel Caine

Quote: I have no such powers. If I did I would be more merciful than God, believe me.
Author: Mario Puzo

Quote: It is the Holy Spirit's job to convict, God's job to judge and my job to love.
Author: Billy Graham

Quote: Your prayer for someone may or may not change them, but it always changes YOU.
Author: Craig Groeschel

Quote: And I can't be running back and fourth forever between grief and high delight.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Quote: Happiness and the absurd are two sons of the same earth. They are inseparable.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: JOY goes against the foundations of mathematics: it multiplies when we divide.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Money does not buy you happiness, but lack of money certainly buys you misery.

Quote: When life gives you pain, accept it. When life gives you happiness, reject it.

Quote: You have everything you need for complete peace and total happiness right now.
Author: Wayne W. Dyer

Quote: Anything seems possible at night when the rest of the world has gone to sleep.
Author: David Almond

Quote: Every goal first started as something in our mind. You have it all within you!

Quote: Hope is a flicker, a candle flame kept burning by the simple act of breathing.

Quote: I can hardly wait for tomorrow, it means a new life for me each and every day.

Quote: I hope for the day when everyone can speak again of God without embarrassment.

Quote: I would like to live a day in the life of an ant and hope not to get squashed.

Quote: Life must go on, even if it's no joke...just pretend to believe in the future.

Quote: Pity the selfishness of lovers: it is brief, a forlorn hope; it is impossible.

Quote: We hope that we will live only because we must be with God, as alive as He is.

Quote: We yearned for the future. How did we learn it, that talent for insatiability?

Quote: All are lunatics, but he who can analyze his delusion is called a philosopher.

Quote: Always be wary of any helpful item that weighs less than its operating manual.

Quote: Be careful about reading health books. Some fine day you'll die of a misprint.

Quote: Do you answer a question directly?""Hard to say. Ah, there, I've done it again

Quote: Even if you are on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.

Quote: Humor can inform and break down stigma, which is a huge issue in the military.
Author: Garry Trudeau

Quote: I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled.

Quote: I was happy in the haze of a drunken hour, but heaven knows I'm miserable now.

Quote: In wine there is wisdom, in beer there is Freedom, in water there is bacteria.

Quote: Look. Survey. Inspect. My hair is ruined! I look like a pan of bacon and eggs!

Quote: Never attribute to malice that which can be adequately explained by stupidity.

Author: Erma Bombeck

Quote: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.
Author: Nikolai Gogol

Quote: The man who smiles when things go wrong has thought of someone to blame it on.
Author: Robert Bloch

Quote: The Muslims in the Cape are associated with having a very good sense of humor.

Quote: The secret source of humor is not joy but sorrow; there is no humor in Heaven.

Quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: And now, this is the sweetest and most glorious day that ever my eyes did see.
Author: Donald Cargill

Quote: Atticus, he was real nice.""Most people are, Scout, when you finally see them.
Author: Harper Lee

Quote: Bebek berjalan berbondong-bondong, akan tetapi burung elang terbang sendirian.
Author: Sukarno

Quote: Creativity flows when the mind is light. Be light and ignite your imagination.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Do not look down with disdain on what Christ spent so much to achieve for you.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: Dream big and never give up on those dreams. Who knows where they'll take you?
Author: Amy McGuire

Quote: Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's needs, but not every man's greed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: I believe that if one always looked at the skies, one would end up with wings.
Author: Gustave Flaubert

Quote: If it can be destroyed by the truth, it deserves to be destroyed by the truth.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Knowledge does not come to us by details, but in flashes of light from heaven.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Like a missing tooth, sometimes an absence is more noticeable than a presence.
Author: Jodi Picoult

Quote: Most don't deserve your tears... and the ones that do will never make you cry.
Author: T. Rafael Cimino

Quote: Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Sometimes you just have to jump out the window and grow wings on the way down.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: Stay focus on what God has assigned me to do. Keep my mind on what I am doing/
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: That's a misconception, Lennie. The sky is everywhere, it begins at your feet.

Quote: Then that's what the Northern Lights are. All the lives that we're not living.

Quote: Time was a film run backward. Suns fled and ten million moons fled after them.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quote: Travel Moulds A Man,People Mould His Wisdom And Experiences Mould His LIFE...!

Quote: until the end of the world,all whys will be answered,but now,you can only ask!
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: What have you gained since you haven't prayed? What will you lose if you pray?
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: What is grander than a country and more valuable than gold? Strength of heart.
Author: Cornelius Elmore Addison

Quote: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: What the mind can conceive and believe, and the heart desire, you can achieve.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Whether you know or not, you are the infinite potential of love, peace and joy
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: You know me better than you think, you know, and you shall know me better yet.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: You're never given a dream without also being given the power to make it true.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Paranormal events are just edges of the infinite we “happen” to encounter.
Author: Doug Dillon

Quote: A fool can easily be known(identified) by what proceeds from his or her mouth.

Quote: I felt knowledge and the unity of the world circulate in me like my own blood.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: One of the greatest pieces of economic wisdom is to know what you do not know.
Author: John Kenneth Galbraith

Quote: Only through Beauty's morning-gate, dost thou penetrate the land of knowledge.
Author: Friedrich Schiller

Quote: The obvious can sometimes be illuminating when perceived in an unhabitual way.
Author: Daniel Quinn

Quote: For the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
Author: Muhammad Ali

Quote: I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: I want words at my funeral. But I guess that means you need life in your life.
Author: Markus Zusak

Quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.
Author: Marcus Garvey

Quote: It takes too much energy to be against something unless it's really important.
Author: Madeleine L'Engle

Quote: I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.
Author: Michael Jordan

Quote: Life ... is a taleTold by an idiot, full of sound and fury,Signifying nothing.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future.
Author: John Green

Quote: Love doesn't make the world go 'round; love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: My mother always said 'Don't bother other people.' I think that's good advice.
Author: Amy Sedaris

Quote: Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.
Author: Guillaume Apollinaire

Quote: Of all sad words of tongue or pen, the saddest are these, 'It might have been.
Author: John Greenleaf Whittier

Quote: One who makes himself a worm cannot complain afterwards if people step on him.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quote: People soon get tired of things that aren't boring, but not of what is boring.
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: Sometimes the hardest part isn't letting go but rather learning to start over.
Author: Nicole Sobon

Quote: Step with care and great tact, and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: The hardest thing in life to learn is which bridge to cross and which to burn.
Author: David Russell

Quote: You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Youth offers the promise of happiness, but life offers the realities of grief.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: A pair of powerful spectacles has sometimes sufficed to cure a person in love.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Absence makes the heart grow fonder, but it sure makes the rest of you lonely.
Author: Charles M. Schulz

Quote: Every woman wants a man who'll fall in love with her soul as well as her body.
Author: Rainbow Rowell

Quote: He who does not love his own language is worse than an animal and smelly fish.
Author: Jose Rizal

Quote: It was brave,"countered Issa. "It was rare. It was love, and it was beautiful.
Author: Laini Taylor

Quote: Love doesn't make the world go 'round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
Author: Franklin P. Jones

Quote: Love is not altogether a delirium, yet it has many points in common therewith.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: Love possesses not nor will it be possessed, for love is sufficient unto love.
Author: Khalil Gibran

Quote: Love sucks. Sometimes it feels good. Sometimes it's just another way to bleed.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton

Quote: love, I've come to understand is more than three words mumbled before bedtime.
Author: Nicholas Sparks

Quote: No matter how bad your heart is broken, the world doesn't stop for your grief.
Author: Faraaz Kazi

Quote: The great tragedy of life is not that men perish, but that they cease to love.
Author: W. Somerset Maugham

Quote: The sweetest noise on earth, a woman's tongue; A string which hath no discord.
Author: Bryan Procter

Quote: There's a difference between really loving someone and loving the idea of her.
Author: Gillian Flynn

Quote: True beauty is something that attacks, overpowers, robs, and finally destroys.
Author: Yukio Mishima

Quote: Being aware is being aware of one's own mind and the games it plays on itself.
Author: Robin Macnaughton

Quote: He thinks in secret, and it comes to pass: environment is but a looking glass.
Author: James Allen

Quote: It was really amazing the number of hard hits from which a mind could recover.
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Old man with a young mind is much younger than the young man with an old mind!
Author: Mehmet Murat ildan

Quote: To understand the immeasurable, the mind must be extraordinarily quiet, still.
Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

Quote: being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.
Author: Charles Bukowski

Quote: I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: So many things are possible just as long as you don't know they're impossible.
Author: Norton Juster

Quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.
Author: Jimi Hendrix

Quote: Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength.
Author: Corrie ten Boom

Quote: A poet is not an apostle; he drives out devils only by the power of the devil.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: Flow is the best of what happens when potential is activated by consciousness.
Author: Dew Platt

Quote: For axioms in philosophy are not axioms until they are proved upon our pulses.
Author: John Keats

Quote: Man is but a reed, the most feeble thing in nature; but he is a thinking reed.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: That is why enemies can be great motivators. They serve as fuel for your fire.
Author: Simon Zingerman

Quote: Time is simply the measurement of human progression against that of existence.
Author: Gerald M. Givens

Quote: To establish that a rule is likely to be true, one must try to prove it false.
Author: Stuart Sutherland

Quote: What matters creative endless toil, When, at a snatch, oblivion ends the coil?
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Who is to decide which is the grimmer sight: withered hearts, or empty skulls?
Author: Honoré de Balzac

Quote: On ne peut opposer absraitement le spectacle et l'activité sociale effective.
Author: Guy Debord

Quote: Partout où il y a représentation indépendante, le spectacle se reconstitue.
Author: Guy Debord

Quote: To fall in love with someone's thoughts - the most intimate, splendid romance.
Author: Sanober Khan

Quote: If practice makes you perfectshouldn't good behavior be addedto the curriculum
Author: Cornelia "Connie D."DeDona

Quote: Our wounds are often the openings into the best and most beautiful part of us.
Author: David Richo

Quote: you can take this mouththis wound you wantbut you can't kissand make itbetter.
Author: Daphne Gottlieb

Quote: I like the silent church before the service begins, better than any preaching.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: May you live in such a way that your death is just the beginning of your life.
Author: Max Lucado

Quote: Out of 100 men, one will read the Bible, the other 99 will read the Christian.
Author: D.L. Moody

Quote: Religion's just a well-oiled profit-driven denial of the randomness of it all.
Author: Wally Lamb

Quote: Hermione was screaming again: the sound went through Harry like physical pain.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Love is a wild fire that cannot be contained by any mere element known to man.
Author: Cristina Marrero

Quote: Nothing good ever comes of love. What comes of love is always something better
Author: Roberto Bolaño

Quote: Why do people always assume that volume will succeed when logic won't? - Damon
Author: L.J. Smith

Quote: And you are made of a hundred trillion cells. We are, each of us, a multitude.
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: For someone who'e smarter than a supercomputer, sometimes you're a real idiot.
Author: Gordon Korman

Quote: Oh! to shoot for the stars if feels right. Aim for my heart if it feels right.
Author: Maroon 5

Quote: I think we have different value systems."—Arthur"Well mine's better."—Ford
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: Been there, done that, got the t-shirt.Sold my soul and yeah, the truth hurts.
Author: Marina Diamandis Marina and the Diamonds

Quote: I believe that the measure of my soul is my capacity to love imperfect people.
Author: Joseph Grenny

Quote: The souls of heroes are forged by the gods and tempered with the pain of life.
Author: Brian Rathbone

Quote: A key to achieving success is to assemble a strong and stable management team.
Author: Vivek Wadhwa

Quote: Another way of remaining in intimacy with God is by remaining in His presence.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: I couldn't do no yodelin', so I turned to howlin'. And it's done me just fine.
Author: Howlin' Wolf

Quote: I think true success is intrinsic... It's love. It's kindness. It's community.
Author: Tom Shadyac

Quote: If you wish to be a success in the world, promise everything, deliver nothing.
Author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Quote: Let your words glorify God and edify your hearers and then beautify your life.
Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu

Quote: Maintaining spirituality and humanism are the keys to success. It's a balance.
Author: Bikram Choudhury

Quote: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: With ordinary talent and extraordinary perseverance, all things are attainable
Author: Thomas Fowell Buxton

Quote: I have no name,"she purred. "I'm whoever the keepers of my fate tell me to be.
Author: Sarah J. Maas

Quote: Michael: There's nothing here to fear.Lucifer: Well, there's always the truth.
Author: Mike Carey

Quote: We don't get to chose what is true. We only get to choose what we do about it.
Author: Kami Garcia

Quote: Compassion is the awareness of a deep bond between yourself and all creatures.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: If it's not good enough for your eyes, why is it good enough for your stomach?

Quote: Man's mind stretched to a new idea never goes back to its original dimensions.

Quote: No other animal on Earth has portrayed such a disregard for life than mankind.
Author: Anthony Douglas Williams

Quote: I don't fancy colors of the face, I'm always attracted to colors of the brain.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson

Quote: Men must endureTheir going hence, even as their coming hither.Ripeness is all.

Author: Ernesto Che Guevara

Quote: Where lowland is, that's where water goes. All medicine wants is pain to cure.
Author: Rumi

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: If the story you're telling, is the story you're telling, you're in deep shit.

Quote: That's all we have, finally, the words, and they had better be the right ones.
Author: Raymond Carver

Author: Stephen King

Quote: There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed.

Quote: Any fool can turn a blind eye but who knows what the ostrich sees in the sand.

Quote: Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.

Quote: Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.

Quote: No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.

Quote: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.

Quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

Quote: The only difference between success and failure is the ability to take action.

Quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.

Quote: One must always draw, draw with the eyes, when one cannot draw with a pencil.

Quote: The worst state of affairs is when science begins to concern itself with art.

Quote: If there are no dogs in Heaven, then when I die I want to go where they went.

Quote: Unless their use by readers bring them to life, books are indeed dead things.

Quote: Can the sarcasm,' he said. 'Please, I always use fresh sarcasm, never canned.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton

Quote: Whatever you do, in the privacy of your own rain shower, is your own business
Author: Gregory David Roberts

Quote: To buy a cake... to howl at the moon... to know true happiness... I am happy.

Quote: Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well.

Author: Jeaniene Frost

Quote: Some are born weird, some achieve it, others have weirdness thrust upon them.
Author: Dick Francis

Author: Shel Silverstein

Author: Meg Cabot

Quote: When red-headed people are above a certain social grade their hair is auburn.

Author: G.K. Chesterton

Quote: God is whispering in your heart, in the whole existence, just tune your ears.

Author: Lana Del Rey

Quote: ...you're either gonna spend your life fucking pussy, or taking it to church.
Author: Dave Matthes

Quote: All that exists is just and unjust and is equally justified in both respects.

Quote: The fact that life has no meaning is a reason to live-moreover, the only one.
Author: Emil Cioran

Author: D.H. Lawrence

Author: Paul Ricoeur

Quote: It's not enough to have lived. We should be determined to live for something.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: Sometimes our walls exist just to see who has the strength to knockthem down.

Quote: I can't take anything you don't give me. Stop giving me power over your life.

Quote: I guess I like things that take time and attention. More worthwhile that way.
Author: Huntley Fitzpatrick

Quote: what a luxury it was for people to hold their loved ones whenever they wanted
Author: Cecelia Ahern

Quote: You keep runnin that mouth and I'm goin to take you back there and screw you.

Quote: This is Sailor Supergirl,” George says. “She knows all about black holes.
Author: Huntley Fitzpatrick

Quote: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.
Author: John Dewey

Quote: If a conclusion is not poetically balanced, it cannot be scientifically true.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: It's true; life really is generous to those who pursue their Personal Legend.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Behind the perfection of a man's style, must lie the passion of a man's soul.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Every single human soul has more meaning and value than the whole of history.
Author: Nikolai A. Berdyaev

Quote: Inside us there is something that has no name, that something is what we are.
Author: José Saramago

Quote: Liberation happens each time we become conscious of the contents of the soul.

Quote: Being sick successfully is not included in society's panoply of worthy goals.
Author: Kaimana Wolff

Quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.

Quote: He would never again need anything from his mother and father but their love.
Author: Frederick Drimmer

Quote: I believe in luck: how else can you explain the success of those you dislike?

Quote: I'm an eternal realist and the success rate for being an actor is pretty low.
Author: Tom Hiddleston

Quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Author: Oliver Goldsmith

Quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Success is not to be pursued; it is to be attracted by the person you become.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: Success is often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quote: To be successful you need friends and to be very successful you need enemies.
Author: Sidney Sheldon

Quote: Being a leader is making the people you love hate you a little more each day.

Quote: Don't ever trust men with good intentions. They'll always disappoint you."Leo
Author: Lisa Kleypas

Quote: Tell people the hammered truth, and it will ring like steel against an anvil.
Author: Elizabeth Haydon

Quote: There are some things one remembers even though they may never have happened.
Author: Harold Pinter

Quote: No animals needs to die in order for me to live. And that makes me feel good.
Author: Howard Lyman

Quote: Please don't refuse with your eyes what the animals endure with their bodies.

Quote: Please don't refuse with your eyes what the animals endure with their bodies.
Author: Shaun Monson

Quote: Anger exceeding limits causes fear and excessive kindness eliminates respect.
Author: Euripides

Quote: As a well spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Sometimes wisdom came from strange places, even from giant teenaged goldfish.

Quote: The secret of life, though, is to fall seven times and to get up eight times.

Quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study;but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.

Quote: To believe yourself brave is to be brave; it is the one only essential thing.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: When I write, I feel like an armless, legless man with a crayon in his mouth.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Quote: Writing feels safer somehow. I can catch myself before I say the wrong thing.
Author: Hillary Frank

Quote: A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.
Author: Roy T. Bennett

Quote: Do not fight with pigs - you will be smeared in mud but the pig will like it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
Author: Steve Maraboli

Quote: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.

Quote: I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
Author: Estee Lauder

Quote: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?
Author: John Wooden

Quote: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
Author: Samuel Butler

Quote: One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quote: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
Author: Robert Greene

Quote: The person who cannot control his words shows that he cannot control himself.
Author: Robert Greene

Quote: The world doesn't always give you want, but it often gives you what you need.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: Trust your instincts: my first reaction is almost invariably the right one.
Author: Estee Lauder

Quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.
Author: H. L. Mencken

Quote: Draw your pleasure, paint your pleasure, and express your pleasure strongly.
Author: Pierre Bonnard

Quote: It is through art, and through art only, that we can realise our perfection.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: My hobbies away from horse racing would be reading and painting; I love art.
Author: Chantal Sutherland

Quote: Photography takes an instant out of time, altering life by holding it still.

Author: Jeannette Walls

Quote: Your current circumstances are part of your redemption story He is writing.
Author: Evinda Lepins

Quote: Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness; it has no taste.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: In pursuit of happiness, smart people often end up dumbing down themselves.
Author: Erol Ozan

Quote: The secret of happiness is not doing what we like but in liking what we do.
Author: J.M. Coetzee

Quote: The true measure of a man is how he treats you when others are not looking.
Author: Alessandra Torre

Quote: You and your purpose in life are the same thing. Your purpose is to be you.
Author: George Alexiou

Quote: For every bad thing in life, there are more good things to tip the balance.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: Hope is not a resting place but a starting point - a cactus, not a cushion.
Author: H. Jackson Brown

Quote: Hope is the crystal meth of emotions. It hooks you fast and kills you hard.
Author: Jennifer Donnelly

Quote: I hope to have communion with the people, that is the most important thing.
Author: Pope John Paul II

Quote: I never really thought of myself as depressed so much as paralyzed by hope.
Author: Maria Bamford

Quote: The Opera was a very cold film, a hopeless and dark film, no hope, no love.
Author: Dario Argento

Quote: To be truly radical is to make hope possible rather than despair convincing
Author: Raymond Williams

Quote: what we call our despair is often only the painful eagerness of unfed hope.
Author: George Eliot

Quote: A successful book is not made of what is in it, but what is left out of it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: Brits have a better sense of humor in most ways. It's darker, more cutting.
Author: Stephan Pastis

Quote: By all means continue destroying my possessions. I daresay I have too many.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Horse sense is the thing a horse has which keeps it from betting on people.
Author: W.C. Fields

Quote: Humor does not diminish the pain - it makes the space around it get bigger.
Author: Allen Klein

Quote: I never made one of my discoveries through the process of rational thinking
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I require three things in a man: he must be handsome, ruthless, and stupid.
Author: Dorothy Parker

Quote: I'm happy to tell you there is very little in this world that I believe in.
Author: George Carlin

Quote: It's no use going back to yesterday, because I was a different person then.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Quote: Men live by intervals of reason under the sovereignty of humor and passion.
Author: Thomas Browne

Quote: My way of joking is to tell the truth. It's the funniest joke in the world.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: No mind is thoroughly well organized that is deficient in a sense of humor.
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quote: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: The problem with doing nothing is that you never know when you're finished.
Author: Nelson DeMille

Author: Jeaniene Frost

Quote: As architect of your reality, you are empowered to create it as you choose.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: As long as you do things for God, you are a Hall of Famer in heaven's list.
Author: Rick Warren

Quote: Because of his hormones, he only has three emotions: crabby, hungry, horny.
Author: Sherry Argov

Quote: Berputar menjadi sesuatu yang bukan kita, demi bisa menjadi diri kita lagi.
Author: Dee Lestari

Quote: But remember, boy, that a kind act can sometimes be as powerful as a sword.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Dead yesterdays and unborn tomorrows, why fret about it, if today be sweet.
Author: Omar Khayyám

Quote: Don't limit a child to your own learning, for she was born in another time.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: Every person has a right to risk their own life for the preservation of it.
Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Quote: Forget the place you're trying to get to and see the beauty in right now...
Author: Evanescence

Quote: I don't trust men everybody likes. Being nice isn't the same as being good.
Author: Sarah Rees Brennan

Quote: I prefer you to make mistakes in kindness than work miracles in unkindness.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: I try to avoid looking forward or backward, and try to keep looking upward.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Quote: In the future, there will be no female leaders. There will just be leaders.
Author: Sheryl Sandberg

Quote: Just do what you were going to do, before you said you were going to do it.
Author: Delma Pryce

Quote: Kemampuan membaca itu sebuah rahmat. Kegemaran membaca; sebuah kebahagiaan.
Author: Goenawan Mohamad

Quote: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Life is very short, and there's no time for fussing and fighting my friends
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Never let anybody guess that you have a mind of your own. Above all be pure
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quote: No one really knows why they are alive until they know what they'd die for.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: Remake the world, a little at a time, each in your own corner of the world.
Author: Rick Riordan

Quote: Sometimes the hardest one to see . . .is the one standing right before you.
Author: Lenore Wolfe

Quote: Stories change us; they change the world. People are stories of themselves.
Author: Karen Healey

Quote: Success seems to be largely a matterof hanging on after others have let go.
Author: William Feather

Quote: The flow of Guiness into the studio was inspirational as well as nutritive.
Author: Carter Burwell

Quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. Watch your step.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: The summit of happiness is reached when a person is ready to be what he is.
Author: Desiderius Erasmus

Quote: To die is nothing, but to live with purpose and integrity, that's something
Author: Elle Newmark

Quote: Until justice rolls down like water and righteousness like a mighty stream.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: We make our own truths and lies....Truths are often lies and lies truths...
Author: Bernhard Schlink

Quote: we tend to steer our lives in the direction of the lessons we need to learn
Author: Don Campbell

Quote: When a good man is hurt, all who would be called good must suffer with him.
Author: Euripides

Quote: When life takes away, something of greater value is always given in return.
Author: Michael J. Fox

Quote: When men are pure, laws are useless; when men are corrupt, laws are broken.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Your own Self-Realization is the greatest service you can render the world.
Author: Ramana Maharshi

Quote: You're better than this. Better than whatever it is you're going to do now.
Author: Richelle Mead

Quote: I have always thirsted for knowledge, I have always been full of questions.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: I'm fat because I'm greedy, and if my mind is fat it's because I'm curious.
Author: Stephen Fry

Quote: Knowledge, like money and muck (manure), serves us best when spread evenly.
Author: Stuart Aken

Quote: Whatever in creation exists without my knowledge exists without my consent.
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
Author: Simone de Beauvoir

Quote: Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Don't let fear rule your life. Live one day at a time, and never be afraid.
Author: Tammy Faye Bakker

Quote: Don't let your luggage define your travels, each life unravels differently.
Author: Shane Koyczan

Quote: Dying is only one thing to be sad over. Living unhappily is something else.
Author: Mitch Albom

Quote: I envy people that know love. That have someone who takes them as they are.
Author: Jess C. Scott

Quote: If a man is to live, he must be all alive, body, soul, mind, heart, spirit.
Author: Thomas Merton

Quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: Life consists not in holding good cards but in playing those you hold well.
Author: Josh Billings

Quote: Life moves very fast. It rushes from Heaven to Hell in a matter of seconds.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Maybe if I forgot things once in a while, we'd all be a little bit happier.
Author: Jay Asher

Quote: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
Author: Bob Marley

Quote: Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on.
Author: Henry Rollins

Quote: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person.
Author: Chuck Palahniuk

Quote: Toby Zeigler: There's literally no one in the world I don't hate right now.
Author: Aaron Sorkin

Quote: What a waste my life would be without all the beautiful mistakes I've made.
Author: Alice Bag

Quote: A flower cannot blossom without sunshine, and man cannot live without love.
Author: Max Muller

Quote: A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does
Author: Dan Millman

Quote: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quote: As a lyricist, you love to hear other great lyrics or other great concepts.
Author: Alicia Keys

Quote: I could've sworn I was telling the truth when I told you I didn't miss you.
Author: pleasefindthis

Quote: I love my cats more than I love most people. Probably more than is healthy.
Author: Amy Lee

Quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
Author: Peter Ustinov

Quote: No woman wants to be in submission to a man who isn't in submission to God!
Author: T.D. Jakes

Quote: The only love that I really believe in is a mother's love for her children.
Author: Karl Lagerfeld

Quote: The words "I Love You' kill, and resurrect millions, in less than a second.
Author: Aberjhani

Quote: The worst thing you can do if you miss or need someone is let them know it.
Author: Sarah Dessen

Author: Maggie Stiefvater

Quote: What is love? two souls and one flesh; friendship? two bodies and one soul.
Author: Joseph Roux

Quote: When you forgive, you love. And when you love, God's light shines upon you.
Author: Jon Krakauer

Quote: Why is it so hard to articulate love yet so easy to express disappointment?
Author: Kaui Hart Hemmings

Quote: You are the one girl that made me risk eveything for a future worth having.
Author: Simone Elkeles

Quote: You're like a grey sky. You're beautiful, even though you don't want to be.
Author: Jasmine Warga

Quote: All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.
Author: Lemony Snicket

Quote: Faith is taking the first step even when you can't see the whole staircase.
Author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Quote: I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.
Author: David Levithan

Quote: I myself am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions.
Author: Augusten Burroughs

Quote: If no one in the entire world cared about you, did you really exist at all?
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane.
Author: W.G. Sebald

Quote: None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are.
Author: Anne Rice

Quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
Author: Harper Lee

Quote: There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do.
Author: John Steinbeck

Quote: Usually I'm remarkably good natured. Try me on a day that doesn't end in y.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Where there is love, there is often also hate. They can exist side by side.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Will looked horrified. "What kind of monster could possibly hate chocolate?
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: There is no exquisite beauty… without some strangeness in the proportion.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: And now we step to the rhythm of miracles.--from The Light, That Never Dies
Author: Aberjhani

Quote: Be a life long or short, its completeness depends on what it was lived for.
Author: David Starr Jordan

Quote: Congress shall make no law abridging the freedom of production and trade...
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: In football everything is complicated by the presence of the opposite team.
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre

Quote: The goal of education is to enable individuals to continue their education.
Author: John Dewey

Quote: There is no problem more difficult to solve than that created by ourselves.
Author: Felix Alba-Juez

Quote: To all appearances he was just drifting. In actuality he was just drifting.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: What is this slow blue dream of living, and this fevered death by dreaming?
Author: Aberjhani

Quote: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Only the very weak-minded refuse to be influenced by literature and poetry.
Author: Cassandra Clare

Quote: Poetry is a deal of joy and pain and wonder, with a dash of the dictionary.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: We talk so abstractly about poetry because all of us are usually bad poets.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: The universe speaks to us, if we have the courage to see it for what it is.
Author: Nikki Rowe

Quote: Though mountains melt and oceans burn,The gifts of love shall still return.
Author: Rosamund Hodge

Quote: And now you are and I am and we're a mystery which will never happen again.
Author: E.E. Cummings

Quote: How dare you say it's nothing to me?Baby, you're the only light I ever saw.
Author: John Mayer

Quote: One minute of reconciliation is worth more than a whole life of friendship!
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: And if you ever - and I do mean ever - try to leave me, I'm goin' with you.
Author: Catherine Anderson

Quote: Do you think there's a difference? Between belonging with and belonging to?
Author: Jenny Han

Quote: A man who knows what other men know,know nothing for they all know the same
Author: Alchemist

Quote: Not a single one of the cells that compose you knows who you are, or cares.
Author: Daniel C. Dennett

Quote: Science is my territory, but science fiction is the landscape of my dreams.
Author: Freeman Dyson

Quote: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.
Author: Adam Smith

Quote: Words, too, have genuine substance -- mass and weight and specific gravity.

Quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.

Quote: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
Author: Joyce Brothers

Quote: Defeat is not the worst of failures. Not to have tried is the true failure.
Author: George Edward Woodberry

Quote: Don't confuse fame with success. Madonna is one; Helen Keller is the other.
Author: Erma Bombeck

Quote: Earn your success based on service to others, not at the expense of others.

Quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quote: He has achieved success who has worked well, laughed often, and loved much.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: It goes without saying that it's hard to attain a certain level of success.

Quote: It's a shame how much artists have to bleed for people to enjoy their work.

Quote: It's our nature: Human beings like success but they hate successful people.

Quote: Never let success get to your head and never let failure get to your heart.

Quote: Result of HARDWORK Is Neither Friends Nor Enemy,To the AGE Of the ACHIEVER!
Author: Sujit Lalwani

Quote: Success is more a function of consistent common sense than it is of genius.
Author: An Wang

Quote: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines, practiced every day.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: You have had many successes, and you have earned the right to be respected.
Author: Lorii Myers

Quote: But no. There is a difference between the truth and what we wish were true.
Author: Patrick Rothfuss

Quote: I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours.
Author: Hunter S. Thompson

Quote: Leowin: Don't worry Luthiel. 'Truth's existence never depended upon belief.
Author: Robert Fanney

Quote: News flash, Bozo. Don't ever tell a girl to relax. It only makes us madder.

Quote: Our kindness may be the most persuasive argument for that which we believe.
Author: Gordon B. Hinckley

Quote: Those who understand history are condemned to watch other idiots repeat it.
Author: Peter Lamborn Wilson

Quote: Understanding is a three edged sword: your side, their side, and the truth.
Author: J. Michael Straczynski

Quote: Whether your pleasing or pissing everybody off, your doing something wrong.
Author: David Cook

Quote: You are the Truth from foot to brow. Now, what else would you like to know?
Author: Rumi

Quote: You can't let the truth bring out the worst and let it get the best of you.
Author: Criss Jami

Quote: Anyone who cares about the Earth - really cares - must stop eating animals.

Quote: Wearing cosmetics that were tested on animals makes you ugly on the inside.
Author: Ricky Gervais

Quote: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Risks must be taken because the greatest hazard in life is to risk nothing.
Author: Leo Buscaglia

Quote: There were many terrible things in my life and most of them never happened.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: To come to nothing through something is the way to outside from both sides.
Author: Dejan Stojanovic

Quote: Where ignorance lurks, so too do the frontiers of discovery and imagination
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: Color is the overpowering of black; white – the final victory over black.
Author: Dejan Stojanovic

Quote: A blank piece of paper is God's way of telling us how hard it is to be God.
Author: Sidney Sheldon

Quote: Language exists less to record the actual than to liberate the imagination.
Author: Anthony Burgess

Quote: This diary is my kief, hashish and opium pipe. This is my drug and my vice.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Do Something. If it works, do more of it. If it doesn't, do something else.
Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
Author: Robert Frost

Quote: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
Author: Albus Dumbledore

Quote: It is well known that those who do not trust themselves never trust others.
Author: Alfred Adler

Quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: The quality of your life is determined by the quality of questions you ask.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: The very essence of instinct is that it's followed independently of reason.
Author: Charles Darwin

Quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: To the world you may be one person; but to one person you may be the world.
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: When you realize you've made a mistake, take immediate steps to correct it.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Anime is intended to have ambiguous features. That's part of the art form.
Author: M. Night Shyamalan

Quote: Any fool can have bad luck; the art consists in knowing how to exploit it.
Author: Frank Wedekind

Quote: Art in the classroom not only spurs creativity, it also inspires learning.
Author: Mickey Hart

Quote: Art is not a study of positive reality, it is the seeking for ideal truth.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: Every human is an artist. The dream of your life is to make beautiful art.
Author: Don Miguel Ruiz

Quote: I got my diploma from Ealing College of Art, in graphics and illustration.
Author: Freddie Mercury

Quote: To array a man's will against his sickness is the supreme art of medicine.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: When art dresses in worn-out material it is most easily recognized as art.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Before you sleep, read something that is exquisite, and worth remembering.
Author: Desiderius Erasmus

Quote: How many a man has dated a new era in his life from the reading of a book.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Reading made Don Quixote a gentleman. Believing what he read made him mad.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: Shelving books incorrectly is as good as stealing them. It's almost worse.
Author: Paul Acampora

Quote: The real purpose of books is to trap the mind into doing its own thinking.
Author: Christopher Morley

Quote: Ultimately, the number of books always exceeds the space they are granted.
Author: Alberto Manguel

Quote: Un buen escritor se aprecia mejor por lo que rompe que por lo que publica.
Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

Quote: Men should think twice before making widowhood women's only path to power.
Author: Gloria Steinem

Quote: The light at the end of the tunnel is just the light of an oncoming train.
Author: Robert Lowell

Quote: You lived what anybody gets, Bernie. You got a lifetime. No more. No less.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Quote: A fondness for reading, properly directed, must be an education in itself.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Education is everywhere, prompting one to think, to consider, to remember.
Author: Louis L'Amour

Quote: People need to be educated so that they can make intelligent moral choices
Author: Gary L. Francione

Quote: When we teach a child patience we offer them the gift of a dignified life.
Author: Allan Lokos

Quote: Faith moves mountains, but only knowledge moves them to the right place...
Author: Joseph Goebbels

Quote: Have faith in your skills. Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
Author: Suzy Kassem

Quote: I love the recklessness of faith. First you leap, and then you grow wings.
Author: William Sloane Coffin Jr.

Quote: It is certain that an atom of goodness on the path of faith is never lost.
Author: Rumi

Quote: A friend is an emotional bond, just like friendship is a human experience.
Author: Simon Sinek

Quote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
Author: George Santayana

Quote: I was born with an adult head and a tiny body. Like a 'Peanuts' character.
Author: Jon Stewart

Quote: It's so trendy, almost bleeding to death. All the cool girls are doing it.
Author: Francine Pascal

Quote: Every child comes with the message that God is not yet discouraged of man.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quote: God is no fonder of intellectual slackers than He is of any other slacker.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: We have never heard the devil's side of the story, God wrote all the book.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: With life. Rooter says that life is how God gives purpose to the universe.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: There's the risk of being loved...and that would keep me from being happy.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: We've got everything we need right here, and everything we need is enough.
Author: Jack Johnson

Quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: Hope is like a word made with cloud, without faith, it quickly blows away.
Author: Anthony Liccione

Quote: I have hope for you, if only because you're the only one left to hope for.
Author: Orson Scott Card

Quote: I hope all you young girls see yourself up there... we were just like you.
Author: Mia Hamm

Quote: I hope people will say, 'Mr. Valentino, he did something for fashion, no?'
Author: Valentino Garavani

Quote: It will get easier each time, I think. I hope. I just have to keep trying.
Author: Jenny Han

Quote: Love, we say, is life; but love without hope and faith is agonizing death.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: Right now I'm not involved with anybody, but I hope by 75 I will be again.
Author: Stevie Nicks

Quote: She was a dreamer and a schemer & one didnt dream and scheme without hope.
Author: Loretta Chase

Quote: There is hope and a kind of beauty in there somewhere, if you look for it.
Author: H. R. Giger

Quote: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a purpose.
Author: Garrison Keillor

Quote: Everybody's got to believe in something. I believe I'll have another beer.
Author: W.C. Fields

Quote: Help me, I can't breathe, your ego is pushing all the air out of the room.
Author: Ilona Andrews

Quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
Author: Charles Lamb

Quote: I didn't have time to write a short letter, so I wrote a long one instead.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: I took a test in Existentialism. I left all the answers blank and got 100.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: If you haven't got anything nice to say about anybody come sit next to me.
Author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

Quote: I've got to keep breathing. It'll be my worst business mistake if I don't.
Author: Steve Martin

Quote: Money may not buy happiness, but I'd rather cry in a Jaguar than on a bus.
Author: Françoise Sagan

Quote: What you see on stage is pretty much the way I am... a dry sense of humor.
Author: Bob Newhart

Quote: What's up?"[asked Ford.]I don't know,"said Marvin, "I've never been there.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: A thousand words leave not the same deep impression as does a single deed.
Author: Henrik Ibsen

Quote: A writer must teach himself that the basest of all things is to be afraid.
Author: William Faulkner

Quote: Behind every trial and sorrow that He makes us shoulder, God has a reason.
Author: Khaled Hosseini

Quote: Books didn't make me wallow in darkness, darkness made me wallow in books.
Author: Jackson Pearce

Quote: Deacon Jones has been the most inspirational person in my football career.
Author: Jack Youngblood

Quote: Dissatisfaction can be a source of inspiration if you learn to control it.
Author: Tadahiko Nagao

Quote: don't you think between here and now we will see each other once or twice?
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Dumbledore will only leave from Hogwarts when there are none loyal to him!
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Each day begins a new journey of life, for if we awake, there is a reason.
Author: Bethanie Armstrong

Quote: Each moment, each person, is sacred and worthy of respect- especially you.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: He who does not see the light in others does not see the light in himself.
Author: Doreen DeVore

Quote: I was never really insane except upon occasions when my heart was touched.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: It's okay to be a loser, it just depends on how good you are at being one.
Author: Billie Joe Armstrong

Quote: Let us live so that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Let us make our future now, and let us make our dreams tomorrow's reality.
Author: Malala Yousafzai

Quote: Life is short. Kiss slowly, laugh insanely, love truly and forgive quickly
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: Love is the opposite of fear and it lights the flames of a million hearts.
Author: Amy Leigh Mercree

Quote: Meditation is a way for nourishing and blossoming the divinity within you.
Author: Amit Ray

Quote: Memories of our lives, of our works and our deeds will continue in others.
Author: Rosa Parks

Quote: Ninety percent of everything you believe you can achieve in life you will.
Author: Gregory C Dugger

Quote: Remember that the most beautiful things in the world are the most useless.
Author: John Ruskin

Quote: Sometimes I arrive just when God's ready to have somone click the shutter.
Author: Ansel Adams

Quote: The heart of a person only beats when it's surrounded by blood, by family.
Author: Erica Goros

Quote: The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain!
Author: Dolly Parton

Quote: When dreams become words to share with others - amazing things can happen.
Author: Richard A. Hackett Jr.

Quote: When people leave you, identify why they left and think about what is left
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: you don't have to worry about burning bridges, if you're building your own
Author: Kerry E. Wagner

Author: Tim Willocks

Quote: Love is the most powerful force in the world. That love can do anything.

Quote: Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun.

Quote: the Real-World was a sprawling mess of a book in need of a good editor.

Quote: The truth always carries the ambiguity of the words used to express it.

Quote: Those who lack the courage will always find a philosophy to justify it.

Quote: ...Time held me green and dyingThough I sang in my chains like the sea.

Quote: A poet's autobiography is his poetry. Anything else is just a footnote.

Quote: I feel there is an angel in me' she'd say 'whom I amconstantly shocking
